A Master Chief toy appears in "Ask Orange #4: Master Chef".
Madagascar characters appear in the Annoying Orange episode "Big Top Orange".
Annoying Orange Vs Plants Vs Zombies is a parody of Plants Vs Zombies and characters play Plants Vs Zombies games in later episodes.
Kitchen-mon is a parody of Pokemon and characters play Pokemon games in later episodes.
Annoying Orange vs Slender is a parody of Slender and characters play Slender games in later episodes.
Annoying Orange vs Minecraft is a parody of Minecraft and characters play Minecraft in later episodes.
Midget Apple becomes Iron Man in Iron Apple.
Orange dresses as Superman in Man Of Peel.
Arnold SchwarzenEGGer is a parody of Terminator and characters watch a trailer of Terminator Genisys in Trailer Trashed.
Link from Zelda appears in the Annoying Orange episode "Mystery Of The Sasquatch" and characters play Zelda games in later episodes.
Annoying Orange vs Fruit Ninja is a parody of Fruit Ninja and characters play Fruit Ninja in later episodes.
Ned Meets The Annoying Orange is a crossover between the two series.
Annoying Orange vs Flappy Bird is a parody of Flappy Bird and characters play Flappy Bird in later episodes.
Annoying Orange characters play Sonic games.
Sailor Spoon is a spoof on Sailor Moon.
Annoying Orange characters play Super Smash Bros games.
Star Wars characters appear in FRUIT WARS: The Fart Awakens Teaser Trailer.
A image of Roblox appears in Ask Orange #20: DELETING YOUTUBE!!!.
Dragon Fruit Z is a spoof on Dragon Ball Z.
Annoying Orange characters play Hello Neighbor.
Annoying Orange characters play Tattletail.
Annoying Orange characters play Bendy And The Ink Machine.
Kirby is mentioned in Ask Orange #43: Pear-achu!.
Annoying Orange characters watch a trailer of Toy Story 4 in Trailer Trashed.
Annoying Orange characters watch a trailer of Frozen 2 in Trailer Trashed.
A Quiet Place is mentioned in Loud Place.
Avatar is mentioned in Ask Orange #54: Who Cut The Cheese.
Among Us characters appear in Annoying Orange is AMONG US!.
Annoying Orange vs Fall Guys! is a parody of Fall Guys.
Friday Night Funkin'  characters appear in Annoying Orange vs Friday Night Funkin'.
The characters participate in Squid Game in Annoying Squid Game.

Anohana.description: A poster of Sebastian Michaelis from Black Butler can be seen in the Anohana episodes: "The Real Wish" and "I Wonder".
Jintan plays Devil May Cry 4 in Anohana: The Flower We Saw That Day.

Another Century's Episode.description: Mechs from Super Robot Wars appear in Another Century's Episode and Another Century's Episode R.
Mechs from Gundam appear in every Another Century's Episode game.
Mechs from Macross appear in Another Century's Episode 2, 3, R, and Portable.
Mechs from Getter Robo appear in Another Century's Episode 3.
Mechs from Eureka Seven appear in Another Century's Episode 3 and Portable.
Mechs from Full Metal Panic! appear in Another Century's Episode R.
Mechs from Code Geass appear in Another Century's Episode R and Portable.
Mechs from Armored Core appear in Another Century's Episode R.

Another Code.description: In Another Code: Two Memories/Trace Memory there's a book called "Path of Radiance".
Trace Memory features a book called '"The Legend of Zelda Chronology".

Another Crab's Treasure.description: A plush of an Imposter from Among Us can be found in Another Crab's Treasure.
A Cult of the Lamb costume can be found in Another Crab's Treasure.
A cartridge of a game called "Going Under 64" as well as a costume based on Jackie Fiasco can be found in Another Crab's Treasure.
A Forsburn costume can be found in Another Crab's Treasure.
A floppy disk for a parody of Doom called "Mood" can be found in Another Crab's Treasure.

Another Eden.description: Characters from Persona appear in Another Eden: The Cat Beyond Time and Space as a collaboration.
Character from the Tales of series appear in Another Eden as part of a collaboration event.
Characters from Chrono Cross appear in Another Eden as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Octopath Traveler appear in Another Eden as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from The King of Fighters appear in Another Eden as part of a special collaboration.

Another World (NBC).description: Many characters have gone between the shows As The World Turns and Another World.
Michael Bauer from Guiding Light appeared in an episode of Another World.
Kimberlin Brown from The Young and the Restless appeared in an episode of Another World.

Ant-Man.description: Both series frequently interact, as Ant-Man and Wasp are founding Avengers members.
There is a toy of Thomas the Tank Engine in the Ant-Man movie.
Them! is shown on TV in the Ant-Man & The Wasp.
Black Panther appears in Ant-Man & The Wasp Vol. 1 #5.

Antonball.description: SAGE 2020 demo of Antonball Deluxe features Snick the Porcupine from Pizza Tower. Peppino appears as a guest character in Antonball Deluxe.
Clive is featured as a playable character in Antonball Deluxe.

Any Malu.description: Any Malu has a The Walking Dead picture. The Walking Dead is also mentioned in "QUAL É A SÉRIE? ♫ - PARÓDIA "THE NAME GAME"" and "50 TONS DE ROSA (PARTE 2) - FATOS SOBRE MIM!!".
Batman is mentioned in "Any Malu Answers #03", while Killer Croc and Two-Face are mentioned in "Surreal Squad (special episode) - Villains and the Suicide Squad".
Superman is mentioned in "Any Malu Answers #03".
The Lion King is parodied in "50 Shades of Pink (part 1)".
Suicide Squad is mentioned in "Surreal Squad (special episode) - Villains and the Suicide Squad".
Any Malu dresses up as Harley Quinn in "Surreal Squad (special episode) - Villains and the Suicide Squad".
Willen dresses up as the Joker in "Surreal Squad (special episode) - Villains and the Suicide Squad".
Captain Boomerang is mentioned in "Surreal Squad (special episode) - Villains and the Suicide Squad".
Catwoman is mentioned in "Surreal Squad (special episode) - Villains and the Suicide Squad".
Game of Thrones is mentioned in "QUAL É A SÉRIE? ♫ - PARÓDIA "THE NAME GAME"" and "50 TONS DE ROSA (PARTE 2) - FATOS SOBRE MIM!!".
Agatha dresses up as Maleficent in "QUAL É A SÉRIE? ♫ - PARÓDIA "THE NAME GAME"".
Once Upon A Time is mentioned in "QUAL É A SÉRIE? ♫ - PARÓDIA "THE NAME GAME"".
House of Cards is mentioned in "QUAL É A SÉRIE? ♫ - PARÓDIA "THE NAME GAME"".
Stranger Things is mentioned in "QUAL É A SÉRIE? ♫ - PARÓDIA "THE NAME GAME"" and "50 TONS DE ROSA (PARTE 2) - FATOS SOBRE MIM!!".
Supernatural is mentioned in "QUAL É A SÉRIE? ♫ - PARÓDIA "THE NAME GAME"".
Westworld is mentioned in "QUAL É A SÉRIE? ♫ - PARÓDIA "THE NAME GAME"".

Any Malu, Mordecai and Rigby play Goat Simulator in "MEU PRIMEIRO GAMEPLAY!! FT. MORDECAI E RIGBY".

Scream is shown in "ESPECIAL DE HALLOWEEN - CLICHÊS MAIS PERTURBADORES DOS FILMES DE TERROR".

Dragon Ball is shown in "̶H̶a̶c̶k̶e̶a̶r̶a̶m̶ ̶m̶e̶u̶ ̶c̶a̶n̶a̶l̶!̶!̶!̶ DESMANTELO". Dragon Ball is also parodied in "Any Malu Invites Luba (feat Riha...)", while Any Malu uses the Dragon Balls in "TESTANDO COISAS DE DESENHOS!!".
Marvel's Spider-Man is shown in "5 DICAS SURREAIS - OS GAMES DO WILLEN".
Mega Man 11 is shown in "5 DICAS SURREAIS - OS GAMES DO WILLEN". Any Malu also uses the Mega Buster in "TESTANDO COISAS DE GAMES!".
Soul Calibur VI is shown in "5 DICAS SURREAIS - OS GAMES DO WILLEN".
God of War (2018) is shown in "5 DICAS SURREAIS - OS GAMES DO WILLEN".
Lumpy Space Princess appears in "FINALMENTE MOSTREI MINHA MÃE!!! O CARTOON ME CONTRATOU?".
Darwin Watterson is interviewed in the Any Malu Show episode: "Convida: Gumball".
Bubbles appears in the Any Malu Show episode: "Cartoon Musical Talents". Bubbles and Blossom are also interveiwed in the episode: ""Convida: Meninas Superpoderosas".
Ben Tennyson is interviewed in the Any Malu Show episode: "Convida: Ben 10". Any Malu also uses the Omnitrix in "TESTANDO COISAS DE DESENHOS!!".
World of Warcraft is mentioned in "WORLD OF ANY MALU - ESPECIAL".
Shaggy and Scooby-Doo appear in the Any Malu Show episode: "TALK SHOW COM SCOOBY-DOO E SALSICHA".

Ape Escape.description: The McDonald's Original Happy Disc for the PS2 contained a demo for Ape Escape 2001, where graphics from the game are replaced with McDonald's logos. Ronald McDonald also appears on the title screen as the start button.
The "Snake vs. Monkey" minigame in Metal Gear Solid 3 features the apes from Ape Escape, while Solid Snake from Metal Gear makes an appearance in Ape Escape 3.

In the Japanese version of Ratchet & Clank: Up your Arsenal, by entering a code you can unlock a wearable Pipo Suit for Ratchet to wear.  Also in many versions of Ape Escape 3, a Ratchet picture can be seen when entering a cheat-code, as well as a monkey wearing Ratchet costume, with a small version of Clank jetpack to fly around and a replica model of the RYNO.

Apex Legends.description: Apex Legends is a spin-off of Titanfall.
Pathfinder has a skin based off of BD-1 from Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order. Several Star Wars themed charms have also been made avaliable.
A charm of a Head Crab from Half-Life could be obtained for the Steam release of Apex Legends.
Charms of Potato GLaDOS and a Companion Cube from Portal could be obtained for the Steam release of Apex Legends.

A Nessie plush from Apex Legends can be found in Medal of Honor: Above & Beyond. Additionally, a charm of Manon from Medal of Honor could be obtained in Apex Legends for the launch of Medal of Honor: Above & Beyond. A charm of Sarge was also avaliable for EA Play members.
A charm of Faith Connors from Mirror's Edge could be obtained in Apex Legends by EA Play members.
Charms of the Male and Female Shepard from Mass Effect could be obtained in Apex Legends for the release of Mass Effect Legendary Edition.
A charm of Dr. Hakim from It Takes Two could be obtained in Apex Legends by EA Play members.
A charm of a Highland Ravager from Dragon Age could be obtained in Apex Legends by EA Play members.
A charm of Isaac Clarke's helmet from Dead Space could be obtained in Apex Legends by EA Play members.
Apex Legends includes several cosmetics based on Final Fantasy VII Rebirth, including Materia items and a Mythic Buster Sword weapon.

Aqua Teen Hunger Force.description: Blair Witch is mentioned in the ATHF episode "Broodwich".

Space Ghost appears in the Aqua Teen Hunger Force episodes "The Dressing" and "Multiple Meat". Carl and Carl Jr. from the Space Ghost Coast to Coast episode "Chambraigne" appear in the Aqua Teen Hunger Force episode "Carl Wash". Meatwad and the Cybernetic Ghost of Christmas Past from the Future appear in the Space Ghost special Adult Swim Brain Trust.
12 oz. Mouse is shown on a monitor in Aqua Teen Hunger Force Colon Movie Film for Theaters.
Contact is mentioned by Shake in the Aqua Teen Hunger Force episode "Laser Lenses".
Futurama is mentioned in the Aqua Teen Hunger Force episode "Bible Fruit".
Underworld is mentioned in the Aqua Teen Hunger Force episode "2-And-a-Half Star Wars Out of Five".
Carl Brutananadilewski explains the plot of Big Momma's House in the ATHF episode "Larry Miller Hair System".
Pretty Woman is mentioned in the ATHF episode "Larry Miller Hair System".
Land Before Time is mentioned in the ATHF episode "Granite Family".
Pibby and the glitch are seen interrupting an episode of Aqua Teen Hunger Force during a broadcast on Adult Swim.

Aquaman.description: Aquaman meets Jabberjaw in the comic Aquaman/Jabberjaw Special #1.
Annabelle appears in the Aquaman movie as an easter egg according to James Wan (Producer/Director of both works).

Aquapazza: Aquaplus Dream Match.description: Characters from Utawarerumono appeared in Aquapazza: Aquaplus Dream Match.

Joust is featured in Williams Arcade's Greatest Hits and Midway's Greatest Arcade Hits while Joust 2 is in Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Midway Collection 2.

Battlezone is featured in Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Atari Collection 1
Centipede is featured in Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Atari Collection 1 and Millipede is featured in only the Playstation version ofArcade's Greatest Hits: The Atari Collection 2
Missile Command is featured in Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Atari Collection 1
Tempest is featured in Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Atari Collection 1
BurgerTime is featured in Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Midway Collection 2
Moon Patrol is featured in Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Midway Collection 2 and Midway's Greatest Arcade Hits
Asteroids is featured in Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Midway Collection 2 and Midway's Greatest Arcade Hits
Root Beer Tapper is featured in Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Midway Collection 2 and Midway's Greatest Arcade Hits
Crystal Castles is featured in Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Atari Collection 2
Gauntlet is featured in Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Atari Collection 2 and Midway's Greatest Arcade Hits

Vindicators is featured in Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Atari Collection 2

Arcade Gamer Fubuki.description: Characters from Taisen Net Gimmick made a cameo appearance in Arcade Gamer Fubuki.
The manga and OVA Arcade Gamer Fubuki features the Virtua Fighter Arcade games.
Characters from Sgt Frog have made cameo appearances throughout the Arcade Gamer Fubuki series and vice verse.
A character can be seen playing Columns in the 2nd episode of Arcade Gamer Fubuki.
A character can be seen playing Fighting Vipers 2 in episode 3 of Arcade Gamer Fubuki.
A poster for a parody of Puyo Puyo called "Poyo Poyo" can be seen in the 3rd episode of Arcade Gamer Fubuki.

Arcaea.description: Characters and music from Dynamix appear in Arcaea while music from Arcaea appears in Dynamix as part of a special collaboration.
Music and characters from Lanota can be found in Arcaea as part of a collaboration event while music from Arcaea can be played in Lanota as part of a collaboration event.

Groove Coaster Wai Wai Party featured a DLC pack featuring music from Arcaea as well as characters that are selectable as navigators and avatars. Additionally, music and characters from Groove Coaster can be found in Arcaea as part of a collaboration event.
Music and characters from Chunithm can be found in Arcaea as part of a collaboration event.
Music and characters from O.N.G.E.K.I. can be found in Arcaea as part of a collaboration event.
Music from maimai can be found in Arcaea as part of a collaboration event.
Music and characters from WACCA can be found in Arcaea as part of a collaboration event.
Music and characters from Muse Dash can be found in Arcaea as part of a collaboration event. Additionally, Muse Dash also features music from Arcaea.
Tracks from Needy Streamer Overload can be played in Arcaea as part of a special collaboration.
Music and characters from Cytus II can be found in Arcaea as part of a collaboration event.

Arcana (HAL Laboratory).description: Kirby makes a cameo appearance during the opening sequence of Arcana. Additionally, the logo for Kirby Quest from Kirby Mass Attack is inspired by the logo for Arcana.

Archer.description: The Belchers appears in the Archer episode: "Fugue and Riffs".

Archie (Comic Series).description: Archie and Sabrina crossover each other all the time.
Josie and the Pussycats have appeared in many Archie comics, as well as Riverdale.
Betty and Veronica issue #144 features a poster of Peanuts.
Dick Tracy animations were shown on Archie's TV Funnies.
Archie and the Ninja Turtles have a crossover together.
The Punisher has a crossover with Archie in The Punisher Meets Archie.
Wolverine appears in the end of The Punisher Meets Archie.
Archie and Friends: A Halloween Tale features Sonic and Knuckles as guest stars.
Teen Titans has a crossover with Archie in Tiny Titans/Little Archie and his Pals.
Glee has a comic crossover with Archie.
The Predator has a comic crossover with Archie.
Archie and Sharknado meet in a comic crossover.
Donnie Darko is mentioned in the Riverdale episodes: "Chapter Two: A Touch of Evil", "Chapter Twenty-One: House of the Devil" and "Chapter One Hundred and Fifteen: Return to Rivervale".
Black Swan is mentioned in the Riverdale episode: "Chapter Seven: In a Lonely Place".
An American Werewolf in London is mentioned in the Riverdale episode: "Chapter Ten: The Lost Weekend".
Harley & Ivy Meet Betty & Veronica is a crossover between the two series.
The Riverdale episode "Chapter Thirty-One: A Night to Remember" is centered around a staging of Carrie: The Musical.

In The Punisher meets Archie the evil Archie look alike goes to a Union Station where one of the town selections is Gotham which is Batman's Hometown. Later Archie would officially cross paths with Batman in Archie meets Batman '66
Red Sonja, Vampirella, and Archie appear in the comic crossover, Red Sonja and Vampirella Meet Betty and Veronica.
Red Sonja, Vampirella, and Archie appear in the comic crossover, Red Sonja and Vampirella Meet Betty and Veronica.
Archie Meets Flash Gordon was going to be a crossover between the two series, but was never released.
The Riverdale episode "Chapter One Hundred and Twelve: American Psychoes" is centered around a staging of American Psycho: The Musical.

In the Pretty Little Liars: Original Sin episodes "Chapter Six: Scars", Eddie tells Imogen and Tabby that after the Radley closed, patients were either discharged or transferred to an establishment called Sisters of Quiet Mercy located in a place called Riverdale. It would later be confirmed by Riverdale's executive producer Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa that Riverdale and Pretty Little Liars share the same universe.
There is official crossover art featuring Michael Myers from Halloween and Betty and Veronica from Archie.

Are We There Yet?.description: Yu-Gi-Oh is mentioned in Are We There Yet?
Dragon Ball GT is mentioned in Are We There Yet?
Pokémon is mentioned in Are We There Yet?
Digimon is mentioned in Are We There Yet?

SpongeBob is mentioned in Are We There Yet?

Kevin plays Eternal Darkness: Sanity's Requiem in Are We There Yet?

Arena of Valor.description: Batman and The Joker appear in Arena of Valor.
Superman appears in Arena of Valor.
Wonder Woman appears in Arena of Valor.
The Flash appears in Arena of Valor.
The Colonel from KFC is a playable character in Arena of Valor.
Kazuto "Kirito" Kirigaya and Asuna Yuuki are Skin equippable on the Hero Allain and Butterfly respectively in Arena of Valor.
ULTRAMAN appears in Arena of Valor, as a Skin for Ryoma, and Seven appears in Arena of Valor as a Skin for Florentino.

Ichigo Kurosaki appears in Arena of Valor, as a Skin for Lu Bu, Byakuya Kuchiki appears in Arena of Valor as a Skin for Murad, Shihakushō ' appears in Arena of Valor as a Skin for Lindis, Toshiro Hitsugaya appears in Arena of Valor as a Skin for Bright and Karakura First High School appears in Arena of Valor. as a Skin for Annette
Genos appears in Arena of Valor, as a Skin for Errol, and Terrible Tornado appears in Arena of Valor, as a Skin for Krixi.
Harley Quinn appears in Arena of Valor, as a Skin for Capheny.

Tanjiro Kamado appears in Arena of Valor as a skin for Yan, Nezuko Kamado appears as a skin for Keera, Zenitsu Agatsuma appears as a skin for Murad, and Hashibira Inosuke appears in Arena of Valor as skin for Zephys.
Characters from Sailor Moon appeared in Arena of Valor as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Fatal Fury appeared in Honor of Kings as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Hunter x Hunter appeared in Arena of Valor as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Hello Kitty appeared in Honor of Kings as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Saint Seiya appeared in Honor of Kings as part of a special collaboration.

Arkanoid.description: Rainbow Islands: The Story of Bubble Bobble 2 includes an island ("Doh's Island") based off Arkanoid, with several enemies and DOH as the final boss. DOH is also a boss in Bubble Bobble Part II and Parasol Stars; Bub, Bob and Drunk are among the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders, while Round 79 in Bubble Bobble and "TV Machine" Round D-7 in Bubble Symphony references Arkanoid; Round 31 in Arkanoid Returns, Zone C-4 and Zone Beta in Arkanoid DS, Round 04L in Arkanoid Plus!, Round B-2 in Arkanoid HD and Round 98 in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders contain references and two wallpapers from the series are unlockable in DS.

Rainbow Islands: The Story of Bubble Bobble 2 includes an island ("Doh's Island") based off Arkanoid, with several enemies and DOH as the final boss; Bubby is one of the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders.

Stage 6 in the Parody Mode of Space Invaders DX is based on Arkanoid and features a playable Vaus; while Stage 5 in Arkanoid is patterned after an invader alien and Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders is a crossover between both franchises.

The Vaus from Arkanoid is a DLC character in Elevator Action Deluxe, while the Spy from Elevator Action appears as one of the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders, and Stage 141 in the game is patterned after the spy.
The paddles from Arkanoid appear among the videogame characters in the movie Pixels, while the Pixels version of the Invader is an event character in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders.
Nico from Spica Adventure appears as one of the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders.
Patrako from Cleopatra Fortune appears as one of the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders, while a wallpaper based on Cleopatra Fortune is unlockable in Arkanoid DS.

Ptolemy from The Fairyland Story appears as one of the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders, while Round 41 in the MSX port of The Fairyland Story makes reference to Arkanoid and Zone β-5 in Arkanoid DS bears resemblance to Ptolemy. Arkanoid - Eternal Battle features a The Fairyland Story background as DLC.
Tiki from The NewZealand Story appears as one of the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders.
Sayo-chan/Pocky appears as one of the characters providing special attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders, while Zone β-4 in Arkanoid DS is patterned after a Puka Puka enemy.
Kage from The Legend of Kage appears as one of the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders, while a wallpaper based on The Legend of Kage 2 is unlockable in Arkanoid DS.
Reika Kirishima from Time Gal appears as one of the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders.
Zac from Pu·Li·Ru·La appears as one of the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders.
Lufia from Lufia & the Fortress of Doom appears as one of the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders.

Chack'n and Monsta from Chack'n Pop appear among the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders, while Stage 4 in Tournament Arkanoid, Round D-4 in Arkanoid DS, Round 10L in Arkanoid Plus! and Round 66 in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders are patterned after Chack'n. Arkanoid - Eternal Battle features a Chack'n Pop background as DLC.
Sonic Blast Man appears as one of the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders.
C-Mond from Puchi Carat appears as one of the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders, while the "Wings" Vaus customization from Arkanoid DS is the cursor from Puchi Carat.
Burn, Emilio, Keith and Wendy from Psychic Force appear among the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders.

Proco, Riga Pratica, Ti2, Iron Fossil and Great Thing are among the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders, while several wallpapers based on the Darius series are unlockable in Arkanoid DS and Zone β-2 resembles the Silver Hawk.

The main characters from The Ninja Warriors appear among the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders, while Round 32 in Arkanoid Returns is patterned after the kunoichi from The Ninja Warriors.
Nancy from Chase H.Q. appears as one of the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders.

Linka and Yume from Groove Coaster 3 appear among the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders and Nadia Vivie appears as a Navigator in Groove Coaster, while Groove Coaster features two BGM remixes based on Arkanoid music.
Arkanoid - Eternal Battle features an Operation Wolf background as DLC.

Arknights.description: Skins based on KFC are available in Arknights. The Colonel can be seen on KFC buckets in the game.
Ash, Blitz, Frost and Tachanka from Rainbow Six: Siege appears in a collab for Arknights.
Characters from Monster Hunter appear in a collab for Arknights.
Characters from Destiny appear in a collab for Arknights.

Arm Wrestling (Nintendo).description: Arm Wrestling is a spin-off of Punch-Out!! starring the same protagonist; Bald Bull from Punch-Out!! also makes an appearance.

James Bond is mentioned in Armageddon.

Army Men.description: Characters from Metal Slug appear in Army Men Strike as a part of a collaboration.

Army of Two.description: Isaac Clarke from Dead Space is playable in the PSP version of Army of Two: The 40th Day; masks from the Dead Space series are also unlockable in Army of Two: The Devil's Cartel.
Dante from Dante's Inferno is playable in the PSP version of Army of Two: The 40th Day.

Arrested Development.description: In the Arrested Development episode "Mr. F", Michael and Rita interrupt the filming of a Malcolm in the Middle episode.
John Munch, a main character in both Homicide: Life on the Street and Law & Order, appears in Arrested Development's "S.O.B.s" party.
John Munch, a main character in both Homicide: Life on the Street and Law & Order, appears in Arrested Development's "S.O.B.s" party.

Pokémon Art Academy is a crossover between the two series.
Disney Art Academy features drawings of Mickey Mouse characters.
Disney Art Academy features drawings of Winnie the Pooh characters.
Disney Art Academy features drawings of characters from Frozen.

Art of Fighting.description: Ryo Sakazaki is a selectable character in Fatal Fury Special and (as Mr. Karate) in the PlayStation version of Fatal Fury: Wild Ambition, while Geese Howard appears in the ending of the SNES version of Art of Fighting and as the secret final boss in Art of Fighting 2. Additionally, Khushnood Butt from Garou: Mark of the Wolves is said to be a student of Ryo Sakazaki.

Arthur (PBS).description: Arthur meets Mr. Rogers in the episode "Arthur Meets Mr. Rogers".
Teletubbies is mentioned in the Arthur episode "The Contest".
Paige Turner mentioned Captain Underpants and the Wrath of the Wicked Wedgie Woman in the Arthur episode “Fernkenstein's Monster”.
The Chronicles of Ahmayzzia has inspiration from Lord of the Rings.
The Chronicles of Ahmayzzia has inspiration from Chronicles Of Narnia.

The Shining is mentioned in Arthur, malédiction.
Batman v Superman is mentioned in Arthur, malédiction.
Batman v Superman is mentioned in Arthur, malédiction.

Arthur Christmas.description: A poster for Open Season can be seen in Arthur Christmas.
A Shaun the Sheep toy appears in Arthur Christmas.

As The World Turns.description: Many characters have gone between the shows As The World Turns and Another World.
Michael Baldwin from The Young and the Restless has appeared on As the World Turns, while Alison and Emily Stewart from As the World Turns have appeared on The Young and the Restless.

Asdfmovie.description: The muffin advertises Bravest Warriors at the end of "asdfmovie7".

The stegosaurus from asdfmovie appears in "Crash Zoom - Out Of Time". Crash Zoom also features many other references to asdfmovie throughout the series.  Additionally, Lucy appears in the asdfmovie music video "REAL MAN!"

Ashita no Joe.description: Characters from Ashita no Joe make a guest appearance in Girls RPG: Cinderella Life.

Asphalt.description: The GT by Citroën from Gran Turismo appears in Asphalt 8: Airborne.
The Villain Wheels car from Despicable Me 3 appears in an event in Asphalt 8: Airborne.
Asphalt 9: Legends features car paintjobs and voiced countdown packs based on Sakura Miko and Himemori Luna as part of a limited collaboration.

Assassin's Creed.description: Altair's clothes from Assassin's Creed are unlockable in Metal Gear Solid 4; Raiden's uniform from Metal Gear Solid 4 is unlockable in Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood; Brotherhood also features a reference to the Metal Gear series in the form of a cardboard box, while Metal Gear Solid Peace Walker features a reference to the "Leap of Faith".
Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag features a cheat code which turns all the enemies into Rabbids scarecrows.
Ezio's clothes from Assassin's Creed: Revelations are downloadable in Final Fantasy XIII-2.  Also, "Final Fantasy" characters appear in DLC for Assassin's Festival.
The Tower Assassin's Creed is a crossover between the two series.
Armor sets based on Destiny appear in Assassin's Creed Valhalla, while armor sets based on Assassin's Creed appear in Destiny 2.

Assassination Classroom.description: In Chapter 10 of the Assassination Classroom manga, Captain Jack Sparrow appears in one student's imagination.
In Chapter 10 of the Assassination Classroom manga, Lara Croft appears in one student's imagination.
In Chapter 12 of the Assassination Classroom manga, Koro-sensei is seen wearing Naruto's headband.
Mario's hat appears in chapter 18 of the Assassination Classroom manga.
Class E watches Sex and the City in Chapter 25 of the Assassination Classroom manga.

In Chapter 29 of the Assassination Classroom manga, Koro-sensei imagines Goku and Raditz from Dragon Ball Z, a scene later reproduced in Episode 11 of the anime. One of Koro-sensei's clones is seen cosplaying as Goku in Episode 6 of the anime.
A drawing of a Blue Slime from Dragon Quest appears in Chapter 38 of the Assassination Classroom manga. There's a visual allusion to the series in Chapter 68.
A quote from Catcher in the Rye was mentioned in chapter 53 of Assassination Classroom.
A visual allusion to Warsman's broken "Bear Claw" from Kinnikuman appears in Chapter 60 of the Assassination Classroom manga.
A visual allusion to Anpanman appears in Chapter 63 of the Assassination Classroom manga.
In Chapter 63 of the Assassination Classroom manga, Fuwa imagines herself fighting Ryuk from Death Note.
There are references to Fist of the North Star in Chapters 79 and 83 of the Assassination Classroom manga, and a visual allusion to Kenshiro and Raoh in Episode 11 of the anime.

In Chapter 10 of the Assassination Classroom manga, Koro-sensei is seen dressed as Kankichi Ryotsu from Kochikame. One of Koro-sensei's clones is seen cosplaying as Ryotsu in Episode 6 of the anime, and Episode 9 features a minor reference.
Koro-sensei mentions the Hunter x Hunter manga in Chapter 98 of the Assassination Classroom manga.
Koro-sensei mentions the Toriko manga in Chapter 98 of the Assassination Classroom manga. One of Koro-sensei's clones is seen cosplaying as Toriko in Episode 6 of the anime.
Koro-sensei is seen dressed like Doraemon in Chapter 104 of the Assassination Classroom manga.
The Toguro Brothers from Yu Yu Hakusho make a brief cameo in Chapter 118 of the Assassination Classroom manga.
Golgo 13 makes a brief cameo in Chapter 118 of the Assassination Classroom manga.
One of Koro-sensei's clones is seen cosplaying as Ichigo from Bleach in Episode 6 of the Assassination Classroom anime.
One of Koro-sensei's clones is seen cosplaying as Takasugi from Gintama in Episode 6 of the Assassination Classroom anime.
Episode 11 of the Assassination Classroom anime features a visual allusion to Andromeda Shun and Phoenix Ikki of Saint Seiya.
Episode 23 of the Assassination Classroom anime features Karma playing a One Piece game on the 3DS.

Assault Lily.description: Hibiki, Miku, Chris, and Carol appear as collaboration units in the mobile game Assault Lily Last Bullet.
Characters from Date A Live appear in Assault Lily Last Bullet as part of a collaboration.
Characters from Girls und Panzer appear in Assault Lily Last Bullet as part of a collaboration.
Characters from Puella Magi Madoka Magica appear in Assault Lily Last Bullet as part of a collaboration.

Astro Bot.description: Aku Aku makes an appearance in Astro's Playroom. A bot that resembles Crash Bandicoot appears in Astro's Playroom.
The R-C01 from the cover of Air Combat appears in Astro's Playroom.
Bots can be found playing a game similar to Ridge Racer called "Bot Racer" in Astro's Playroom.
The Buster Sword from Final Fantasy VII appears in Astro's Playroom.
A bot that references Pain appears in Astro's Playroom as well as the Pain logo.
Bots can be found playing a game similar to Street Fighter called "Bot Fighter in Astro's Playroom.

Bots can be found playing a game resembling God of War called "Bot of War" in Astro's Playroom. Additionally you can also find bots resembling Kratos and his son. God of War Ragnarök features a poem based on the Astro Bot.
A toy of Spyro the Dragon appears in Astro's Playroom.

Astro Boy.description: Hikari makes an appearance in Astro Boy chapter “Shootout in the Alps.”
Acetylene Lamp appears frequently in Astro Boy.
Black Jack and Piniko appear in the Astro Boy (1980) episode "The Time Machine" and in the video game Astro Boy: Omega Factor.
Darth Vader appears as a cameo in "The Time Machine" in Astro Boy (1980).
Sharaku Hosuke appears in the video game Astro Boy: Omega Factor.
Pook transforms into Leo/Kimba from Kimba the White Lion in Astro Boy: Omega Factor.

Asura's Wrath.description: PTX-40A from Lost Planet makes a cameo appearance during Interlude 1 in Asura's Wrath.
The Yashichi from Vulgus makes a cameo appearance during Interlude 2 in Asura's Wrath.
Mobichan from Side Arms makes a cameo appearance during Interlude 4 in Asura's Wrath.
Amaterasu and Issun from Ōkami make a cameo appearance during Interlude 10 in Asura's Wrath.

Sagat from Street Fighter makes a cameo appearance during Interlude 10 in Asura's Wrath; Chun-li makes a cameo in Interlude 22 and Ryu/Evil Ryu and Akuma/Oni are enemies in DLC content for Asura's Wrath; while Asura, Yasha, Kalrow, Olga, Augus and Mithra are selectable in Street Fighter × All Capcom.
A Melynx from Monster Hunter makes a cameo appearance during Interlude 10 in Asura's Wrath, banners showing Felyne from Monster Hunter can also be seen during Interlude 22.
A Mega Man graffiti can be seen during Interlude 22 in Asura's Wrath.

Atari Force.description: Atari Force #3 features the Zylons from Star Raiders.

Atelier.description: Gust from Hyperdimension Neptunia appears as a resident in Westwald in Nelke & the Legendary Alchemists: Ateliers of the New World as DLC.

The Atelier Sophie 2 Collaboration Pack for Tales of Arise will feature multiple items based on Atelier Sophie 2, while the Tales of Arise Collaboration Accessories Set for Atelier Sophie 2 will feature multiple items based on Tales of Arise.

Athena (SNK).description: Psycho Soldier is a spiritual successor to Athena; Athena Asamiya from Psycho Soldier is confirmed to be the daughter of Princess Athena from the Athena games.
Athena appears in The King of Fighters series while characters from The King of Fighters made a cameo appearance in Athena On Stage.
Characters from Art of Fighting make a cameo appearance in Athena on Stage.
Heidern from Ikari Warriors makes a cameo appearance in Athena on Stage.

Athenian Rhapsody.description: The Frogun appears as a weapon in Athenian Rhapsody. Additionally, hat based on Thunder Goober from Athenian Rhapsody appears in Frogun Encore.

Atlantis no Nazo.description: Gonbe from Ikki makes a cameo in Atlantis no Nazo.

Atop the 4th Wall.description: Linkara reviews Superman at Earth’s End.
Linkara reviews World of Warcraft #2 and #3.
The Angry Video Game Nerd makes a cameo Linkara's review of Wolverine: Adamantium Rage.
Linkara reviews The Marriage of Xena and Hercules.
Linkara reviews The Marriage of Xena and Hercules.
Linkara reviews Silent Hill: Dying Inside #1 and #2.
Linkara reviews Justice League: Act of God Part 1.
Linkara reviews Superman meets the Nesquik Bunny.
Linkara reviews Pokemon: The Electric Tale of Pikachu (HD).
Linkara reviews Catwoman – Guardian of Gotham #1.
Linkara reviews Bart Simpson’s Treehouse of Horror #2.
Linkara reviews Archie Giant Series Magazine #452.
Linkara reviews The Punisher: Silent Night #1.
Linkara reviews Bill and Ted’s Excellent Comic Book #1.
Linka reviews JoJo's Bizarre Adventure Episodes 1-4.
Linkara reviews Phineas and Ferb: Mission Marvel.

Attack on Titan.description: The Avengers fight The Titans in the 8 page comic Attack on Avengers.
The Guardians of the Galaxy fight The Titans with The Avengers and Spider-Man in the 8 page comic Attack on Avengers.
Spider-Man fights The Titans with The Avengers and The Guardians of the Galaxy in the 8 page comic Attack on Avengers.
Monokuma from Danganronpa appears as a Titan in Attack on Titan 2: Future Coordinates.
Shinra from Fire Force fights the Colossal Titan with Eren as part of a promotion to AnimeJapan 2019.

Attack the Block.description: Dobby the House Elf is mentioned in Attack the Block.
Jerome mentions Gears of War in Attack the Block.
Biggz mentions Gollum in Attack the Block.
Pest mentions Pokémon in Attack the Block.
Moses mentions Naruto in Attack the Block.

Austin & Ally.description: Austin & Ally characters and Jessie characters cross over with each other.
Ernie and Judy from K.C. Undercover appear in the episode Scary Spirits & Spooky Stories.

Austin Powers.description: In Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery, when Dr. Evil is threatening the President of the United States, he shows him footage of the White House being destroyed in the movie Independence Day as demonstration of what his weapon would be capable of.
Star Wars is mentioned in the teaser trailer for Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me.
Pippi Longstocking is mentioned in Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me.
"It's a Hard-Knocked Life" from Annie is heard in Austin Powers in Goldmember.
Godzilla is mentioned in Austin Powers in Goldmember.
People dressed as Charmander and Pikachu can be seen in Austin Powers in Goldmember.

Auto Modellista.description: Auto Modellista features a car sticker of MegaMan.EXE from Mega Man: Battle Network and two Servbot figures can be placed in the garage.
Auto Modellista features car stickers referencing the Street Fighter series.
Auto Modellista features car stickers of Dante and Lucia from Devil May Cry 2.
Auto Modellista features a car sticker of Ryu and Nina from Breath of Fire: Dragon Quarter.
Auto Modellista features two car stickers from Steel Battalion.
Auto Modellista features a car sticker of Dino Crisis 3.

Avengers (Marvel).description: Both series frequently interact, as Iron Man is one of the founding (and most common) Avengers members and often serves as their leader.
Both series frequently interact, as Hulk is one of the founding (and most common) Avengers members; Hulk Smash Avengers is part of both series.
Both series frequently interact, as Thor is one of the founding (and among the most common) Avengers members.
Both series frequently interact, as Ant-Man and Wasp are founding Avengers members.
The Avengers and the Fantastic Four have been featured in many comics and media together
Both series frequently interact, as Captain America joins the Avengers in Avengers #4". Since then he has been among the most common Avengers members, often serving as their leader.
Many X-Men have been Avengers.
Black Panther is a regular member of the Avengers. The Avengers have appeared in Black Panther comics.
Starfox has been a member of the Avengers.
Moon Knight has been a member of the Avengers.
The Avengers have a crossover with the Justice League.
Squirrel Girl has been a member of both the Avengers and the Great Lakes Avengers.
Wolverine has been a member of the Avengers.
Deadpool has been a member of the Avengers.
The Avengers have a crossover with Transformers.
Shang-Chi has been a member of both the Secret Avengers and the Avengers.
Daredevil has been a member of the Avengers.
In the movie The Avengers a character is seen playing Galaga.
Blade has been a member of the Avengers.
Man-Thing has been a member of the Avengers.
The Avengers fight The Titans in the 8 page comic Attack on Avengers.
A Laputa Robot appears at the Avengers Tower in Avengers: Age of Ultron.
Hit-Monkey appears in Marvel Avengers Academy.
Spider-Man appears in Avengers: Infinity War.
The Guardians of the Galaxy appear in Avengers: Infinity War.
Tobias Funke from Arrested Development can be seen in the collector's museum in Avengers: Infinity War.
Groot can be seen playing Defender in Avengers: Infinity War.
Aliens is mentioned by Peter Parker in Avengers: Infinity War.
Iron Man refers to Star-Lord as "Flash Gordon" in Avengers: Infinity War.
Footloose is mentioned in Avengers: Infinity War.

Thanos appears in Fortnite. Thor's Stormbreaker, Iron Man's Repulsors, Hawkeye's Bow and Captain America's Shield have appeared as items in the game as a part of the Endgame LTM. Korg can also be seen playing Fortnite in Avengers Endgame.
Ghost Rider has been a member of the Avengers.
Stuart Little is mentioned in Avengers: Endgame.
Back to the Future is mentioned in Avengers: Endgame.
Star Trek is mentioned in Avengers: Endgame.
Terminator is mentioned in Avengers: Endgame.
Quantum Leap is mentioned in Avengers: Endgame.
Bill & Ted is mentioned in Avengers: Endgame.
Die Hard is mentioned in Avengers: Endgame.
Edwin Jarvis from Agent Carter appears in Avengers: Endgame.
Conan The Barbarian is a member of the Savage Avengers.
The Punisher has been a member of the Avengers.
Ultraman x Avengers is a crossover between the two series.
Jeff the Land Shark is a playable character in Marvel Rivals.

Axe Cop.description: "Stolen Pizza, Stolen Lives" is a crossover between the two series.
Milla Vodello appears in a flashback in the Axe Cop episode "No More Bad Guys".
Ice King appears in a flashback in the Axe Cop episode "No More Bad Guys".

Ayakashi Triangle.description: Sugar from One Piece gives Matsuri a grape in Issue 5-6 2021 of Weekly Shonen Jump.

Azur Lane.description: A Xingchen costume from VOCALOID4 appears as a skin for Unicorn in Azur Lane.
Characters from Hyperdimension Neptunia appear as shipgirls in Azur Lane.
The mascot characters "22" and "33" of Bilibili appear as shipgirls in Azur Lane.
Characters  from Utawarerumono appear as shipgirls in Azur Lane.
Kizuna AI makes an appearance in Azur Lane as part of a special collaboration.
Various Hololive characters are obtainable as part of a collaboration event.
Characters from Dead or Alive Xtreme Venus Vacation appear as shipgirls in Azur Lane.
Characters from THE iDOLM@STER appear in Azur Lane as part of a collaboration event.
Characters from SSSS.Gridman and SSSS.Dynazenon appear in Azur Lane as part of a collaboration event.
Characters from Atelier Ryza 2 and Atelier Ryza 3 appear in Azur Lane as part of a collaboration event.
Characters from Senran Kagura: New Link appear in Azur Lane as part of a collaboration event.

Azure Striker Gunvolt.description: Mighty Gunvolt is a crossover between Azure Striker Gunvolt, Mighty No. 9, and Gal*Gun.
Mighty Gunvolt is a crossover between Azure Striker Gunvolt, Mighty No. 9, and Gal*Gun.
Using a Shovel Knight amiibo in Azure Striker Gunvolt 2 allows the player to fight Shovel Knight.

Baby Driver.description: Austin Powers is mentioned in Baby Driver.
Michael Myers is mentioned in Baby Driver.
Monsters Inc shows on TV in Baby Driver.
Fight Club shows on TV in Baby Driver.

Baby Shark.description: Blaze and the Monster Machines characters appear in a commercial for the Baby Shark television series.
Blue's Clues characters appear in a commercial for the Baby Shark television series.
Bubble Guppies characters appear in a commercial for the Baby Shark television series. The Bubble Guppies episode "The Jawsome Sharkventure!" is a crossover between both series.
PAW Patrol characters appear in a commercial for the Baby Shark television series.

The show collaborated with Pinkfong on a video featuring a new performance of "Baby Shark," with animated versions of Elmo, Abby Cadabby, and Cookie Monster appearing with the titular Baby Shark and William (a fish).

Babylon (Series).description: Sybil Fawlty appears in a Hotel Babylon sketch for the Children in Need charity event.
Captain Peacock from Are You Being Served? appears in a Hotel Babylon sketch for the Children in Need charity event.

Babylonian Castle Saga.description: Ghosts from Pac-Man appear as enemies in special stages in The Quest of Ki, and Pac-Man appears as a creature card in Seme COM Dungeon: Drururuaga, while Pac-Man Monsters featured characters from Tower of Druaga during a timed promotion and two themes featuring characters from The Tower of Druaga and The Return of Ishtar appear in Pac-Man 99; Dig·Dra·Pac Janken ou is a crossover between the two series and The Tower of Druaga is included in Pac-Man's Pixel Bash.

Pookas from Dig Dug appear as enemies in special stages in The Quest of Ki, while Dig・Dra・Pac Janken ou is a crossover between the two series; additionally a Gilgamesh costume appears in Dig Dug Island.
The core of the Bosconian bases and meteorites from the game appear as enemies in special stages in The Quest of Ki.
The Scorpions from Galaga appear as enemies in special stages in The Quest of Ki.
Mushlins from Libble Rabble appear as enemies in special stages in The Quest of Ki.

Nyamco from Mappy appears as an enemy in special stages in The Quest of Ki and Ki is featured in one of the images in the "Spot the Difference" minigame in Mappy Kids; a Gilgamesh costume with a special action is featured in Mappy Taiketsu! Neo Nyamco-dan, Gilgamesh also appears in Hippari Mappy Daisakusen and Touch the Mappy with 80's Dot Stars; while Mappy is featured in one of the action arts in Dungeon RPG: Druaga Daifugo no Tou.
The Special Flag and Lucky Flag from Rally-X are usable items in The Quest of Ki; the Special Flag also makes a minor appearance in Seme COM Dungeon: Drururuaga.

The Blue Crystal Rod is unlockable in console versions of Soul Edge and SoulCalibur II, SoulCalibur III and SoulCalibur IV, and the Red Crystal Rod is unlockable in console ports of SoulCaibur II. Nightmare and Soul Edge appear as cards in Seme COM Dungeon: Drururuaga. Sophitia received a bonus costume based on Princess Ki in console ports of SoulCalibur II, and Gilgamesh's helmet and sword are available as custom items in SoulCalibur III.

Valkyrie, Sandra and Sabine are playable characters in Sugoroku Adventure: The Tower of Druaga, Valkyrie is playable in Druaga Online: The Story of Aon and appears as a Creature card in Seme COM Dungeon: Drururuaga.

Taira no Kagekiyo appears as a creature in Seme COM Dungeon: Drururuaga, while the default name for the 2nd player in Genpei Toma Den: Computer Boardgame is "Girugame", after Gilgamesh from The Tower of Druaga.
Dr. Don from Point Blank appears as a creature card in Seme COM Dungeon: Drururuaga, while an image of Gilgamesh appears as a possible target in Point Blank 3.
Clovis from Dragon Buster appear as a creature card in Seme COM Dungeon: Drururuaga, and his sword is an equipment card.

The Xevi language from Xevious is featured as the language of Aon in Druaga Online: The Story of Aon, while a picture of a Terrazi enemy from Xevious appears in the Museum area of The Return of Ishtar.
Momo makes a cameo appearance in episode 1 of The Tower of Druaga: the Aegis of Uruk, while a Crab Fencer appears in Dungeon RPG: Druaga Daifugo no Tou.
Monmotaro from Yōkai Dōchūki makes a cameo appearance in episode 1 of The Tower of Druaga: the Aegis of Uruk.

Back to the Beach.description: June, Wally and Beaver from Leave It to Beaver appears in Back to the Beach.
Gilligan and the Skipper from Gilligan's Island appears in Back to the Beach.
Pee-wee Herman appears in Back to the Beach.

Back to the Future.description: Characters watch the Honeymooners episode "The Man from Space" in Back to the Future.
Marty McFly calls himself Darth Vader in Back To The Future.
Marty McFly lies about he is from the planet Vulcan in Back To The Future.
In Back to the Future Part II, Marty sees a ad for Jaws 19. The box for the Jaws NES Game appears in the antique shop in 2015.
In Back to the Future Part II, a Roger Rabbit plush appears in the antique shop in 2015.
In Back to the Future Part II, Marty plays Wild Gunman.
In Back to the Future Part II Biff watches A Fistful of Dollars, then in Part III Marty gets inspiration from the Dollars Trilogy movies for his disguise and to defeat Buford Tannen.
A poster for Revenge of the Creature appears at the drive-in theater in Back to the Future Part III.

Episode 1 of Back to the Future: The Game features a reference to the "Mario Brothers"; additionally the game Back to the Future Part II & III features enemies very similar to the ones from the Mario series.
One of the floppy disks is labelled 'WOPR' in the third episode of Back To The Future: The Game.

A April Fools Trailer for Fast and The Furious 7 (tricked as a trailer for a new BTTF movie known as "Fast to the Future) shows the character Dominic Toretto riding the Deloreon from Back to the Future.
Transformers/Back to the Future is a crossover between the two series.

Bad Dudes Vs. DragonNinja.description: Karnov is the first level boss in Bad Dudes Vs. DragonNinja.

Baki the Grappler.description: Baki Hanma vs Kengan Ashura is a crossover series between Baki the Grappler and Kengan Ashura released exclusively on Netflix.

Bakugan.description: A Bakugan version of Spider-Man is in two Bakugan VS Marvel sets.
A Bakugan version of Wolverine is in two Bakugan VS Marvel sets.
A Bakugan version of Iron Man is in four Bakugan VS Marvel sets.
Bakugan versions of Captain America and Red Skull are each in two Bakugan VS Marvel sets.

Balatro.description: Cards based on Among Us appeared in Balatro as part of the "Friends of Jimbo" update.
Cards based on Dave the Diver appeared in Balatro as part of the "Friends of Jimbo" update.
Cards based on Vampire Survivors appeared in Balatro as part of the "Friends of Jimbo" update.
Cards based on The Witcher appeared in Balatro as part of the "Friends of Jimbo" update.

Baldi's Basics.description: You can find a chalkboard in Baldi's Basics in Education and Learning that mentions Homestar Runner.

Baldur's Gate.description: Baldur's Gate takes place in the Dungeons & Dragons universe.

Ball (G&W).description: Mario the Juggler is a remake of Ball, while Mario and Luigi star in the Ball remake within Game & Watch: Super Mario Bros.; UNDIRECT: Modern Ball within Game & Watch Gallery 2 features elements from the Mario series.
A microgame version of Ball is featured in WarioWare: Touched! UNDIRECT: Modern Ball W Mode within Game & Watch Gallery 2 features elements from Wario Land.

Balloon Fight.description: Tingle's Balloon Fight DS is a crossover between the two series.

Bambi.game: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (Disney)
Bambi.description: Thumper and the Seven Dwarfs is a crossover between Bambi and Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs.

BanG Dream!.description: BanG Dream! characters wear Persona 5 outfits as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Hatsune Miku appear in BanG Dream! as part of a collaboration.
Characters from BanG Dream! dress-up as Re:Zero characters as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Zombie Land Saga appear in BanG Dream! Girls Band Party! during a collaboration event.
Various Hololive characters are obtainable in BanG Dream! as part of a collaboration event.
Characters from BanG Dream! dress-up as Tokyo Revengers characters as part of a special collaboration.

BanG Dream!.game: That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime
BanG Dream!.description: Characters from BanG Dream! Girls Band Party! are transported to the world of That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime as part of a collaboration event.

Band Stars.description: Band Stars contains The Glee Pack which contains the characters from Glee.
Band Stars contains The Pitch Perfect 2 Pack which contains the characters from Pitch Perfect.
The Fruit Ninja stage was added to Band Stars in celebration of Fruit Ninja series' 5th anniversary.

Barbarian (Titus).description: Barbarian is released in Japan as Warrior Blade: Rastan vs. Barbarian, changing one of the characters to Rastan while keeping the other elements the same.

Barbie.description: The TMNT interact with Barbie in a promo for Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem.
Zach Snyder's Justice League is mentioned in Barbie.
The Godfather is mentioned in Barbie.

Barcode Battler.description: The Doraemon Barcode Battler Cards set is part of both series; Doraemon 2: Nobita's Great Adventure Toys Land and Doraemon 3: Nobita and the Jewel of Time are also compatible with the Barcode Battler II.
The Dragon Slayer Barcode Battler Cards set is part of both series; Dragon Slayer II is also compatible with the Barcode Battler II.
The Super Mario World Barcode Battler Cards set is part of both series.
The Legend of Zelda Barcode Battler Cards set is part of both series.
The Barcode Fighter Cards set set is part of both series.
A Dead Zone card is included in the game Barcode World.
A Blaster Master card is included in the game Barcode World.
Four Hebereke cards are included in the game Barcode World.
A Wing of Madoola card is included in the game Barcode World.
A Gimmick! card is included in the game Barcode World.

Barcode Fighter.description: The Barcode Fighter Cards set set is part of both series.

Barnyard (Nickelodeon).description: Otis holds a Charlotte's Web book in Barnyard.
Planet Zeenu appears in the opening of the final episode of Back at the Barnyard. Otis and Pig appear in Planet Sheen's pilot.

Barry Steakfries.description: Age of Zombies was originally going to be a part of Halfbrick Fridays series, and PSP version of Halfbrick Rocket Racing has digital billboards advertising it. A Blast Off Jetpack from Jetpack Joyride is based on the rocket from Halfbrick Blast Off.
Fruit Ninja and Barry Steakfries series contain references to each other. Sensei makes a cameo appearance in Age of Zombies and interacts with Barry in episode 60 of Barry Vlog.

Barry Steakfries is a playable character in Raskulls and an avatar in Magic Brick Wars. The King appears as one of the clothing sets in Jetpack Joyride, and interacts with Barry in several episodes of Barry Vlog.
Jetpack Joyride features the Gravity Suit from Gravity Guy.
Peter Venkman, Slimers and Proton Pack appeared in Monster Dash in 2014. Various characters and locations from Ghostbusters appeared in Jetpack Joyride as part of a special crossover event in 2021.
Various characters and locations from Back to the Future appeared in Jetpack Joyride as part of a special crossover event.

Mecha Micro vehicle skin for Profit Bird in Jetpack Joyride is directly based on Micro from Fish Out of Water!. Olympus makes an appearance in Jetpack Joyride Rock Opera - Shirt Sleeves and Jetpack Joyride 2 as part of the Fish Tank jetpack.

Barry Steakfries is a playable character in Dan The Man. Professor Brains also appears as an antagonist in Fright Zone DLC. The game had a crossover event with Jetpack Joyride in celebration of its 10th anniversary. Dan and Josie appear as clothing sets in Jetpack Joyride.

Colossatron appears as a vehicle skin for Mr. Cuddles in Jetpack Joyride, described  by the game as a 1/4 scale replica of the original, created after Scientists played Colossatron: Massive World Threat on their phones. Rick Dalton appears in one of the trailers for Monster Dash reporting on the outbreak. Colossatron's destroyed head appears at the beginning of Neontropolis levels in Jetpack Joyride 2.
Characters and locations from Metal Slug appear in Jetpack Joyride as part of a special crossover event.
Characters and locations from Star Trek appear in Jetpack Joyride as part of a special crossover event.
Characters and locations from 1987 TV Series appear in Jetpack Joyride as part of a special crossover event.

Baseball (Nintendo).description: Mario and Luigi are the leaders of the teams in the Game Boy version of Baseball.

Basil of Baker Street.description: A toy of Dumbo appears in The Great Mouse Detective.

Bastion.description: Turrets from Portal appear in Bastion after starting a New Game +.
Dino Run DX features a hat based on The Kid.

Baten Kaitos.description: Pac-Man is referenced as an ancient hero in several Magnus found in the Baten Kaitos series.
The Magnus "Wonder MOMO" in Baten Kaitos: Eternal Wings and the Lost Ocean is based on Wonder Momo.
The Magnus "Rare Action Figure" in Baten Kaitos: Eternal Wings and the Lost Ocean is based on KOS-MOS from Xenosaga.

There's a recreation of one stage from The Tower of Druaga in the area "Detourne the Mystical Garden" from Baten Kaitos: Eternal Wings and the Lost Ocean, and several Magus cards are based on the series.

Batgirl.description: Batgirl series is a spinoff to Batman.
Batgirl has a comic crossover with Ghost.

Batman.description: Both series have frequently interacted, the first time being in the World's Finest Comics magazine which included mainly stories from both series; the first in-universe link between both series was in The Adventures of Superman Radio Show, which occasionally co-starred Batman and Robin.
Batman and Godzilla was supposed to be in a movie crossover battle together.

The Green Hornet and Kato appear in the Batman episodes "The Spell of Tut", "A Piece of the Action", and "Batman Satisfaction". Additionally, Batman '66 Meets the Green Hornet is a crossover between the two series.
Colonel Klink from Hogan's Heroes appears in the Batman episode "It's How You Play The Game".
Lurch from The Addams Family appears in the Batman episode "The Penguin's Nest".

The story in The Brave and the Bold #93 is a crossover between the two series, and the House of Mystery also appears in All-New Batman: The Brave and the Bold #12; additionally a character dressed like Cain appears in Batman #237.

Characters from Batman appear in the The New Scooby-Doo Movies episodes "The Dynamic Scooby-Doo Affair" and "The Caped Crusader Caper" as well as many Scooby-Doo! Team-Up comics and the Scooby-Doo and Guess Who? episode "What a Night, For a Dark Knight!"; characters from Scooby-Doo appear in the Batman: The Brave and the Bold episode "Bat-Mite Presents: Batman's Strangest Cases!"; Shaggy dresses up as Batman in LEGO Scooby-Doo! Haunted Hollywood; Scooby-Doo! & Batman: The Brave and the Bold is part of both series.
Batman encounters The Shadow in Batman vol. 1 #253 and #259.
The Joker series is a spin-off of Batman.
Batman and The Hulk had a comic book crossover together.
Batman: Year One issue #1 features a Snoopy lamp in one panel.
Batgirl series is a spinoff to Batman.
Batman and Judge Dredd had a comic book crossover.
Batman and Predator had a comic book crossover series together called Batman versus Predator.
Catwoman series is a spinoff to Batman.
Batman and Spawn had a comic book crossover together.
Batman and The Punisher had a comic book crossover together.
Batman and Spider-Man had a comic book crossover together.
Batman and Captain America had a comic book crossover together.
Batman has a comic crossover with Daredevil in Daredevil and Batman: Eye for an Eye.
Batman and Aliens had a comic book crossover together called Batman/Aliens.
There is a two issue crossover miniseries between Batman, Hellboy and Starman.
Batman and The Darkness had a comic book crossover together.
Batman from Batman Beyond partakes in the Kids WB Pokémon Battle for the Badge; Ash Ketchum also meets Batman characters Kids' WB promos.
Batman has a meeting with Agent J & Agent K from Men in Black in a Kids' WB promo.
Batman discusses with Superman and Agent J & Agent K from Men in Black about letting Captain Planet join their team.
Batman meets Jim Kim from Detention who is disguised as him, Batman asks for a hall pass and Jim gives him a fake one.
The Mask meets The Joker in a four issue comic series.

Batman/The Spirit is a crossover between the two series.
The Lego City sets 7236 Police Car and 7991 Recycle Truck make an appearance in Lego Batman: The Videogame.
The Doom Patrol made an appearance in the Batman: The Brave and the Bold episode "The Last Patrol!"
Space Ghost appears in Batman: The Brave and The Bold.
Kano makes an appearance in Batman: Arkham City Lockdown; while the Joker is a DLC character in the first Kombat Pack for Mortal Kombat 11.
A V for Vendetta comic can be seen on a magazine rack in Batman: The Dark Knight Returns Part 1.
Batman characters appear in The Lego Movie series; the short Batman's A True Artist as well as The Lego Batman Movie and it's sets, shorts, and cancelled sequel are part of both series.
Gotham is a spinoff to the Batman series.
The Green Loontern from Duck Dodgers appears in LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham.
Weeping Angels make cameo appearances in Lego Batman 3: Beyond Gotham
Batman and TMNT will have an upcoming comic book crossover.
The comic Batman '66 Meets the Man from U.N.C.L.E. is a crossover between the two series.
The comic Batman '66 Meets Steed and Mrs Peel is a crossover between the two series.
Voldemort appears in The LEGO Batman Movie.
Sauron appears in The LEGO Batman Movie.
The Wicked Witch of the West and her flying monkeys appear in The LEGO Batman Movie.
Gremlins appear in The LEGO Batman Movie.
The Kraken appears in The LEGO Batman Movie.
King Kong appears in The LEGO Batman Movie.
Agent Smith appears in The LEGO Batman Movie.
Batman meets Elmer Fudd in Batman/Elmer Fudd Special.
Batman appears in several issues of Doomsday Clock. Marionette and Mime from Watchmen appear in the Batman comic Flashpoint Beyond #0.

In The Punisher meets Archie the evil Archie look alike goes to a Union Station where one of the town selections is Gotham which is Batman's Hometown. Later Archie would officially cross paths with Batman in Archie meets Batman '66
Batman/The Maxx is a crossover between both series.
Batman appears in Crossover #2.
Beetlejuice appears on a variant cover for Gotham City Sirens #2 and Batman #152.

BattleBlock Theater.description: The Alien is an unlockable character in BattleBlock Theater along. However only for a limited time Fat Kid was also unlockable.

The Knight is an unlockable character in BattleBlock Theater. However only for a limited time Giraffey and The Troll were also unlockable. Hatty Hattington from BattleBlock Theater would later become DLC in Castle Crashers.

Battle Arena Toshinden.description: Earthworm Jim is a selectable character in the PC version of Battle Arena Toshinden.

Battle Breakers.description: Cuddle Team Leader, Jess, Kyle, Ramirez, Raven, Rustlord and a Supply Llama pet from Fortnite appear in Battle Breakers. Razor and Kurohomura also appear in Fortnite, along with a Cloudpuff Back Bling.

Battle Nations.description: Team Fortress 2 characters appear in Battle Nations, along with missions based on the game.

Battle Racing Stars.description: Barry Steakfries, Zombie T-Rex, Flash and Scientist are playable characters in Battle Racing Stars.
The King is a playable character in Battle Racing Stars.
Mari, Sensei and Katsuro are playable characters in Battle Racing Stars.'
Dan and Josie are playable characters in Battle Racing Stars.
A rocket from Halfbrick Blast Off makes a cameo appearance in Battle Racing Stars.
Olympus makes a cameo appearance in the UFO Apocalypse version of "Bounce Tunnels" stage in Battle Racing Stars.
Colossatron appears in the "Colossatron's Menace" event in Battle Racing Stars.

Battle Stadium D.O.N.description: Characters from Dragon Ball Z are playable characters in the game.
Characters from One Piece are playable in the game.
Characters from Naruto are playable in the game.

Battle Tryst.description: Pastel from TwinBee is a playable character in Battle Tryst.
Battle Tryst was planned to feature Simon and Richter from Castlevania.

Battle for Dream Island.description: In the Battle for Dream Island episode "Rescission", the entire cast of Inanimate Insanity is a recommended character by the series' creator AnimationEpic. Battle for Dream Island characters have made cameos in multiple episodes of Inanimate Insanity. "BFDI and II Finally Cross Over (L.A. MEETUP ON 6/24)" and "BFDI and Inanimate Insanity Meet Up!" are crossovers between both series.
Leafy mentions GLaDOS in "Gardening Hero" and Companion Cube also appears in "5b".
Dora from Battle for Dream Island is based off of Dora from Dora the Explorer. In "Insectophobe's Nightmare 3", Puffball Speaker Box mentions Dora the Explorer.

Battlefield.description: Battlefield Heroes features downloadable costumes and weapons from the 2010 game Medal of Honor and from Medal of Honor: Warfighter.
In Battlefield 3 you can find the helmet of Isaac Clarke from Dead Space; additionally, two characters are seen playing Dead Space in Battlefield: Hardline.
A statue of a peashooter appears in Battlefield 4.
A map of the Ace Combat world is featured in the Battlefield 4: Second Assault map Operation Métro.

Battlestar Galactica.description: The Serenity from Firefly can be seen in the Battlestar Galactica episode "33".
A Constellation class starship is seen in Battlestar Galactica (2004) "Daybreak".

Battletoads.description: The Rhyno enemy from Wizards & Warriors makes an appearance in Battletoads.
Battletoads & Double Dragon is a crossover between the two series.

Battlezone (Atari).description: A tank from Battlezone appears in the Futurama episode "Anthology Of Interest II".
Battlezone is mentioned in Ready Player One.
An arcade cabinet for Battlezone can be seen in Wreck-It Ralph.

Bayonetta.description: Bayonetta features a reference to Resident Evil 4.
The Wii U version of Bayonetta and Bayonetta 2 feature a costume based on Link, also including the Master Sword weapon.
Bayonetta 2 features the Chain Chomp from the Mario series as a weapon; a Peach and a Daisy costume also appear in the Wii U version of Bayonetta and in Bayonetta 2.
The Wii U version of Bayonetta and Bayonetta 2 features the Power Suit from Metroid as a costume, also including the Arm Cannon and Morph Ball functionality.
Bayonetta 2 features a costume based on Fox McCloud with Arwing-shaped guns and an Arwing actually appearing in the game.
Lappy from Astral Chain appears in a trailer for Bayonetta 3. Lappy can also be spotted in Tokyo in Bayonetta 3.

Baywatch.description: Gilligan and Marry Ann from "Gilligan's Island" appear in the "Baywatch" episode "Now Sit Right Back and You'll Hear a Tale".
Ronnie wears a Donkey Kong shirt in the Baywatch movie.
Jason Bourne is mentioned in the Baywatch movie.
High School Musical is mentioned in the Baywatch movie.
Breaking Bad is mentioned in the Baywatch movie.
A SpongeBob mobile is seen in the Baywatch movie, and the SpongeBob theme song is heard. Additionally, David Hasselhoff's appearance in The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie parodies his role in Baywatch.

Bazooka Blitzkrieg.description: Bazooka Blitzkrieg is compatible with the Super Scope, and the main character is seen using it in the game.

Wile E. Coyote is mentioned in Bear With Me.

Beatmania.description: Dance Dance Revolution 2ndMix with Beatmania IIDX Club Version and later games include music tracks from the Beatmania series; music from the Dance Dance Revolution series is featured in some Beatmania games.

Songs from Chase Chase Jokers appeared in Beatmania IIDX 30 Resident as part of a special collaboration and vice versa.

Beavis and Butt-Head.description: Daria is a spin off of Beavis and Butt-Head.

Ray Barone appears in the Becker episode "Drive, They Said".
Doug Heffernan from The King of Queens appears in the Becker episode "Drive, They Said".
Citizen Kane is mentioned in the Becker episode "Super Bob".

Bedtime Stories.description: Somebody in a Buzz Lightyear costume makes an appearance in Bedtime Stories.
Movie tickets for The Lion King can be found in Bedtime Stories.
Two kids watching The Suite Life of Zack & Cody appear in Bedtime Stories.
Somebody in a Ming the Merciless costume makes an appearance in Bedtime Stories.
Bobbi mentions Princess Leia in Bedtime Stories.

Bee Movie.description: Yogi Bear is mentioned in Bee Movie.
Fozzie Bear is mentioned in Bee Movie.
Vincent from Over the Hedge appears in one of the court scenes from Bee Movie.

Beef.description: A plush of Rubble from PAW Patrol appears in the Beef episodes: "The Birds Don't Sing, They Screech in Pain" and "Just Not All at the Same Time".

X-Men is mentioned in the Beef episode: "Just Not All at the Same Time".
Wolverine is mentioned in the Beef episode: "Just Not All at the Same Time".

G.I. Joe is mentioned in the Beef episode: "We Draw A Magic Circle".

Marge Simpson is mentioned in the Beef episode: "The Great Fabricator".

Beeny.description: Beeny acts as a prequel to Kiwi 64 with Kiwi even becoming playable for the last level of the game. A building called Beeny's Bank can also be seen in the Doomsday DLC for Super Kiwi 64.
Macbat appears in a photo in Kiwi's house and is mentioned by Kiwi in Beeny.
Regina & Mac make cameo appearances in Beeny.
Toree appears as a secret unlockable character in Beeny. Additionally, Beeny appears as a playable character in Toree Jolly Jam.

Beethoven (Universal).description: In Beethoven a character is seen playing Super Mario Bros. 3.
Jerry Maguire VHS is shown in Beethoven's 3rd.

Beetlejuice.description: The Blues Brothers from The Blues Brothers appear in Beetlejuice Graveyard Tours.

Bejeweled.description: Zuma is included as a bonus game in the PlayStation 3 version of Bejeweled 3, while Bejeweled 3 is included as a bonus game in the Xbox 360 version of Zuma's Revenge.

Ben 10.description: Galvan Prime is mentioned in The Secret Saturdays episode: Guess Who's Going To Be Dinner, while villains from Ben 10 appear in a most wanted list in the episode: Van Rook's Apprentice. Characters from The Secret Saturdays appear in the Ben 10: Omniverse episodes: "T.G.I.S." and "The Most Dangerous Game Show".
Characters from Ben 10 appear in Generator Rex in the episode: "Ben 10/Generator Rex: Heroes United", while characters from Generator Rex appear in Ben 10 (2016) in the episode, "Ben Gen Rex".
Transformers Animated's Lockdown's hook and Grimlocks fire sword appear in the Ben 10: Omniverse episode "The More Things Change: Part 2".

Bendee.description: The End Credits Theme from Cow and Chicken is used in "Bendee 4"

Edd from Eddsworld appears in "Bendee's Second Birthday", while Bendee appears in "Eddsworld Christmas Special"; according to the Eddsworld Documentary it is confirmed that Bendee and Edd are the same person.

Bendy and the Ink Machine.description: Hello Bendy was a limited time event between the two games. In Bendy And The Ink Machine Bendy's and Sammy Lawrence's roles were played by the neighbor; in Hello Neighbor the neighbor wore a Bendy mask and various easter eggs related to Bendy can be found.

Berd.description: An officially licensed figure was released by Youtooz called "Angry Berd" that showed one of the Berd characters with the appearance of Bomb from Angry Birds.
Berd characters play Monopoly in "candy 7: rescue mission".
Monster Hunter is mentioned in "candy 11: bursting with FUEL".

Berserk.description: Characters from Berserk are featured in Overlord: Mass for the Dead as part of a special collaboration.

Best Friends Whenever.description: Riley and Lucas from Girl Meets World appear in the Best Friends Whenever episode "Cyd and Shelby's Haunted Escape".

Better Call Saul.description: Better Call Saul is a spin-off of Breaking Bad.
A Stuart Little poster can be seen in the Better Call Saul episode: "Nacho".
A replica of the Bravado Banshee from Grand Theft Auto appears in the Better Call Saul episode "Bagman".

Betty Boop.description: Betty Boop and Popeye appear together in Popeye the Sailor with Betty Boop.
Betty Boop and Felix is a crossover between both series.

Between The Lions.description: Big Bird, Bert, Ernie and Elmo appear in the Between The Lions episode "Tweet! Tweet!"

Beverly Hillbillies.description: There were several characters that crossed over between The Beverly Hillbillies and Petticoat Junction.
There were several characters that crossoved over between The Beverly Hillbillies and Green Acres.

Beyblade X Transformers is a collaborative toy line between the two series.

Beyond Good & Evil.description: A mosquito from the Rayman series makes a cameo appearance in Beyond Good & Evil.

Beyond Two Souls.description: An NPC can be found reading a newspaper with the headline "Origami Killer: Seven victims and still no lead" in the Beyond: Two Souls chapter "Homeless". A reference to the events of Heavy Rain.

Sofia appears in Big Air Adventure.

Big Brain Academy.description: In Big Brain Academy there are images of objects from the Mario series, while Super Mario Maker features a costume based on Dr. Lobe from Big Brain Academy.
One of the images in Big Brain Academy's puzzles is the Triforce from the Zelda series.

Big City Greens.description: There’s a doll of Cricket from Big City Green in the Amphibia episode “A Night at the Inn”, while a doll of Sprig from Amphibia can be seen in the Big City Greens episode "Present Tense".
Raven Symoné from Raven's Home talks on the phone with Cricket from Big City Greens as part of a Random Ring call.

Dr. Doofenshmirtz talks on the phone with Cricket, Tilly, and Gramma from Big City Greens as part of a Random Ring call. Additionally, a Perry the Platypus doll appears in the Big City Greens episode "Present Tense".

Launchpad talks on the phone with Cricket from Big City Greens as part of a Random Ring call.

A picture of Stitch appears in Big Hero 6.
Pictures of Bolt and Esther appear in Big Hero 6.
An Oswald sticker is in Hiro's bedroom.
an action figure of Ralph appears in Big Hero 6 while Baymax, Hero, GoGo Tomago and Honey Lemon appears in  Ralph Breaks the Internet.
Launchpad from DuckTales talks on the phone with Baymax from Big Hero 6 as part of a Random Ring call.

Big Momma's House.description: Jerry Maguire is mentioned in Big Momma's House.

Lady Bird is mentioned in the Big Mouth episode: "The Department of Puberty".

A image of Bojack Horseman appears in the Big Mouth episode "Re-New Year's Eve".

The toy Tickle Me Elmo is mentioned in one Big Nate comic strip.

Big Time Rush.description: Brobee appears in the 'Big Time Rush episode "Big Time Halloween" while he, Plex and Foofa appear in Big Time Rush episode "Big Time Cameo".
Patchy The Pirate from SpongeBob appears in the Big Time Rush episode "Big Time Beach Party".

Big Trouble in Little China.description: Escape from New York and Big Trouble in Little China had a comic book crossover together.

Bill & Ted.description: A poster of the 1976 King Kong movie can be seen in Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure.
There's a reference to Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back in Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure.
Ronald McDonald appears in Bill and Ted's Excellent Halloween Adventure.
In Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey, Bill and Ted watch the Star Trek episode "Arena" and later references it.

Billie Bust Up.description: A picture of Barnaby from Billie Bust Up and The Snatcher from A Hat in Time can be found in Barnaby's Manor in Billie Bust Up.

Billy Hatcher.description: Billy Hatcher and the Giant Egg features some Sonic characters as egg animals; Billy Hatcher makes a cameo appearance in Sonic Riders and is playable in Sonic Riders: Zero Gravity and Sonic & Sega All-Stars Racing; Billy Hatcher is set to appear in the crossover comic Sonic and Megaman: Worlds Unite.
The minigame Chu Chu Rocket! Challenge is unlockable in Billy Hatcher and the Giant Egg by collecting the in-game GBA item.
The minigame NiGHTS Score Attack is unlockable in Billy Hatcher and the Giant Egg by collecting the in-game GBA item.
A minigame version of Puyo Puyo is unlockable in Billy Hatcher and the Giant Egg by collecting the in-game GBA item.

Binary Land.description: The bird enemy from Challenger appears as an invincible hazard in the NES port of Binary Land. Additionally, a whale item, similar to the whale enemy from Challenger, also appears as an item, but this is not confirmed.

Bionic Commando.description: Main character from Commando, Super Joe, is a recurring character in the Bionic Commando series.
In Bionic Commando Rearmed, a Met sprite appears in the background; there's also Servbot banners in the 2009 Bionic Commando.
Boxes and banners with the TriCell logo from Resident Evil 5 appear in the 2009 Bionic Commando.

Bird & Beans.description: Pyoro was originally a videogame within the Wario series.

Birdemic.description: Citizen Kane is mentioned in Birdemic 2.
There is a minor reference to the Saw franchise in the 2013 film Birdemic 2.

Birdman and the Galaxy Trio.description: Harvey Birdman, Attorney at Law is a spin-off of Birdman and the Galaxy Trio.

Atlas from Portal 2 is selectable in the Steam version of Runner2; additionally Portal 2 features a flag item with the image of the main character from the Bit.Trip series on it while Bit.Trip Beat features a Portal 2-themed level.
Spelunky Guy is in Bit.Trip Runner2 on the "Good Friends DLC".
Quote is in Bit.Trip Runner2 on the "Good Friends DLC".

Raz is in Bit.Trip Runner2 on the "Good Friends DLC".

Tetris can be seen in the Black Mirror episode: "Striking Vipers.
