Blair Witch is mentioned in the Black Mirror episode: "Loch Henry".
Stuart sings the Scooby-Doo theme in the Black Mirror episode: "Loch Henry".

Black Panther.description: Black Panther made his debut in Fantastic Four #52, and would go on to appear in numerous Fantastic Four comics, with him had at one point becoming a member of the Fantastic Four. Additionally, the Fantastic Four and Doctor Doom have appeared in numerous Black Panther comics.
Black Panther is a regular member of the Avengers. The Avengers have appeared in Black Panther comics.

Spider-Man and Black Panther appear together in Marvel Team-Up #87. Additionally, Black Panther appears in various Spider-Man comics, while Spider-Man appears in Black Panther: The Man Without Fear #516 and Black Panther Vol. 4 #18. Also, Kraven the Hunter from Spider-Man appears in Black Panther Vol. 3 #6 and #7, Rhino from Spider-Man appears in Black Panther Vol. 4 #3-6, and Morlun from Spider-Man appears in Black Panther Vol. 5 #3-6.
Black Panther appears in various Hulk comics, while Hulk appears in Black Panther Vol. 3 #17.

Black Panther appears in various Iron Man comics and in several episodes of Iron Man: Armored Adventures, while Iron Man appears in Black Panther Vol. 3 #41-45 and Black Panther Vol. 4 #18 and #21-26. Additionally, Zeke Stane from Iron Man appears in several issues of Black Panther Vol. 1 and 6.

Black Panther appears in Daredevil #245, #512 and #612, Daredevil Vol. 3 #3, and Daredevil Vol. 4 #7; and appears with Daredevil in Over the Edge #6. Additionally, Black Panther: The Man Without Fear is a continuation of a story that began in Daredevil, and Daredevil appears in Black Panther: The Most Dangerous Man Alive #529.

Black Panther/Captain America: Flags of Our Fathers is a crossover between the two series. Additionally, Black Panther appears in various Captain America comics and in Captain America: Civil War, while Captain America appears in Black Panther Vol. 3 #27 and #30 and Batroc the Leaper from Captain America appears in Black Panther Vol. 4 #3-6 and Black Panther (IDW) #5.
Black Panther appears in various X-Men comics, while the X-Men appear several times in Black Panther Vol. 4.
Moon Knight appears in Black Panther Vol. 3 #20-22.

Black Panther vs. Deadpool is a crossover between both series. Additionally, Black Panther has appeared in several Deadpool comics, while Deadpool appears in Black Panther Vol. 3 #22 and #23 and Black Panther and the Agents of Wakanda #5 and #6.
Wolverine appears in Black Panther Vol. 3 #41-44 and Black Panther Vol. 4 #14, while Black Panther appears in various Wolverine comics.
Black Panther appears in Thor Vol. 5 #16. Thor and Loki appear in Black Panther Vol. 3 #46 and #47, while All-Father Thor appears in Black Panther and the Agents of Wakanda #2.
Shang-Chi appears in Black Panther Vol. 4 #11 and #18. Black Panther appears in Master of Kung Fu #3 and #4.
Blade appears in Black Panther Vol. 4 #12, #13 and #18.
Black Panther appears in Doctor Strange: Damnation #2-4 and Doctor Strange #388. Doctor Strange appears in Black Panther Vol. 4 #18 and Black Panther and the Agents of Wakanda #2.
Captain Marvel appears in Black Panther Vol. 4 #35-38, while Black Panther appears in Captain Marvel Vol. 9 several times, and a photo of him is seen in Captain Marvel: The End.
Moon Knight appeared in Klaws of the Panther Vol. 1 #4.
Black Panther appears in Venomverse and Venom: The End. The Venom sybmiote appears in Black Panther: Long Live the King #6.

Black Rock Shooter.description: There's a series of Weiß Schwarz cards based around characters and items from Black Rock Shooter.
RWBY characters appeared in Black Rock Shooter for a collaboration event.

Black Scorpion (Roger Corman).description: The comic Legend of Isis/Black Scorpion is a crossover between the two series.

Mobichan from Side Arms appears as an item in Black Tiger.
The barrel sprite from Pirate Ship Higemaru appears as an item in Black Tiger.

Blackthorne.description: Erik, Baleog and Olaf from The Lost Vikings make a cameo appearance in Blackthorne.

Blade (Marvel).description: Wolverine vs. Blade Special is a crossover between the two series.
The owners of Underworld pitched a crossover with Blade to Marvel, but the idea was rejected.

Boktai.description: Boktai and the Megaman Battle Network series have had multiple crossovers with eachother. Battle Network 4 features Django at various points, including during a mini-quest to defeat ShadeMan.EXE. in Boktai 2, ShadeMan.EXE becomes a post-game boss. There are also "crossover battles" that can be played by using a wireless adapter to connect to Battle Network 5. Due to declining sales of the Boktai series in the west, English releases began cutting crossovers between games. In Rockman.EXE6 (Battle Network 6) there are various references to Boktai 3 (which never saw an english release). In Lunar Knights, the 4th Boktai game, the Japanese version links with Shooting Star Rockman (Megaman Star Force), allowing players to fight Taurus Fire. Defeating him unlock Omega-Xis as a terrenial to assist the player.

Bombergirl.description: Bombergirl is a spin-off of the Bomberman series, set in a world where Bomberman is a fictional character.
Shiori Fujisaki from Tokimeki Memorial appears as a playable character in Bombergirl.
Tsugaru from the Beatmania series appears as a playable character in Bombergirl.
The "Grim Aloe Explosive Battle" limited event from Bombergirl features Grim Aloe from Quiz Magic Academy as a playable character, as well as an Academy uniform as a Dress-Up Part.

The "Evangelist of Love Advent Gacha" limited event from Bombergirl features an unlockable new character called Sepia Belmont, with her biography establishing she's a descendant of the Belmont Clan. Later events also include a Rondo of Blood and Castlevania III BGM.

The "Konami 50th Anniversary Wai Wai Collab" limited event from Bombergirl is named after Konami Wai Wai World, its banner has sprite art based on its title screen and the event features Konami Lady's Bikini as a Dress-Up Part.
The "Fantastic Shooting Gacha" limited event from Bombergirl features the outfits of Akane & Hikaru from Parodius as unlockable Dress Up Parts and a BGM from Fantastic Parodius.
Racheal from Martial Champion made a cameo appearance in a Bombergirl comic.

The "Fantastic Shooting Gacha" limited event from Bombergirl features unlockable figures of Twinbee, Winbee and Gwinbee, while the "Datena!! Pastel Gacha" limited event features Pastel from TwinBee as an unlockable character.

The "Let's Meet with a Bang!!" limited event from Bombergirl features an unlockable new character named Olive, who is designed after the Contra series and stated in her official bio to be a member of the Contra organization.
Pine from Bombergirl appears as a guest character in Chase Chase Jokers. Additionally, characters from Chase Chase Jokers have made cameo appearances in several Bombergirl comics.

Bomberman.description: Milon makes a cameo appearance in Super Bomberman 2 and is a selectable character in Hi-Ten Chara-Bomb and Saturn Bomberman, while Bomberman characters appear in DoReMi Fantasy: Milon's DokiDoki Adventure.
Bonk is a selectable character in Hi-Ten Chara-Bomb and Saturn Bomberman; additionally Bomberman Hero was originally meant to be a Bonk game.

The minigame BoBomberman included in Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo Bakutou Hajike Taisen is a Bomberman game with Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo characters.

Gachapin ☆ Bomberman and Super Gachapin ☆ Bomberman are crossovers between the two series; Bomberman also appears in Gachapin & Mukku's Big Sports Day while Gachapin Challenge DS features Bomberman themed minigames and Gachapin wearing bomberman's uniform.
Ver.2.1 of Super Bomberman R added three stages from the Metal Gear series as well as bombermen "Solid Snake Bomber", "Naked Snake Bomber" and "Raiden Bomber" based off characters from the series.
Bombergirl is a spin-off of the Bomberman series, set in a world where Bomberman is a fictional character.

A DLC bomberman from Super Bomberman R (added in Ver.1.4) known as "Simon Belmont Bomber" is based off Simon Belmont from Castlevania, while Ver.2.0 added "Dracula Bomber", based on the series' main antagonist, and Ver.2.2 added "Alucard Bomber" and three stages based on the Castlevania series.
As part of a cross promotion, a DLC bomberman known as "Bean Bomber" was added to Super Bomberman R Online based on the Fall Guy, while a Bomberman costume was added to Fall Guys.

Bravely Default.description: Bravely Default is the spiritual successor of Final Fantasy: The 4 Heroes of Light and features many of the same elements; additionally Final Fantasy Brave Exvius includes Bravely Default characters, while Theatrhythm Final Fantasy Curtain Call features downloadable tracks from the game.

Bravoman.description: Bravoman and Alpha Man appear in strip #2 of the Dig Dug 30th Anniversary webcomic, and then Bravoman makes a cameo in strip #7; Dig Dug makes a cameo in strip #100 of the Bravoman web comic, strip #164 features a Fygar from Dig Dug, several pieces of merchandising and video games related to Dig Dug also appear in other strips and the web series.
Strip #27 from the Bravoman web comic references Batman, while "Bravoman & Alpha Boy" from strip #34 is a straight parody.
Strip #51 features a reference to "Mrs. Dig Dug", Mr. Driller's mother; while strip #106 features a Mr. Driller video game.
Wonder Momo appears as part of a crossover story in the Bravoman web comic, and makes several cameos in the web series; strip #240 features Waya Hime disguised as Wonder Momo.
Dirk Davies from The Five-Dimentional Adventures of Dirk Davies makes a cameo appearance in strip #81 of the Bravoman web comic.
Valkyrie makes a cameo in strip #100 and #140 of the Bravoman web comic.

Pac-Man and one of his ghost enemies make a cameo in strip #100 of the Bravoman web comic, strip #230 features the ghost Clyde in a cameo as well and costumes and video games related to Pac-Man also appear in other strips; while a theme featuring characters from Bravoman appears in Pac-Man 99.

The Prince from Katamari Damacy makes a cameo in strips #100 and #278 of the Bravoman web comic; the Prince and the King of All Cosmos appear in the episode "Generic Winter Holiday" of the web series.

Klonoa makes a cameo in strip #100 and #222 of the Bravoman web comic, and strips #239/240 feature Alpha Man disguised as Klonoa; Klonoa also appears in the episode "Generic Winter Holiday" of the web series.

The Galaxian spaceship appears in strip #113 of the Bravoman web comic, while the episode "Generic Winter Holiday" of the web series has one of its aliens making a cameo; there are other minor references to Galaxian as well.
Sky Kid makes a cameo in strip #241 of the Bravoman web comic.

Bravoman appears as a guest character in the final story arc of Mappy: The Beat, while Mappy makes a cameo appearance in the episode "Generic Winter Holiday" of the Bravoman web series; strip #240 features Bravoman disguised as Mappy.
Strip #276 from the Bravoman web comic features a reference to Tekken.
Wagan makes a cameo in strip #280 of the Bravoman web comic, with other references appearing in earlier strips.

Brawlhalla.description: Ragnir is an Alternate Skin for Maypul in Rivals of Aether, while Ranno appears as a skin for Wu Shang in Brawlhalla.

Garnet, Amethyst, Pearl, Steven and Connie from Steven Universe appear as playable characters in Brawlhalla, Malachite makes a cameo appearance in Brawlhalla, and the Crystal Temple appears as a 1v1 stage in Brawlhalla.

Ryu, Chun-Li and Akuma are playable crossover skins. M.Bison, Ken Masters, Sakura Kasugano, Dhalsim and Luke Sullivan also appear as new skins in part 2 of the crossover with Brawlhalla.
Snake Eyes and Storm Shadow are crossover skins in Brawlhalla.
Ezio appears as a playable character and Eivor appears as a crossover skin in Brawlhalla.
Simon Belmont and Alucard are crossover skins in Brawlhalla.

Master Chief and the Arbiter appear as playable characters in Brawlhalla.
Devil Jin, Nina Williams, and Yoshimitsu from Tekken appear as crossover skins in Brawlhalla.
SpongeBob, Patrick and Sandy from SpongeBob SquarePants appear as crossover skins in Brawlhalla.
Obi-Wan Kenobi and Anakin Skywalker from Star Wars appear as crossover skins in Brawlhalla.
Krieg, Lilith and Tiny Tina from Borderlands appear as crossover skins in Brawlhalla.

Breath of Fire.description: Chun-Li makes a cameo in Breath of Fire and later with Sakura in Breath of Fire III, while Ryu, Nina, Peco, Teepo and Momo from Breath of Fire III are selectable in Street Fighter × All Capcom, Breath of Fire 6 features special costumes of Ryu, Chun-Li, Guile and Cammy; Falke got a Katt costume in Street Fighter V: Arcade Edition.
Arthur from Ghosts 'n Goblins appears in portraits in Breath of Fire.
"Zenny", the currency from Black Tiger, appears in several games in the Breath of Fire series.

Breath of Fire 6 features special hunter costumes from Monster Hunter Frontier G, while Frontier G featured costumes of Ryu and Nina from Breath of Fire III; later collaboration events include a Monster Hunter Explore armor set, Rathalos-based weapons, Felyne unlockable character and a special story event in Breath of Fire 6 and a costume set of Ryu and Nina from 6 in Monster Hunter Explore.
Breath of Fire 6 features Madoka and Homura from Puella Magi Madoka Magica: The Movie as part of a special story event, as well as costumes and weapons from the series.
Breath of Fire III enemies Yawn (Foul Weed in English) and Plant42 are named after monsters in Resident Evil, while Breath of Fire 6 features special costumes of Chris, Jill, HUNK and Claire.
Breath of Fire 6 features special costumes of Dante, Trish, Vergil and Lady from Devil May Cry, as well as the special weapons Sparda and Force Edge.
Breath of Fire 6 features special costumes of Morrigan,  Demitri, Felicia and Donovan from Darkstalkers.

Br\u00fctal Legend.description: Brütal Legend features the Tenacious D songs: "The Metal" and "Master Exploder"; the latter of wich features the line "we've got the Pick of Destiny".

Bubble Bobble.description: Monstas and Maitas/Mightas from Chack'n Pop are recurring enemies in the Bubble Bobble series; Chack'n is a recurring character in the Bubble Bobble series having first appeared in Bubble Symphony; he also appears as an item in the original, Memories, Double Shot and Plus! among others, and there are other minor references to him and the series in several Bubble Bobble games.

Bubble Bobble inherits several gameplay elements and many of the same special items seen on The Fairyland Story that'd become recurring in the series, while Rainbow Islands: The Story of Bubble Bobble 2 includes an island ("Magical Island") based off the game, with appearances of several enemies and Horned as the area boss, with Ptolemy making a cameo in the Game Boy Color port; Bubble Symphony features Ptolemy as an assist character and she also spawns as an item in Round 57 of Bubble Memories.
The Rainbow Islands series is a spin-off of Bubble Bobble.

Rainbow Islands: The Story of Bubble Bobble 2 includes an island ("Doh's Island") based off Arkanoid, with several enemies and DOH as the final boss. DOH is also a boss in Bubble Bobble Part II and Parasol Stars; Bub, Bob and Drunk are among the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders, while Round 79 in Bubble Bobble and "TV Machine" Round D-7 in Bubble Symphony references Arkanoid; Round 31 in Arkanoid Returns, Zone C-4 and Zone Beta in Arkanoid DS, Round 04L in Arkanoid Plus!, Round B-2 in Arkanoid HD and Round 98 in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders contain references and two wallpapers from the series are unlockable in DS.

The world of Darius is featured as an island ("Darius Island") in Rainbow Islands: The Story of Bubble Bobble 2 and as the setting of Round E ("Sun 'A' Zone") in Bubble Symphony, including appearances of enemies and Electric Fan/King Fossil (former/NES port) and Yamato (latter) as area bosses; the Silver Hawk is also featured as an assist character in Bubble Symphony, spawns as an item in Round 54 of Bubble Memories with Round 63 of Super Mode resembling the Silver Hawk, and Level 86 of the NES port of Bubble Bobble references Darius.

The world of Kiki KaiKai is featured as an island ("Kiki KaiKai Island") in the NES port of Rainbow Islands: The Story of Bubble Bobble 2 and as the setting of Round B/F ("Kiki KaiKai") in Bubble Symphony, both including appearances of Sayo-chan/Pocky (the latter as an assist character), enemies and Manuke/Rocky as the area boss; Sayo-chan spawns as an item in Round 59 of Bubble Memories, Round 25 of Super Mode references the Puka Puka enemy, and there's an unlockable Kiki KaiKai bubble set in Space Puzzle Bobble.

The cannon from Space Invaders is an assist character in Bubble Symphony and the series is referenced in "TV Machine" Round D-2, Level 11 of Bubble Bobble and Round 5 of Bubble Memories Super Mode; while the recurring "Invader" enemy is based on the eponymous aliens; Stage 3 and 4 in the Parody Mode of Space Invaders DX is based on Bubble Bobble and Rainbow Island respectively and feature a playable Bub in dragon and human form; while he, Bob and Drunk are among the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders.
Bob from Don Doko Don is an assist character in Bubble Symphony.

Hipopo from Liquid Kids is an assist character in Bubble Symphony, and he also spawns as an item in Round 55 of Bubble Memories, while the "Water" bubble in the series works similarly to the water bubbles used in Liquid Kids.
The setting of Pu·Li·Ru·La (Raddish Land) is the setting of Round C and G in Bubble Symphony, with Jack O'Colson as the area boss; Mr. Mikata is also one of many assist characters in the game.
The enemy spy from Elevator Action spawns as an item in Round 56 of Bubble Memories.
Tiki from The NewZealand Story spawns as an item in Round 55 of Bubble Memories.
Sonic Blast Man appears as a playable character in Puzzle Bobble 3.
Psychic Force Puzzle Taisen is a format crossover featuring characters from Psychic Force and gameplay elements from Puzzle Bobble.

Call of Duty.description: Pitfall II is playable in Call of Duty: Black Ops II, Infinite Warfare and WWII.

Spawn appears as an operator in Call of Duty: Warzone 2.0 and Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 along with other Spawn cosmetics.
Alucard from Hellsing appears as an operator in Call of Duty: Warzone 2.0 and Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 along with other Hellsing cosmetics.
Weapons from Doom appear in Call of Duty: Warzone 2.0 and Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 along with other Doom cosmetics.

Ash Williams from Evil Dead appears as an operator in Call of Duty: Warzone 2.0 and Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 along with other Evil Dead cosmetics.

A Sardaukar, Paul Atreides and Feyd-Rautha Harkonnen from Dune appears as operators in Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2, Call of Duty: Modern Warfare III and Call of Duty: Warzone 2.0 along with other Dune cosmetics.
Call of Duty collaborates with The Walking Dead for Season Two of Call of Duty: Warzone and Modern Warfare III, featuring Michonne and Rick Grimes.
Call of Duty collaborates with Warhammer for Season Two of Call of Duty: Modern Warfare, along with other Warhammer cosmetics.
Langley from Path to Nowhere is added to Call of Duty: Mobile as an operator skin for Rin Yoshida. Along with other Path to Nowhere cosmetics.
Mechs from Gundam appear in Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 and Call of Duty: Warzone as operator skins along with other Gundam cosmetics.
Vault Dwellers from Fallout appear in Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 and Call of Duty: Warzone as operator skins along with other Fallout cosmetics.
The Crow appears as an Operator in Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2, Call of Duty: Modern Warfare III and Call of Duty: Warzone 2.0.

Calvin and Hobbes.description: In a Calvin and Hobbes comic strip on October 1, 1986, Hobbes dresses as Mickey Mouse.
In the Calvin and Hobbes comic strip of February 25th 1987, Hobbes tells Calvin that he looks like Astro Boy.
Calvin and Hobbes watch Looney Tunes in the comic strip published on March 22nd 1987.
In the Calvin and Hobbes comic strip of August 12th 1989, Calvin wonders if he could buy Batman junk.

Cameltry.description: The player's ball in Cameltry and Labyrinth can be changed to Chack'n from Chack n' Pop.
The player's ball in Calmetry can be changed to a space invader from Space Invaders.
The player's ball in Cameltry can be changed to the head of Roy Adams from Operation Wolf.

Bubby from Rainbow Islands: The Story of Bubble Bobble II appears in Cameltry holding a 1000 Pts sign if the player reaches the goal with more than 60 seconds on the clock and the ending image from the 4th Plane Master course in the SNES port of Cameltry features Bub and Bob from Bubble Bobble, while its English release On the Ball replaces the Operation Wolf ball with Bub.
Bubby from Rainbow Islands appears in Cameltry holding a 1000 Pts sign if the player reaches the goal with more than 60 seconds on the clock.

The Silver Hawk from Darius appears in Cameltry holding a 1000 Pts sign if the player reaches the goal with more than 60 seconds on the clock, while in the SNES port of Cameltry, the background of stage 2 in the 2nd Plane Expert course, 3rd Plane Special course and 4th Plane Expert course feature the Silver Hawk fighting Strong Shell.
A minion of the Pumpkin Specter from Don Doko Don appears in Cameltry holding a 1000 Pts sign if the player reaches the goal with more than 60 seconds on the clock.
Tiki from The NewZealand Story appears in Cameltry holding a 1000 Pts sign if the player reaches the goal with more than 60 seconds on the clock.
The Inter Gray from Night Striker appears in Cameltry holding a 1000 Pts sign if the player reaches the goal with more than 60 seconds on the clock.
Sayo-chan/Pocky is a preset ball in the Ball Edit Mode from the Sharp X68000 port of Cameltry.
The Vaus from Arkanoid is a preset ball in the Ball Edit Mode from the Sharp X68000 port of Cameltry.

The ending image from the 4th Plane Beginner course in the SNES port of Cameltry features Rastan holding the fire sword, while the head of Rastan is a preset ball in the Ball Edit Mode from the Sharp X68000 port of Cameltry.
In the SNES port of Cameltry, the background of stage 1 in the 1st Plane Expert course, stage 4 and 1 of the 4th Plane Master and Special courses feature Hipopo and Tamasun from Liquid Kids.

Camp Camp.description: The Harry Potter spell "Avada Kedavra" is mentioned in the Camp Camp episode "Mind Freakers".
Monopoly is mentioned in the Camp Camp episode "Quest to Sleepy Peak Peak".
Game of Thrones is mentioned in the Camp Camp episode "Quest to Sleepy Peak Peak".
A figurine of the Green Power Ranger appears in the Camp Camp episode "NIGHT OF THE LIVING ILL".
Scooby-Doo is mentioned in the Camp Camp episode "Ered Gets Her Cool Back".
The Relic of Knowledge from RWBY can be found in the Camp Camp episode "The Quarter-Moon Convergence". Additionally, the two series make several other references to each other all of the time.
The Twilight Zone is mentioned in the Camp Camp episode "St. Campbell's Day".

Camp Lazlo.description: A package for Clam from Camp Lazlo appears in Foster's Home for Imaginary Friends, during the CN Invaded crossover event, and Clam can be seen receiving it in Camp Lazlo.
Heffer appears in the final episode of Camp Lazlo.

Candy Crush Saga.description: Characters from Space Jam appear in Candy Crush Saga as part of a special collaboration.
Sonic characters appeared in Candy Crush Saga during a special collaboration.
Characters from Barbie appear in Candy Crush Saga as part of a special collaboration.

Cannon Spike.description: Cammy and Charlie from Street Fighter are selectable characters in Cannon Spike, and Vega/Balrog/Claw also appears as boss character "Fallen/Revenger Balrog"; while Simone and Shiba Shintaro were introduced in the Street Fighter universe via the online Street Fighter V character encyclopedia and Cammy is given her Cannon Spike costume in Arcade Edition.
Mega Man is a hidden selectable character in Cannon Spike.
Baby Bonnie Hood from Darkstalkers is a hidden selectable character in Cannon Spike.
Arthur from Ghost 'n Goblins is a selectable character in Cannon Spike.
The Cannon Spike stage "The Unholy Dwelling" is inspired by Resident Evil, including an appearance of Cerberus zombie dogs as enemies.

Capcom Arcade.description: Street Fighter and Street Fighter II: Champion Edition are included in Capcom Arcade Hits: Volume 1. "Street Fighter II, Champion Edition and Turbo are included in Capcom Arcade.

1942 and 1943: The Battle of Midway are included in Capcom Arcade Hits: Volume 2 and Capcom Arcade. 1943: The Battle of Midway is included in Capcom Arcade Cabinet as part of the "Game Pack 1", 1942 is included in the "Game Pack 5" and 1943 Kai is included as a bonus game.
Commando is included in Capcom Arcade Hits: Volume 3, Capcom Arcade and Capcom Arcade Cabinet as part of the "Game Pack 4".
Gun.Smoke is included in Capcom Arcade Hits: Volume 3 and Capcom Arcade Cabinet as part of the "Game Pack 2".
Ghouls 'n Ghosts, Ghosts 'n Goblins and Super Ghouls 'n Ghosts are included in Capcom Arcade. Ghosts 'n Goblins is included in Capcom Arcade Cabinet as part of the "Game Pack 2".
Final Fight is included in Capcom Arcade.
Super Puzzle Fighter II Turbo is included in Capcom Arcade.
Magic Sword: Heroic Fantasy is included in Capcom Arcade.
Black Tiger is included in Capcom Arcade Cabinet as part of the "Game Pack 1".
Avengers is included in Capcom Arcade Cabinet as part of the "Game Pack 1".
Section Z is included in Capcom Arcade Cabinet as part of the "Game Pack 2".
Side Arms is included in Capcom Arcade Cabinet as part of the "Game Pack 3".
The Speed Rumbler is included in Capcom Arcade Cabinet as part of the "Game Pack 3".
Exed Exes is included in Capcom Arcade Cabinet as part of the "Game Pack 3".
Legendary Wings is included in Capcom Arcade Cabinet as part of the "Game Pack 4".
Trojan is included in Capcom Arcade Cabinet as part of the "Game Pack 4".
SonSon is included in Capcom Arcade Cabinet as part of the "Game Pack 5".
Pirate Ship Higemaru is included in Capcom Arcade Cabinet as part of the "Game Pack 5".
Vulgus is included in Capcom Arcade Cabinet as one of two bonus games.

Capcom Arcade Stadium.description: Vulgus is included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
Pirate Ship Higemaru is included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
1942, 1941: Counter Attack, 194X: The War Against Destiny and 1944: The Loop Master are included in Capcom Arcade Stadium, 1943 Kai is included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.
Commando and Mercs are included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
Section Z is included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
Trojan is included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
Legendary Wings is included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
Arcade Bionic Commando is included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
Forgotten Worlds is included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
Ghosts 'n Goblins and Ghouls 'n Ghosts are included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
Arcade Strider is included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
Dynasty Wars and Warriors of Fate are included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
Final Fight is included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
Mega Twins is included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
Street Fighter II: The World Warriors, Hyper Fighting and Turbo are included in Capcom Arcade Stadium, Street Fighter and the 3 Street Fighter Alpha games are included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.
Captain Commando is included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
Varth: Operation Thunderstorm is included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
Armored Warriors is included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
Cyberbots is included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
Battle Circuit is included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
Progear is included in Capcom Arcade Stadium.
SonSon is included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.
Exed Exes is included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.
Gun.Smoke is included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.
The Speed Rumbler is included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.
Side Arms: Hyper Dyne is included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.
Hissatsu Buraiken is included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.
Black Tiger is included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.
Magic Sword is included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.
Three Wonders is included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.
The King of Dragons is included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.
Knights of the Round is included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.
Saturday Night Slam Masters is included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.
Darkstalkers, Night Warriors and Vampire Savior are included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.
Mega Man: The Power Battles and Mega Man 2: The Power Fighters are included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.
Super Puzzle Fighter II Turbo is included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.
Super Gem Fighter Mini Mix is included in Capcom Arcade 2nd Stadium.

Capcom Baseball.description: Arthur is pictured in a newspaper ad in Capcom Baseball. One of the players in the "Capcom Games" team is named "Daimakai", after Ghouls 'n Ghosts Japanese name, Dai Makaimura.
The Unknown Soldiers are pictured in a newspaper ad in Capcom Baseball. One of the players in the "Capcom Games" team is named "Lost", after the series' Japanese name, Lost Worlds.
Strider Hiryu is pictured in a newspaper ad in Capcom Baseball. One of the players in the "Capcom Games" team is named "Stri", after the series.

Capcom Beat'em Up Bundle.description: Armored Warriors is included in Capcom Beat'em Up Bundle.
Battle Circuit is included in Capcom Beat'em Up Bundle.
Captain Commando is included in Capcom Beat'em Up Bundle, and the Captain makes an actual appearance in the game's commercial.
Final Fight is included in Capcom Beat'em Up Bundle.
The King of Dragons is included in Capcom Beat'em Up Bundle.
Knights of the Round is included in Capcom Beat'em Up Bundle.
Warriors of Fate is included in Capcom Beat'em Up Bundle.

Capcom Black Jack.description: Capcom Black Jack features appearances of Chun-li from Street Fighter.
Capcom Black Jack features appearances of Claire Redfield from Resident Evil.
Capcom Black Jack features appearances of B.B. Hood from Darkstalkers.
Capcom Black Jack features appearances of Nina from Breath of Fire III.
Capcom Black Jack features appearances of Kyoko Minazuki from Rival Schools.

Capcom Classics Collection.description: Various 194X games are included in the various Capcom Classics Collection titles.
Arcade Bionic Commando is included in Capcom Classics Collection and Capcom Classics Collection Remixed. NES Bionic Commando is included in Capcom Classics Mini-Mix.
Various Commando games are included in the various Capcom Classics Collection titles.
Exed Exes is included in Capcom Classics Collection and Capcom Classics Colection Reloaded.
Final Fight is included in Capcom Classics Collection and Capcom Classics Collection Remixed. Mighty Final Fight is included in Capcom Classics Mini-Mix.
Forgotten Worlds is included in Capcom Classics Collection and Capcom Classics Collection Remixed.
Various Ghosts n' Goblins games are included in Capcom Classics Collection.
Pirate Ship Higemaru is included in Capcom Classics Collection and Capcom Classics Collection Reloaded.
Legendary Wings is included in Capcom Classics Collection and Capcom Classics Collection Remixed.
Section Z is included in Capcom Classics Collection and Capcom Classics Collection Remixed.
SonSon is included in Capcom Classics Collection and Capcom Classics Colection Reloaded.
Various Street Fighter games are included in the various Capcom Classics Collection titles.
Trojan is included in Capcom Classics Collection.
Vulgus is included in Capcom Classics Collection and Capcom Classics Colection Reloaded.
Gun.Smoke is included in Capcom Classics Collection and Capcom Classics Colection Reloaded.
Black Tiger is included in Capcom Classics Collection Remixed and Capcom Classics Collection Volume 2.
Captain Commando is included in Capcom Classics Collection Remixed and Capcom Classics Collection Volume 2.
Avengers is included in Capcom Classics Collection Remixed and Capcom Classics Collection Volume 2.
Magic Sword: Heroic Fantasy is included in Capcom Classics Collection Remixed and Capcom Classics Collection Volume 2.
Side Arms is included in Capcom Classics Collection Remixed and Capcom Classics Collection Vol 2.
Arcade Strider is included in Capcom Classics Collection Remixed and Capcom Classics Collection Volume 2. NES Strider is included in Capcom Classics Mini-Mix.
Three Wonders is included in Capcom Classics Collection Remixed and Capcom Classics Collection Volume 2.
Varth: Operation Thunderstorm is included in Capcom Classics Collection Remixed and Capcom Classics Collection Volume 2.
Avengers is included in Capcom Classics Collection Remixed and Capcom Classics Collection Volume 2.
Mega Twins is included in Capcom Classics Collection Remixed and Capcom Classics Collection Volume 2.
The Speed Rumbler is included in Capcom Classics Collection Remixed and Capcom Classics Collection Volume 2.
The King of Dragons is included in Capcom Classics Collection Reloaded and Capcom Classics Collection Volume 2. .
Knights of the Round is included in Capcom Classics Collection Reloaded and Capcom Classics Collection Volume 2. .
Capcom Classics Collection Volume 2 features an image of Mega Man X in the title screen; the DLC stage pack "CCC_R is Here" for Mega Man Powered Up is named after Capcom Classics Collection Remixed.

Capcom Fighting.description: Twelve Street Fighter characters are selectable in Capcom Fighting Evolution; Ingrid is selectable in Street Fighter Alpha 3 MAX and the three original characters from Capcom Fighting All-Stars have been included in the online Street Fighter V character encyclopedia and Karin is given an Ingrid costume in Arcade Edition.
Anakaris, Demitri, Felicia and Jedah from Darkstalkers are selectable in Capcom Fighting Evolution.
Leo, Kenji, Hauzer and Hydron from Red Earth are selectable in Capcom Fighting Evolution.
Haggar, Jessica and Carlos Miyamoto make a cameo appearance in Alex's ending in Capcom Fighting Evolution.
Characters from Rival Schools make cameo appearances in Capcom Fighting Evolution.
June Lin Milliam and Ellie from Star Gladiator make cameos in Felicia's ending in Capcom Fighting Evolution.
Tong Pooh from Strider makes a cameo in Felicia's ending in Capcom Fighting Evolution.
Ayame and Rouge from Power Stone make cameos in Felicia's ending in Capcom Fighting Evolution.
Yellow Iris from Battle Circuit makes a cameo in Felicia's ending in Capcom Fighting Evolution.
Dante from Devil May Cry makes a cameo appearance in Jedah's ending from Capcom Fighting Evolution.
The Yashichi enemy from Vulgus appears in Hydron's ending from  Capcom Fighting Evolution.
A statue of the War God from Forgotten Worlds makes a cameo in Guy's ending in Capcom Fighting Evolution.

Capcom Fighting Collection.description: Darkstalkers, Night Warriors: Darkstalker's Revenge, Vampire Savior: The Lord of Vampire, Vampire Hunter 2: Darkstalkers’ Revenge, and Vampire Savior 2: The Lord of Vampire are included in Capcom Fighting Collection.
Red Earth is included in Capcom Fighting Collection.
Cyberbots is included in Capcom Fighting Collection.
Super Puzzle Fighter II Turbo is included in Capcom Fighting Collection.
Hyper Street Fighter II is included in Capcom Fighting Collection, while Street Fighter Alpha 3 UPPER is included in Capcom Fighting Collection 2.
Super Gem Fighter Minimix is included in Capcom Fighting Collection.
Capcom vs. SNK: Millennium Fight 2000 and Capcom vs. SNK 2: Mark of the Millennium 2001 are included in Capcom Fighting Collection 2.
Capcom Fighting Evolution is included in Capcom Fighting Collection 2.
Power Stone and Power Stone 2 are included in Capcom Fighting Collection 2.
Project Justice is included in Capcom Fighting Collection 2.
Plasma Sword is included in Capcom Fighting Collection 2.

Capcom Generations.description: Capcom Generations 1 includes the first three games in the 194X series.
Capcom Generations 2 includes the first three games in the Ghosts 'n Goblins series.
Capcom Generations 3 includes Pirate Ship Higemaru.
Capcom Generations 4 includes Commando and Mercs.
Capcom Generations 5 includes three Street Fighter titles, and was released as Street Fighter Collection 2 outside Japan.

Capcom Girl no Mind Puzzle.description: Capcom Girl no Mind Puzzle features appearances of Chun-Li and other Street Fighter girls.
Capcom Girl no Mind Puzzle features appearances of Roll and Tron from the Mega Man series.
Capcom Girl no Mind Puzzle features appearances of Jill Valentine from the Resident Evil series.
Capcom Girl no Mind Puzzle features appearances of Morrigan and Felicia from the Darkstalkers series.
Capcom Girl no Mind Puzzle features appearances of Hinata from the Rival Schools series.
Capcom Girl no Mind Puzzle features appearances of June Lin Milliam from the Star Gladiator series.
Capcom Girl no Mind Puzzle features appearances of Devilot from Cyberbots.

Captain America.description: Captain America characters appear in the Avengers series, most notably Captain America joins the Avengers in issue 4 and since then he has become among the most common members of the Avengers, often serving as their leader.
There have been many crossovers between Iron Man and Captain America.
Moon Knight appeared in Captain America Vol. 1 #245, Captain America Vol. 4 #29, Captain America: Hail Hydra Vol. 1 #4-5, Captain America Vol 7 #24-25.
Captain America faces off against Conan The Barbarian in What If #43.
Shang-Chi appears in Captain America Vol. 1 #302 and #412-414. Captain America appears in Deadly Hands of Kung Fu Vol. 2 #1 and Shang-Chi Vol. 2 #2.

Black Panther/Captain America: Flags of Our Fathers is a crossover between the two series. Additionally, Black Panther appears in various Captain America comics and in Captain America: Civil War, while Captain America appears in Black Panther Vol. 3 #27 and #30 and Batroc the Leaper from Captain America appears in Black Panther Vol. 4 #3-6 and Black Panther (IDW) #5.
John Steed and Emma Peel make an appearance in Captain America #401.
Batman and Captain America had a comic book crossover together.
Agent Carter is a spin-off of Captain America: The First Avenger.
Star Wars is mentioned in Captain America: Civil War.

Captain Caveman.description: Captain Caveman appeared regularly in The Flintstone Comedy Show; Captain Caveman appeared in a segment on The Flintstones Kids called "Captain Caveman and Son".

Captain Commando.description: The NES ports of 1942 and 1943: The Battle of Midway are part of the Captain Commando Challenge Series.
The NES port of Commando is part of the Captain Commando Challenge Series.
The NES port of Ghosts 'n Goblins is part of the Captain Commando Challenge Series.
The NES port of Trojan is part of the Captain Commando Challenge Series.
The Commodore 64 port of Side Arms is part of the Captain Commando Challenge Series.
Mega Man and Mega Man 2 are part of the Captain Commando Challenge Series.
The NES port of Gun.Smoke is part of the Captain Commando Challenge Series.
The NES port of Legendary Wings is part of the Captain Commando Challenge Series.
Mickey Mousecapades is part of the Captain Commando Challenge Series.
The NES port of Bionic Commando is part of the Captain Commando Challenge Series.
The Amiga port of Forgotten Worlds is part of the Captain Commando Challenge Series.
The NES version of Willow is part of the Captain Commando Challenge Series.
The NES version of Strider is part of the Captain Commando Challenge Series.
Capcom's DuckTales for the NES is part of the Captain Commando Challenge Series.
Ginzu from Captain Commando has ties to Guy from Final Fight. The setting of Captain Commando is a future version of Metro City, the setting of Final Fight, and a bust of Haggar appears as an item.

Captain Kangaroo.description: Captain Kangaroo appeared on episode 1126 of Mister Rogers' Neighbourhood, while Mr. Rogers appeared on Season 20 Episode 1 of Captain Kangaroo.

Captain Laserhawk.description: Captain Laserhawk: A Blood Dragon Remix features many elements from the Far Cry series.
Captain Laserhawk: A Blood Dragon Remix features many elements from the Assassin's Creed series.
Captain Laserhawk: A Blood Dragon Remix features many elements from the Rainbow Six series.
Sarah Fisher and Sam Fisher from Splinter Cell appear in Captain Laserhawk: A Blood Dragon Remix.
Rayman appears in Captain Laserhawk: A Blood Dragon Remix.
Rabbids appear in Captain Laserhawk: A Blood Dragon Remix.
Jade and Pey'j from Beyond Good & Evil appear in Captain Laserhawk: A Blood Dragon Remix.
Marcus Holloway, Wrench and T-Bone from Watch Dogs appear in Captain Laserhawk: A Blood Dragon Remix.

Captain Marvel (Marvel).description: Captain Marvel appears in Black Panther Vol. 4 #35-38, while Black Panther appears in Captain Marvel Vol. 9 several times, and a photo of him is seen in Captain Marvel: The End.

Captain N.description: Mother Brain is the main villain in the Captain N TV show, while Samus appears in the comic.
Simon Belmont and Dracula from Castlevania is a recurring character in the Captain N TV show.
Pit and the Eggplant Wizard are recurring characters in Captain N.
Mega Man and Dr. Wily are recurring characters in the Captain N TV show; the Captain N version of Mega Man then appears in the "Short Circuit" page on the Archie Mega Man comic, issues 49 and 55.
King Hippo is a recurring character in the Captain N TV show, while Glass Joe makes a cameo in the episode "Videolympics". Little Mac makes an appearance in the Captain N comic.
Donkey Kong is a recurring character in Captain N: the Game Master.
Captain N: The Game Master features some references to the Mario series; episodes from The Adventures of Super Mario Bros. 3 and Super Mario World were featured in Captain N & the Video Game Masters.
The Captain N: The Game Master episode "How's Bayou" features elements from The Adventures of Bayou Billy.
The Captain N: The Game Master episodes "Three Men and a Dragon" and "The Trojan Dragon" feature elements from Dragon Warrior.
The Captain N: The Game Master episodes "Nightmare on Mother Brain's Street" and "In Search of the King" feature elements from Wizards & Warriors.
The Captain N: The Game Master episode "Simon the Ape-Man" features a reference to Star Trek.
The Captain N: The Game Master episode "Simon the Ape-Man" features a reference to Batman.
The Captain N: The Game Master episode "Simon the Ape-Man" features a reference to Prinsess Leia.
The Captain N: The Game Master episode "Gameboy" features elements from BurgerTime.
Link and Zelda guest star in three episodes of Captain N.
The Captain N episodes "The Trouble With Tetris" and "Totally Tetrisized" feature elements from Tetris.
The Captain N: The Game Master episode "The Big Game" features elements from California Games.
The Captain N: The Game Master episode "I Wish I Was a Wombatman" features elements from Marble Madness.
The Captain N: The Game Master episode "The Invasion Of The Paper Pedalers" features elements from Paperboy.
The last episode of Captain N: The Game Master features elements from Final Fantasy.

Captain Planet.description: Yakko, Wakko, and Dot from Animaniacs sing a song about Captain Planet in a Kids' WB promo.

Captain Rainbow.description: Birdo and Piranha Plant make an appearance in Captain Rainbow.
Mappo and Tao from Giftpia make an appearance in Captain Rainbow (Tao also appears in Chibi-Robo!! but his page in the official site states him to be from Giftpia).
Gitchoman (Drake Redcrest) from Chibi-Robo! makes an appearance in Captain Rainbow; a picture of Captain Rainbow can be found in Okaeri! Chibi-Robo! Happy Richie Osoji!.
Little Mac from the NES game Punch-Out!! makes an appearance in Captain Rainbow.
Hikari from Shin Onigashima makes an appearance in Captain Rainbow.
Takamaru from Nazo no Murasame Jo makes an appearance in Captain Rainbow.
The golf player from the NES game Golf makes an appearance in Captain Rainbow.
Lip from Panel de Pon makes an appearance in Captain Rainbow.
Crazy Tracy from The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening makes an appearance in Captain Rainbow.
The Famicom Wars Soldiers make an appearance in Captain Rainbow.
The Devil from Devil World makes an appearance in Captain Rainbow.

Captain S.description: Captain S enters the world of Altered Beast.
Captain S enters the world of Fifa International Soccer.
Captain S enters the world of Streets of Rage.
Captain S enters the world of Comix Zone.
Captain S enters the world of Shinobi.
Captain S enters the world of Turtles in Time.
Captain S enters the world of Metal Gear.
Captain S enters the world of Strider.
Captain S enters the world of Mega Man.
Captain S enters the world of Vector Man.
Captain S enters the world of Ecco The Dolphin.
Captain S enters the world of Rocket Knight.
Captain S enters the world of Castlevania.
Captain S meets The Angry Video Game Nerd and in a later video fights him.

Captain Toad.description: The Captain Toad series is a spin-off of the Mario series, starring Captain Toad from the Mario series; Super Mario Maker also features a costume based on Captain Toad and one based on Toadette from Captain Toad.

Captain Underpants.description: Dog Man is a spin-off of Captain Underpants.

Captain Velvet Meteor.description: Loid Forger from Spy x Family appears in Captain Velvet Meteor: The Jump+ Dimensions.
Ushio Kofune from Summer Time Rendering appears in Captain Velvet Meteor: The Jump+ Dimensions.

Capy Fine Racing GP.description: Eddie from Brütal Legend makes an appearance in Capy Fine Racing GP.
Reynold from Costume Quest makes an appearance in Capy Fine Racing GP.
Anwen from Might and Magic makes an appearance in Capy Fine Racing GP.
Raz from Psychonauts makes an appearance in Capy Fine Racing GP.
Jef Leppard from Super Time Force makes an appearance in Capy Fine Racing GP.

Car 54, Where Are You?.description: Officer Leo Schnauser is seen watching The Munsters in the 1994 film.

Caravan Stories.description: Characters from Beastars appear in Caravan Stories for a collaboration event.
Characters from Fire Force appear in Caravan Stories for a collaboration event.

Caravan Stories.game: The Rising of the Shield Hero
Caravan Stories.description: Characters from The Rising of the Shield Hero appear in Caravan Stories for a collaboration event.
Characters from DanMachi appear in Caravan Stories for a collaboration event.
Characters from Ayakashi Triangle appear in Caravan Stories for a collaboration event.
Characters from Oshi no Ko appear in Caravan Stories for a collaboration event.
Characters from Tokyo Revengers appear in Caravan Stories as a part of a collaboration.

Card City Nights.description: Characters from Ittle Dew appear in Card City Nights and Card City Nights 2. Additionally, an outfit based on Little Dude from Card City Nights appears in Ittle Dew 2.
Characters from Iji appear in Card City Nights and Card City Nights 2.
Characters from Princess Remedy In a World of Hurt appear in Card City Nights after an update. Additionally, characters from Princess Remedy in a Heap of Trouble were added in Card City Nights 2.
Harbor Street, Bear Mine, and Turnip Corp. from Card City Nights appear as stages in Slap City. Additionally, characters from Slap City were added in Card City Nights 2.

Cardcaptor Sakura.description: Tetris With Cardcaptor Sakura: Eternal Heart is part of both series.

Care Bears.description: Madballs were featured as a crossover in the Care Bear comics, with issue 13.

Carmen Sandiego.description: X the Owl & Henrietta Pussycat from Mister Rogers' Neighborhood appeared in the episode "The Case of the Lifted Lines".

CarnEvil.description: A Trog appears in the Freak Show level from CarnEvil, frozen inside a block of ice as one of the stage's attractions; the enemy "Carnie the Dinosaur" may be inspired by the dinosaurs in Trog!.

Carnival Phantasm.description: Carnival Phantasm features characters from the Fate/ series.
Carnival Phantasm features characters from the Tsukihime series.
Carnival Phantasm features characters from the Melty Blood series.

Carole & Tuesday.description: Carole & Tuesday takes place in Alba City, a location that can also be found in Cowboy Bebop. Additionally, the currency used in Carole & Tuesday is the same as the currency used in Cowboy Bebop.
IDEA can be seen watching Space Dandy in the Carole & Tuesday episode "Video Killed the Radio Star".

Caroline in the City.description: Niles Crane and Daphne Moon from Frasier appear in the Caroline in the City episode "Caroline and the Bad Back".

Caroline from Caroline in the City makes an appearance in the Friends episode: "The One with the Baby on the Bus", while Chandler from Friends appears in the Caroline in the City episode: "Caroline and the Folks".
Jonathon Eliot from The Single Guy appears in the Caroline in the City episode "Caroline and the Folks".

Carrie (Stephen King).description: The Scooby-Doo theme song is mentioned in Carrie.
Carrie is shown on TV in Knocked Up.

Cars (Pixar).description: The Pizza Planet truck makes many appearances in the Cars series; Cars has many references to the Toy Story series; a toy resembling Lightning McQueen as well as a poster of Finn McMissile can be seen in Toy Story 3.
The birds from For The Birds are seen on a power line in Cars.
The snowman from Knick Knack cameos in Lizzie's curio shop in Cars.
Characters watch a car version of Monsters Inc in Cars.
Characters watch a car version of A Bug's Life in Cars.
The Luxo, Jr. can be seen twice on the credits of Cars 2: the first over looking the Pixar Studios building on a map, and the second in an advertisement for "Air Luxo".
A Cars and Star Wars Toy Line was sold in 2013, but was updated in 2014 and 2015.
The "TripleDent" company from Inside Out is a car sponsor in Cars 3.

Cartoon All-Stars To The Rescue.description: Slimer appears in Cartoon All-Stars To The Rescue.
Michelangelo appears in Cartoon All-Stars To The Rescue.
Bugs Bunny and Daffy Duck appear in Cartoon All-Stars To The Rescue.
Baby Kermit, Baby Piggy and Baby Gonzo appear in Cartoon All-Stars To The Rescue.
ALF appears in Cartoon All-Stars To The Rescue.
Alvin, Simon, and Theodore appear in Cartoon All-Stars To The Rescue.
Huey, Dewey, and Louie appear in Cartoon All-Stars To The Rescue.
Garfield appears in Cartoon All-Stars To The Rescue.
Winnie The Pooh and Tigger appear in Cartoon All-Stars To The Rescue.
Papa Smurf, Hefty Smurf and Brainy Smurf appear in Cartoon All-Stars To The Rescue.

Castlevania.description: Moai heads and the Vic Viper from the Gradius series appear as items in several Castlevania games, while the boss Bat Company from Dawn of Sorrow can assume the form of the giant Moai boss from Gradius.

Goemon visits the world of Castlevania in the Ganbare Goemon: Jigenjou no Akumu OVA, Simon Belmont is a playable character in Ganbare Goemon Gaiden 2: Tenka no Zaihō, a vampire hunter look-alike makes a cameo appearance in Ganbare Goemon 2: Kiteretsu Shōgun Magginesu, and Simon's grandfather appears in the Ganbare Goemon: Jigoku-hen manga. Goemon appears as an item in Castlevania: Harmony of Despair.
Sexy Parodius features a stage based off Castlevania, while Aitsu and Koitsu from Parodius make a cameo appearance in Castlevania: Portrait of Ruin and Harmony of Despair.
Metal Gear Solid features a reference to Castlevania: Symphony of the Night, Solid Snake's bandanna and Solid Eye from Metal Gear Solid 4 are hidden items in Castlevania: Lord of Shadows.
The item "Bear Ring" from Castlevania: Circle of the Moon transforms Nathan Graves into Beartank from Rakugakids.
Twinbee appears as an item in three games of the Castlevania series.

A skeleton enemy in Getsu Fuma Den is named Shimon and attacks with a whip, referencing Simon Belmont from Castlevania; while Getsu Fuma and a map based on his game are DLC content in Castlevania: Harmony of Despair.

A cat version of Wagan from Wagan Land is featured in Cat Busters as part of a Namco Catalog IP collaboration.

ClayFighter.description: The Lost Vikings also appeared as cameo in various of Interplay's ClayFighter games: Olaf appeared mentioned in Helga's ending in the first ClayFighter being his girlfriend but later dumping him for Tiny; Erik and Baleog's faces appear as animated sculptures in the stage “Clay Keep” (Tiny's stage) in ClayFighter 2: Judgment Clay; and in some interviews, Interplay designers hinted one of them would appeared in the then upcoming ClayFighter III but that never happened.
In "Clayfighter 63⅓" Earthworm Jim is a playable character.
In "Clayfighter 63⅓" Boogerman is a playable character.

Clerks.description: Jay and Silent Bob from Clerks appear in Mallrats alongside other references to the movie, while Walt and Steve-Dave from Mallrats appear in Clerks: The Animated Series; the Clerks comic and Clerks: The Lost Scene also feature references to Mallrats.
Jay and Silent Bob from Clerks make an appearance in Chasing Amy and there are other minor references to the movie; Alyssa Jones from Chasing Amy then appears in Clerks: The Lost Scene.
The Jay and Silent Bob series is a spin-off of the Clerks series.
Dante's cousin Grant Hicks makes a cameo in Dogma, while Clerks II is set in a Mooby's fast food restaurant from Dogma.
Star Wars is mentioned in Clerks 2.
Lord of the Rings is mentioned in Clerks 2.
A Quiet Place is mentioned in Clerks III.

Conan the Barbarian.description: The first Conan story, The Phoenix on the Sword, was a rewrite of an unpublished Kull story, By This Axe, I Rule. Conan The Barbarian borrows many elements from Kull stories. In the Conan the Barbarian story Shadows in the Skull, it's revealed that Conan is a direct descendant of Kull.
Red Sonja is a spinoff of Conan The Barbarian.
Thor faces off against Conan The Barbarian in What If #39.
Captain America faces off against Conan The Barbarian in What If #43.
Wolverine faces off against Conan The Barbarian.

One of the earliest appearances of Doctor Strange villain Shuma-Gorath was in Conan the Barbarian #259. Heroic Signatures holds the rights to the Shuma-Gorath name, along with additional elements related to the Conan the Barbarian and Kull of Atlantis mythos, which is licensed to Marvel Comics.
Rune faces off against Conan The Barbarian.
Munchkin has a Conan the Barbarian expansion, and also a Conan the Barbarian variant compatible with the base game.
Wonder Woman has a crossover with Conan The Barbarian.
Moon Knight appeared in Conan: Serpent War Vol. 1 #1-4
Black Cat appears in Conan: Battle for the Serpent Crown.
Black Panther appears in Conan: Battle for the Serpent Crown #3, while Shuri from Black Panther appears in Conan: Battle for the Serpent Crown #4.

Contra.description: Bill and Lance are at The Outer Heaven Show Pub. Stage 3 in Contra III: The Alien Wars (Neo Kobe Steel Factory) is set in Neo Kobe, the setting of Snatcher, and feature Snatcher-looking androids as end bosses.
In a special ending from Shattered Soldier Bill and Lance find Sparkster and attack him, while in the special ending from Rocket Knight Sparkster gets attacked by Bill.
A weapon used in two Challenge missions from Contra 4 shoots miniature Vic Vipers. Contra ReBirth features several references to the Gradius series.
A background NPC skateboard girl from Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles II: The Arcade Game makes a minor cameo in Contra ReBirth.
The character Elsu from Arena of Valor appears as a playable character in Contra: Return.
The Terminator and John Connor appear as playable characters in Contra: Returns.
Characters from Saint Seiya: Awakening appeared in Contra Returns during a collaboration event.

In Craig of the Creek, Slide the Ferret is a parody of Sonic the Hedgehog.

Crash Bandicoot.description: Spyro is an unlockable character in the Game Boy Advance version of Crash Nitro Kart and is DLC in Crash Team Racing Nitro-Fueled and Crash Team Rumble. Spyro also makes a cameo in Crash Twinsanity; while Crash makes minor cameos in The Legend of Spyro: A New Beginning and The Legend of Spyro: The Eternal Night. Crash Purple and Spyro Orange are crossover games between the two series.
There's an unused Hulk costume in Crash of the Titans.

The "Hog Wild" plane in Uncharted is named after a level in Crash Bandicoot, while Uncharted 4 features a fully playable stage from the first Crash Bandicoot in one scene, Crash Bandicoot N.Sane Trilogy has Coco watching said scene from Uncharted 4 on her laptop and a framed picture of Nathan Drake on Crash's home and Crash Bandicoot 4: It's About Time has a nod to Nathan Drake in Tawna's epilogue.
Hasty's jacket in Crash Team Racing Nitro-Fueled includes a patch based on Barnstorming.

Crash Zoom.description: Lucy and Ben appear in a flashback in the Eddsworld episode "PowerEdd", while Tom and the monster from "PowerEdd" appears in "Crash Zoom - Orcs & Dorks". The ghost that possesses Edd and Matt in "Trick or Threat" is Kate from Crash Zoom. A PowerEdd action figure and a poster of "Space Cats" was in "Crash Zoom - Movie Massacre"; Additionally, Edd and Tom and a poster of "ASDF Land" appear in "Crash Zoom - Fingered"; characters from Crash Zoom can be seen in a picture in "The End (Part 2)". In "Crash Zoom - Cover Up", a kid from the episode "Fun Dead" appears in one of the pictures.
A figurine of Ristar can be seen in "Crash Zoom - Movie Massacre"
Crash Zoom - Fingered was originally planned to be a sponsored video that promoted The Amazing Spider-Man 2 and was supposed to feature the Green Goblin but was canceled.
An Inkling Amiibo appears in "Crash Zoom - Orcs & Dorks."
A figurine of Rick Sanchez appears in "Crash Zoom - Orcs & Dorks."

A Sonic the Hedgehog popsicle appears in "Crash Zoom - Firing Squad"

The stegosaurus from asdfmovie appears in "Crash Zoom - Out Of Time". Crash Zoom also features many other references to asdfmovie throughout the series. Additionally, Lucy appears in the asdfmovie music video "REAL MAN!"
A bear that looks like Winnie the Pooh appears in "Crash Zoom - Shell Shock"

Danny Phantom.description: Dash Baxter watches tv and accidentally destroys it, after that he says 'right at the part where he says you complete me' in the Danny Phantom episode "Doctor's Disorders". A reference to the iconic line from Jerry Maguire.

Danny Phantom appears on a wanted poster in The Fairly OddParents episode "Poltergeeks". In the episode Crash Nebula, an easter egg is shown when Sprig is looking at his comic. If you look closely, you will see that Danny Phantom is shown on the back of the comic. It says "Butch Hartman's Danny Phantom" and a caption that says "Coming Soon". In Cheese & Crockers, the concept of Denzel Crocker becoming half-man, half-cheese due to a machine built by Cosmo and Wanda is similar to Danny Phantom becoming half-ghost when he used his parents' machine. In The Fairly OddParents episode The End of the Universe-ity, Dark Laser making Timmy go to the bad side is a reference to the episode, Control Freaks, where Danny was hypnotized and becomes bad. In Wishology!, Timmy's and Trixie's kiss is similar to Danny's and Sam's kiss in Phantom Planet. Dash Baxter appears in the episode "Flyboy". "The Fairly Odd Phantom" is a crossover between The Fairly OddParents, Danny Phantom, T.U.F.F. Puppy and Bunsen is a Beast. They also have the same crossover in a comic. In the Danny Phantom episode "What You Want", Danny and Tucker can be seen playing a Crash Nebula arcade game. An older version of AJ appears in the Danny Phantom episode Frightmare.
The Fairly Odd Phantom is a crossover between these series.
The Fairly Odd Phantom is a crossover between these series.
