Poppy Playtime characters appear as DLC for Dark Deception: Monsters & Mortals.
DOORS characters appear as DLC for Dark Deception: Monsters & Mortals.

Darkman.description: The Darkman vs. Army of Darkness comic is a crossover between the two series.

Darkstalkers.description: Blanka from Street Fighter II is referenced in the English version of Felicia's ending from Night Warrior: Darkstalkers' Revenge while characters from Darkstalkers appear in Street Fighter × All Capcom and Street Fighter Battle Combination; guests costumed as Darkstalkers characters appear in Street Fighter Alpha 2, "Street Fighter VS Darkstalkers" is a comic crossover between both series and Street Fighter V features several Darkstalkers costumes. There are other minor references between both series.
A sketch from Red Earth shows Darkstalkers' Hsien-ko as a member of Mai-Ling's combat unit, Darkstalkers/Red Earth: Maleficarum is a manga crossover between both series.

Darkwing Duck.description: Darkwing Duck is a spinoff of DuckTales.
Chip 'n Dale Rescue Rangers has a crossover with Darkwing Duck in Disney Afternoon #9.
Sunni Gummi from Gummi Bears makes a cameo in the Darkwing Duck comic "Campaign Carnage - Part 4".

Dastardly and Muttley.description: Dastardly and Muttley in Their Flying Machines is a spin-off of Wacky Races.

Date A Live.description: Characters from Neptunia appear in Date a Live: Spirit Pledge as part of a collaboration event.

Dave the Diver.description: Leahs from Master of Eternity makes a cameo appearance in Dave the Diver.
Godzilla and Ebirah appear in Dave the Diver as DLC.
Characters and items from Guilty Gear Strive appear as a part of Dave the Diver Anniversary Edition.

Dawson's Creek.description: There's a reference to Crash Bandicoot in the season 3 episode "Four to Tango" from Dawson's Creek.

Day Job.description: Garfield is mentioned in the Day Job episode “Episode 1”.

Days Gone.description: Days Gone features the taser used by Gabriel Logan, the protagonist of Syphon Filter.
Days Gone featured items from Death Stranding after an update.

Daytona USA.description: One of the curves in the Expert course "Virtua City" in Daytona USA 2 is named after Sarah Bryant.

Dead Cells.description: Scorpion from Mortal Kombat is mentioned in the description for the Grappling Hook item in Dead Cells.
A painting of Solaire from Dark Souls can be found in Dead Cells.
A painting of the the Lookout Station from Firewatch can be found in Dead Cells.
A painting of 2B and 9S from Nier:Automata can be found in Dead Cells.
A painting of Hamlet from Darkest Dungeon can be found in Dead Cells.
Two items called Hayabusa Boots and Hayabusa Gloves can be found in Dead Cells.
A painting of the sword from Transistor can be found in Dead Cells.
A painting of the Dueling Peaks from The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild can be found in Dead Cells.
An HEV Suit, Crowbar and Headcrab can be found in Dead Cells as part of a small update to promote the release of Half-Life: Alyx.
The King from Dead Cells appears in Skul: The Hero Slayer as part of an update. Items and skins from Skul: The Hero Slayer appear in Dead Cells as part of the "Everyone Is Here" update.
A painting of the knight from Hollow Knight can be found in Dead Cells. Additionally, items and skins from Hollow Knight appear in Dead Cells as part of the "Everyone Is Here" update.
Items and skins from Hyper Light Drifter appear in Dead Cells as part of the "Everyone Is Here" update.
Items and skins from Guacamelee! appear in Dead Cells as part of the "Everyone Is Here" update.
Items and skins from Blasphemous appear in Dead Cells as part of the "Everyone Is Here" update.
Items and skins from Soul Knight appear in Dead Cells. Items and skins from Dead Cells appear in Soul Knight.
Items and skins from Slay the Spire appear in Dead Cells as part of the "Everyone Is Here Vol. 2" update.
Items and skins from Shovel Knight appear in Dead Cells as part of the "Everyone Is Here Vol. 2" update.
Items and skins from Terraria appear in Dead Cells as part of the "Everyone Is Here Vol. 2" update. Additionally, items from Dead Cells appear in Terraria after an update.
Items and skins from Hotline Miami appear in Dead Cells as part of the "Everyone Is Here Vol. 2" update.
Items and skins from Katana Zero appear in Dead Cells as part of the "Everyone Is Here Vol. 2" update.
Items and skins from Risk of Rain appear in Dead Cells as part of the "Everyone Is Here Vol. 2" update.
A painting of Alucard from Castlevania can be found in Dead Cells.  Also, Castlevania characters will appear as part of the Dead Cells: Return to Castlevania DLC.

Dead Estate.description: Digby has a costume based on the Boyfriend from Friday Night Funkin'. Additionally, there is an item called "Friday Night Pumpkin".

Dead Rising.description: Mega Man's Mega Buster weapon is unlockable in Dead Rising, while costumes based off Mega Man X (normal and first armor), Roll Caskett, Proto Man, Dr. Wily, Sigma, Bass and Zero are featured in several games of the series, together with a multitude of smaller references. Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster features costumes based on Mega Man and Lan Hikari from Mega Man Battle Network and Tron Bonne from Mega Man Legends.
A costume inspired by Spencer from Bionic Commando can be unlocked in Dead Rising: Chop Till You Drop; Dead Rising 4 features a t-shirt with the Bionic Commando remake's logo.
The "Daisy Dukes Outfit" in Dead Rising 3 is a reference to The Dukes of Hazzard.

Super Ultra Dead Rising 3' Arcade Remix Hyper Edition Ex Plus Alpha features Ryu and Chun-Li costumes, along with the actual moves from Street Fighter, and zombie versions of Akuma and M.Bison as bosses; Dead Rising 2 also features a Blanka mask and the combo weapons "Roaring Thunder" and "Dragon Punch" reference techniques from Street Fighter; Dead Rising 4 features costumes of several Street Fighter characters, and Frank West from Dead Rising appears in official art for Street Fighter × All Capcom. Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster features costumes based on Ken and Sodom from the Street Fighter series.

Regina from Dino Crisis is featured as a costume for Annie Greene in Super Ultra Dead Rising 3' Arcade Remix Hyper Edition Ex Plus Alpha, along an actual Pteranodon from the series; a poster of Dino Crisis 3 is a collectible in the "Capcom Heroes" mode from Dead Rising 4: Frank's Big Package.

Edward Falcon's power form from Power Stone is featured as a costume for Nick Ramos in Super Ultra Dead Rising 3' Arcade Remix Hyper Edition Ex Plus Alpha, along his actual moves; Dead Rising 4 features a Power Stone board game and art books in its backgrounds.

Shoma from Rival Schools is featured as a costume for Chuck Greene in Super Ultra Dead Rising 3' Arcade Remix Hyper Edition Ex Plus Alpha, along with his actual moves; Dead Rising 4 features Rival Schools Arcade cabinets, art books and banners in its backgrounds.

Captain Commando is featured as a costume for Chuck Greene in Super Ultra Dead Rising 3' Arcade Remix Hyper Edition Ex Plus Alpha, along with his actual moves, and later as a costume for Frank West in Dead Rising 4.
Kaijin no Soki is featured as a costume for Frank West in Super Ultra Dead Rising 3' Arcade Remix Hyper Edition Ex Plus Alpha, along with his actual moves.

Felicia and B.B. Hood are featured as costumes for Nick Ramos and Frank West in Super Ultra Dead Rising 3' Arcade Remix Hyper Edition Ex Plus Alpha, along their actual techniques; Frank West receives a Morrigan costume in Dead Rising 4 and series artwork and Arcade cabinets also appear on its backgrounds. Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster features a costume based on Rikuo from Darkstalkers.

Mike Haggar is featured as a costume for Frank West in Super Ultra Dead Rising 3' Arcade Remix Hyper Edition Ex Plus Alpha; Dead Rising 4 features a Mike Haggar costume and Final Fight Arcade cabinets in its backgrounds.

Nina from Breath of Fire IV is featured as a costume for Annie Greene in Super Ultra Dead Rising 3' Arcade Remix Hyper Edition Ex Plus Alpha, along with her actual moves, while Dead Rising 4 features billboards and art books from Breath of Fire in its backgrounds.
The Option A from Strider appears as an item in Super Ultra Dead Rising 3' Arcade Remix Hyper Edition Ex Plus Alpha.
The P-38 Lightning biplane from 1942 appears as an item in Super Ultra Dead Rising 3' Arcade Remix Hyper Edition Ex Plus Alpha; Dead Rising 4 features a 1943 board game in its background.

Stores in Dead Rising named "Jill's Sandwiches" and "Chris' Fine Foods" references Chris and Jill from Resident Evil, while weapons and the joke character Tofu from Resident Evil 2 appear as items in Super Ultra Dead Rising 3' Arcade Remix Hyper Edition Ex Plus Alpha; Dead Rising 4 features several art books in its backgrounds, while its update Dead Rising 4: Frank's Big Package features a Jill Valentine costume in "Capcom Heroes" mode, along with her actual moves. Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster features costumes based on Chris Redfield, Leon S. Kennedy, a Licker, Nemesis, a Chainsaw Villager and Ashley Graham from the Resident Evil series.
"Zenny", the currency from Black Tiger, appears in Super Ultra Dead Rising 3' Arcade Remix Hyper Edition EX + α, a DLC package for Dead Rising 3.
Art books of Ace Attorney appear in the backgrounds of Dead Rising 4, a poster of Ace Attorney: Spirit of Justice is a collectible in the "Capcom Heroes" mode from Dead Rising 4: Frank's Big Package.
Art books of Asura's Wrath appear in the backgrounds of Dead Rising 4.
Sissel from Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective is featured as a costume for Frank West in the "Capcom Heroes" mode from Dead Rising 4: Frank's Big Package, along with his actual moves.

Art books of Devil May Cry appear in the backgrounds of Dead Rising 4, while its update Dead Rising 4: Frank's Big Package features a Dante costume in "Capcom Heroes" mode, along with his actual moves.
Art books of Ōkami appear in the backgrounds of Dead Rising 4, while its update Dead Rising 4: Frank's Big Package features an Amaterasu costume in "Capcom Heroes" mode, along with her actual moves.

"Arthur's Boxers" is an unlockable item in Dead Rising, and a costume inspired by Arthur from Ghosts 'n Goblins can be found in Dead Rising 2; Dead Rising 4 features a Ghosts 'n Goblins board game in its backgrounds, and its update Dead Rising 4: Frank's Big Package features an Arthur costume in "Capcom Heroes" mode, along with his actual moves.
Viewtiful Joe is featured as a costume for Frank West in the "Capcom Heroes" mode from Dead Rising 4: Frank's Big Package, along with his actual moves.
The magic lamp item from Midnight Wanderers is featured as an item in the "Capcom Heroes" mode from Dead Rising 4: Frank's Big Package.
A poster of Zack & Wiki is a collectible in the "Capcom Heroes" mode from Dead Rising 4: Frank's Big Package.
Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster features a costume of Blodia from CyberBots: Full Metal Madness.

Dead Space.description: Dead Space 3 includes a suit based on the N7 Armor from Mass Effect, with its description also mentioning Shepard as a fictional character.

Dead by Daylight.description: Michael Myers (as The Shape) and Laurie Strode appear as DLC for Dead by Daylight.
Leatherface is a DLC character in Dead by Daylight.
William "Bill" Overbeck appears as DLC for Dead by Daylight.
Freddy Krueger and Quentin Smith appear as DLC for Dead by Daylight.
The Pig and David Tapp appear as DLC for Dead by Daylight.
Ash Williams appears as DLC for Dead by Daylight.
Nancy Wheeler, Steve Harrington, and a Demogorgon from Stranger Things appear as DLC in Dead by Daylight.
Pyramid Head and Cheryl Mason appear as DLC in Dead by Daylight.
The Look-See appears in Dead by Daylight as a cosmetic set for The Doctor.
The Birch appears in Dead by Daylight as a cosmetic set for The Hag.
Characters from Resident Evil appear as DLC in Dead by Daylight.
Characters from Hellraiser appear as DLC in Dead by Daylight.
Characters from The Ring appear as DLC in Dead by Daylight.
Costumes based on Attack on Titan appear as DLC in Dead by Daylight.
The Xenomorph and Ellen Ripley from Alien appear as DLC in Dead by Daylight.
Chucky and Tiffany Valentine from Child's Play appear as DLC in Dead by Daylight.

Tubarão from Rainbow Six: Siege appears as a crossover skin in Dead by Daylight, along with outfits based on Wamai and Blitz, while outfits and other cosmetics based on the Trapper and the Huntress from Dead by Daylight appear in Rainbow Six: Siege.
Alan Wake appears as DLC in Dead by Daylight.
Characters from Dungeons and Dragons appear as DLC in Dead by Daylight.
Lara Croft appears as DLC in Dead by Daylight.
Characters from Castlevania appear as DLC in Dead by Daylight.
Characters from Five Nights at Freddy's appear as DLC in Dead by Daylight.

Dead or Alive.description: Ryu Hayabusa from Ninja Gaiden is a recurring character in the Dead or Alive series, while Muramasa appears in Dead or Alive 4 and 5, Irene Lew appears in Dead or Alive Dimensions, and Momiji and Rachel appear in Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate. Ayane is a recurring character in the modern Ninja Gaiden series, Kasumi is selectable in Ninja Gaiden III: Razor's Edge and several characters from Dead or Alive appear as cards in Ninja Gaiden Clans.

Lei Fang in the PlayStation version of Dead or Alive has a costume based on the pixie from Monster Rancher, while toys of "Suezo" and "False Suezo" can be found in the Survival Mode from Dead or Alive 2: Hardcore and the "Tecmo 50th Anniversary DLC" pack for Dead or Alive 5 Last Round features various costumes based on Monster Rancher; additionally a Pixie-breed monster based on Kasumi from Dead or Alive appears in several Monster Rancher games and another based on Ayame appears on Monster Rancher Advanced 2.

The PlayStation 2 version of Dead or Alive 2 includes costumes for Ayane and Helena based respectively on Millennia from Kagero: Deception II and Reina from Deception III: Dark Delusion, while Dead or Alive 5 Last Round features a DLC costume set of characters from the series, and also a costume for Helena including a shirt with the Kagero: Deception II logo. The "Butterfly Costume" in Deception IV: Blood Ties is based on Ayane.
The character SPARTAN-458 in Dead or Alive 4 is a SPARTAN-II supersoldier from the Halo series; her stage, called Nassau Station, is also from the series.

Ayane is a guest character in Dynasty Warriors: Strikeforce, where her weapons are selectable, and she's playable in Dynasty Warriors Vs. and Warriors Orochi 3, while Kasumi is playable in Warriors Orochi 3 Ultimate; Naotora Li from Samurai Warriors is a guest character in Dead or Alive 5 Last Round, which also features a DLC costume set of characters from the series; Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate features a costume set based on characters from Warriors Orochi 3 Ultimate; Warriors All-Stars features Kasumi, Marie Rose and Honoka as playable characters.
Dead or Alive: Dimensions features a stage based on Metroid: Other M which also features the appearances of Samus and Ridley.
Dead or Alive 5 features Akira, Sarah and Pai Chan from Virtua Fighter as playable characters, while Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate adds Jacky as another playable character.
One of Kasumi's costumes in Dead or Alive 5 Ultimate is a promotional outfit bearing the logo of Ragnarok Odyssey ACE.
The Sports Gear DLC pack for Dead or Alive Ultimate and the Tecmo 50th Anniversary DLC pack for Dead or Alive 5 Last Round include costumes based on Tecmo Bowl.
Dead or Alive 5 Last Round features DLC costumes of characters from Trails in the Sky and Trails of the Cold Steel as part of the "Falcom Mashup" costume set.
Dead or Alive 5 Last Round features DLC costumes of characters from the Ys series as part of the "Falcom Mashup" costume set.
Dead or Alive 5 Last Round features a DLC costume of Mail from Popful Mail as part of the "Falcom Mashup" costume set.
Dead or Alive 5 Last Round features a DLC costume set of characters from Fairy Tail.
Dead or Alive 5 Last Round features a DLC costume set of characters from Attack on Titan and a stage featuring the eponymous titans.
Mai Shiranui from Fatal Fury is a guest character in Dead or Alive 5 Last Round and in Dead or Alive 6.
Dead or Alive 5 Last Round features DLC costumes of characters from Utawarerumono as part of the "Aquaplus Mashup" costume set.
Dead or Alive 5 Last Round features DLC costumes of characters from Guilty Gear as part of the "Arc System Works Mashup" costume set.
Dead or Alive 5 Last Round features DLC costumes of characters from BlazBlue as part of the "Arc System Works Mashup" costume set.
The Tecmo 50th Anniversary DLC pack for Dead or Alive 5 Last Round includes a costume for Christie featuring a shirt with the Star Force logo.
The Tecmo 50th Anniversary DLC pack for Dead or Alive 5 Last Round includes a costume for Hayate featuring a shirt with art from Rygar.
The Tecmo 50th Anniversary DLC pack for Dead or Alive 5 Last Round includes a costume for Zack featuring a shirt themed after Bomb Jack.
The Tecmo 50th Anniversary DLC pack for Dead or Alive 5 Last Round includes a costume for Zack featuring a shirt themed after Solomon's Key.

Kasumi, Marie Rose, Honoka, Ayane, and Leifang appeared in Destiny Child, while costumes from the game appeared in Dead or Alive Xtreme Venus Vacation with an in-universe reference to "Channel Evil" during special collaboration events.
Costumes based on Haruhi Suzumiya appeared in Dead or Alive Xtreme Venus Vacation during the Kadokawa Sneaker Bunko collaboration event.
Costumes based on Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon? appeared in Dead or Alive Xtreme Venus Vacation during a collaboration event.

Dead or Alive.game: How Heavy Are the Dumbbells You Lift?
Dead or Alive.description: Costumes based on How Heavy Are the Dumbbells You Lift? appeared in Dead or Alive 6 during an update.

Dead or Alive 5 Last Round and later games in the series feature costumes based on characters from the Atelier series; in the Dead or Alive Xtreme Venus Vacation collaboration events the characters are also seen performing alchemy from Atelier Ryza.
Kasumi and Marie Rose appear in Alice Gear Aegis, while costumes from the game with functioning weapons appeared in Dead or Alive Xtreme Venus Vacation during special collaboration events.

Kula Diamond from The King of Fighters appears in Dead or Alive 6 as a DLC character while Dead or Alive characters appeared in The King of Fighters Allstar during a special collaboration; additionally Dead or Alive 5 Last Round featured DLC costumes of characters from The King of Fighters. Characters from Dead or Alive 6 appear in the Japanese and Chinese versions of The King of Fighters '98 Ultimate Match Online as part of a special collaboration.

Deadpool.description: Deadpool #27 features a reference to Street Fighter and the Shoryuken.

Black Panther vs. Deadpool is a crossover between both series. Additionally, Black Panther has appeared in several Deadpool comics, while Deadpool appears in Black Panther Vol. 3 #22 and #23 and Black Panther and the Agents of Wakanda #5 and #6.
Deadpool appears in Shang-Chi: Master of Kung Fu Vol. 2 #1. Shang-Chi appears in Deadpool Kills the Marvel Universe #4 and Deadpool Kills the Marvel Universe Again #3 and #4.
Hit-Monkey appears in several Deadpool comics.
Moon Knight appeared in Deadpool Vol. 4 #28-29 and #49.1, Deadpool's Secret Secret Wars Vol. 1 #1.
Captain America appears in Deadpool Vol. 3 during the "Good, the Bad, and the Ugly" storyline.
Wolverine appears in Deadpool Vol. 3 during the "Good, the Bad, and the Ugly" storyline.
Voltron is mentioned in the Deadpool movie.
Agent Smith from The Matrix is mentioned in the Deadpool movie.
The plot of Taken is mentioned in the Deadpool movie.
Deadpool mentions the name Basil Fawlty in the Deadpool movie.
Batman and Robin are mentioned in the Deadpool movie.
A character is referred to as "Mrs. Magoo" in the Deadpool movie.
Blade 2 is mentioned in the Deadpool movie.
Ripley from Alien 3 is mentioned in the Deadpool movie.
The Room is mentioned in Spider-Man/Deadpool #12.
Room is mentioned in Spider-Man/Deadpool #12.
Sharknado is mentioned in Deadpool 2 and Deadpool is mentioned in The Last Sharknado: It's About Time.
The Princess Bride is parodied in Once Upon A Deadpool.
All Might appears in chapter 9 of the Deadpool: Samurai manga.

Death Note.description: The sixteenth chapter of Death Note features a reference to Mario Golf.

Death Proof.description: The Crazy Babysitter Twins from Planet Terror appear in Death Proof, while Jungle Julia from Death Proof is mentioned in Planet Terror.
Big Kahuna from Pulp Fiction is mentioned by Stuntman Mike and Red Apple cigarettes can be seen in a gas station in Death Proof.
Earl and Edgar McGraw from From Dusk till Dawn appear in Death Proof.
Jasper from Kill Bill: Volume 1 appears in Death Proof.

Death Rally.description: Duke Nukem is a playable character in Death Rally, a shareware version was included in Duke Nukem 3D: Kill-A-Ton Collection.
Barry Wheeler and Emerson from Alan Wake make cameo appearances in the remake of Death Rally.
Mighty Eagle from Angry Birds makes a cameo appearance in the remake of Death Rally.
John Gore from Minigore makes a cameo appearance in the remake of Death Rally.

Death Stranding.description: Rick and Morty appear in a crossover promo for Death Stranding.
Aloy, a Watcher, and a Tallneck from Horizon: Zero Dawn appear as holograms in Death Stranding. Additionally, the Stranded Items in Horizon: Zero Dawn are references to Death Stranding.
Mario is mentioned in Death Stranding.
The PC release of Death Stranding features many items based on Half-Life, including a headcrab hat, Gordon's glasses, a Strider hologram, Gravity Gloves, a Lambda logo, and a wearable valve.
The PC release of Death Stranding features companion cubes from Portal, as well as a message from GLaDOS from Portal.
Items, missions, character and lore from Cyberpunk 2077 were added to the PC version of Death Stranding as part of an update.

Deathloop.description: Deathloop was confirmed to take place in the future of the Dishonored universe by the developers.
Deathloop includes an arcade machine of a parody of Doom called "Hell Crasher".
Deathloop includes an arcade machine of a parody of Prey called "Yerp '17".
Deathloop includes an arcade machines of a parodies of Wolfenstein called "Blüdenstein 4-D" and Young Wolf".
Deathloop includes an arcade machine of a parody of The Evil Within called "The Bad Inside".
Deathloop includes an arcade machine of a parody of Ghostwire: Tokyo called "ShadeWire Edo".

Deathstroke.description: DEATHSTROKE/YOGI BEAR SPECIAL #1 is a crossover between the two series.

Deception.description: The monster breed "Ardebaran" from Monster Rancher is patterned after the creature from Tecmo's Deception, while the breed "Time Noise" from Monster Rancher 2 is patterned after Millenia from Kagero: Deception II. Suezo is a secret trap in Kagero: Deception II and Deception IV: Another Princess.

The PlayStation 2 version of Dead or Alive 2 includes costumes for Ayane and Helena based respectively on Millennia from Kagero: Deception II and Reina from Deception III: Dark Delusion, while Dead or Alive 5 Last Round features a DLC costume set of characters from the series, and also a costume for Helena including a shirt with the Kagero: Deception II logo. The "Butterfly Costume" in Deception IV: Blood Ties is based on Ayane.

Deemo.description: Taiko no Tatsujin: Session de Dodon ga Don! and other games in the series feature music tracks from Deemo and vice versa.
Music from Sdorica appears in Deemo as part of a special collaboration.

Deep Space 69.description: Deep Space 69 parodies Star Trek: Deep Space Nine. Spock, Captain Kirk, Captain Picard and Worf appear in the Deep Space 69 episode “License to Bone”.
There are multiple references to Star Wars in the Deep Space 69 episode “Looking for Love in Alderaan Places”. Han Solo and Chewie appear in the episode License to Bone.
Jay performs the Falcon Punch in the Deep Space 69 episode “The Galactic Bonesmen: Part 2”.

Defenders of the Earth.description: The Phantom appears in Defenders of the Earth.
Mandrake the Magician appears in Defenders of the Earth.
Flash Gordon appears in Defenders of the Earth.

Demon Slayer.description: Demon Slayer items and characters appear in Onmyoji Arena.

Demon Turf.description: Niko from Here Comes Niko! makes a cameo appearance in Demon Turf. Additionally, a drawing of Beebz from Demon Turf can be found in Here Comes Niko!
Slimemantha and Vanity from Social Monsters make a cameo appearance in Demon Turf.
Yooka and Laylee from Yooka-Laylee make a cameo appearance in Demon Turf.
Slime-san can be obtained as a pet in Demon Turf.
Hat Kid's hat from A Hat in Time can be found in Demon Turf.
A poster of a devil-looking Lumi from Urusei Yatsura can be found in Demon Turf.
A poster of a devil-looking Power Pro-kun from Power Pros can be found in Demon Turf.
One of the soundtracks in Demon Terf mention Rocky.

Dengeki Bunko (Series).description: Akira Yuki is a playable character. Pai Chan is an assist character
Asuna and Kirito are playable characters. Leafa is an assist character
Kuroyukihime is a playable character. Haruyuki Arita is an assist character
Mikoto Misaka is a playable character. Accelerator, Touma Kamijou and Last Order are assist characters.

Dengeki Bunko (Series).game: The Irregular at Magic High School
Dengeki Bunko (Series).description: Miyuki Shibo is a playable character. Tatsuya Shibo is an assist character
Rentarou Satomi is a playable character. Enju Aihara is an assist character
Selvaria Bles is a playable character. Alicia Mechiott is an assist character
Shana is a playable character. Wilhelmina Carmel is an assist character
Shizuo Heiwajima is a playable character. Celty Sturluson and Izaya Orihara are assist characters
Taiga Aisaka is a playable character. Ryuuji Takasu is an assist character
Sadao Maou is an assist character in Dengeki Bunko Fighting Climax.
Dengeki Bunko Fighting Climax features a stage set in Green Hill Zone from the Sonic series.
Dengeki Bunko Fighting Climax features a stage set in the Cyber Troopers Virtual-On universe.
Dengeki Bunko Fighting Climax features a stage set in the Shinobi universe.
Dengeki Bunko Fighting Climax features a stage set in the game Phantasy Star Online 2.
Dengeki Bunko Fighting Climax features a stage set in the NiGHTS universe.
Dreamcast from Sega Hard Girls makes a cameo in Dengeki Bunko Fighting Climax.
Hatsune Miku, Megurine Luka, and Kabamine Rin & Len are playable characters in Dengeki Bunko: Crossing Void.

Denkigai no Honya-san.description: In episode 12 of Denkigai no Honya-san, Fu-girl cosplays Azusa from K-On.

Dennis the Menace (DC Thomson).description: Wallace and Gromit appears with Dennis the Menace on the cover of The Beano, celebrating The Beanos 70th birthday.

Dennis the Menace (King Features Syndica.description: Dennis is seen reading a Peanuts book in a Dennis The Menace comic strip.

Deploy And Destroy.description: The world of Divergent takes part of Deploy And Destroy.
The world of John Wick takes part of Deploy And Destroy.
The world of Evil Dead takes part of Deploy And Destroy.

Deponia.game: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (Disney)
Deponia.description: Rufus sings the "Heigh Ho" song from Snow White to taunt the dwarf he finds in the jukebox in Chaos On Deponia.
A TV can be found showing a video similar to Teletubbies in Deponia Doomsday.

Descendants.description: Yen Sid appears in the Descendants book The Isle of the Lost.
Governor Ratcliffe has a son in the Descendants book The Isle of the Lost.
The Hyenas have kids in the Descendants book The Isle of the Lost.
Claude Frollo has a daughter in the Descendants book The Isle of the Lost.
Clayton has a son in the Descendants book The Isle of the Lost.
Mother Gothel has a daughter in the Descendants book The Isle of the Lost.
Malefincient has a daughter in Disney Channel's movie Descendants.
Cruella has a son in Descendants.
Jafar somehow has a son in the Disney Channel movie Descendants.
Belle and Beast have a son in Disney Channel's Descendants.
Mulan and Li Shang have a son in Disney Channel's Descendants.
The Fairy Godmother is a character that appears in Disney Channel's movie Descendants.
Alice has a daughter Descendants: Wicked World.
Edgar Balthazar has a son in the Descendants book Return to the Isle of the Lost.
The Ringmaster has a daughter in the Descendants book Return to the Isle of the Lost.
King Arthur has a son in the Descendants book Return to the Isle of the Lost.
Pinocchio has a son in the Descendants book Return to the Isle of the Lost.
Yzma from Emperor's New Groove has a son in Descendants: Wicked World.
Ursula has a daughter in Disney Channel's Descendants 2.
Captain Hook has a son in Disney Channel's Descendants 2.
Robin Hood has a son in the Descendants book Escape from the Isle of the Lost.
Hades is a character that appears in Disney Channel's movie Descendants 3 as Mal’s father.
Dr. Facilier has a daughter in Disney Channel's Descendants 3.

Desperation.description: The magazine Inside View from The Dead Zone appears in Desperation.

Despicable Me.description: In "Despicable Me", Margo was wearing a shirt that resembles the Lorca. Also in the 2012 film "The Lorax", a toy minion can be seen in a junk drawer.
The Minions from Despicable Me meet Flo in a Progressive Commercial and in the game Flo: Minion Nation.
Gollum is mentioned in Despicable Me 2
The Minions series is a spin-off of the Despicable Me series.
Gru and Kyle from Despicable Me makes a cameo in Secret Life of Pets. Marilyn from the mini-movie 'Norman Television makes a cameo in Despicable Me 3.

Destiny (Bungie).description: Commander Zavala, Ikora Rey and Exo Stranger from Destiny appear in Fortnite. Armor sets of Drift, Black Knight and Omega also appear in Destiny 2.
Armor sets based on Destiny appear in Assassin's Creed Valhalla, while armor sets based on Assassin's Creed appear in Destiny 2.
An armor set based on Kratos from God of War appears in Destiny 2.
An armor set based on Aloy from Horizon appears in Destiny 2.
An armor set based on Jin Sakai from Ghost of Tsushima appears in Destiny 2.
A Ghost shell based on the Cordyceps fungus from The Last of Us appears in Destiny 2.
Cosmetics based on The Witcher appear in Destiny 2.
Cosmetics based on Mass Effect appear in Destiny 2.
Cosmetics based on Ghostbusters appear in Destiny 2.
Cosmetics based on Dungeons and Dragons appear in Destiny 2.

Destiny Child.description: Hatsune Miku appears in Destiny Child during a collaboration event.
Destiny Child features Chun-li and Cammy as part of a special collaboration.

Kasumi, Marie Rose, Honoka, Ayane, and Leifang appeared in Destiny Child, while costumes from the game appeared in Dead or Alive Xtreme Venus Vacation with an in-universe reference to "Channel Evil" during special collaboration events.
Kemono Friends characters appeared in Destiny Child for a collaboration event.
Characters from BlazBlue: Central Fiction appeared in Destiny Child as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Catherine: Full Body appeared in Destiny Child as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Guilty Gear appeared in Destiny Child as part of a special collaboration.

Destiny of Spirits.description: "Knack" summons were available during a special collaboration.
"Gravity Rush" summons were available during a special collaboration.
"DOKO DEMO ISSYO" summons were available during a special collaboration.
Several "Patapon 3" summons were available during a special collaboration.
Several "God of War" summons were available during special collaborations.
Sonic and Shadow summons were supposedly available during a special collaboration.
"Killzone" summons were available during a special collaboration.

Destroyer Duck.description: The events of Spider-Man Team-Up #5 and Savage Dragon/Destroyer Duck take place at the same time, and the characters briefly interact.
Savage Dragon/Destroyer Duck is a crossover between the two series. Destroyer Duck appears in Savage Dragon #41.
The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles appear in Savage Dragon/Destroyer Duck.

Detective Conan.description: Detective Conan & Kindaichi Case Files: Chance Meeting of Two Great Detectives is a crossover game between the two series.
Lupin the 3rd vs Detective Conan is a crossover television special between the two series.
Tamagotchi iD Conan ver. is a Conan-themed Tamagotchi.

Detention (Warner Bros.).description: Batman meets Jim Kim from Detention who is disguised as him, Batman asks for a hall pass and Jim gives him a fake one.

Detroit Become Human.description: Heavy Rain is shown at a film theater in the Detroit: Become Human chapter "Battle For Detroit".

Deus Ex.description: An outfit based on the Sarif Industries Armor from Deus Ex that gives weapon and abilities from that game is available in Sleeping Dogs as part of the Square Enix Character Pack.

Devil Children.description: The Devil Children series is a spin off of Shin Megami Tensei.

Devil Dinosaur.description: Black Panther appears in Moon Girl and Devil Dinosaur #13.
Miles Morales & Moon Girl is a crossover between the two series.

Devil May Cry.description: Weapons from the Devil May Cry series are featured in the Sengoku BASARA series and Devil Kings was loosely inspired by the series; while Sengoku BASARA 4 features costumes based off Dante and Vergil from Devil May Cry, the Sengoku BASARA VS Devil May Cry stage play is a crossover between the two series and Sengoku BASARA Battle Party features Dante and Lady from Devil May Cry 4 as part of a collaboration event.
One of Nero's Devil Breaker arms in Devil May Cry 5 is the Mega Buster from Mega Man, while a rescuable Reploid in Mega Man X6 is named after Dante from Devil May Cry.

Devil Summoner.description: The Devil Summoner series is a spin off of Shin Megami Tensei.
Costumes based on characters from Persona 5 appeared in Soul Hackers 2.

Devil Survivor.description: The Devil Survivor series is a spinoff of Shin Megami Tensei.
Characters from Durarara!! appear in Devil Survivor 2 Record Breaker.

Devilman.description: The film Mazinger Z vs Devilman is a crossover between the two series. The manga Mazinger Angels vs Devilman is another crossover.
The manga Devilman vs Getter Robo is a crossover between the two series.
Cutie Honey vs Devilman Lady is a crossover between the two series.
The OVA Cyborg 009 vs. Devilman is a crossover between the two series.

Devolver Bootleg.description: Devolver Bootleg contains a rip-off of Absolver called "Super Absolver Mini: Turbo Fighting Championship".
Devolver Bootleg contains a rip-off of Ape Out called "Ape Out Jr".
Devolver Bootleg contains a rip-off of Downwell called "Shootyboots".
Devolver Bootleg contains a rip off of Enter the Gungeon called "Enter the Gun Dungeon".
Devolver Bootleg contains a rip off of Gato Roboto called "Catsylvania".
Devolver Bootleg contains a rip off of Hotline Miami called "Hotline Milwaukee".
Devolver Bootleg contains a rip off of Luftrausers called "Luftrousers".
Devolver Bootleg contains a rip off of Pikuniku called "PikuBiku Ball Stars".

Devolver Tumble Time.description: Richard and Tony from Hotline Miami appear in Devolver Tumble Time.
Piku, Niku, Mr. Sunshine, Basskick Champion from Pikuniku appear in Devolver Tumble Time.
Blue, Green, Orange, Red and Yellow from Heave Ho appear in Devolver Tumble Time.
Serious Sam and Mental Mate from Serious Sam appears in Devolver Tumble Time.
Prospect 1 and Prospect 2 from Absolver appear in Devolver Tumble Time.
The Big Ape and Baby Ape from Ape Out appear in Devolver Tumble Time.
Carrion appears in Devolver Tumble Time.
Charlie, Math and Chris from Crossing Souls appears in Devolver Tumble Time.
Purple Scientist and Yellow Scientist from Disc Room appears in Devolver Tumble Time.
Welltaro and the Shopkeeper from Downwell appear in Devolver Tumble Time.
Kiki from Gato Roboto appears in Devolver Tumble Time.
Gris and Forest Friend from Gris appear in Devolver Tumble Time.
The Messenger and Qwarble from The Messenger appear in Devolver Tumble Time.
Minit and Crab from Minit appear in Devolver Tumble Time.
Emma Fisher from Observation appears in Devolver Tumble Time.
Hoji and Lo Wang from Shadow Warrior appear in Devolver Tumble Time.
Friend of Pedro from My Friend Pedro appear in Devolver Tumble Time.
Rambro from Broforce appears in Devolver Tumble Time.
Hero 1 and Hero 2 from The Swords of Ditto appear in Devolver Tumble Time.
Lamb, Follower 1 and Follower 2 from Cult of the Lamb appear in Devolver Tumble Time.
The Android from The Talos Principle appears in Devolver Tumble Time.
The King and Queen from Reigns appear in Devolver Tumble Time.
Shotgun Kin from Enter the Gungeon appears in Devolver Tumble Time.
Akara-184, Donovan and Brandeis from The Red Strings Club appear in Devolver Tumble Time.
The Crow from Death's Door appears in Devolver Tumble Time.

Devolverland Expo.description: The T-Shirt Cannon from Enter the Gungeon makes an appearance in Devolverland Expo.
Devolverland Expo features a booth based around Carrion including the monster from the game.
Devolverland Expo features a booth based around Fall Guys including the Fall Guys from the game.
Devolverland Expo features a booth based around Shadow Warrior 3 including the Oni Hamna from the game.
Devolverland Expo features a booth based around Serious Sam 4.
Devolverland Expo features a t-shirt based on Devolver Bootleg.
Devolverland Expo features a poster based on Katana Zero.
Devolverland Expo features a poster based on Ape Out.
Devolverland Expo features a poster based on Gris.
Devolverland Expo features a poster based on Pikuniku.
Devolverland Expo features a poster based on Disc Room.
My Friend Pedro is mentioned in Devolverland Expo.

Dexter's Laboratory.description: George Jetson appears in the Dexter's Laboratory episode Beard to be Feared.
An animatronic of Grape Ape appears in the Dexter's Laboratory episode "Chubby Cheese".
R2-D2 is mentioned in the episode "Lab of the Lost".
Dexter has a box of Scooby snacks in "Dexter's Lab: A Story".
Characters from The Flintstones appear in Dexter's Laboratory.
The Blue Falcon and Dynomutt appear in the Dexter's Laboratory episode "Dyno-Might".

Dexter makes cameos in many Powerpuff Girls episodes as well as the Powerpuff Girls movie; two of The Justice Friends characters Major Glory and Valhallen appeared in the Powerpuff Girls episode "Members Only". In the Dexter's Laboratory episode Mandarker, one of the elderly judges about to present Dexter with a ribbon is shown wearing a monocle and same exact shoes similar to The Mayor of Townsville from The Powerpuff Girls, both of whom are voiced by Tom Kenny. The Rowdyruff Boys appear in a painting in Dexter's Laboratory Issue 4 of IDW Comics, while the rest of the characters from Dexter's Laboratory appear in the comic Powerpuff Girls: Super Smash-Up!; The Powerpuff Girls also made a cameo appearance as one of many plush toys in the Dexter's Laboratory episode "Star Check Unconventional". In the Dexter's Laboratory episode Germ Warfare, the three talking amoebas found under Dexter's microscope are a reference to the Amoeba Boys, one of the villains on The Powerpuff Girls. In the Dexter's Laboratory episode 2Geniuses 2Gether 4Ever, the Alien on the screen of the Alien Communicator Dexter has is the same alien from the episode of The Powerpuff Girls called Beat Your Greens. In the Dexter's Laboratory episode Babysitter Blues, Lisa's pet name for Jeff is Fuzzy Lumpkins which is the name of a villain from The Powerpuff Girls. Jim from The Powerpuff Girls episode Mime for a Change also makes an appearance in the Dexter's Laboratory episode Bygone Errors. On September 17, 2021, ex-PPG writer Rob Renzetti revealed on his Twitter that he had storyboarded a Powerpuff Girls and Dexter's Lab crossover a decade earlier, which he called a fanfic but this is also considered a reportedly unfinished crossover episode.

Huntor from Dexter's Laboratory appears in the Samurai Jack episode "Jack vs. Mad Jack" and the game "Samurai Jack: Battle Through Time", while a Samurai Jack toy can be seen in some Dexter's Laboratory episodes. In the Dexter's Laboratory episode "Robo-Dexo 3000", Dexter mentions Samurai Jackson similar to Samurai Jack. In the IDW Comics, Jack and Aku make a cameo appearance in Dexter's Laboratory Issue 2.
In the Dexter's Laboratory episode "Oh, Brother", Robot Jones is seen as a toy on a bookshelf in one scene where Dexter walks over to the window and looks outside.
In "Go, Dexter Family! Go!" Dexter and his family wear the same clothes Willy Wonka and his guests wear in the Shrinking Room in Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory.
Little Dog and Big Dog appear in the third issue of the Dexter's Laboratory comic book.
Badaxtra from Dexter's Laboratory appears in a tube in the background of the Villainous episode "The Foul Flower", Val Hallen and The Krunk make a cameo in the episode "BH's Bizarre Bad-Venture".

Dexter (Crime Drama).description: Dexter vs. Jason vs. Hack/Slash is a crossover between the three series.
Dexter vs. Jason vs. Hack/Slash is a crossover between the three series.

Diablo.description: The PlayStation 3 version of Diablo III features Journey-themed pauldrons called "The Hero's Journey"; their description also mentions the Travelers from said game as making appearances in Diablo's world.
Runner, Stalker, Clicker, and Bloater enemies from The Last of Us make an appearance in the PlayStation 3 and PlayStation 4 versions of Diablo III: Ultimate Evil Edition.
The Nintendo Switch version of Diablo III: Eternal Collection features a Ganondorf Transmogrification set, a Cucco pet, and a Triforce portrait frame.

Diagnosis: Murder.description: Diagnosis: Murder is a spinoff of Jake and the Fatman.
Ben Matlock appears in the two-part Diagnosis: Murder episode "Murder Two".
Joe Mannix appears in the Diagnosis: Murder episode "Hard-Boiled Murder".
Cinnamon Carter from Mission: Impossible appears in the Diagnosis: Murder episode "Discards".
Rob Petrie from The Dick Van Dyke Show appears in the Diagnosis: Murder episode "Obsession: Part 2".

Diary of a Wimpy Kid.description: The students play a stage play based on Wizard of Oz in Diary of a Wimpy Kid.
Ice Age can be seen on TV in Diary of a Wimpy Kid.
Mario Kart DS is seen being played in the movie.
Greg and Rowley try to make their own Pac-Man arcade machine.
Greg Heffley mentions that Rodrick had The Lord of the Rings on his summer reading list.
The Diary of a Wimpy Kid: The Long Haul movie has a scene where a woman can be seen dressed up as Undyne from a fan-created "alternate universe" of Undertale called "Underkeep".
Mad Max is mentioned in Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Long Haul.
Jeff Kinney confirmed in a tweet that Nate has met Greg, but it is yet to be recorded any of the current books.

Dick Figures.description: Sound effects from Street Fighter can be heard in "Dick Figures - Teabag Teaser".
Sound effects from Sonic can be heard in "Dick Figures - Teabag Teaser".
Sound effects from Pac-Man can be heard in "Dick Figures - Teabag Teaser".

Sound effects from Mario can be heard in "Dick Figures - Teabag Teaser". In the episode: "Modern Flame War 3", there is an achievement named "Your Princess Is In Another Castle", referencing Super Mario Bros.
The victory theme from Final Fantasy can be heard in "Dick Figures - Teabag Teaser".
Red becomes Batman in the Dick Figures episodes: "Flame War" and "Adventures of Batman & The Bloser". A Batman symbol appears in the episode: "Terminate-Her".
The Angry Birds icon can be seen in the Dick Figures episode: "Flame War", when Red and Blue are playing the game.
A Flux Capacitor appears in the Dick Figures episode: "Steakosaurus".
"Dick Figures - He Who Shall Not Be Maimed" features a reference to Harry Potter.
Lord Tourettes from Dick Figures is based on Flippy from Happy Tree Friends. "New Season Teaser" by Mondo Media is a crossover between Happy Tree Friends and Dick Figures.
Red, Blue and Pink play Dungeons & Dragons in the Dick Figures episode: "Role Playas".
Donkey Kong is mentioned in the Dick Figures episode: "Camp Anarchy".
Rorschach is mentioned in the Dick Figures episode: "Captain Red Rum & The Pina Colada Armada".
Nyan Cat appears in the Dick Figures episode: "Y U So Meme?".
UNO is mentioned in the Dick Figures episode: "Real Dudes Bros Night Man".
Red becomes the Terminator in the Dick Figures episode: "Terminate-Her".

The Fat Ugly Girl dresses up as a Companion Cube in the Dick Figures episode: "Terminate-Her". In the episode: "Modern Flame War 3", there is an achievement named "Go to Chell", referencing Chell from Portal.
A stick figure dresses up as Pikachu in the Dick Figures episode: "Terminate-Her".
A stick figure dresses up as Cyclops in the Dick Figures episode: "Terminate-Her".
Blue dresses up as Picard in the Dick Figures episode: "Terminate-Her".
World of Warcraft is mentioned in the Dick Figures episode: "Modern Flame War 3".

Dick Tracy.description: Popeye and Olive Oyl make out-of-frame appearances in a Dick Tracy comic strip.
Characters from Little Orphan Annie have appeared in several Dick Tracy comic strips.
Several characters from The Spirit appear in several Dick Tracy comic strips.
The Green Hornet appears in several Dick Tracy comic strips.
Several characters from the The Addams Family appear in a Dick Tracy comic strip.

Diddy Kong Racing.description: Diddy Kong Racing is a spinoff of the Donkey Kong series.
Banjo is selectable in Diddy Kong Racing; Tiptup makes appearances in Banjo-Kazooie and Banjo-Tooie; The cancelled Diddy Kong Pilot was remade into Banjo-Pilot.
Conker is selectable in Diddy Kong Racing.
The logo of Killer Instinct can be seen on walls in Diddy Kong Racing.

Die Hard.description: Rambo is mentioned in Die Hard.
An episode of The Simpsons is seen on a TV in Die Hard 2; Homer writes a letter to Die Hard in the Simpsons episode "My Mother the Carjacker".
The Addams Family is mentioned in Die Hard with a Vengeance.
Captain Kangaroo is mentioned in Die Hard with a Vengeance.
Dynamite Deka is a spinoff of Die Hard Arcade.
Star Wars is mentioned in Live Free or Die Hard.
Daisy Duke is mentioned in Live Free or Die Hard.
G.I. Joe is mentioned in Live Free or Die Hard.
Freddy can be seen playing Gears of War in Live Free or Die Hard.
An Asteroids arcade cabinet can be seen in Live Free or Die Hard.
A Terminator figurine can be seen in Live Free or Die Hard.

Diff'rent Strokes.description: Arnold and Dudley from Diff'rent Strokes are fans of Knight Rider; David Hasselhoff, star of Knight Rider, appears alongside KITT in the Diff'rent Strokes episode "Hooray For Hollywood: Part 2".
Arnold Jackson appears in the Amazing Stories episode "Remote Control Man".
There is a minor reference to Diff'rent Strokes in Stay Tuned titled “Different Strokes.”

Dig Build Live.description: Mobs watch Felix the Cat in Episode 2 of Dig Build Live.
Dave the Zombie from Slamacow makes a cameo appearance in Episodes 2 and 4 of Dig Build Live.

Dig Dug.description: The Special Flag from Rally-X is a special item in the NES version of Dig Dug II and in Dig Dug Arrangement; Dig Dug: Digging Strike also features a reference to New Rally-X.

Pookas from Dig Dug appear as enemies in special stages in The Quest of Ki, while Dig・Dra・Pac Janken ou is a crossover between the two series; additionally a Gilgamesh costume appears in Dig Dug Island.

Mr. Driller is a spin-off of the Dig Dug series; Mr. Driller also makes an appearance in Dig Dug: Digging Strike, and various characters from the series appear in the Dig Dug 30th Anniversary webcomic.

Pooka from Dig Dug makes a cameo in Pac-Man World, is a recurring enemy in Pac-Man World 2 and an unlockable character in  Ms. Pac-Man Maze Madness, in Pac-Man World Rally along with Fygar and as part of a theme with other Dig Dug characters in Pac-Man 99, while Taizou Hori is selectable in Pac-Man Kart Rally; Pac-Man appears in strip #9 of the Dig Dug 30th Anniversary webcomic; Dig·Dra·Pac Janken ou is a crossover between the two series.
A Valkyrie costume appears in Dig Dug Island.
A Wonder Momo costume appears in Dig Dug Island.

Bravoman and Alpha Man appear in strip #2 of the Dig Dug 30th Anniversary webcomic, and then Bravoman makes a cameo in strip #7; Dig Dug makes a cameo in strip #100 of the Bravoman web comic, strip #164 features a Fygar from Dig Dug, several pieces of merchandising and video games related to Dig Dug also appear in other strips and the web series.
Wagan and other characters from Wagan Land appear in strip #2 of the Dig Dug 30th Anniversary webcomic.
Red from the ShiftyLook Sky Kid comic appears in strip #2 of the Dig Dug 30th Anniversary comic; additionally Pooka from Dig Dug appears as an item in Sky Kid.
Kissy from Baraduke appears in strip #7 of the Dig Dug 30th Anniversary webcomic.
A Creeper from Minecraft appears in strip #23 of the Dig Dug 30th Anniversary web comic.
Hiromi from Burning Force makes a cameo in strip #28 of the Dig Dug 30th Anniversary webcomic.
A character resembling Heihachi Mishima and another dressed like King appear in strip #7 of the Dig Dug 30th Anniversary webcomic, while King makes a cameo in strip #33.

Mappy makes a cameo in strip #33 of the Dig Dug 30th Anniversary webcomic, while the Dig Dug protagonist is a supporting character in Mappy: The Beat; Dig Dug, Pookas and Fygars appear in Mappy Taiketsu! Neo Nyamco-dan, Hippari Mappy Daisakusen and Touch the Mappy with 80's Dot Stars; additionally a Mappy costume appears in Dig Dug Island and a Pooka image appears in Mappy Kids.
BB from Fate/EXTRA CCC stars in Dig Dug BB.

Digimon.description: Mukku and P-Chan make an appearance in Episode 35 of Digimon: Digital Monsters.
Lili from Tekken makes a cameo appearance in Digimon World Re:Digitalize.
Metabee and Rokusho from Medabots appear in Digimon ReArise as part of a collaboration event, while robots inspired by Digimon appear in Medabots S as part of a collaboration event.

Digital Devil Saga.description: The Digital Devil Saga series is a spin-off of Shin Megami Tensei.

Dilbert.description: Dogbert says Kermit is a muppet in one Dilbert comic strip.
Charlie Brown from Peanuts is mentioned in a Dilbert comic strip.

Dino Crisis.description: A Street Fighter Alpha artwork can be found in the Researcher Rest Room area from Dino Crisis; while Dino Crisis was one of the planned series to be featured in Street Fighter × All Capcom.
A Star Wars magazine can be found in the Researcher Rest Room area from Dino Crisis.

Crates in Dino Crisis are marked with Umbrella's logo. One of the costumes found in Resident Evil 3: Nemesis Boutique room includes a costume based on Regina from Dino Crisis. Additionally, a Dino Crisis poster can be found in Resident Evil: Survivor and stage 5 from Dino Stalker features references to Resident Evil.

Dino Rex.description: The beast master is revealed to be Rastan in the ending of Dino Rex.

Dinosaurs (ABC).description: Godzilla is mentioned in the Dinosaurs episode "Hurling Day".

Disenchantment.description: Fry, Bender, and Professor Farnsworth make a cameo from the hologram created by the crystal ball in the episode Dreamland Falls.

Disgaea.description: Laharl, Etna, Flonne, Baal, Vyers and Pringer X from Disgaea appear in Phantom Brave. Marona from Phantom Brave appears in Disgaea 3 as a bonus character, while both Marona and Ash appear in Disgaea 2: Dark Hero Days, Disgaea 4, and Disgaea D2 as DLC characters.

Nisa mentions the Netherworld from Disgaea in Hyperdimension Neptunia mk2, and a giant Prinny from Disgaea appears as part of one of her attacks in the same game. Nisa later appears as a DLC character in Disgaea 4, Disgaea D2, and Disgaea 5.

Disney Princess.game: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs (Disney)
Disney Princess.description: Snow White is one of the official Disney Princesses, first appearing in the original Disney's Musical Princess Collection.

Cinderella is one of the official Disney Princesses, first appearing in the original Disney's Musical Princess Collection with Prince Charming; the Fairy Godmother was also included in the Disney Perfume Princess Collection .
Aurora is one of the official Disney Princesses, first appearing in the original Disney's Musical Princess Collection; Prince Phillip was also included in the Disney's Dancing Princess Collection.
Belle is one of the official Disney Princesses, first appearing in the original Disney's Musical Princess Collection with The Beast.
Jasmine is one of the official Disney Princesses, first appearing in the original Disney's Musical Princess Collection with Aladdin.
Pocahontas is one of the official Disney Princesses, first appearing in the Disney's Dancing Princess Collection.
Ariel is one of the official Disney Princesses, first appearing alongside Prince Eric in a Disney's Dancing Princess Collection Gift Set; Ariel's sisters are also included in later material.
The song "I Won't Say (I'm in Love)" from Hercules is included in Sing Along Songs: Disney Princess Volume 1 - Once Upon a Dream.
Mulan is one of the official Disney Princesses, first appearing as a singer for the "If You Can Dream" song in Disney Princess Sing Along Songs - Volume 1: Once Upon a Dream.
The song "Love" from Robin Hood is included in Disney Princess Sing Along Songs - Volume 2: Enchanted Tea Party.
The songs "In a World of My Own" and "All in the Golden Afternoon" from Alice in Wonderland are included respectively in Disney Princess Sing Along Songs - Volume 2 and Volume 3.
Tiana is one of the official Disney Princesses, joining the line-up with a coronation ceremony.
Rapunzel is one of the official Disney Princesses, joining the line-up with a coronation ceremony.
Merida is one of the official Disney Princesses, joining the line-up with a coronation ceremony.
Moana is one of the official Disney Princesses, first appearing in promotional material and added to the official line-up in 2019.
Raya is one of the official Disney Princesses, joining the line-up during Disney's 2022 World Princess Week.

Zorro and Django have a crossover comic.

A card based on Cult of the Lamb can be found in Do You Know Gaming?.
A card based on Inscryption can be found in Do You Know Gaming?.

Doc McStuffins.description: Pooh, Tigger, Piglet, Eeyore and Christoper Robin from Winnie The Pooh appear in the Doc McStuffins episode Into the Hundred Acre Wood. Pooh makes a cameo in the episode The Doc McStuffins Christmas Special.

Doctor Strange.description: Doctor Strange villain Shuma-Gorath and his iron-bound books were first mentioned in Robert E. Howard's Kull of Atlantis short story "The Curse of the Golden Skull". Heroic Signatures holds the rights to the Shuma-Gorath name, along with additional elements related to the Conan the Barbarian and Kull of Atlantis mythos, which is licensed to Marvel Comics.
Doctor Strange appears in Rom #5, #41, #42 and #54. Rom appears in a flashback in Doctor Strange, Sorcerer Supreme Annual #2.
Black Panther appears in Doctor Strange: Damnation #2-4 and Doctor Strange #388. Doctor Strange appears in Black Panther Vol. 4 #18 and Black Panther and the Agents of Wakanda #2.
Moon Knight appeared in Doctor Strange: Damnation Vol. 1 #1-4, Doctor Strange Vol. 1 #387, and Death of Doctor Strange: Spider-Man Vol. 1 #1.

Doctor Who.description: A character starts a projector to play a James Bond film in the novelisation Doctor Who And The Tenth Planet by Gerry Davis.
K-9 series is a spin-off of the Doctor Who series.
Godzilla is mentioned in part 2 of the comic story Time Bomb from issue 115 of Doctor Who Magazine.
Transformer's villain, Death's Head, appears in "Doctor Who Magazine #135".
A character gets nicknamed 'Darth Vader' in part 1 of Survival from Doctor Who.
There have been several crossovers with Doctor Who and The Avengers.
EastEnders and Doctor Who have a television crossover together in "Dimensions in Time".
Back To The Future is mentioned in the novel Left Handed Hummingbird by Kate Orman.
Mel Joseph plays Sonic The Hedgehog in the novel Conundrum by Steve Lyons.
Doctor Who and Judge Dredd were suppose to have a crossover together but was scrapped due to the lack of success of 1995's "Judge Dedd".
X Files is mentioned in chapter 5 of the novel Dying Days by Lance Parkin.
It is said Lethbridge Stewart knows about Mario Bros in the novel Business Unusual by Gary Russell.
It is said the Doctor has the 1st edition of 1984 in the novel Business Unusual by Gary Russell.
Peri Brown thinks about watching Magnum PI in the short story Turnabout Is Fair Play (from Short Trips And Sidesteps) by Graeme Burk.
Jurassic Park is mentioned in part 2 of the short story Town Called Eternity (from Short Trips And Sidesteps) by Lance Parkin and Mark Clapham.
Battlestar Galactica is mentioned in the comic story Ophidius from issue 300 of Doctor Who Magazine.
Blade Runner is mentioned in the novel EarthWorld by Jacqueline Rayner.
Asterix is mentioned in the novel Year Of Intelligent Tigers by Kate Orman.
It is said that Anji Kapoor was once forced to watch the entire Quantum Leap series in the novel Slow Empire by Dave Stone.
Buffy and Vampire Slayer and Doctor Who reference each other on numerous occasions.
Anji Kapoor thinks Rhian Salmond looks like Velma Dinkley in the novel Book Of The Still by Paul Ebbs.
It is said the Doctor is trying to solve how Mary Poppins' umbrella works in the short story Christmas Special by Marc Platt.
Charlie And The Chocolate Factory is mentioned in the novel Winner Takes All by Jacqueline Rayner.

In chapter 4 of the novel Gallifrey Chronicles by Lance Parkin, Rachel Rowley finds a complete set of Harry Potter books in the TARDIS. It is said there are 10 books in the series, despite being actually 7 in real life.
Sixth Sense is mentioned in the novel Stone Rose by Jacqueline Rayner.
Spongebob is mentioned in the novel Stone Rose by Jacqueline Rayner.
RoboCop is mentioned in the novel Stone Rose by Jacqueline Rayner.
Torchwood series is a spin-off of the Doctor Who series.
Sarah Jane Adventures series is a spin-off of the Doctor Who series.
The 10th Doctor from Doctor Who appears as Lauren Cooper's English teacher in a charity sketch.
The Master watches Teletubbies in the Doctor Who episode "Sound Of Drums"..
Call Of Duty is mentioned in the audio drama Crimes Of Thomas Brewster.
Doctor Hooves from My Little Pony resembles the Tenth Doctor from Doctor Who; My Little Pony is mentioned in the Doctor Who episode "Last Christmas".
Bob the Builder toys are briefly shown on a shelf in the Doctor Who episode "Closing Time".
A lego duplo model of Lightning McQueen is briefly shown on a shelf in the Doctor Who episode "Closing Time".
Star Trek: The Next Generation and Doctor Who have a comic crossover together.
Addams Family is mentioned in the Doctor Who episode "Flatline".
Cabin In The Woods is mentioned in the Doctor Who episode "Under The Lake".
A promotional video released in 2015 for Doctor Who's arrival on Disney XD featured the TARDIS flying through Davenport Bionic Academy, past several characters from the series.
A promotional video released in 2015 for Doctor Who's arrival on Disney XD featured the TARDIS entering the school from Kirby Buckets, with Kirby having already drawn the ship.

Doctor Who.game: Star vs. the Forces of Evil
Doctor Who.description: A promotional video released in 2015 for Doctor Who's arrival on Disney XD featured the TARDIS landing in a back garden, as noticed by Marco Diaz and Star Butterfly from the series.
A promotional video released in 2015 for Doctor Who's arrival on Disney XD featured the TARDIS entering the Mystery Shack, as seen by Dipper, Mabel, and Grunkle Stan.
Class is a spin-off of the Doctor Who series.
Dr. Men was a crossover between the two series.

Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story.description: A Daddy Day Care poster is shown in Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story.

Dog Man.description: Dog Man is a spin-off of Captain Underpants.

Dogma (View Askew Productions).description: Jay and Silent Bob appear in Dogma, while their comic Chasing Dogma is a prequel to the film; the Mooby's fast food from Dogma appears in Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back, and God also makes a cameo.
Dante's cousin Grant Hicks makes a cameo in Dogma, while Clerks II is set in a Mooby's fast food restaurant from Dogma.
One of the Stygian Triplets is wearing a Hellboy T-shirt in Dogma.
Walt and Steve-Dave from Mallrats make a cameo in Dogma.
A Madman figure can be seen on a shelf in Dogma.

Doki Adventures.description: Sportacus and Stephanie meet Doki in promos for the show on Discovery Kids.
George meets Doki in a promo for the show on Discovery Kids.

Doko Demo Issyo.description: Captain Sawada from Street Fighter: The Movie appears in Mainichi Issho, while Toro and Kuro from Doko Demo Issyo are selectable in PlayStation 3 and PlayStation Vita versions of Street Fighter X Tekken.

Don't Starve.description: Eye For An Eye is an update that introduces shared content between Terraria and Don't Starve Together.
Characters and items from Cult of the Lamb appear in Don't Starve Together and vice versa.

Don't Toy with Me, Miss Nagatoro.description: Yoshi mentions One Piece in Chapter 1 of Don't Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro.
The fictional game "Burakue/BraQue" mentioned in Chapter 27 of Don't Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro is a reference to Dragon Quest's commonly used short form "Dorakue/"DraQue" or "DQ".
Chapter 27 of Don't Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro has minor references to Hajime no Ippo in its side story.
There's an allusion to Attack on Titan during an imagination spot in Chapter 35 of Don't Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro.
Don't Toy With Me, Miss Nagatoro x Magical Sempai is a crossover manga chapter between the two series.
The character Yoshi in a fantasy segment of Episode 6 of Don't Toy with Me, Miss Nagatoro appears out of an egg similar to Nintendo’s Yoshi.

DonPachi.description: Star Soldier vs DoDonPachi DaiOuJou CARAVAN'06 is a crossover between both series.

Don Doko Don.description: The Worm enemy and red devil from The Fairyland Story appear as enemies in Don Doko Don.

Donald Duck.description: The Donald Duck series can be considered a spin-off to the Mickey Mouse series, since it stars Donald in his modernized incarnation from the Mickey Mouse series, as well as featuring various Mickey Mouse characters in its early comic strips; there have been many other cameos and crossovers between the two series through the years.

The Donald and Goofy shorts as well as The Mickey, Donald and Goofy cartoons in Mickey Mouse Works and the movie Mickey, Donald, Goofy: The Three Musketeers can be considered crossovers between the two series;Humphrey the Bear from the Goofy short Hold That Pose makes an appearance in the Donald Duck short Rugged Bear and then becomes a regular character in the series.
Chip and Dale appear in the Donald Duck short of the same name and become recurring characters afterwards.
Uncle Scrooge is a spin-off of Donald Duck
Donald Duck is mentioned in Home Alone 2: Lost In New York.
Uncle Scrooge's Money Bin is a set piece in Disney Infinity, while Donald Duck is a playable character in Disney Infinity 2.0.
Flipping Decisions was comic story mentioned by Frank Underwood in Chapter 57 of House of Cards.

Donkey Hodie.description: Donkey Hodie is a spin-off to Mister Rogers' Neighborhood.

Donkey Kong.description: The Mario series is a spinoff of the Donkey Kong series and characters from Donkey Kong appeared in many Mario games; Mario makes an appearance in Donkey Kong Country 2, while elements from the Mario series are featured in "Modern" versions of Donkey Kong games within the Game & Watch Gallery series; the Mario vs Donkey Kong sub-series is part of both series.
Frogger meets Donkey Kong between the episodes of their shows in the Saturday Supercade.
Donkey Kong characters meet Pitfall! characters between episodes of their shows in the Saturday Supercade.
Mario meets Q*bert between the episodes of Donkey Kong and Q*bert, in the Saturday Supercade, while Q*bert meets Donkey Kong Jr. between the episodes of their respective shows.
Kangaroos Joey and Katy meet Donkey Kong between the episodes of their shows in the Saturday Supercade.
Yoshi makes an appearance in Donkey Kong Country 2; a baby version of Donkey Kong, called Baby Donkey Kong, is playable in Yoshi's Island DS.
Link makes an appearance in Donkey Kong Country 2 and is referenced in Donkey Kong Country 3. He is also playable in a minigame version of Donkey Kong within NES Remix.
Arcade cabinets and a poster for Killer Instinct can be seen in Donkey Kong Country 2.
Diddy Kong Racing is a spinoff of the Donkey Kong series.
Characters, places and items from the Donkey Kong series are featured in all Super Smash Bros. games; Mr. Game & Watch makes a cameo in Donkey Kong Country Returns.
Musical instruments from Banjo-Kazooie can be seen in Donkey Kong 64; there also are minor references to the Donkey Kong series in Banjo-Kazooie and Banjo-Tooie.
Donkey Kong 64 features Jetpac as a playable minigame.
In Pokémon Stadium 2, connecting an NES to a TV can show an image from Donkey Kong; music themes from the Pokémon series are featured in Donkey Konga games.
Sabre Wulf's head appear in Cranky Kong's house in the Game Boy Advance version of Donkey Kong Country.

The ending theme from Bakuryū Sentai Abaranger is featured in the Japanese version of Donkey Konga, while the opening theme from Tokusou Sentai Dekaranger is featured in the Japanese version of Donkey Konga 2.
The opening theme from the Hamtaro TV show is featured in the Japanese version of Donkey Konga.
The Legend of Starfy theme is featured in the Japanese version of Donkey Konga.
"Ai no Uta" and "Tane no Uta", the songs from the Japanese commercials for Pikmin and Pikmin 2, are featured respectively in the Japanese versions of Donkey Konga.
Themes from the Doraemon TV show are featured in the Japanese versions of Donkey Konga and Donkey Konga 2.
Opening themes from the Detective Conan TV show are featured in the Japanese version of Donkey Konga and in Donkey Konga 3.
The theme from the Mazinger Z TV show is featured in the Japanese version of Donkey Konga 2.
The theme from Mobile Suit Gundam SEED is featured in the Japanese version of Donkey Konga 2, while the theme from Mobile Suit Gundam SEED Destiny is featured in Donkey Konga 3.
Themes from the Naruto TV show are featured in the Japanese version of Donkey Konga 2 and in Donkey Konga 3.
Themes from the Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo TV show are featured in the Japanese version of Donkey Konga 2 and in Donkey Konga 3.
The theme from the Pretty Cure TV show is featured in the Japanese version of Donkey Konga 2.
Bubbles from Clu Clu Land is unlockable in DK King of Swing.
The theme from the Fullmetal Alchemist TV show is featured in Donkey Konga 3.
A song from Star Fox: Assault is featured in Donkey Konga 3.
The theme from Dragon Ball Z is featured in Donkey Konga 3.
The theme from the Shin-chan TV show is featured in Donkey Konga 3.
The song from the  Fire Emblem: Fuin no Tsurugi commercial is featured in Donkey Konga 3.
A song from Balloon Fight is featured in Donkey Konga 3.
A song from Kid Icarus is featured in Donkey Konga 3, while Kid Icarus: Uprising features a reference to Donkey Kong.
A song from Nazo no Murasame Jo is featured in Donkey Konga 3.
A song from Ice Climber is featured in Donkey Konga 3.
A song from Dig Dug is featured in Donkey Konga 3.
A song from Xevious is featured in Donkey Konga 3.
A song from Mappy is featured in Donkey Konga 3.
A song from The Tower of Druaga is featured in Donkey Konga 3.
A song from Sky Kid is featured in Donkey Konga 3.
A song from Pac-Man is featured in Donkey Konga 3.

Creatures from the Metroid series appear in the background in Donkey Kong Country Returns, along with other references to the series, while Samus' Gunship and a Metroid appear in Donkey Kong: Tropical Freeze.
Mini Mario & Friends: amiibo Challenge features a level based on Luigi's Mansion.

Donnie Darko.description: Donnie Darko and his friends has a discussion about The Smurfs.
Donnie Darko and Gretchen watch The Evil Dead.

Doom (ID Software).description: In Doom II, there is a secret level that features the world of Wolfenstein that features many enemies from Wolfenstein.
A skeleton wearing the Dragonborn iron helmet with an arrow in its knee can be found in the 2016 version of Doom, during the Kadingir Sanctum mission.
There have been frequent crossovers between Fallout and Doom.
In Doom II, Commander Keen can be found in the super-secret Doom II map, Level 32: Grosse, as an easter egg.  Also a reply on Twitter by Tom Hall confirms that Keen is BJ Blackowitz III.

Door Door.description: Door Door was supposed to be a port of Dig Dug, but was rejected by Enix.

Dora the Explorer.description: Go, Diego, Go! is a spin-off of Dora the Explorer.
Dora & Kai-Lan's Pet Shelter is a crossover between Dora the Explorer and Ni Hao, Kai-Lan. Kai-Lan appears in Team Umizoomi & Dora's Fantastic Flight
Team Umizoomi & Dora's Fantastic Flight is a crossover between both series.
Pablo and Uniqua from The Backyardigans appears in Team Umizoomi & Dora's Fantastic Flight.
Pitfall is mentioned in Dora and the Lost City of Gold.

Doraemon.description: It's the '82 New Year! Doraemon ・ Kaibutsu-kun ・ Ninja Hattori-kun is a special that contains both series. UNDIRECT: Ninja Hattori eats New Year's Eve Noodles with Doraemon and Q-Taro in a promotional video.

Doraemon makes a small cameo in Super Mario-Kun.INDIRECT: Characters from Doraemon, Mario, and Little Ghost Q-Taro meet in the October 1987 issue of Shogakukan's Kindergarten.In one of the many episodes from the 1979-2004 series, Nobita plays a video game resembling the original Super Mario Bros. for the Famicom.Mario (who later turns into the Japanese prime minister Shizo Abe) and Doraemon appeared in the presentation for the cancelled Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games.

The Doraemon Barcode Battler Cards set is part of both series; Doraemon 2: Nobita's Great Adventure Toys Land and Doraemon 3: Nobita and the Jewel of Time are also compatible with the Barcode Battler II.
Doraemon meets Hello Kitty is a crossover between the two series.
The Doraemon & Jurassic World line of merchandise is cross-promotion between the two series, and Doraemon meets a dinosaur from Jurassic World during a live performance.
