Lady and the Tramp is mentioned in Skating Sensation and Dear Dork.
Mary Poppins is mentioned in Skating Sensation.
Looney Tunes is mentioned in Dear Dork.
Miss Piggy is mentioned in Dear Dork.
Willy Wonka is mentioned in Holiday Heartbreaker.
Karate Kid is mentioned in Holiday Heartbreaker and TV Star.
The Hunger Games is mentioned in Holiday Heartbreaker.
Power Rangers is mentioned in TV Star.
Kung Fu Panda is mentioned in TV Star.
Ninjago is mentioned in TV Star.
The Last Airbender is mentioned in TV Star.
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles is mentioned in TV Star.

Doshin the Giant.description: On an island in Doshin the Giant, the ground textures are replaced with the texture of faces of creatures from Cubivore.

Dota.description: Zeus's taunt assembles Mario's jump animation with a coin on the top.
A Chocobo and a Moogle were available for a limited time in Dota 2 by pre-purchasing Final Fantasy Type-0 HD for Steam.
Amaterasu is available as a courier in Dota 2 as a pre-order bonus for Okami HD on Steam.

Double Dragon.description: Battletoads & Double Dragon is a crossover between the two series.
The Double Dragon movie has a reference to the Stay-Puft Marshmallow Man from Ghostbusters.

Dr. Katz, Professional Therapist.description: Bert and Ernie are shown on TV in the Doctor Katz episode "Pretzelkins".
Kermit the frog is mentioned in the Doctor Katz episode "Monte Carlo".
Sister Act 2: Back in the Act is mentioned in the Dr. Katz, Professional Therapist episode: "Movies".

Dr. Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine.description: Dr. Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine is a spin-off of the Sonic series.
Dr. Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine is a remake of Puyo Puyo.

Dr. Slump.description: Godzilla makes many appearances in the Dr. Slump manga.
Rodan was mentioned in the Dr. Slump chapter "The Big-Small Gun!".
Arale mentioned Doraemon in the Dr. Slump chapter "1980: Living For Tomorrow!".
Senbei reads a book about Mothra in the Dr. Slump chapter "The Mysterious Egg".
Arale and Senbei dress up as R2-D2 and C-3PO in the Dr. Slump chapter "The Invader from Space".
Batman appears in the Dr. Slump chapter "Kids Gone Wild".
In Dr. Slump Volume 2 of Chapter 21, Gamera appears flying in the sky.
In the Dr. Slump chapter "The Siverman Cometh", Arale and Gatchan enter a book titled "The Great Adventure of King Kong".
Arale, along with other Dr. Slump characters, made an appearance in Dragon Ball. Young Goku is a character in the remake of Dr. Slump.

Dr. Stone.description: Senku mentions how the fly amanita mushroom looks like something out of Mario in Chapter 2 of Dr. Stone.
Senku mentions he likes Doraemon in Chapter 4 of Dr. Stone.
A model of the standard Gundam from Mobile Suit Gundam can be seen in Senku's room in Chapter 10 of Dr. Stone.
Senku mentions  Dragon Quest in Chapter 19 of Dr. Stone.
Senku mentions Monster Hunter in Chapter 19 of Dr. Stone.
Gen notices Senku looks like Anpanman in Chapter 25 of Dr. Stone.
Chapter 60 of Dr. Stone shows a representation of Goku (possibly) to describe different types of entertainment.
Episode 19 of Dr. Stone features technology that looks like the Death Star from Star Wars.

Chapter 174 of Dr. Stone shows Taiju raising his fist with an x on the wrist, referencing when the Straw Hats departed Alabasta and leaving Vivi behind in chapter 216 of One Piece.  Some of Kingdom of Science members viewing the mobile lab as a crewmate and crying on its final departure can also be similar to the Straw Hat's view of the Going Merry and its funeral in Chapter 430.  Also, Senku appears with Ace showcasing their sparks in Issue 3-4 2021 of Weekly Shonen Jump, as well as Chapter 181 of Dr. Stone featuring a cover art with One Piece characters.

Dracula (Bram Stoker).description: The Dracula series by Universal is an authorized adaptation of Bram Stoker's novel.

Dracula (Universal).description: The Dracula series by Universal is an authorized adaptation of Bram Stoker's novel.
Dracula is a major character in House of Frankenstein and Abbott and Costello Meet Frankenstein while the Frankenstein monster is a major character in House of Dracula.
The Wolf Man appears in House of Dracula. Dracula also appears in the novel Return Of The Wolf Man.

Dragalia Lost.description: Fire Emblem characters appear in Dragalia Lost during special collaborations.
Mega Man characters appear in Dragalia Lost during a special collaboration.
Monster Hunter characters appear in Dragalia Lost during a special collaboration.
Pecorine from Princess Connect! Re:Dive appears in Dragalia Lost during a special collaboration.
Persona 5 characters appear in Dragalia Lost during a special collaboration.

Dragon's Dogma.description: Dragon's Dogma features Guts and Griffith's armor sets from the Berserk Golden Age Arc film, while Dragon's Dogma Online features a 2nd collaboration event with extra armors and items from the film.
The list of generic monickers in Dragon's Dogma features "Anakaris", "Anita", "Demitri", "Donovan", "Felicia" and "Morrigan" as possible monickers.

The list of generic monickers in Dragon's Dogma features the names of several Street Fighter characters as possible monickers, while Dragon's Dogma Online features some head gear and hairstyles from the series as accessories, and later Ryu's theme from Street Fighter II as part of a special event.
The list of generic monickers in Dragon's Dogma features "Cody", "Guy", "Haggar" and "Poison" as possible monickers.

The list of generic monickers in Dragon's Dogma features "Dr. Wily", "Rockman", "Roll", "Tron" and "Mega Man" as possible monickers, while Dragon's Dogma Online features the "Dr. Wily Stage1" theme from Mega Man as part of a special event.
The list of generic monickers in Dragon's Dogma features "Asura" as a possible monicker.
The list of generic monickers in Dragon's Dogma features "Samanosuke" as a possible monicker.

The list of generic monickers in Dragon's Dogma features "Felyne" as a possible monicker, while Dragon's Dogma Online features Rathalos and Rathian-based armors, Felyne masks and the "Proof of a Hero" theme as part of a special event, and the game has a shared special event with Monster Hunter Frontier Z.
The list of generic monickers in Dragon's Dogma features "Viewtiful Joe" as a possible monicker.
The list of generic monickers in Dragon's Dogma features "Hayato" as a possible monicker.
The list of generic monickers in Dragon's Dogma features "Hideo", "Kyouko", "Momo", "Roy" and "Kyousuke" as possible monickers, while Dragon's Dogma Online features costumes of Batsu and Hinata.

The list of generic monickers in Dragon's Dogma features "Dante", "Lady", "Sparda", "Trish" and "Vergil" as possible monickers, while Dragon's Dogma Online features the Devil May Cry "Devils Never Cry" theme as part of a special event.
The list of generic monickers in Dragon's Dogma features "Maya", "Miles", "Pearl" and "Missile" as possible monickers.
The list of generic monickers in Dragon's Dogma features "Bosch", "Nina" and "Momo" as possible monickers.

The Xbox 360 version of Dragon's Dogma included a download code for a Resident Evil 6 demo. The list of generic monickers in Dragon's Dogma features "Barry", "Claire, "Chris", "Jill", "Leon", "Rebecca", "Tyrant" and "Wesker" as possible monickers.
The item "Cursed King's Belt" from Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen is designed after Leo's belt and references him in its description.

As part of a collaboration event, monsters from Dragon's Dogma Quest appeared in Puzzle & Dragons and vice versa, later a special Dragon's Dogma dungeon was added to Puzzle & Dragon as part of the former's 5th anniversary.
Dragon's Dogma Quest features an original story and characters from Kaku-San-Sei Million Arthur as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from the 2014 Strider appear as cards in Dragon's Dogma Quest as part of a special collaboration. The Strider class in Dragon's Dogma may be named after Strider Hiryu.
Dragon's Dogma Online features an original story and costume sets from Persona 5 as part of a special collaboration.
Dragon's Dogma Online features armor sets and weapons from Imperial SaGa as part of a special collaboration.
Dragon's Dogma Online features costume sets and weapons from Attack on Titan as part of a special collaboration.

Dragon's Dogma Online features the Ghosts 'n Goblins graveyard theme as part of a special event, and later a special collaboration including costumes based on Arthur and Princess Prin Prin, and a monster designed after Satan.
Dragon's Dogma Online features character costumes and weapons from Overlord as part of a special collaboration.
Dragon's Dogma Online features costume sets based on characters from Re:Zero as part of a special collaboration.

Travis can wear a Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen t-shirt in Travis Strikes Again: No More Heroes, while a pawn based on Travis Touchdown is available in the Switch version of Dragon's Dogma: Dark Arisen.

Dragon Adventures.description: Dragon Adventures was released as a Roblox experience and the player's Roblox Avatar can be used in it. Dragon Adventures was also part of the official Metaverse Champions event.
Cut the Rope Collaboration Event was an event that was an official collaboration between Cut the Rope and Dragon Adventures.

Dragon Age.description: A head of a krogan from Mass Effect can be found mounted on the wall in various places in Dragon Age Inquistion; an Orge from Dragon Age appears as a statue in Mass Effect 2 and the game also features a downloadable armor based on Dragon Age; there are other minor references to Mass Effect in the series.

Dragon Ball.description: Arale, along with other Dr. Slump characters, made an appearance in Dragon Ball. Young Goku is a character in the remake of Dr. Slump.

Characters from Dragon Quest appear in Volume 10 of Dragon Ball. Additionally the Hero in the American version of Dragon Quest VIII can transform to look similar to a Super Sayan, while hairstyles based on Dragon Ball characters can be used for the hero in Dragon Quest IX.
Goku is a playable character in the game.
The box for Super Mario Kart can be seen in Dragon Ball Z: The Legacy of Goku II.
Dragon Ball Z: The Legacy of Goku II features an appearance of a The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past cartridge.
The box for Secret of Mana can be seen in Dragon Ball Z: The Legacy of Goku II.
The box for Super Metroid can be seen in Dragon Ball Z: The Legacy of Goku II.
The box for Yoshi's Island can be seen in Dragon Ball Z: The Legacy of Goku II.
The box for the North American Final Fantasy II can be seen in Dragon Ball Z: The Legacy of Goku II.
"Cross Epoch" is a crossover between Dragon Ball and One Piece.
Toriko has a crossover with Dragon Ball in a One Piece crossover.
Jaco the Galactic Patrolman is a prequel to the Dragon Ball series.  Jaco also makes later appearances in Ressurection 'F' and Dragon Ball Super.
In "Dragon Ball Z: Battle of Z" Goku can wear clothes from Naruto.

Dragon Blaze.description: The gem-spitting wooden head from Gunbird 2 reappears in Dragon Blaze.

Dragon Buster.description: The Special Flag from Rally-X is a special item in Dragon Buster II.

Dragon Egg.description: Characters from Attack on Titan appear in Dragon Egg as part of a collaboration.
Characters from Fairy Tail appear in Dragon Egg as part of a collaboration.
Characters from The Seven Deadly Sins appear in Dragon Egg as part of a collaboration.

Dragon Egg.game: That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime
Dragon Egg.description: Characters from That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime appear in Dragon Egg as part of a collaboration.
Characters from The Promised Neverland appear in Dragon Egg as part of a collaboration.
Characters from Is It Wrong to Try to Pick Up Girls in a Dungeon? appear in Dragon Egg as part of a collaboration.
Characters from Umi Monogatari appear in Dragon Egg as part of a collaboration.
Characters from Shaman King appear in Dragon Egg as part of a collaboration.
Characters from Tokyo Revengers appear in Dragon Egg as part of a collaboration.
Characters from Overlord appear in Dragon Egg as part of a collaboration.

Dragon Nest.description: Kemono Friends characters appear in Dragon Next M for a collaboration event.
Characters from MapleStory appear in World of Dragon Nest as part of a special collaboration.

Dragon Poker.description: Characters from Dragon Poker and The Battle Cats appear in each other's games as a part of a collaboration event. Diffuse Dorapo & Nyanko was a crossover between the two series.
Nimue from Million Arthur appears in Dragon Poker as part of a collaboration event. Diffuse Dorapo & Nyanko was a crossover between the two series.
Characters from Gatchaman appear in Dragon Poker as part of the Tatsunoko Collab event.
Characters from Astro Boy appear in Dragon Poker as part of the Tezuka Character World collaboration.
Characters from Black Jack appear in Dragon Poker as part of the Tezuka Character World collaboration.
Dragon Poker characters appear in Merc Storia for a collaboration event, while Merc Storia characters appear in Dragon Poker as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Resident Evil appear in Dragon Poker as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Berserk appear in Dragon Poker as part of a special collaboration.
Dragon Poker features several characters from Mega Man Battle Network and Megaman X as part of several special collaborations.
Characters from The Seven Deadly Sins appear in Dragon Poker as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Fist of the North Star appear in Dragon Poker as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from KonoSuba appear in Dragon Poker as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Ace Attorney appear in Dragon Poker as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from DanMachi appear in Dragon Poker as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from A Certain Magical Index appear in Dragon Poker as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Yakuza appear in Dragon Poker as part of a special collaboration.
Dragon Poker features several characters from Re:Zero as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Macross appear in Dragon Poker as part of a special collaboration.
Dragon Poker features several characters from Shin Megami Tensei V as part of a special collaboration.
Dragon Poker features several characters from Attack on Titan as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Steins;Gate appear in Dragon Poker as part of a special collaboration.
Dragon Poker features several characters from Mushoku Tensei as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Fire Force appear in Dragon Poker as part of a special collaboration.
Overlord characters appear in Dragon Poker as part of a special collaboration.
Made in Abyss characters appear in Dragon Poker for a collaboration event.
Characters from Digimon appear in Dragon Poker for a collaboration event.

Dragon Quest.description: Shantotto from Final Fantasy XI and a Moogle from Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn appear during special events in Dragon Quest X, while various monsters and characters from Dragon Quest of the Stars appeared in Mobius Final Fantasy; additionally in international versions of Final Fantasy there's the tomb of a character named "Erdrick" and the Wyrmhero Blade in Final Fantasy XII is based on Erdrick's sword from Dragon Quest; a demo version of Final Fantasy XII was included in the North American release of Dragon Quest VIII.
Theatrhythm Dragon Quest is a format crossover between the two series. Dragon Quest characters appear.
NieR: Automata has a weapon from Dragon Quest while characters from NieR:Automata appeared in Dragon Quest X Online as part of a special collaboration.

Dragon Slayer.description: The Legend of Heroes series is a spin-off of the Dragon Slayer series.
The Dragon Slayer Barcode Battler Cards set is part of both series; Dragon Slayer II is also compatible with the Barcode Battler II.
Dragon Slayer IV: Drasle Family, also known as Legacy of the Wizard, was featured in Namcot Collection.

Drake & Josh.description: A Double Dragon Arcade cabinet can be seen in the season 2 episode "Movie Job" from Drake & Josh
Addie Singer from Unfabulous appears in the Drake & Josh episode "Honor Council".

Drakengard.description: NieR is a spin off of Drakengard.

Drawn Together.description: Characters from South Park appear in the Drawn Together episodes The Other Cousin, A Tale of Two Cows and The Drawn Together Movie: The Movie.
Scorpion makes a cameo appearance in Drawn Together episode "The One Wherein There Is a Big Twist, Part II".
Peter and Lois from Family Guy make an appearance in the Drawn Together episode "The Lemon-AIDS Walk".

DreamMix TV World Fighters.description: Bomberman is selectable in DreamMix TV World Fighters.
Solid Snake is selectable in DreamMix TV World Fighters.
Optimus Prime and Megatron are selectable in DreamMix TV World Fighters.
Simon Belmont is selectable in DreamMix TV World Fighters.
TwinBee is selectable in DreamMix TV World Fighters.
Moai is selectable in DreamMix TV World Fighters.
Power Pro-Kun is selectable in DreamMix TV World Fighters.
Master Higgins is selectable in DreamMix TV World Fighters.
Yūgo Ōgami is selectable in DreamMix TV World Fighters.
Takao is selectable in DreamMix TV World Fighters.
Microman is selectable in DreamMix TV World Fighters.
A Licca-chan is selectable in DreamMix TV World Fighters.
The stage "Floating Continent" in DreamMix TV World Fighters is based on the first stage of Star Soldier.

DreamWorks Kart.description: Hiccup and Toothless are playable characters in DreamWorks Super Star Kartz, while Astrid is playable in DreamWorks All-Star Kart Racing.
Shrek, Fiona and Donkey are playable characters in DreamWorks Super Star Kartz, while Lord Farquaad is playable in DreamWorks All-Star Kart Racing.
Alex the Lion and Skipper are playable in DreamWorks Super Star Kartz, while King Julian is playable in DreamWorks All-Star Kart Racing.
B.O.B. is a playable character in DreamWorks Super Star Kartz.
Mr. Wolf and Diane Foxington are playable characters in DreamWorks All-Star Kart Racing.
The Boss Baby and Tina Templeton are playable characters in DreamWorks All-Star Kart Racing.
Puss in Boots, Kitty Softpaws and Death are playable characters in DreamWorks All-Star Kart Racing.
Po, Tigress, Master Shifu and Master Oogway are playable characters in DreamWorks All-Star Kart Racing.
Megamind is a playable character in DreamWorks All-Star Kart Racing.
Bridget and King Gristle are playable characters in DreamWorks All-Star Kart Racing. Poppy, Branch, Barb and Cooper also appear in the game.

DreamWorks Most Wanted.description: Characters from Kung Fu Panda appear in DreamWorks Most Wanted.
Characters from Kung Fu Panda appear in DreamWorks Most Wanted.
Characters from Shrek appear in DreamWorks Most Wanted.
Characters from Puss in Boots appear in DreamWorks Most Wanted.
Characters from Madagascar appear in DreamWorks Most Wanted.
Characters from The Croods appear in DreamWorks Most Wanted.

DreamWorks Universe of Legends.description: Characters and locations from Kung Fu Panda appear in DreamWorks Universe of Legends.
Characters and locations from How to Train Your Dragon appear in DreamWorks Universe of Legends.
Characters and locations from Shrek appear in DreamWorks Universe of Legends.
Characters and locations from Megamind appear in DreamWorks Universe of Legends.
Characters and locations from Madagascar appear in DreamWorks Universe of Legends.
Characters from The Croods appear in DreamWorks Universe of Legends.
Characters from Mr. Peabody & Sherman appear in DreamWorks Universe of Legends.
Characters from Turbo appear in DreamWorks Universe of Legends.
Characters from Monsters vs. Aliens appear in DreamWorks Universe of Legends.
Characters from Bee Movie appear in DreamWorks Universe of Legends.

Drill Dozer.description: Drill Dozer features an unlockable outfit based on Mario's.

Droopy.description: Droopy Dog was a member of Bullet's cartoon animal police force.

DuckTales.description: DuckTales is a spinoff of the Uncle Scrooge series.
Launchpad McQuack appears as the title character's lackey.

In a limited time event in Roblox, players could get DuckTales-themed gear and spawn Scrooge McDuck as a companion. Due to the Toy Story rule, this can be considered a real incarnation of Scrooge McDuck.
Don Karnage from TaleSpin has become a prominent character in the 2017 reboot of DuckTales.
Chip, Dale, Monterey Jack, Gadget Hackwrench and Zipper appear in the DuckTales episode "Double-O-Duck In You Only Crash Twice".
Launchpad from DuckTales talks on the phone with Baymax from Big Hero 6 as part of a Random Ring call.
Launchpad talks on the phone with Cricket from Big City Greens as part of a Random Ring call.

Duck Dodgers.description: Duck Dodgers is a spinoff of the Looney Tunes.
In the episode "The Green Loontern", Duck Dodgers meets Green Lantern and even becomes part of The Green Lantern Corps as The Green Loontern.
Zoidberg makes a cameo in Attack Of The Drones.
Gazoo makes a cameo in Attack Of The Drones.
Yogi and Boo Boo from Yogi Bear make cameos in the Duck Dodgers episode "K-9 Quarry".
Wally Gator makes a cameo in the Duck Dodgers episode "K-9 Quarry".
Top Cat makes a cameo in the Duck Dodgers episode "K-9 Quarry".
Hong Kong Phooey makes a cameo in the Duck Dodgers episode "K-9 Quarry".
In the episode "M.M.O.R.P.D.", Dodgers turns into Muttley from Wacky Races.

Duckman.description: Homer Simpson appears in the Duckman episode "Duckman and Cornfed in 'Haunted Society Plumbers'".

Dudes of Hazmat.description: The California Raisins are mentioned in the Dudes of Hazmat episode “Episode 1”.

Duel Masters.description: Duel Masters and Mega Man Battle Network had a cross promotion with their characters making brief appearances in each other's movies. Additionally, the Duel Masters cards Forte, Brave Fear Lord and Rockman EXE & Katta feature Bass.EXE and MegaMan.EXE respectively from Mega Man Battle Network.
The Duel Masters card Heaven Eleven 8210 Style, Reversal Elemental is based on Inazuma Eleven GO.
The Duel Masters card Baal Balalaku, Hero Djinn features Baal from Magi.

As part of special collaboration events, Puzzle & Dragons and Puzzle & Dragons Radar featured a dungeon with creatures from Duel Masters. Additionally, there are several Duel Masters cards featuring characters from Puzzles & Dragons.
The Duel Masters card Kushala Daora, Steel Dragon features the Kushala Daora from Monster Hunter.
There are several Duel Masters cards featuring characters from Transformers.
There are several Duel Masters cards featuring characters from Magic: The Gathering. Additionally, early issues of the Duel Masters manga have characters playing Magic: The Gathering.
The Duel Masters card Valkyrie Dogiragon features Valt Aoi and Valkyrie Wing Accel from Beyblade Burst.
The Duel Masters card Invasion Start Nyanko Corps / Nyanko Gun Firing features cats from The Battle Cats.
There are several Duel Masters cards featuring characters from Osomatsu.
The Duel Masters card Pretty Children features Kaoru Akashi, Aoi Nogami and Shiho Sannomiya from Zettai Karen Children.
The Duel Masters card Beast Liger, Legendary Zoid features Beast Liger from Zoids.

The Duel Masters card Bachio Sensei, Unforgiving of Shakapachi features characters from Taiko no Tatsujin. Additionally, Taiko no Tatsujin Yellow Version and Taiko no Tatsujin Plus feature a music track from Duel Masters.
The Duel Masters card Prince features the Prince from Katamari Damacy.
The Duel Masters card Beholder, Orderly General features a Beholder from Dungeons & Dragons.

The Duel Masters card Destructive Red! Scrapper Red! Knowledgeable Blue! Brain Blue! Enchanting Green! Trap Green! Flashy Yellow! Spark Yellow! Greedy Purple! Hand Purple! We are where the break is! Shield Sentai, Triggerger!! features the Power Rangers.
The Duel Masters card Spike Spiegel features the character of the same name from Cowboy Bebop.

Duels of Fortune.description: Mystery Johnson from Schwarzerblitz is a playable character in Duels of Fortune, while Clyde, Callowman and Sylvan from Duels of Fortune are costumes and Sir Rattlebone is a playable character in Schwarzerblitz.

Duke Nukem.description: In Duke Nukem, Dr. Proton taunts Duke Nukem and further brags how Commander Keen cannot escape his mine.

In Serious Sam 2, the blonde, shades-wearing skeleton of Duke Nukem can be found in Stage 10. Upon finding it, Sam quips "Dude, you've been hanging here, like, forever". In Episode 5, Level 4 of Duke Nukem 20th Anniversary World Tour, Sam's body can be found and Duke quips "Why so...serious?". There are many references to Duke Nukem in the dialogue of some Serious Sam games, often calling him "Blondie".

Dumb and Dumber.description: Jerry Maguire is mentioned in Dumb and Dumber To.
Titanic is mentioned in Dumb and Dumber To.
Lloyd mentioned Dig Dug in Dumb and Dumber To.
James Bond is referenced in Dumb and Dumber To.

Dumbo & Cool.description: Gish has a cameo in Dumbo & Cool.

Dumbo (Disney).description: Dumbo makes an appearance in some Mickey Mouse comics, in the Mickey Mouse Club opening and in the House of Mouse series, while the train Casey Junior appears in Mickey's Racing Adventure and in the Mickey Mouse episode "Tokyo Go"; Clara Cluck makes an appearance in the Dumbo story "Dumbo The Musician".

Dungeon & Fighter.description: Dungeon Fighter Online had a special collaboration with the Fate/ series, including several Fate/Zero characters.
Re:Zero characters appear in Dungeon Fighter Online for a collaboration event.

Dungeon Defenders.description: The PC version of Dungeon Defenders features Pyro, Heavy, Engineer and Medic from Team Fortress 2.
The PC version of Dungeon Defenders features The Portal Gun from Portal.
The PC version of Dungeon Defenders features characters from Penny Arcade.

Various items and characters from Terraria appear in Dungeon Defenders 2, including the Dryad, Demon Eyes, and the Eye of Cthulhu, while various items and characters from Dungeon Defenders 2 appear in Terraria, including the Tavernkeep and the Old One's Army.

Dungeons & Dragons.description: Baldur's Gate takes place in the Dungeons & Dragons universe.
Dungeons & Dragons characters appear in the Infestation 2 Crossover event.
Rick and Morty has an official comic crossover with Dungeons & Dragons.

There are official sourcebooks for Dungeons & Dragons featuring Ravnica, Theros, and Strixhaven as campaign settings, locations from Magic: The Gathering. Additionally, downloadable "Plane Shift" supplements exist depicting Magic locations Zendikar, Innistrad, Kaladesh, Amonkhet, Ixalan, and Dominaria. Characters from the Saturday morning "Dungeons & Dragons" cartoon appear depicted on alternate-art cards in limited-edition "Secret Lair Drop Series: Saturday Morning D&D" release. Additionally, Drizzt Do'Urden and many other characters appear as tournament-legal cards in "Dungeons & Dragons: Adventures in the Forgotten Realms" set.

Durarara!!.description: Toaru Majutsu no Index VS Durarara!! Special Collaboration is a crossover between the two series. Additionally, A Certain Magical Index Illusion Convergence features several characters from Durarara!! as part of a special collaboration.

Dust: An Elysian Tail.description: You can find Spelunky Boy and Girl in The Cirromon Caverrns trapped until you free them.
You can find Tim in Blackmoor Mountains trapped until you free him.
You can find Gomez in Blackmoor Mountains trapped until you free him.
You can find Meat Boy in The Glade and Bandage Girl in The Abadis Forrest trapped until you free them.
You can find The Kid in Archer's Pass trapped until you free him.
You can find The Dishwasher and Yuki in The Sorrowing Meadows trapped until you free them.
You can find The Maw in Everdawn Basin trapped until you free him.

Dying Light.description: Weapons from Left 4 Dead 2 appear in Dying Light as DLC, as well as Bill and Gnome Chompski appearing in the second DLC pack.
Weapons based on Chivalry appear in Dying Light as part of a collaboration event.
Weapons and accessories based on The Walking Dead appear in Dying Light 2 as part of a special collaboration.
Weapons and accessories based on Payday 2 appear in Dying Light 2 as part of a special collaboration.
Weapons and accessories based on For Honor appear in Dying Light 2 as part of a special collaboration.

Dynamite Deka.description: Dynamite Deka is a spinoff of Die Hard Arcade.

Death Adder from Golden Axe is the third stage boss in the Sega Saturn version of Dynamite Deka, while Easy mode also features costumes based on Tyris Flame and the Ax Battler from Golden Axe. Chicken Leg appears in Dynamite Deka 2.

A Cockatrice enemy from Altered Beast makes a background cameo in the 2nd stage of Dynamite Cop, while the Werewolf and Garuda transformations appear as costumes for Bruno and Cindy in the Sega Ages remake of Dynamite Deka.

Dynomutt, Dog Wonder.description: Characters from Scooby-Doo appear in the Dynomutt, Dog Wonder episodes "Everyone Hyde!", "What Now, Lowbrow?" and "The Wizard of Ooze"; characters from Dynomutt, Dog Wonder appear in the Scooby-Doo comic stories "Big House Brouhaha" and "It Was a Dark and Gritty Knight..." as well as the Scooby-Doo! Mystery Incorporated episode "Heart of Evil", the Scooby-Doo and Guess Who? episode "Scooby-Doo, Dog Wonder!", and the movie Scoob; Scooby-Doo! Mask of the Blue Falcon is a crossover between the two series.

E.T..description: The Tom & Jerry short "The Mouse Comes to Dinner" appeared on T.V. because E.T. doesn't like it.
Indiana Jones makes a cameo in the game E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial for Atari 2600. E.T. appears as one of the tiles in Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull.
In E.T. and Friends: Magical Movie Visitors, Beldar and Connie from The Coneheads make a cameo.

E/R.description: E/R's Julie Williams is cousins with George and Louise Jefferson from The Jeffersons.

EEK3 2020 Virtual Show Floor.description: Skully and Haunty make a guest appearance in EEK3 2020 Virtual Show Floor.
Sotiris from Lost in Vivo makes a guest appearance in EEK3 2020 Virtual Show Floor.
The Manager from Night of the Consumers makes a guest appearance in EEK3 2020 Virtual Show Floor.
The Boss and Tasty from Tasty Ramen make a guest appearance in EEK3 2020 Virtual Show Floor. The game is also advertised on an arcade machine in EEK3 2020 virtual Show Floor.
ULTRAKILL is advertised on an arcade machine in EEK3 2020 Virtual Show Floor.

EFootball.description: Characters from Blue Lock appeared in eFootball 2024 as part of a special collaboration.

ER.description: King Kong is mentioned in the ER episode "24 Hours".
Duke Nukem is mentioned in the ER episode "Homeless for the Holidays".
Ghost is mentioned in the ER episode "Out On A Limb".

EZ2DJ.description: DJMAX RESPECT V featured a DLC pack featuring music from EZ2ON while EZ2ON REBOOT : R features music from DJMAX RESPECT V as part of a special collaboration.

Early Edition.description: Dr. Phillip Watters, Dr. Keith Wilkes, and Dr. Diane Grad from Chicago Hope appear in the Early Edition episode "Mum's the Word".
Sammo Law from Martial Law appears in the Early Edition episode "Play It Again, Sammo".

Earth Defense Force (D3 Publisher).description: An Earth Defense Force 5 trailer promotes Starship Troopers: Traitor of Mars using a news broadcast to link the two series.

The Pale Wing costumes from Earth Defense Force 2017 Portable appear as DLC outfits in Onechanbara Z2: Chaos. Aya and Saki from Onechanbara appear as DLC characters in Earth Defense Force: World Brothers.

Earthworm Jim.description: In the Sega CD version of Earthworm Jim, a Donkey Kong mask is unlockable; in Donkey Kong Country 2 a gun looking like Earthworm Jim's can be seen in Cranky Kong's video game hero challenge results.

EastEnders.description: EastEnders and Doctor Who have a television crossover together in "Dimensions in Time".
"East Street" is a crossover episode between Coronation Street and EastEnders.
Events from Hollyoaks were mentioned in an episode of EastEnders.

Ed, Edd n Eddy.description: Marvin the Martian substitutes Edd in a promo.
A sign mentioning Uncle Stumpy's Animal Park, a location in The Brothers Grunt, is seen in the finale of Ed, Edd, n Eddy.

Eddsworld.description: Garfield and Odie appear on a computer in the animation "Edd". Garfield phones appear in "Surf & Turf Wars (Part 1)"
There are multiple references to Mario throughout the Eddsworld series.
Link and Navi appear in "Edds Legend of Zelda". There's other references throughout the series.

Edd from Eddsworld appears in "Bendee's Second Birthday", while Bendee appears in "Eddsworld Christmas Special"; according to the Eddsworld Documentary it is confirmed that Bendee and Edd are the same person.
In "Eddsworld Christmas Special", Tord gets a Maniac Mansion 2004 Special Edition game.
Evil Dead is featured in "Evil Dead - Scottman."
Edd and Tord play Worms Armageddon in the Eddsworld episode "The Dudette Next Door".
The Credits Theme from The Ren & Stimpy Show is used in the Eddsworld episode "The Dudette Next Door".
The Smosh logo can be seen on the side of the helicopter in "Tord's Adventure".

Edd, Tom, Tord, and Paul sing the "F.U.N. Song" in "F is for Friends". Edd and Matt sing "Now That We're Men" in "SpongeBob Test". King Neptune's crown appears in the volcano's treasure in "Beaster Bunny".
Tetris was mentioned in "Tom's Tales of Awesome".
Charlie Brown from Peanuts is mentioned on the news in "This World of Edd".
In the Eddsworld episode "EW Halloween Special", Edd and Tord are playing Zombies Ate My Neighbors.
A guy is dressed as Superman in "Koit/Eddsworld Collab". Daily Planet appears in "PowerEdd".
An asdfmovie toy appears in the Eddsworld episode: "Spares". There's other references to asdfmovie throughout the series.
Godzilla is mentioned in the Eddsworld episode "Spares".
King Kong is mentioned in the Eddsworld episode "Spares".
Jurassic Park is mentioned in the Eddsworld episode "Spares".
The game "House of the Lead" from the episode "Spares" is based on House of the Dead.
The game "Fap Fap Revolution" from the episode "Spares" is based on Dance Dance Revolution.
In the Eddsworld comic "Game", Edd, Tom and Matt play Pokémon; in the episode "Beaster Bunny" from Eddsworld, two characters are dressed as Jessie and James from Pokémon.
In a flashback from "25ft Under the Seat", Tom is dressed as Stewie Griffin from Family Guy.
There are several references to Doctor Who in the Eddsworld series.
Batman is mentioned in the Eddsworld comic "Mystery 1".
The title of a Eddsworld comic is called Warioware.
The book "How to Cook for Forty Humans" appears in the storage room in "Space Face". Jebediah Springfield's tongue appears in "Beaster Bunny".
An identity disc from Tron appear in the storage room in "Space Face".
A item from Star Trek appears in "Space Face".
WALL-E appears in the garbage disposal unit in "Space Face".
In "Space Face", Bender's head appears in the garbage disposal unit.
Characters play Pong in the episode "The Snogre".
Yogi Bear appears in "Fun Dead".
A toy of Catbug from Bravest Warriors can be found in the episode "Fun Dead".
In "Fun Dead" from Eddsworld, the Umbrella Corporation from Resident Evil is seen under the "Eggs" poster.
Slender Man appears in the episodes "Fun Dead" and "The Chronicles of Santa".

Lucy and Ben appear in a flashback in the Eddsworld episode "PowerEdd", while Tom and the monster from "PowerEdd" appears in "Crash Zoom - Orcs & Dorks". The ghost that possesses Edd and Matt in "Trick or Threat" is Kate from Crash Zoom. A PowerEdd action figure and a poster of "Space Cats" was in "Crash Zoom - Movie Massacre"; Additionally, Edd and Tom and a poster of "ASDF Land" appear in "Crash Zoom - Fingered"; characters from Crash Zoom can be seen in a picture in "The End (Part 2)". In "Crash Zoom - Cover Up", a kid from the episode "Fun Dead" appears in one of the pictures.
Nick Fury appears at the end of "PowerEdd". The Infinity Gauntlet appears in the Eddsworld episode "Beaster Bunny".
Plank from Ed, Edd n Eddy makes a cameo in "The End (Part 2)".
Bunny from The Powerpuff Girls appears in "Beaster Bunny"
Father and the Delightful Children from Down the Lane appear in "Beaster Bunny".
The gems of Steven, Garnet, Amethyst, and Pearl appear in the volcano's treasure in "Beaster Bunny"
In "Beaster Bunny", Billy wears a Sam and Max shirt.
Eddie from Helluva Boss appears in "Beaster Bunny".
Calvin appears in "Beaster Bunny".
A squid from Splatoon appears in Zanta's stone tablet in "The Chronicles of Santa".

Edens Zero.description: Happy in Eden’s Zero looks very similar to Happy in Fairy Tail.  Also there are certain cameos of Natsu and Lucy in Chapter 3, as well as the mentioning of the race “Nikora”.
A Tanchimo appears in Digitalis at Chapter 30 of Eden's Zero.

Eek! The Cat.description: Agents Mulder and Scully guest star in the Eek! The Cat episode "Eek Space-9".

Egg (G&W).description: Egg is adapted from the Game & Watch Mickey Mouse, and features the same setting.
UNDIRECT: Modern Egg within Game & Watch Gallery 3 features elements from Yoshi's Cookie.

Eggerland.description: Adventures of Lolo is a spin off of Eggerland.

Ehrgeiz.description: Cloud and Tifa from Final Fantasy VII are playable in the arcade and PlayStation versions of Ehrgeiz, while Sephiroth, Yuffie, Vincent, and Zack are playable in the PlayStation version. Final Fantasy VIII and Dissidia 012 Final Fantasy feature a weapon called Ehrgeiz.

El Chapulin Colorado.description: The episode "Todo queda en familia" is a crossover between both series; El Chavo characters appear in the El Chapulin Colorado episodes "Los bebés ya no vienen de París, ahora vienen de Júpiter", "El disfraz, el antifaz y algo más" and "Blancanieves y los 7 Churín Churín Fun Flais"; there are also several minor references between both series.

El Chavo.description: The episode "Todo queda en familia" is a crossover between both series;El Chavo characters appear in the El Chapulin Colorado episodes "Los bebés ya no vienen de París, ahora vienen de Júpiter","El disfraz, el antifaz y algo más" and "Blancanieves y los 7 Churín Churín Fun Flais"; there are also several minor references between both series.
The El Chavo Animado episode "Un Buen Recado" features a video game based on Super Mario Bros.
The episode "The key of love" is a crossover between El Chavo and Monica Toy.

Elebits.description: Statues and memorabilia of Robbie the Rabbit can be found in Elebits: The Adventures of Kai and Zero.
Tako/Octopus from Parodius appears as an elebit in Elebits: The Adventures of Kai and Zero.
Penta from Antarctic Adventure appears as the elebit "Penguin" in Elebits: The Adventures of Kai and Zero.
TwinBee appears as an enemy in Elebits: The Adventures of Kai and Zero.

Elemental Story.description: Elemental Story features characters from Mega Man X as part of a collaboration event.
The Quintessential Quintuplets appear in Elemental Story for a collaboration event with Kadokawa Sneaker Bunko.
Characters from Tokyo Revengers appear in Elemental Story as part of a collaboration.
Haruhi Suzumiya characters appear in Elemental Story for a collaboration event with Kadokawa Sneaker Bunko.

Elements Destiny.description: Kit from Lunistice makes a guest appearance in Elements Destiny.
Lea and Emelie from CrossCode make a guest appearance in Elements Destiny.

Elena of Avalor.description: Elena of Avalor is a spin-off of Sofia the First.
Belle make cameo appearances in the episodes First Day of Rule, Model Sister and Coronation Day.
Cinderella make cameo appearances in the episode First Day of Rule.

Elevator Action.description: Sayo-chan/Pocky is a DLC character in Elevator Action Deluxe.

The Vaus from Arkanoid is a DLC character in Elevator Action Deluxe, while the Spy from Elevator Action appears as one of the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders, and Stage 141 in the game is patterned after the spy.
Reika Kirishima from Time Gal is a DLC character in Elevator Action Deluxe.

Elite Beat Agents.description: Several characters from Osu! Tatakae! Ouendan cameo in Elite Beat Agents, while a mode could be unlocked in Osu! Tatakae! Ouendan 2 that made characters from Elite Beat Agents playable. Additionally, Elite Beat Agents is considered a spiritual sequel to Osu! Tatakae! Ouendan.

Elite Squad.description: Characters and locations from The Division appear in Tom Clancy's Elite Squad.
Characters and locations from EndWar appear in Elite Squad.
Characters and locations from Ghost Recon appear in Tom Clancy's Elite Squad.
Characters and locations from H.A.W.X appear in Elite Squad.
Characters and locations from Rainbow Six appear in Elite Squad.
Characters and locations from Splinter Cell appear in Tom Clancy's Elite Squad.

Ellen.description: Paige Clark and Spence Kovak from Ellen appear in the Drew Carey Show episode "Drew Gets Married"; Drew Carey appears in the Ellen episode "Secrets & Ellen".
Grace Kelly from Grace Under Fire appears in the Ellen episode "Secrets & Ellen".

Elsword.description: Elesis from Grand Chase appears in Elsword as part of a special collaboration.
Rose from Dungeon Fighter Online appears in Elsword as part of a special collaboration.

Elvira.description: Elvira's House of Mystery is a crossover between the two series.
Elvira finds a copy of Swamp Thing #48 in Elvira's House of Mystery #5.
Elvira met the Crypt Keeper from Tales From The Crypt in a promotional image for Knott's Scary Farm's 1999 Halloween Haunt.
Blade from Puppet Master appears and attacks Elvira's puppet in the second episode of 13 Nights of Elvira.
Elvira meets a Hobgoblin in the fourth episode of 13 Nights of Elvira.
Elvira smokes from Eebee the Evil Bong in the eleventh episode of 13 Nights of Elvira.

Emily is Away.description: A The Ring themed icon appears in Emily is Away.
A Harry Potter themed icon appears in Emily is Away.
A Lord of the Rings themed icon appears in Emily is Away.
A Matrix themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.
A Finding Nemo themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.
A Pirates of the Caribbean themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.
A Kill Bill themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.
Final Destination 2 is mentioned in Emily is Away.
An Incredibles themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.

Emily is Away.description: An Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.
A Kill Bill themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.
A Saw themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.

A Batman Begins themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.

A Borderlands themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.
A BioShock themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.

A The Walking Dead themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.
A The Stanley Parable themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.
A Five Night's at Freddy's themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.
A Morrowind themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.
