A Portal themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.
A GTA: Vice City themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.
A Nyan Cat themed icon can be unlocked in Emily is Away.

Emmerdale.description: Reg Holdworth from Coronation Street appears in The Dingles in Venice.
Events from EastEnders were mentioned in an episode of Emmerdale.
Events from Hollyoaks were mentioned in an episode of Emmerdale.
Events from Casualty were mentioned in an episode of Emmerdale.

Empty Nest.description: Empty Nest is a spin off of The Golden Girls.
Nurses is a spinoff to Empty Nests.

EndWar.description: Operatives from the Rainbow appear in EndWar; "The End Begins: Rainbow Six" is a crossover between the two series.
Anna Grimsdottir from Splinter Cell appears in EndWar: The Hunted; "The End Begins: Splinter Cell" is a crossover between the two series.

Energizer.description: The Wicked Witch of the West appears in an Energizer commercial where she tries to go after the Energizer Bunny.
Wile E. Coyote appears in an Energizer commercial where he tries to go after the Energizer Bunny.
Darth Vader appears in an Energizer commercial where he tries to go after the Energizer Bunny.
Boris & Natasha appear in two Energizer commercials where they try to go after the Energizer Bunny.
Characters from Shrek appear in an Energizer commercial.
Po from Kung Fu Panda appears in an Energizer commercial.

Ensemble Stars!.description: Hello Kitty appears in Ensemble Stars! as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Ensemble Stars! and 100 Sleeping Princes & the Kingdom of Dreams appear in each other’s game as special collaborations.
Characters from Ensemble Stars! and Merc Storia appear in each other’s game as special collaborations.
Characters from Ensemble Stars! and Last Period appear in each other’s game as special collaborations.
Hatsune Miku appears in Ensemble Stars! during a collaboration event.
Characters from Cookie Run: Kingdom appear in Ensemble Stars! as part of a collaboration event.

Enter the Gungeon.description: Enter the Gungeon and Payday 2 had a collaboration in which items based on one game would be available in the other.
Devolver Bootleg contains a rip-off of Downwell called "Shootyboots".

Epic Pinball.description: Epic Pinball features a table based on Jill of the Jungle.

Epic Rap Battles of History.description: South Park is mentioned in Hulk Hogan and Macho Man vs Kim Jong-il.
Edward Kenway from Assassin's Creed appears in "Blackbeard vs Al Capone" as part of a sponsorship from Ubisoft.
Terminator has been a rapper for Epic Rap Battles of History as part of a sponsored video.

Epic Seven.description: Kizuna AI appears in Epic Seven as part of a special collaboration.

Epic Seven.game: That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime
Epic Seven.description: Characters from That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime appeared in Epic Seven during a collaboration event.
Characters from Guilty Gear appeared in Epic Seven as part of a special collaboration.
Characters from Re:Zero appeared in Epic Seven during a collaboration event.
Characters from Overlord appeared in Epic Seven during a collaboration event.

Episode (Pocket Gems).description: Mean Girls has a playable storyline in Episode.
Pretty Little Liars has a playable storyline in Episode.
Pitch Perfect has a playable storyline in Episode.
Clueless has a playable storyline in Episode.

Escape from New York.description: "Escape from New York" and "Big Trouble in Little China" had a comic book crossover together.

Esurance.description: In an Esurance commercial, Erin Esurance is a guest on Space Ghost: Coast to Coast.
In an Esurance commercial, Erin Esurance watches Speed Racer.

Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind.description: Huckleberry Hound is mentioned in Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind.
The Munsters can be seen on TV in Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind.

Etrian Odyssey.description: Characters from Trauma Center make cameo appearances in multiple games in the Etrian Odyssey series.

Etrian Odyssey HD features a character portrait of Joker from Persona 5 as DLC while Etrian Odyssey II HD features a character portrait of Teddie from Persona 4 and Etrian Odyssey III HD features a character portrait of Aigis from Persona 3.
Etrian Odyssey II HD features a character portrait of Demi-Fiend from Shin Megami Tensei III as DLC while Etrian Odyssey III HD features a character portrait of Nahobino from Shin Megami Tensei V.
Etrian Odyssey HD features a character portrait of Ringo from Soul Hackers 2 as DLC.

Euphoria.description: In the pilot episode of Euphoria, Rue lists characters from The Wire as gang members she knew.

Eureka (Syfy).description: Vincent says he loves Doctor Who in the Eureka episode "I Do Over".
Douglas Fargo cameos in the Warehouse 13 episode "13.1" and Claudia Donovan cameos in the Eureka episode "Crossing Over".

Euro Historia.description: Arthur from Ghosts 'n Goblins appeared in Hyaku Nen Senki: Euro Historia as part of a special promotion.
Shana appeared in Hyaku Nen Senki: Euro Historia as part of a collaboration event with Dengeki Bunko ranobes.

As part of a special collaboration, a "Diorekkusu" monster from Monster Hunter appeared in Hyaku Nen Senki: Euro Historia and a set of Euro Historia armors were accessible in Monster Hunter Frontier G.
Dante from Devil May Cry 3 appeared in Hyaku Nen Senki: Euro Historia as part of a special collaboration.

Evangelion.description: Gunbuster appears as a guest character in Neon Genesis Evangelion: Battle Orchestra.
Transformers X Evangelion is a crossover between the two series.

Godzilla vs Evangelion: The Real 4-D and P Godzilla  vs. Evangelion: G Cell Awakening are crossovers between the two series. Additionally, as an April's Fools joke to promote Shin Godzilla, "Godzilla vs Evangelion" merchandise was released.
"22" and "33" wear the "Evangelion" plugsuits in an official collaboration.

Everhood.description: Everhood: Eternity Edition features a bonus boss battle featuring Ian and Cold Brew from Rhythm Doctor.
Everhood: Eternity Edition features a bonus boss battle that takes place in the world of Slipstream.
Everhood: Eternity Edition features a bonus boss battle featuring Gourmet from Mago.

Everybody's Golf.description: The North American and European versions of Everybody's Golf 2 feature Sir Daniel Fortesque as an unlockable golfer.
The North American and European versions of Everybody's Golf 2 feature Gex The Gecko as an unlockable golfer.
The North American and European versions of Everybody's Golf 2 feature Sweet Tooth as an unlockable golfer.
The North American and European versions of Everybody's Golf 4 feature Ratchet and Clank as an unlockable golfer.
The North American and European versions of Everybody's Golf 4 feature Jak and Daxter as an unlockable golfer.
The Japanese and European versions of Everybody's Golf 4 feature A Pipo Monkey as an unlockable golfer.
The North American and European versions of Everybody's Golf 5 feature Kratos as an DLC golfer.
The North American and European versions of Everybody's Golf 5 feature Sackboy as an DLC golfer.
The North American and European versions of Everybody's Golf: World Invitational feature Pac-Man as an DLC golfer.
The North American and European versions of Everybody's Golf: World Invitational feature Kat as an DLC golfer.
Kazuma Kiryu from Yakuza appears as a DLC golfer in the Japanese version of Hot Shots Golf: World Invitational.
Everybody's Golf features Final Fantasy-themed items, including a Chocobo as a caddie.
Everybody's Golf features costumes based on Dark Cloud as part of a Level-5 Collaboration event.
Everybody's Golf features costumes based on Professor Layton as part of a Level-5 Collaboration event.
Everybody's Golf features costumes based on Ni No Kuni as part of a Level-5 Collaboration event.
Everybody's Golf features costumes based on Yo-Kai Watch as part of a Level-5 Collaboration event.
Everybody's Golf features costumes based on White Knight Chronicles as part of a Level-5 Collaboration event.

Everybody Loves Raymond.description: Ally quotes A Streetcar Named Desire in the Everybody Loves Raymond episode: "I Love You".
Count Chocula is mentioned in the Everybody Loves Raymond episode: "I Love You".
The Twilight Zone is mentioned in the Everybody Loves Raymond episodes: "Standard Deviation" and "Why Are We Here".
Terminator 2 is mentioned in the Everybody Loves Raymond episode: "Your Place or Mine?"
Decals of characters from Baby Looney Tunes appear in the Everybody Loves Raymond episode: "Debra's Sick".
The Little Mermaid is mentioned in the Everybody Loves Raymond episode: "Debra's Sick".
beauty and the Beast is mentioned in the Everybody Loves Raymond episode: "Debra's Sick".
Raymond makes a reference to Barney the Purple Dinosaur in the Everybody Loves Raymond episode: "The Car".

Characters from Everybody Loves Raymond appear in The King of Queens episodes: "Road Rayge", "Rayny Day", "Dire Strayts", and "Raygin' Bulls. Doug Heffernan from The King of Queens appears in the Everybody Loves Raymond episodes: "The Lone Barone" and "Ray Home Alone".

Evil (CBS).description: Steven Universe is mentioned in the Evil episode "Rose390".
A Charlie Brown Christmas is mentioned in the Evil episode "7 Swans a-Singing".
George from Evil and Nick Newman from The Young and the Restless appear together in a commercial for Evil.

Evil Bong.description: The Gingerdead Man appears in Evil Bong and some of its sequels, with Gingerdead Man vs. Evil Bong and the comic The Gingerdead Man Meets Evil Bong being crossovers between the two series.

Evil Con Carne.description: Evil Con Carne is a spinoff to Grim and Evil.

Evil Con Carne.game: The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy
Evil Con Carne.description: In The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy episode, Chicken Ball Z, Mandy bought Bunny Island from Hector Con Carne from Evil Con Carne, and took charge of becoming it's new, evil dictator, bent on dominating the world. General Skarr would later become a regular character in the series.
Hector does an impression of Huckleberry Hound in the Evil Con Carne episode "Hector, King of the Britons".

Evil Dead.description: The Darkman vs. Army of Darkness comic is a crossover between the two series.
Marvel Zombies vs. The Army of Darkness is a crossover between the two series.

A Nightmare on Elm Street features a reference to The Evil Dead, while Evil Dead II features a reference to the Nightmare on Elm Street series; Freddy vs. Jason vs. Ash is a direct crossover between the two series.
Army of Darkness / Xena and Xena / Army of Darkness are direct crossovers between the two series.
Hack Slash vs. The Army of Darkness is a crossover between the two series.
Vampirella/Army of Darkness is a crossover between the two series.
The Army of Darkness versus Re-Animator: Necronomicon Rising is a crossover between the two series.

Evil Ernie.description: The Final Revenge of Evil Ernie is a crossover between the two series.

Evolution Skateboarding.description: Solid Snake and Raiden are selectable in Evolution Skateboarding, while Metal Gear Solid 2: Substance features a minigame with elements from Evolution Skateboarding.
Frogger is selectable in Evolution Skateboarding.

There is a stage called Dracula's Castle which features Dracula, Skeletons, but most important to the series to link these two as type 1 is a Brachyura. The character, Vampire Hunter is unlockable in the game who is similar to Simon Belmont.

Excite.description: Excitebike: Bun Bun Mario Battle Stadium is a crossover between the two series; The downloadable content pack The Legend of Zelda × Mario Kart 8 for Mario Kart 8 includes a track based on Excitebike.

Exed Exes.description: The Yashichi enemy from Vulgus appears as an enemy in Exed Exes.

Exist Archive.description: Costumes based on Star Ocean appear in Exist Archive as part of a special collaboration.
Costumes based on Valkyrie Profile appear in Exist Archive as part of a special collaboration.
A Monokuma costume is available as DLC for Exist Archive: The Other Side of the Sky.

Exoprimal.description: Robot versions of Ryu, Guile, and Chun Li from Street Fighter 6 appear in Exoprimal as part of a special collaboration.
Rathalos from Monster Hunter appears in Exoprimal as part of a special collaboration, along with several cosmetics based on Monster Hunter.
Mega Man appears in Exoprimal as part of a special collaboration, along with several cosmetics based on Mega Man.

Extraordinary Ones.description: My Hero Academia characters are playable in Extraordinary Ones.
Mob Psycho 100 characters are playable in Extraordinary Ones.
Durarara!! characters are playable in Extraordinary Ones.
Extraordinary Ones released skins and items from A Certain Scientific Accelerator and A Certain Scientific Railgun T.
KonoSuba characters are playable in Extraordinary Ones.
Re:Zero characters are playable in Extraordinary Ones.

Eyeshield 21.description: Characters from Eyeshield 21 appear in Jump Super Stars and Jumputi Heroes as playable characters.
The Eyeshield 21 episode "3 Brothers Of Texas Ranch" features a game based on Tekken 2.

F-1 Race.description: Famicom Grand Prix: F-1 Race is part of both series.
Mario is the pilot in Famicom Grand Prix: F-1 Race; Mario, Luigi, Toad, Peach and Bowser appear in F-1 Race for the Game Boy.
Link makes a cameo in the game boy version of F-1 Race.
Samus makes a cameo in the game boy version of F-1 Race.
Pit makes a cameo in the game boy version of F-1 Race.
Donkey Kong makes a cameo in the game boy version of F-1 Race.

F-Zero.description: Captain Falcon makes a cameo in the comic Super Mario: Im Rausch der Geschwindigkeit and in Volume 4 of Super Mario-kun; One of the tracks in F-Zero X is the "Rainbow Road" from Mario Kart 64; The downloadable content pack The Legend of Zelda × Mario Kart 8 for Mario Kart 8 includes a track based on F-Zero.

Captain Falcon is selectable in Super Smash Bros. and its sequels, where stages from the series also appear, with Samurai Goroh appearing as an Assist Trophy in Super Smash Bros. Brawl; Captain Falcon performs a Falcon Punch in the last episode of the anime F-Zero: GP Legend.
A R.O.B. shaped crane appears in F-Zero GX.
AiAi from Super Money Ball appears F-Zero GX on Billy's belt and an Emblem in Garage Mode.
One of the emblems in F-Zero GX's Garage Mode represents Sonic the Hedgehog; Aliens looking like Chaos from the Sonic series make an appearance in F-Zero GX.
A trailer for F-Zero GX is included in The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time Master Quest; One of the emblems in F-Zero GX's Garage Mode represents Tingle from the Zelda series.

FAITH.description: A drawing of V1 from ULTRAKILL can be found in Chapter 3 of FAITH: The Unholy Trinity.
A Horror from DUSK can be found outside the Shack in Chapter 3 of FAITH: The Unholy Trinity.
Graffiti of WD Gaster can be found in Chapter 3 of FAITH: The Unholy Trinity.
Graffiti of Uboa can be found in Chapter 3 of FAITH: The Unholy Trinity.
Graffiti of White Face can be found in Chapter 3 of FAITH: The Unholy Trinity.

FIFA.description: Cosmetics based on Apex Legends appear in FIFA 22 as part of a special collaboration.

FLCL.description: A Kenny doll can be seen in the episode "Marquis de Carabas" of FLCL.

FLIP.description: Matthew writes Gollum on his hand then does an impression of Gollum in FLIP.

FTL: Faster Than Light.description: Rockman is an assist in Fraymakers.

Fahrenheit (Quantic Dream).description: A "Citizen Cage" poster can be found in Fahrenheit.
A game cover of Beyond: Two Souls can be found in the remastered version of Fahrenheit.

Fairly OddParents.description: Titanic is mentioned in the Oh Yeah! Cartoons short "The Fairly OddParents!".
In the short "Party of Three!" from Oh Yeah! Cartoons, Timmy says "Warp speed, Mr. Sulu" while riding a roller coaster.
Voltron is mentioned in the short "The Temp!" from Oh Yeah! Cartoons.
The Partridge Family is mentioned in the short "The Zappys!" from Oh Yeah! Cartoons.
There are several references to The Matrix in The Fairly OddParents.

"Pipe Down" features Timmy somehow managing to misinterpret a rowboat gesture in a game of charades as the entirety of Ghostbusters II. In "Fairly Odd Baby" Chet Ubetcha says "Dogs and Cats living together... It's mass hysteria." This is a reference to the Ghostbusters line "Human sacrifice, dogs and cats living together... Mass hysteria!". "Poltergeeks" parodies Ghostbusters.
In the beginning of "Abra-Catastrophe" Timmy is dressed as Spider-Man.

Jimmy, Carl, and Cindy were mentioned in The Fairly OddParents episode "Sleepover and Over". Jimmy Neutron and The Fairly OddParents have a crossover called Jimmy Timmy Power Hour. They also have comic crossovers.
Yogi Bear was mentioned in "Jimmy Timmy Power Hour".
In the episode "Channel Chasers", they go to the show Carpet Critters, a parody of Rugrats. Dill Pickles from Rugrats makes a cameo in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".
Snap from ChalkZone makes a cameo in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".
Donnie and Darwin make cameos in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".
Krumm from Aaahh!!! Real Monsters makes a cameo in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".
Truman from The X's makes a cameo in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".
Daggett from The Angry Beavers makes a cameo in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".
Appa from Avatar: The Last Airbender makes a cameo in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".

Fairly OddParents.game: My Life as a Teenage Robot
Fairly OddParents.description: Mrs. Wakeman from My Life as a Teenage Robot makes a cameo in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".
Mr. Blik from Catscratch makes a cameo in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".
In Wishology!, Timmy is dressed as Harry Potter, Poof takes the form of a golden quidditch snitch, and Vicky is Moldywart, which is Lord Voldemort.
At the end of "Super Zero" Wanda is dressed as Wonder Woman.
Garfield is drawn on a cup in "Manic Mom-Day"

Poof makes a cameo as a fountain fish in the T.U.F.F. Puppy episode "Mall Rat." Dudley makes cameos in various episodes of The Fairly OddParents as well as one of the head gags. "The Fairly Odd Phantom" is a crossover between The Fairly OddParents, Danny Phantom, T.U.F.F. Puppy and Bunsen is a Beast. They also have the same crossover in a comic.

Danny Phantom appears on a wanted poster in The Fairly OddParents episode "Poltergeeks". In The Fairly OddParents episode "Crash Nebula" Danny Phantom is shown on the back of Sprig's comic. The concept of Denzel Crocker becoming half-man, half-cheese in "Cheese & Crockers" is similar to Danny Phantom becoming half-ghost when he used his parents' machine. "The Fairly Odd Phantom" is a crossover between The Fairly OddParents, Danny Phantom, T.U.F.F. Puppy and Bunsen is a Beast. They also have the same crossover in a comic. In the Danny Phantom episode "What You Want", Danny and Tucker can be seen playing a Crash Nebula arcade game.
The title card for "Balance of Flour" is a reference to Pac-Man. Ghosts from Pac-Man appear on a poster in "Poltergeeks".
The Hungry Games is a parody movie of The Hunger Games.

The Fairly Odd Phantom is a crossover between The Fairly OddParents, Danny Phantom, T.U.F.F. Puppy and Bunsen is a Beast. Timmy, Cosmo, Wanda, Mr. Turner, Mrs. Turner and Mr. Crocker appear in the episode "Beast of Friends". Sparky made a cameo in the Bunsen is a Beast episode "Beast In Show".

Fairy Tail.description: Master Higgins is a playable guest character in TV Anime: Fairy Tail: Gekitou! Madoushi Kessen.
There is a crossover chapter between the manga Fairy Tail and Rave.
There is a crossover chapter between the magna Fairy Tail and The Seven Deadly Sins.
Characters from Fire Force appear in Fairy Tail Goku Mahou Ranbu as part of a special collaboration.

Fall Guys.description: The Gordon Freeman and Alyx skins are available in Fall Guys.
The Jacket skin is available in Fall Guys.
The Scout skin is available in Fall Guys.
The Bullet Kin skin is available in Fall Guys.
The P-BODY and Chell skins are available in Fall Guys.
The Pedro skin is available in Fall Guys.
A skin based on Gato Roboto is available in Fall Guys.
A skin based on the titular character of Gris is available in Fall Guys.
The Messenger skin is available in Fall Guys.
The Godzilla skin is available in Fall Guys. Mechagodzilla appears a part of the Season 1 (2022) premium season pass.
The Untitled Goose Game skin is available in Fall Guys.
Three skins from Doom are available in Fall Guys: Doomguy, Tyrant, and Cacodemon.
Skins based on Cuphead and Mugman are available in Fall Guys.
The Imposter skin is available in Fall Guys.
SCOUT from Murder By Numbers is a skin in Fall Guys.
A skin based on Shovel Knight is available in Fall Guys.
Skins based on Tron are available in Fall Guys.
As part of a cross promotion, a DLC bomberman known as "Bean Bomber" was added to Super Bomberman R Online based on the Fall Guy, while a Bomberman costume was added to Fall Guys.
A skin based on 2B from Nier:Automata appears in Fall Guys.
Skins based on Ratchet and Clank are available in Fall Guys.
Skins based on Disney's The Jungle Book are available in Fall Guys.
AiAi from Super Monkey Ball is a costume in Fall Guys.
A skin based on the Guy Spelunky and Ana Spelunky from Spelunky appear in Fall Guys.
A skin based on the Prisoner from Dead Cells appears in Fall Guys.
Sackboy from LittleBigPlanet is a costume in Fall Guys.
A skin based on Aloy from Horizon: Zero Dawn appeared in Fall Guys.
Skins based on The Nightmare Before Christmas are available in Fall Guys. Zero appears in a celebration.
Filbo Fiddlepie and a Bunger hat from Bugsnax appear in Fall Guys.
A skin based on Astro and the T-Rex from Astro's Playroom appear in Fall Guys.
A skin based Ezio from Assassin's Creed appears in Fall Guys, as a part of the Season 1 (2022) premium season pass.
Skins based on Master Chief, a Brute and a Grunt from Halo appear in Fall Guys.
A skin based on El Chapulin Colorado appears in Fall Guys.
A skin based on Viper Ning from Naraka: Bladepoint appears in Fall Guys. Additionally, the Through the Fire mode in Naraka: Bladepoint is inspired by Fall Guys.
Skins based on Mai Shiranui and Terry Bogard from Fatal Fury appear in Fall Guys.
Sonic, Knuckles, Tails and Dr. Eggman skins are available in Fall Guys. Additionally, a Sonic-themed round, titled "Bean Hill Zone", is also avaliable to play.
Hatsune Miku appears in Fall Guys, as a part of the Season 2 (2022) premium season pass.
A Xenomorph from Alien appears in Fall Guys, as a part of the Season 2 (2022) premium season pass. A Chestburster appears in a celebration.
Spock from Star Trek appears in Fall Guys, as a part of the Season 2 (2022) premium season pass.
Skins based on the Hunter, Warlock, and Titan from Destiny 2 appear in Fall Guys.
Skins based on ToeJam and Earl appear in Fall Guys.
A skin based on the crow from Death's Door appears in Fall Guys.
Skins based on various characters from the Ghostbusters series appear in Fall Guys.
Skins based on the a Dalek, the Fourth Doctor and the Thirteenth Doctor from Doctor Who appear in Fall Guys.
Skins based on characters from Masters of the Universe appear in Fall Guys.
Skins based on SpongeBob, Patrick, Squidward, Sandy, and Mr. Krabs from SpongeBob appears in Fall Guys.
A skin based on the Last Dragonborn from Skyrim appears in Fall Guys.
A skin based on the Ultraman appears in Fall Guys.
Skins based on Ryu, Cammy and Akuma from Street Fighter appear in Fall Guys.
Skins based on Jin Sakai and The Ghost from Ghost of Tsushima appears in Fall Guys.
Skins based on Marcus Fenix, Kait Diaz, General RAAM from Gears of War appear in Fall Guys.
Skins based on The Grinch appear in Fall Guys.
Skins based on characters from Encanto appear in Fall Guys.
Skins based on Invincible, Omni-Man and Atom Eve from Invincible appear in Fall Guys.
A skin based on appeared in Fall Guys.
Skins based on Hello Kitty appear in Fall Guys.
Skins based on Tomb Raider appear in Fall Guys.
Skins based on Sam Porter Bridges appear in Fall Guys.
Skins based on Yooka-Laylee appear in Fall Guys.
Skins based on Pac-Man appear in Fall Guys.
Skins based on Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles appear in Fall Guys.
Skins based on Woody and Buzz Lightyear appear in Fall Guys.
Skins based on Star Wars appear in Fall Guys.

Fallout.description: Fallout 4 features a fictional game called "Pipfall", partially based on Pitfall.
Fallout 4 features a fictional game called "Red Menace", partially based on Donkey Kong.
Morgan Yu's spacesuit is available as part of Fallout 4's Creation Club.
the Quake Thunderbolt is available as part of Fallout 4's Creation Club.
There have been frequent crossovers between Fallout and The Elder Scrolls.

Famicom Grand Prix.description: Famicom Grand Prix: F-1 Race is part of both series.
Mario is the pilot in Famicom Grand Prix: F-1 Race and its sequel with Luigi as the navigator, while the Monster truck makes an appearance in Super Mario Bros. & Friends: When I Grow Up

Family Basic games.description: Mario and Pauline from Donkey Kong make an appearance in built-in games in Family Basic - v.3.
The Sidesteppers and Fighter Flies from Mario Bros. make an appearance in built-in games in Family Basic - v.3.

Family Guy.description: Characters watch Brady Bunch in the Family Guy episode "Death Has A Shadow".
Characters watch Philadelphia in the Family Guy episode "Death Has A Shadow".
GI Jew toys are shown in the Family Guy episode "Death Has A Shadow".
The Kool-Aid Man appears in many Family Guy episodes.
Stewie Griffin uses a Sesame Street phone in the Family Guy episode "I Never Met The Dead Man".
Star Trek was mentioned in the Family Guy episode "I Never Met The Dead Man"; there are later references to Star Trek.

Peter Griffin meets Wile E. Coyote in the Family Guy episode "I Never Met the Dead Man". Bugs Bunny and Elmer Fudd appear in Stewie Griffin: The Untold Story; Taz was mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Farmer Guy".
Peter Griffin dreams about meeting Alf in the Family Guy episode "I Never Met The Dead Man".
In the Family Guy episode "Chitty Chitty Death Bang", Bruce is dressed as Spider-Man. Many other episodes feature references to Spider-Man.
Teletubbies is shown on TV in the episode "A Hero Sits Next Door".
Speed Racer appears in the Family Guy episode "The Son Also Draws".
Peter writes a letter to Angus MacGyver in the Family Guy episode "Brian: Portrait of a Dog".
A blue M&M appears in the Family Guy episode "Brian: Portrait of a Dog"; a red M&M shoots Peter in "Christmas Crime".
Lois and Brian watch The Dick Van Dyke Show in the Family Guy episode "Holy Crap".
Peter Griffin takes a box of cereal from Tricks the Trix Rabbit in the Family Guy episode "Da Boom".

Family Guy was shown on TV in The Simpsons episode "Missionary: Impossible", Peter Griffin appears as a clone of Homer Simpson in The Simpsons episode "Treehouse of Horror XIII"; Peter appears in a book in the episode "The Italian Bob". Stewie Griffin talks about The Simpsons in the Family Guy episode "8 Simple Rules for Buying My Teenage Daughter". Homer Simpson appears in the Family Guy episode "PTV"; The Simpsons characters appear in the Family Guy episode "Movin' Out (Brian's Song)"; various episodes of The Simpsons were referenced in the Family Guy episode "Save the Clam". In the episode "The Simpsons Guy", the Griffins go to Springfield and meet The Simpsons characters.
The sign by the NBC building mentions "We Used to Have Seinfeld, Remember?" in the Family Guy episode "If I'm Dyin', I'm Lyin'".
Breakfast cereal mascots are in the role of the Breakfast Club cast in the Family Guy episode "Let's Go To The Hop"; Breakfast Club is mentioned in theFamily Guy episode "Peter Principal".
Lethal Weapon 2 was mentioned in the Family Guy episode "E. Peterbus Unum".
Sam Wheat and Molly Jensen appear in the Family Guy episode "Story On Page One"; Ghost is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Don't Be A Dickens At Christmas".
Characters watch Blair Witch Project at the cinema in the Family Guy episode "Thin White Line".
Stewie Griffin plays with Kermit and Miss Piggy toys in the Family Guy episode "Brian Does Hollywood Part 2".
Leonard Part 6 is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Brian Does Hollywood".
In the episode "And the Weiner is...", Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer has a tumor when a doctor arrives to check on his red nose and became Rudolph the Uncircumstanced Reindeer.
Peter Griffin shouts "Wilson" at a ball with a face on a raft in the Family Guy episode "Fish Out Of Water". Cast Away is also mentioned in "Bigfat".
Stewie watches The Smurfs in the Family Guy episode "Emission Impossible".
Pretty Woman is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Screwed The Pooch".
Episodes of The Jeffersons were mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Peter Griffin: Husband, Father...Brother?".
Frosty appears in the episode "A Very Special Family Guy Freakin' Christmas", while Brian's drunken Christmas music rant in "Christmas Guy" includes Frosty the Snowman.
ThunderCats was mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Brian Wallows and Peter's Swallows".
The Family Guy episodes "Stuck Together, Torn Apart" and "Chick Cancer" feature references to Q*bert.
Stewie and Brian watch Magnum, P.I. in the Family Guy episode "Stuck Together, Torn Apart".
The Silence of the Lambs is referenced in several episodes of Family Guy.
McDonald's was mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Road to Europe", there's later references in the series.
Stewie Griffin is reading Peter Griffin's copy of "Garfield at Large" in "North by North Quahog".
Barney was mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Fast Times at Buddy Cianci Jr. High".
Peter watches Jake and the Fatman in the Family Guy episode "Petarded".
Barney Rubble meets Peter Griffin in the Family Guy episode "Peter's Got Woods".
Tom Tucker is seen playing a handheld Crash Bandicoot racing game in Stewie Griffin: The Untold Story.
Casper appears in Stewie Griffin: The Untold Story.
Jonny Quest appears in Stewie Griffin: The Untold Story.
Stewie Griffin enters map 5, episode 1 of Doom in the opening of "PTV".
All in the Family is shown on PTV in the Family Guy episode of the same name.
Characters are dressed up as the A Team in the Family Guy episode "Brian Goes Back To College".
Scrat from the Ice Age series makes an official appearance in the Family Guy episode: "Sibling Rivalry". Sid the Sloth also advertises Family Guy in a promo for Fox's Animation Domination block.

Peter Griffin appears in the Robot Chicken episode "Suck It"; Stewie and Brian enter the world of Robot Chicken in the Family Guy episode "Road to the Multiverse". Robot Chicken is mentioned in several Family Guy episodes.

The townspeople from South Park are against Family Guy in the Cartoon Wars duology, there are other references to Family Guy in the series; South Park is mentioned in the Family Guy episodes "Bigfat" and "Family Guy Through the Years", and Kenny appears in the episode "V is for Mystery".

Roger appears in the Family Guy episodes Meet the Quagmires, The Simpsons Guy, Blue Harvest, It's A Trap! and Send in Stewie, Please. Barney appears in the Family Guy episode Killer Queen. Stan and Avery appear in the Family Guy episode Lois Kills Stewie while Stan makes a cameo in the episode Excellence in Broadcasting. Brian makes a cameo in the American Dad episode The People vs. Martin Sugar while he and Stewie make a cameo in the American Dad episode The Worst Stan. Peter appears in the American Dad episode Hurricane!.
Ryu from Street Fighter appears as a character in the browser game American Dad vs. Family Guy Kung-Fu II.
Popeye appears in the episode "You May Now Kiss the...Uh...Guy Who Receives".

Peter and Brian watch Dora the Explorer in issue 2 of Family Guy. Stewie has Dora on his sled in the episode "How the Griffin Stole Christmas"; a fanfic of Dora the Explorer appears in the Family Guy episode "Peter's Lost Youth".
In the Family Guy episode "Mother Tucker", Tom Tucker asked Peter Griffin if he wants to watch Chicken Little.

Family Guy is shown on TV in "Bad Karma", a DVD bonus feature, which is also an alternate version of "Pilot". My Name Is Earl is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Believe It Or Not, Joe's Walking On Air".
Yogi Bear and Boo-Boo appear in the Family Guy episode "Hell Comes to Quahog".
A person watches Madagascar in the Family Guy episode "Hell Comes to Quahog".
A Tetris cutaway gag was featured in the Family Guy episode "Prick Up Your Ears".

Stewie has a toy of a green SpongeBob in the episode "Prick Up Your Ears". Meg puts on an episode of SpongeBob SquarePants in the Family Guy episode "Road to Rupert". SpongeBob and Squidward were mentioned in "Road to the North Pole". In the episode "Inside Family Guy", a character is dressed as SpongeBob SquarePants.
Chester Cheetah is in the episode "Chick Cancer".
There are several references to Cheers throughout Family Guy.
Mister Rogers' Neighborhood was mentioned in the Family Guy episode "No Chris Left Behind".
Peter Griffin dresses as Donald Duck in the Family Guy episode "Movin' Out (Brian's Song)".
Stitch is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Movin' Out (Brian's Song)".
Sebastian is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Movin Out (Brian's Song)".
Contact is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Former Life of Brian".
Call of Duty: Modern Warfare was mentioned in the Family Guy episode "I Dream of Jesus", while Peter plays Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 in the episode "April in Quahog".
A clip from Hook is edited into a fake interview in the Family Guy episode Kiss Seen Round The World.
A fake promo for 24 was shown in the Family Guy episode "Peter's Progess"; 24 was mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Friends of Peter G".
Brian plays Pac-Man in the episode "Road to the Multiverse".

The Cleveland Show is a spinoff of Family Guy. Additionally, a promo for The Cleveland Show appears in the Family Guy episode "The Big Bang Theory", while the episode "He's Bla-ack!" is about Cleveland returning to Family Guy.
Stewie watches Hannah Montana in the Family Guy episode "Hannah Banana".
Curious George is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Dog Gone" and later episodes.
Carter Pewterschmidt watches The Big Bang Theory in the Family Guy episode "Business Guy"; The Big Bang Theory is referenced in later episodes.
Grand Theft Auto is mentioned in the Family Guy episode: "Big Man on Hippocampus".
The Scorpion King is mentioned in Family Guy episode: "Big Man on Hippocampus".
Stewie mentions Handy Manny in the episode "Brian & Stewie".  Stewie also calls Handy Manny in the episode "Herppy the Love Sore".

Futurama was mentioned in Stewie Griffin: The Untold Story; Bender appears in the Family Guy episodes "Blue Harvest", "The Splendid Source", "Boopa-Dee Bappa-Dee", and "Throw It Away".  His appearance on "The Splendid Source" and "Throw It Away" are official cameos.
Risky Business is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Something, Something, Something, Dark Side".
Labyrinth is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "And Then There Were Fewer".
In the Family Guy episode "Halloween on Spooner Street", Chris is dressed as Optimus Prime.
Peter Griffin sings the CatDog theme song in the Family Guy episode "Friends of Peter G".
Bubo appears in the Family Guy episode "Tiegs for Two".
Beetlejuice is mentioned by Mayor West in the Family Guy episode "Brothers & Sisters".
Grape Ape was mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Screams of Silence: The Story of Brenda Q."
Brian is revealed to be the author of Harry Potter in the episode "Back to the Pilot".
Love Actually is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Cool Hand Peter".
Characters watch Avatar at the cinema in the Family Guy episode "Grumpy Old Man".
Tom and Jerry was mentioned in the episode "Grumpy Old Man". Peter and Lois watch Tom and Jerry in the episode "Valentine's Day in Quahog".
Forrest Gump is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Friends Of Peter G".

Peter Griffin is mentioned in Ted, while the Griffins watch Ted in the Family Guy episode: "Mobsters Inc". Ted is also mentioned in the Family Guy episodes: "Veteran Guy" and "The Birthday Bootlegger". A hat based off of Ted was available in Family Guy Online as part of a promotion of the film.
Mad Men is mentioned in the Family Guy episodes: "Ratings Guy", "The New Adventures of Old Tom", "Emmy-Winning Episode" and "Regarding Carter".
Hank Hill meets Peter and Louis in the episode season 11 episode "Bigfat". Bobby Hill is one of the many characters Stewie morphs into in the Family Guy episode "Boopa-Dee Bappa-Dee".
Stuart Little is mentioned in the Family Guy episode: "Brian's Play".
Louise Belcher is one of the many characters Stewie morphs into in the Family Guy episode "Boopa-Dee Bappa-Dee". Bob from Bob's Burgers makes an official cameo in The Simpsons/Family Guy crossover.
Manny Delgado is one of the many characters Stewie morphs into in the Family Guy episode "Boopa-Dee Bappa-Dee".
The "Baby Bobble Stewie" costume in Family Guy: The Quest for Stuff is based on Bub, there are a few enemies inspired by Bubble Bobble characters.
In the episode "The Most Interesting Man in the World", Chris mentions that he wants to watch The Walking Dead.
In the episode "The Most Interesting Man in the World", Chris mentions that he wants to watch Game of Thrones.
iCarly is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Baby Got Black".
The Boondocks is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "He's Bla-ack!".
Schmendrick from The Last Unicorn is mentioned in the Family Guy episode: "Meg Stinks!".
Peter played Angry Birds in court in the episode Quagmire's Mom.
Where the Wild Things Are is mentioned in the Family Guy episodes: "Quagmire's Mom" and "The Dating Game".
The Family Guy episode "Encyclopedia Griffin" features a skit based on Donkey Kong.
Jiminy Cricket appears in the Family Guy episode "Roasted Guy" and is mentioned in "Road to India".
In the Family Guy episode "The Peanut Butter Kid", Godzilla arrives to Haiti only to find it destroyed.
In the Family Guy episode "A Lot Going On Upstairs", Brian Griffin says that Glenn Close was mean in her performance as Cruella De Vil in the live action version of 101 Dalmatians.
Doctor Who shows on TV in the Family Guy episode "Inside Family Guy".
Minions are mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Inside Family Guy".
Woody and Buzz Lightyear are mentioned in the Family Guy episode "The Finer Strings".
A Rocky event for Family Guy: The Quest for Stuff is released.
Big Momma's House is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Passenger Fatty Seven".
In the episode "Passenger Fatty Seven" Peter Griffin wished he stayed home to finish the remake of Inside Out.

Chris watches Rick and Morty in the episode "Roasted in an Open Fire", Rick and Morty was mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Pal Stewie"; in the Family Guy episode "PeTerminator", Stewie borrowed the portal gun from Rick and Morty and says that they borrowed plenty from them.
Usual Suspects is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Crimes And Meg's Demeanor".
Rover Dangerfield appears in the Family Guy episode "The Woof of Wall Street".
In the Family Guy episode "Griffin Winter Games" Brian Griffin says that "Oksana Baiul" sounds like something Gandalf would say.
Tony the Tiger appears in the Family Guy episode "Pawtucket Pete".
In the episode "Island Adventure" Moana has been mentioned.
Wreck-It Ralph is mentioned in the episode "Adam West High"; Peter and Lois watch "Wreck-It Ralph 3: Ralph Wrecks the Toilet" in the Family Guy episode "Cutaway Land".
In the Family Guy episode "Bri-Da", Ghost Rider appears at the 28th Annual Quahog Monster Truck Rally and Gunshow.
Young Sheldon was mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Disney's The Reboot".
Bojack Horseman was mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Disney's The Reboot".
Beavis and Butt-Head appear in the Family Guy episode "Peter & Lois' Wedding".
Daria appears in the Family Guy episode "Peter & Lois' Wedding".
Peter mentioned Hercules in the episode "Heart Burn" due to Disney owning the rights to Fox.
Peter and his friends watch a gag involving the Death Angel from A Quiet Place in the episode “Undergrounded”.
Splice is mentioned in the Family Guy episode: "Baby Stewie".
Chris Griffin writes a Phineas And Ferb fanfic in the Family Guy episode "Movin In (Principal Shepherd's Song)".
Lois plays Caillou in the episode “Stewie's First Word”.
Annabelle appears in the Family Guy episode "The Talented Mr. Stewie".
Uncle Grandpa is mentioned by Peter in the Family Guy episode "Young Parent Trap".
In the Family Guy episode "Meg Goes to College", Peter Griffin sings the Blue's Clues song "Mailtime".
The Family Guy episode "Brief Encounter" features a reference to JoJo's Bizarre Adventure.
That's So Raven is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "HBO-No".
Shrek is mentioned in the Family Guy episode "Happy Holo-ween".

Family Matters.description: Family Matters is a spin-off of Perfect Strangers.

Steve Urkel from Family Matters appears on the Full House episode "Stephanie Gets Framed". Steve Urkel was mentioned by DJ in the Fuller House episode "Here Comes the Sun" Michelle from "Full House" appears in two "Family Matters" promos interacting with Steve and Laura.
Cory Mathew is mentioned by Steve Urkel as a friend in the Family Matters episode “Beauty and the Beast”.

Family Stadium.description: Acha from Toy Pop appears in Famista '88 - '91 as the newscaster, while Pino appears as a player in Famista Online 3, Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and its sequels, and along with Acha in Famista Dream Match; additionally players named after Pino and Acha appeared in the Namco Stars team in Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium and its sequels.

The Namco Stars team from Family Statium is unlockable in Kyukai Dochuki, while Tarosuke from Shadow Land appears as a player in Famista Online, Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and its sequels, and Famista Dream Match; additionally one of the players in the Namco Stars team in Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium '87 and its sequels is called "Tarosuke".

Pac-Man appears during a homerun in Super Batter Up, then appears alongside other Pac-Man characters in the audience of the Namco stadium in Super Famista 4, Super Famista 5 and Famista 64, and as an actual player in Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and Famista Dream Match; additionally one of the players in the Namco Stars team in Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium and its sequels is called "Pac", while Famista Online 2010 and Famista Climax feature a player based on Blinky (as "Akabe") in the Rivals team, and Ms. Pac-Man appears as the mascot of the Namco Stars team in Famista 64; Pac-Man also appears as the logo of the team in Super Famista and its sequels.

The field in the Namco stadium in Super Famista 4, Super Famista 5 and Famista 64 features elements from Xevious, and the Solvalou ship, the Mothership Andor (under the name "Xevious") and the Bacura appear as guest players in Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and Famista Dream Match; additionally Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium and its sequels include players called "Solvalou" and "Xevious", while Famista Online 2010 and Famista Climax include one in the Rivals team based on the Mothership Andor.

The Meowky from Mappy are among the audience in the Namco stadium in Super Famista 4 and Famista 64, and Mappy himself appears as a player in Famista Online 3, Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and its sequels, and Famista Dream Match, while Nyamco appears in Famista Online 2011, Famista Returns and Famista Climax (here in the Rivals team); additionally Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium and its sequels include players called "Mappy" and "Nyamco".

Elements from Dig Dug appear in the background of the Namco stadium in Super Famista 4, Super Famista 5 and Famista 64, while Fygar appears as a player in Famista DS, Famista Online, and the protagonist of Dig Dug (called "Dig Dug") and Pooka appear as guest players in Pro Baseball Famista 2011; additionally Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium and its sequels include players called "Dig Dug", "Fygar" and "Pooka".

The Tower of Druaga appears in the background of the Namco stadium in Super Famista 4, Super Famista 5 and Famista 64, while Gil and Ki appear as players in Famista Online, Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and its sequels, and Famista Dream Match with Druaga also appearing in the Rivals team in Famista Online 2010 and Famista Climax; additionally Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium and its sequels include players called "Gil", "Ishita" and "Ki".
Elements from Metro-Cross appear in the background of the Namco stadium in Super Famista 4.

The "Sky Kids" appear during a homerun in the Namco stadium in Super Famista 4; additionally Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium and its sequels include players called "Baron" and "Sky Kid" in the Namco Stars team, while Famista Online 2010 features a player based on the enemy planes from Sky Kid  in the Rivals team.

Elements from Libble Rabble appear in the background of the Namco stadium in Super Famista 5; additionally one of the players in the Namco Stars team in Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium and its sequels is called "Tofukafu".

Amul appears (in dragon form) during a homerun in the Namco stadium in Super Famista 5, and (in human form) as a player in Famista DS, Famista Online 3, Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and its sequels and Famista Dream Match, while Chaos and Zawell appear in the Rivals team in Famista Online 2010 and Famista Climax; additionally Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium '87 and its sequels include players called "Amul" and "DSUPI" (or "D. Spi").

Valkyrie appears among the audience in the Namco stadium in Famista 64 and as an actual player along with Sandra in Famista Online, Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and its sequels, and Famista Dream Match, and she also appeared as the mascot for the Namco Stars team in Super Famista 3-5; the enemy Zouna also appeared in the Rivals team in Famista Online 2010 and in Famista Climax; additionally Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium '88 and its sequels include players called "Quarkman" and "Sandra".

Family Stadium 2003 features a stadium set in the world of Klonoa, and Klonoa himself appears as a player in Famista Online, Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and its sequels, and Famista Dream Match, with the King of Sorrow also appearing in Dream Match; additionally one of the players in the Namco Stars team in Famista Advance is called Popka, and an image of Klonoa appears in the Namco stadium.

Family Stadium 2003 features a stadium set in the world of Taiko no Tatsujin and players called "Don Wada" and "Katsu Wada", that also return in later games; Don-chan himself appears as a player in Pro Yakyuu Famista 2011, then alongside Katsu-chan in Famista Dream Match and alongside Tatsu-Don in Famista Climax.
Famista Online, Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and Famista Dream Match feature Hitomi Yoshino as a guest player; additionally Famista Advance and Family Stadium 2003 feature a player called "Moto G".

Famista Online, Famista DS, Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and Famista Dream Match feature KOS-MOS from Xenosaga as a guest player, with Albedo also appearing in Famista Online 2010 and Shion appearing in Famista 2011 and Dream Match.

Famista Online, Pro Baseball Famista 2011, Famista Dream Match and Famista Climax feature a racer from Ridge Racer as a player (called "Ridge"), with Reiko Nagase also appearing in Famista 2011 and Dream Match; additionally some games in the series feature players called "RRR" (referencing Ridge Racer Revolution), "R4" (referencing R4: Ridge Racer Type 4), "Rage" (referencing Rage Racer) and "Reiko".

Famista Online, Pro Baseball Famista 2011, Famista Dream Match and Famista Climax feature Susumu and Taizo Hori as guest players (altough Taizo appears in 2011 as "Dig Dug"); additionally Famista Advance and its sequels include players called "Susumu", "Taizo" and "Anna", and an image of Puchi appears in the Namco stadium in Famista Advance.
Famista Online 2 features Apollo from Phelios as a guest player; additionally one of the players in the Namco Stars team in Famista '89 and its sequels is called "Apollo".
Famista Online, Famista DS, Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and its sequels  and Famista Dream Match feature The Prince from Katamari as a guest player, with the King also appearing in Dream Match.

The Namco Special set in Kotoba no Puzzle Mojipittan Wii Deluxe includes a puzzle of a Famista player with other baseball players as assistants, while Pro Baseball Famista 2011, Famista Dream Match and Famista Climax feature Moji-kun as a guest player.

Famista Online 2010 features Bakuda from Bravoman in the Rivals team, while Pro Baseball Famista 2011, Famista Dream Match and Famista Climax feature Bravoman in the Namco Stars team, with Bakuda, Black Bravo and Pistol Daimyo also appearing in the Rivals team in Climax; additionally Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium '88 and its sequels include players called "Bravoman" and "Waya Hime".

Famista Online 2010 and Famista Climax feature Mabu from Rolling Thunder in the Rivals team; additionally one of the players in the Namco Stars team in Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium '88 and its sequels is called "Albatross".

Famista Online 2010 and Famista Climax feature Yoritomo from Genpei Toma Den in the Rivals team, while Kagekiyo appears in the Namco Stars team in Famista Online 2011, Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and its sequels, and Famista Dream Match; additionally one of the players in the Namco Stars team in Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium '87 and its sequels is called "Kagekiyo".

Famista Online features Heihachi from Tekken as a guest player, with Unknown also appearing in Famista Online 2010 and Nina and Yoshimitsu appearing in Famista Online 2011, while Pro Baseball Famista 2011 features Heihachi, Nina and Panda, and Famista Climax features Heihachi, Devil and Unknown; additionally Super Famista 5 and its sequels include players called "Devil", "Heihachi", "Mokujin" and "Tekken".
Famista Online 2011 features Paco from Marvel Land as a guest player.

Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and Famista Dream Match feature Wagan as a guest player; additionally Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium '88 and its sequels include players called "Wagan", "Takuto", "Karin" (after the protagonists of Wagan Paradise) and "Hisopiso" (after the character from Wagan Land 3).

Pro Baseball Famista 2011 features the XFA-27 from Ace Combat (here called "Ace-con") as a guest player; Kei Nagase and the X-02 Wyvern (called "Ace") were also added in January 2016 in Famista Dream Match; additionally Famista 3 and its sequels include players called "Air-con", "Ace Combat" or other variations.

Pro Baseball Famista 2011 features Chihaya, Haruka and Miki from THE iDOLM@STER as guest players, while 13 idols from the series appeared in Famista Online 2011 during a special collboration, and Pro Yakyuu Famista Climax features Haruka, Mirai, Uzuki and Tendo.

Famista Online 2011, Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and its sequels, and Famista Dream Match feature the crocodile from Wani Wani Panic as a guest player (called "Wani Wani"); additionally Gear Stadium Heiseiban and its sequels include players called "Wani Wani", "Wani Para" (after Wani Wani Paradise), "Takoika" and "Same Same".

Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and Famista Dream Match feature an alien from Galaga as a guest player; additionally Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium and its sequels include players called "Galaga", "Gala 3" (only in Famista 2), "Kyara Hachi" (after Galaga '88), "Dragoon" (after the player's ship from Galaxian 3), "Galboss" and "Zolgear".

Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and Famista Dream Match feature Mitsurugi and Siegfried from the Soul series as guest players, with Taki, Ivy and Astaroth also added to Famista Dream Match in December 2015, and Mitsurugi also returning in Famista Climax; additionally one of the players in the Namco Stars team in Super Famista 5 and its sequels is called "Soul Edge", while one in Family Stadium 2003 is called "Maxi".

One of the players in the Namco Stars team in Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium and its sequels is called "P.P.", and he's depicted in Pro Baseball Famista 2011  and Famista Dream Match  as a racer from Pole Position.
Pro Baseball Famista 2011 features Soma and Shio from God Eater as guest players, while Pro Yakyuu Famista Climax features Alisa and Vajra.
Famista Online 2011, Pro Baseball Famista 2011 and its sequels, and Famista Dream Match feature Wonder Momo as a guest player (sometimes simply called "Momo").
Famista Online 2012 features Clovis from Dragon Buster as a guest player; additionally Famista '89 and its sequels include players called "Carl" and "Clovis".
Famista Dream Match features Hiromi from Burning Force as a guest player.

Famista Dream Match and Famista Climax feature Rick from Splatterhouse as a guest player; additionally one of the players in the Namco Stars team in Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium '88 and its sequels is called "Rick".

One of the players in the Namco Stars team in Famista 2 is called "Tank". Saki, Kaoru, Natasha and Tsubame from Shin-Gun Destroy! Girl's Tank Battalion were added to Famista Dream Match during a special promotion.
Pro Yakyuu Famista Climax features Sharon from Numan Athletics as a guest player; additionally one of the players in the Namco Stars team in Famista '94 is called "Numan".
Pro Yakyuu Famista Climax features a player called "Tank", who is shown driving a tank from Tank! Tank! Tank!.

Pro Yakyuu Famista Climax features Velvet from Tales of Berseria in the Bandai Namco team, while Barbatos from Tales of Destiny 2 and Dhaos from Tales of Phantasia appear in the Rivals team; addtionally Super Famista 5 and its sequels include players called "Cress", "Mint", "Reid" and "Tales".

The Special Flag from Rally-X is a special item in Pro Yakyuu Famista Climax; it also makes minor appearances in other games in the series; additionally one of the players in the Namco Stars team in Pro Yakyuu Family Stadium and its sequels is called "Rally-X".

Family Tennis.description: Alice from Märchen Maze is a selectable character in Family Tennis Advance.
Bravoman is a selectable character in Family Tennis Advance.
Taira no Kagekiyo is a selectable character in Family Tennis Advance.
Valkyrie is a selectable character in Family Tennis Advance.
Klonoa is a selectable character in Family Tennis Advance.
Heihachi Mishima from Tekken is a selectable character in Family Tennis Advance.
Hitomi Yoshino from MotoGP 2 is a selectable character in Family Tennis Advance.
Gilgamesh and Ki from The Tower of Druaga are selectable characters in Family Tennis Advance.
Susumu Hori and Anna Hottenmeyer from Mr. Driller are selectable characters in Family Tennis Advance.
Taroko is a selectable character in Family Tennis Advance.
Wonder Momo is a selectable character in Family Tennis Advance.
Pino from Toy Pop is a selectable character in Family Tennis Advance.
Rick from Splatterhouse is a selectable character in Family Tennis Advance.
Pac-Man is a selectable character in Family Tennis Advance.

Family Ties.description: Commando is mentioned in the Family Ties episode "Architect's Apprentice".

Fanboy & Chum Chum.description: No Toy Story is a reference to Toy Story.

Fangirl.description: Beverly Hills, 90210 is mentioned in Fangirl.
Battlestar Galactica is mentioned in Fangirl.
Harry Potter is mentioned in Fangirl. Also, the Simon Snow books in Fangirl are heavily based on Harry Potter.
Fellowship of the Ring is mentioned in Fangirl.
Top Gun is mentioned in Fangirl.
Risky Business is mentioned in Fangirl.
Golden Girls is mentioned in Fangirl.
Hello Kitty is mentioned in Fangirl.
Mad Men is mentioned in Fangirl.

Fantasia.description: Mickey Mouse appears in Fantasia. Little Pan from the Pastoral Symphony segment of Fantasia makes an appearance in the cover story to Mickey Mouse Weekly #521, while The Mushrooms from the Nutcracker Suite segment are enemies in the North American version of Mickey Mousecapade; various characters from Fantasia and Fantasia 2000 also appear in the House of Mouse series.
Donald Duck is the protagonist of the Fantasia 2000 segment Pomp and Circumstance

Fantastic Beasts.description: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them is a spin-off of the Harry Potter series.

Fantastic Four.description: There have been many cameos and crossovers between both series, the first one being in Amazing Spider-Man #1.

Black Panther made his debut in Fantastic Four #52, and would go on to appear in numerous Fantastic Four comics, with him had at one point becoming a member of the Fantastic Four. Additionally, the Fantastic Four and Doctor Doom have appeared in numerous Black Panther comics.

Doctor Doom from Fantastic Four appears in Master of Kung Fu #60. Shang-Chi appears in Fantastic Four Roast and Ultimate Fantastic Four #23, #52, and #53. The Fantastic Four appear in Shang-Chi Vol. 2 #4.
Fred and Barney Meet The Thing is part of both series.
The Micronauts appeared in Fantastic Four Vol 1 #246.
Moon Knight appeared in Fantastic Four Annual Vol. 1 #22 and Fantastic Four Vol. 6 #40 and #45.
In Issue 33 of Ultimate Fantastic Four, Johnny Storm and Benjamin Grimm can be seen playing Tekken 5.

Fantastic Max.description: Space Ghost appears in the Fantastic Max episode "The Big Sleep".
The Great Gazoo appears in the Fantastic Max episode "The Big Sleep".
George Jetson appears in the Fantastic Max episode "The Big Sleep".

Fantasy Island.description: The Love Boat and Fantasy Island have a crossover.

Fantasy War Tactics.description: Characters from the BlazBlue series appear in Fantasy War Tactics as part of a collaboration event.
Characters from MapleStory appear in Fantasy War Tactics as part of a collaboration event.
Sol Badguy, Ky Kiske, Ramlethal Valentine, and May from Guilty Gear appear in Fantasy War Tactics as part of a collaboration event.
Characters from Noblesse appear in Fantasy War Tactics as part of a special collaboration.
Tower of God characters appear in Fantasy War Tactics for a special collaboration.

Far Cry.description: A rabbid appears in a trailer for Far Cry Vengeance.
Vaas Montenegro says "Run, Forrest, run" in Far Cry 3.
Far Cry 6 had a crossover mission with that centered around a hardcore Rambo fan where you could obtain a replica of the Vengeance Bow and other cosmetics.
Far Cry 6 had a crossover mission with Stranger Things, titled "The Vanishing".

FarmVille.description: Jack and his wagon from The Pioneer Trail appear in FarmVille as part of a special collaboration. Additionally, quests for Farmville appear in The Pioneer Trail as part of a special collaboration.
Megamind characters appears in FarmVille as part of a special collaboration.
Rio characters appear in FarmVille as part of a special collaboration.
Flo appeared in Farmville 2: Country Escape during a limited event.

Farm Hokkorina.description: Sonic appared in Farm Hokkorina during a special promotion from February 21st to march 30th.

Fast and Furious.description: A Daddy Day Care poster is shown in 2 Fast 2 Furious.
The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift features a reference to Donkey Kong.
The PlayStation 2 The Fast and The Furious video game by Namco features drift charms of Pac-Man and all the ghosts.
The PlayStation 2 The Fast and The Furious video game by Namco features drift charms of Taizo Hori, Fygar and Pooka from Dig Dug: Digging Strike.
The PlayStation 2 The Fast and The Furious video game by Namco features a drift charm of Susumu Hori from Mr. Driller.
The PlayStation 2 The Fast and The Furious video game by Namco features drift charms of a Katamari, The Prince and the King of All Cosmos from Katamari Damacy.
The PlayStation 2 The Fast and The Furious video game by Namco features drift charms of Katsu and Don from Taiko no Tatsujin.
The PlayStation 2 The Fast and The Furious video game by Namco features drift charms of 13 characters from Soul Calibur III.
The PlayStation 2 The Fast and The Furious video game by Namco features drift charms of 12 characters from Tekken 5.
Furious 7 shows Luke Hobbs watching The Incredible Hulk on TV.

Fatal Frame.description: Costumes based on Millennia and Reina from the Deception series are unlockable in Fatal Frame II: Crimson Butterfly - Director's Cut.
Samus' Zero Suit is unlockable in Project Zero 4.
Spirit Camera is a spinoff to the Fatal Frame series.
Project Zero 2: Wii Edition features unlockable costumes of Mario and Luigi.

Ayane from Dead or Alive is a bonus playable character in Zero: Nuregarasu no Miko. Costumes based on Kasumi and Ayane from the Dead or Alive series are unlockable in Fatal Frame II: Crimson Butterfly - Director's Cut.
Zelda Suit is unlockable in Maiden of Black Water.

Fatal Fury.description: Ryo Sakazaki is a selectable character in Fatal Fury Special and (as Mr. Karate) in the PlayStation version of Fatal Fury: Wild Ambition, while Geese Howard appears in the ending of the SNES version of Art of Fighting and as the secret final boss in Art of Fighting 2. Additionally, Khushnood Butt from Garou: Mark of the Wolves is said to be a student of Ryo Sakazaki.
The King of Fighters series is centered around the tournament from the Fatal Fury series, and features many characters from it.
Ryo Sakazaki appears in the PlayStation version of Fatal Fury: Wild Ambition as his "Mr. Karate II" alias from Buriki One.
Several The Last Blade characters make cameo appearances on Hokotomaru's stage in Garou: Mark of the Wolves.
Garou Densetsu vs. Fighter's History Dynamite is a crossover between the two series.

Fate (TYPE-MOON).description: Zelretch from Tsukihime makes a cameo at the end of the Heaven's Feel route in Fate/stay night.

Father Ted.description: There is a Masters Of The Universe themed bed in the Father Ted episode "Good Luck Father Ted".
Jurassic Park is mentioned in the Father Ted episode "Passion Of Saint Tibulus".
Forrest Gump is mentioned in the Father Ted episode "Passion Of Saint Tibulus".
The second season episode "Old Grey Whistle Theft" of Father Ted features characters playing Street Fighter II.
Boyz N The Hood is mentioned in the Father Ted episode "Old Grey Whistle Theft".
Mister Bean is mentioned in the Father Ted episode "Flight Into Terror".
Shining is mentioned in the Father Ted episode "Are You Right There Father Ted?".

Father of the Pride.description: Smokey and the Bandit is mentioned in the Father of the Pride episode "Larry's Debut and Sweet Darryl Hannah Too".
Donkey appears in an episode named after him in the show Father of the Pride.
Sarmoti dresses up as Gandalf in the Father of the Pride episode "And the Revolution Continues".
Law & Order is mentioned in the Father of the Pride episode "Possession".
CSI: Miami is mentioned in the Father of the Pride episode "Possession".
Fight Club is mentioned in the Father of the Pride episode "Sarmoti Moves In".
Frasier is mentioned in the Father of the Pride episode "Stage Fright".
Caroline in the City is mentioned in the Father of the Pride episode "Stage Fright".
Star Wars is mentioned in the Father of the Pride episode "The Siegfried and Roy Fantasy Experience Movie".
Ghostbusters is mentioned in the Father of the Pride episode "The Siegfried and Roy Fantasy Experience Movie".

Felix the Cat.description: Betty Boop and Felix is a crossover between both series.

In the Garfield and Friends episode "The Automated, Animated Adventure", Garfield's model transforms into Felix the Cat. In The Twisted Tales of Felix the Cat episode "The Fuzzy Bunny Show", a kid mistook Felix for Garfield.
In The Twisted Tales of Felix the Cat episode "The Fuzzy Bunny Show", Felix says "You wouldn't do this to the Ninja Turtles".

Ferris Bueller's Day Off.description: Ferris Bueller's Day Off takes place in Shermer, Illinois, a fictional suburb that first appeared in Sixteen Candles. Additionally, according to Word of God, Samantha Baker from Sixteen Candles and Ferris Bueller knew each other.
The I Dream of Jeannie theme plays in Ferris Bueller's Day Off.
Alien is mentioned in Ferris Bueller's Day Off.
Dirty Harry is mentioned in Ferris Bueller's Day Off.
The Star Wars theme plays in Ferris Bueller's Day Off.

Fight Klub.description: The first Fight Klub set features cards based on Army of Darkness, including a character card of Ash Williams.
The first Fight Klub set features cards based on Rambo, including a character card of John Rambo.
The first Fight Klub set features cards based on Silence of the Lambs, including a character card of Hannibal Lecter.
The first Fight Klub set features cards based on Friday the 13th, including a character card of Jason Voorhees.
The first Fight Klub set features cards based on Saw II, including a character card of Jigsaw.
The second Fight Klub set features cards based on The Lost Boys, including a character card of Michael Emerson.
The second Fight Klub set features cards based on Tank Girl, including a character card of Tank Girl.
The second Fight Klub set features cards based on The Devil's Rejects, including a character card of Captain Spaulding.
The second Fight Klub set features cards based on Reservoir Dogs, including a character card of Mr. Blonde.
The third Fight Klub set features cards based on Robocop, including a character card of Robocop.
The third Fight Klub set features cards based on Terminator 2, including character cards of The Terminator and T-1000 and a partner card of John Connor.

Fight Night.description: The GameCube version of Fight Night Round 2 features Little Mac from the SNES game Super Punch-Out!! as an unlockable boxer.
Fight Night Round 3 features The King from Burger King as an unlockable trainer.

Fighter's History.description: Karnov is one of two bosses in "Fighter's History" and Fighter's History Dynamite. The second game was rebranded Karnov's Revenge in English markets.
The Bonus stage Ox from Karate Champ is a secret boss character in Fighter's History Dynamite.
Garou Densetsu vs. Fighter's History Dynamite is a crossover between the two series.

Fighters Megamix.description: Fighters Megamix features many characters from Virtua Fighter.
All original characters from Fighting Vipers are selectable in Fighters Megamix.
Fighters Megamix features two characters and two stages from Sonic the Fighters; Deku from Fighters Megamix makes a cameo appearance in the 50th issue of the Archie Sonic the Hedgehog comic.
Fighters Megamix features Janet from Virtua Cop 2 as a playable character.
Fighters Megamix features The Hornet as a playable character.
Fighters Megamix features Rent a Hero as a playable character.
The plane from After Burner makes a cameo in Fighters Megamix. There is also a music track from After Burner in the game.

Fighting Layer.description: Fighting Layer and Fighter EX Layer feature characters originally from the Street Fighter EX series, while Ace from Street Fighter EX3 features three moves lifted from Fighting Layer and five Fighting EX Layer costumes were available in Street Fighter V: Champion Edition in limited events.
Fighting EX Layer features Terry Bogard from the Fatal Fury series as a DLC guest character.

Fighting Vipers.description: Pepsi Man is unlockable in the Japanese Sega Saturn version of the game.
Toys based on Sonic characters appear in the introduction of the console versions of Fighting Vipers; Sonic and Tails are also included in the game's code, though unused, in the arcade version.

Figure (Komoe).description: Hatsune Miku appeared in Figure Fantasy and Figure Story during a collaboration event.

Figure (Komoe).game: That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime
Figure (Komoe).description: Rimuru and Milim from That Time I Got Reincarnated as a Slime appeared in Figure Fantasy and Figure Story during a collaboration event.
Mikoto Misaka from A Certain Scientific Railgun T appeared in Figure Fantasy during a collaboration event.
Characters from Black Rock Shooter appeared in Figure Fantasy during a special collaboration event.

Fillmore!.description: Kim Possible appears in Fillmore! in the background of the episode Codename: Electric Haircut.
Spinelli from Recess appears in Fillmore! in the background of the episode Codename: Electric Haircut.

Final Destination.description: Stuart Little is mentioned in Final Destination.
Diff'rent Strokes is mentioned in Final Destination 2.
Top Gun is mentioned in Final Destination 3.
SpongeBob is mentioned in Final Destination 3.

Final Fantasy.description: Makai Toushi SaGa features enemies from Final Fantasy and the first three SaGa games were released as the Final Fantasy Legend series outside Japan; Final Fantasy Legends: Toki no Suishou features characters from Romancing SaGa 2 as summons, while Adel from Imperial SaGa, and various characters from Romancing Saga 3 appeared in Final Fantasy Brave Exvius during special collaborations; additionally Unlimited SaGa features a demo version of Final Fantasy X and a Chocobo Card is present, but unused, in the code for Romancing Saga 3, while Theatrhythm Final Fantasy Curtain Call features downloadable tracks from the SaGa series.

The Mana series started with Seiken Densetsu: Final Fantasy Gaiden; a chocobo is unlockable as a pet in Legend of Mana, while Final Fantasy Legends: Toki no Suishou features Salamander and Undine from the Mana series as a summon called Spirit of Mana, and characters from Secret of Mana and Trias of Mana also appeared in Final Fantasy Brave Exvius during special collaborations; additionally Final Fantasy X-2 features a minor reference to Secret of Mana while Theatrhythm Final Fantasy Curtain Call features a downloadable track from Seiken Densetsu 3.
The Chocobo series is a spin-off of the Final Fantasy series.
Ehrgeiz features some characters from Final Fantasy VII; Final Fantasy VIII and Dissidia 012 Final Fantasy feature a weapon called Ehrgeiz.

Many characters, items and general themes from the Final Fantasy series are featured prominently in the Kingdom Hearts series, while characters from Kingdom Hearts appear in World of Final Fantasy, Final Fantasy Record Keeper, and Final Fantasy Brave Exvius during special promotions; additionally three costumes from Kingdom Hearts are downloadable in Dissidia 012 Final Fantasy, and Kingdom Hearts Final Mix contains a trailer for Final Fantasy X-2.
Commander Shepard armor from Mass Effect 3 is downloadable in Final Fantasy XIII-2.
Theatrhythm Final Fantasy and its sequels are format crossovers between the two series. Final Fantasy characters appear.

Bravely Default is the spiritual successor of Final Fantasy: The 4 Heroes of Light and features many of the same elements; additionally Final Fantasy Brave Exvius includes Bravely Default characters, while Theatrhythm Final Fantasy Curtain Call features downloadable tracks from the game.

Shantotto from Final Fantasy XI and a Moogle from Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn appear during special events in Dragon Quest X, while various monsters and characters from Dragon Quest of the Stars appeared in Mobius Final Fantasy, Brickman appeared in Final Fantasy XIV, and characters from the series appeared in Final Fantasy Brave Exvius during special collaborations; additionally in international versions of Final Fantasy there's the tomb of a character named "Erdrick" and the Wyrmhero Blade in Final Fantasy XII is based on Erdrick's sword from Dragon Quest; a demo version of Final Fantasy XII was included in the North American release of Dragon Quest VII.
2 Tracks from The World Ends with You can be downloaded in Theatrhythm Final Fantasy: Curtain Call.
Pure Odio from Live A Live appears as a summon in Final Fantasy Legends: Toki no Suishou. 2 Tracks from Live A Live can be downloaded in Theatrhythm Final Fantasy: Curtain Call.

Characters from Valkyrie Profile appear in Final Fantasy Legends: Toki no Suishou and Final Fantasy Brave Exvius. Additionally, characters from Final Fantasy Record Keeper appeared in Valkyrie Anatomia as part of a collaboration event.
Characters from Brave Frontier appeared in Final Fantasy Brave Exvius during special collaborations and vice versa.

Thirteen Yokai from Yo-Kai Watch appear as minions in Final Fantasy XIV, during an event from July 26 to October 3, 2016, while Yo-Kai Watch 3 features a Yokai based on Moogle, and one riding a Chocobo from the Final Fantasy series; characters from Dissidia Final Fantasy also appeared in Yo-Kai Watch: Wibble Wobble.

A special collaboration between Final Fantasy Brave Exvius and Monster Hunter Explore includes a "Hunter" unit, weapons and an exclusive boss battle in the former, and costumes, weapons and a Moogle in the latter; Monster Hunter World features creatures from Final Fantasy XIV and vice versa during a collaboration; Monster Hunter 4G/Ultimate and Monster Hunter X also feature a downloadable costume from Final Fantasy; Rathalos from Monster Hunter appears in Final Fantasy VII: Ever Crisis as part of a crossover event.

Characters from Star Ocean: Anamnesis appear in Final Fantasy Brave Exvius and vice versa, during special collaborations; additionally Star Ocean: Till the End of Time features a character based on Aerith from Final Fantasy VII.
Characters from NieR: Automata appear in Final Fantasy Brave Exvius during special collaborations; additionally, music from the Nier series can be heard on the radio in Final Fantasy XV.
Final Fantasy XV Windows Edition features a costume based on Gordon Freeman from Half-Life.

Final Fantasy XV Windows Edition features a costume based on Super Llama Man from The Sims, while The Sims 4 features a costume based on Noctis Lucis Caelum from Final Fantasy XV (added in update 64).
Lara Croft appears in Final Fantasy Brave Exvius during a special collaboration; additionally Lightning Returns: Final Fantasy XIII features a downloadable costume based on Lara Croft.
Characters from Xenogears appeared in Final Fantasy Brave Exvius during special collaborations; there have also been other minor references between the two series.
Characters from Just Cause 3 appear in Final Fantasy Brave Exvius during a special collaboration.
Characters from Octopath Traveler appear in Final Fantasy Brave Exvius during special collaborations. Cecil from Final Fantasy IV appears in Octopath Traveler during a special collaboration.
Deus Ex: Human Revolution features a poster for Final Fantasy XXVII.  Characters from Deus Ex appear in Final Fantasy Brave Exvius during a special collaboration.
Characters from SINoALICE appeared in Final Fantasy Brave Exvius during a special collaboration.
Characters from Fullmetal Alchemist appeared in Final Fantasy Brave Exvius during special collaborations.

Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 3 features a reference to Final Fantasy VI.  Also Joker, Queen, and Violet from Persona 5 Royal appear in War of the Visions: Final Fantasy Brave Exvius as part of a collaboration event.

Characters from Chrono Cross made and appearance in Final Fantasy Brave Exvius as part of a special collaboration. Theatrhythm Final Fantasy Curtain Call features a downloadable music track from Chrono Trigger; additionally Chrono Trigger was released along Final Fantasy IV in Final Fantasy Chronicles, while Final Fantasy IX features references to the Chrono series.

Aya Brea from Parasite Eve appears in Final Fantasy: Brave Exvius as part of a collaboration event. Additionally, in Parasite Eve there's a poster of characters from Final Fantasy VII and a poster of a Chocobo; Aya Brea's Costume from The 3rd Birthday is downloadable in Dissidia 012 Final Fantasy; there also are minor references to Final Fantasy VII in Parasite Eve II and to Parasite Eve in Final Fantasy IX.
Several skins based on Final Fantasy XIV appear in Fall Guys, while stages from Fall Guys appear in Final Fantasy XIV as part of an update.

Final Fight.description: Characters from Street Fighter make cameos in various Final Fight games; various Final Fight characters are recurring characters in the Street Fighter series.
Mega Man's face appears on a billboard in Mighty Final Fight. Two rescuable Reploids in Mega Man X6 are named after Guy and Cody.
Mobichan from Side Arms appears in the continue screen in Mighty Final Fight.
The Yashichi enemy from Vulgus appears as an item in Final Fight 3.
Sengoku BASARA billboards are visible in Final Fight: Streetwise.
Ōkami billboards and paitings are visible in Final Fight: Streetwise.

Finding Nemo.description: The ball from Luxo, Jr. appears in Finding Nemo
Buzz and The Pizza Planet Truck appears in Finding Nemo. The Barracuda and the googles appears in Toy Story 4.
Mike appears in Finding Nemo's end credits.
Riley from Inside Out appears in Finding Dory.
Characters from Finding Nemo appear in Disney Heroes: Battle Mode

Fire (G&W).description: UNDIRECT: Modern Fire within Game & Watch Gallery and Game & Watch Gallery Advance features elements from the Mario series.
UNDIRECT: Donkey Kong Jr. makes an appearance in Modern Fire within Game & Watch Gallery and Game & Watch Gallery Advance.

Fire Attack.description: UNDIRECT: Modern Fire Attack within Game & Watch Gallery Advance features elements from the Mario series.
UNDIRECT: Wario's Hen from Wario Land II makes an appearance in Modern Fire Attack within Game & Watch Gallery Advance.

Fire Emblem.description: Characters from the Shin Megami Tensei series appear in Tokyo Mirage Sessions ♯FE
Tokyo Mirage Sessions ♯FE includes costumes based on characters from Etrian Odyssey.
Tokyo Mirage Sessions ♯FE includes Joker from Persona as DLC (and Itsuki in the Encore re-release)

Fire Force.description: Shinra from Fire Force fights the Colossal Titan with Eren as part of a promotion to AnimeJapan 2019.

Chapter 182 of Fire Force shows Haumea envisioning the Soul Eater Moon.  This is later confirmed to be real at the end of chapter 229. Additionally, characters from Soul Eater appeared in Fire Force: Enbu No Sho as part of a special collaboration.
A poster for "Space Wars", possibly resembling Star Wars, appears in Chapter 238 of Fire Force.
Arthur and Vulcan play "Dragon Question", a parody of Dragon Quest, in Chapter 258 of Fire Force.

Firefly (Fox).description: The Weyland-Yutani logo is seen on the cannon Malcolm Reynolds fires in Firefly "Serenity".

Fireman Sam.description: Fireman Sam appears in Children's Party at the Palace.

Fireman Sam.game: The Official BBC Children in Need Medley
Fireman Sam.description: Fireman Sam, Firefighter Elvis Cridlington, Station officer Basil Steele and Firefighter Penny Morris sing in The Official BBC Children in Need Medley.

Firewatch.description: A book written by someone with the same exact name as the father of the protagonist from Gone Home can be found in Firewatch.
You can find a sweatshirt in Firewatch with the name of the school that Joel and Ellie visit in The Last of Us.

A book can be found in Firewatch called "The Patriots" which is the name of the enemy organization in the Metal Gear Solid series. Not only that, but the book is written by Donald Anderson, The DARPA Chief from the first Metal Gear Solid.

Fish Hooks.description: A game based on Super Mario Bros. can be seen in the Fish Hooks episodes "Fish Out of Water" and "Doggonit".

Fist of the North Star.description: Fist of the North Star: Lost Paradise is a spin-off of the Yakuza series, and Kazuma Kiryu from Yakuza appears as a downloadable skin.
Characters from Virtua Fighter appear in Fist of the North Star: Legends ReVIVE as part of a collaboration event.
Characters from Baki the Grappler appear in Fist of the North Star: Legends ReVIVE as part of a collaboration event.
Characters from Street Fighter V appear in Fist of the North Star: Legends ReVIVE as part of a collaboration event.
