Characters from Tekken 7 appears in Fist of the North Star: Legends ReVIVE as part of a collaboration event.

Fitness Boxing.description: Fitness Boxing feat. Hatsune Miku: Isshoni Exercise is a crossover between both series.

Five Nights at Freddy's.description: A robot version of Mr. Chipper from Chipper & Sons Lumber Co. appears as a secret boss in Five Nights at Freddy's World, and Mr. Chipper himself becomes a secret playable character in Update 2; while the Ultimate Custom Night character El Chip is based on Chipper.
An Asteroids arcade cabinet can be seen in Five Nights at Freddy's
A Centipede arcade cabinet can be seen in Five Nights at Freddy's
Missile Command is mentioned in Five Nights at Freddy's

Flaming Carrot.description: The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles appear in Flaming Carrot #25-27. Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles/Flaming Carrot is a crossover between both series.
Mystery Men is based on characters from Flaming Carrot.

Flash Gordon.description: Archie Meets Flash Gordon was going to be a crossover between the two series, but was never released.

Flash Point (Sega).description: An image of Flicky appears in Flash Point.

Flintstones.description: Yogi Bear and Boo Boo appear in the Flintstones episode "Swedish Visitors".

Characters from The Flintstones appear in Space Jam: A New Legacy. Additionally, characters from Looney Tunes and Flintstones could be found interacting with one another on the back of some boxes for Cocoa Pebbles Crunch'd.

Flower Pot Men.description: Bill, Ben, and Little Weed appear at the start of the video, which appears to be set in the garden from the series.

Food Wars!: Shokugeki no Soma.description: There's an allusion to Dragon Quest III in chapter 19 of the Shokugeki no Soma manga.
There's an allusion to Kenshiro from Fist of the North Star in chapter 28 of the Shokugeki no Soma manga.
In chapter 61 of the Shokugeki no Soma manga, Soma carves a perfect Gundam figurine out of vegetables.
There's a reference to JoJo's Bizarre Adventure in chapter 71 of the Shokugeki no Soma manga.
There's an allusion to Ultraman King in chapter 74 of the Shokugeki no Soma manga.
There's an allusion to the Ace Attorney series in chapter 81 of the Shokugeki no Soma manga.
Nami from One Piece appears in the crossover Extra Chapter "A Magnificient Banquet" of the Shokugeki no Soma manga.
Chitoge Kirisaki from Nisekoi appears in the crossover Extra Chapter "A Magnificient Banquet" of the Shokugeki no Soma manga.
Kagura from Gintama appears in the crossover Extra Chapter "A Magnificient Banquet" of the Shokugeki no Soma manga.
Chika Amatori from World Trigger appears in the crossover Extra Chapter "A Magnificient Banquet" of the Shokugeki no Soma manga.

Irina Jelavić and Koro-sensei from Assassination Classroom appear in the crossover Extra Chapter "A Magnificient Banquet" of the Shokugeki no Soma manga.
A special crossover manga chapter between Food Wars!: Shokugeki no Soma and Kinnikuman involving characters from both franchises was published in Kinnikuman Jump volume #5.

Fortnite.description: A Jazz Jackrabbit poster can be found in some locations in Fortnite.
A Shadow Complex poster can be found in some locations in Fortnite.

Thanos appears in Fortnite. Thor's Stormbreaker, Iron Man's Repulsors, Hawkeye's Bow and Captain America's Shield have appeared as items in the game as a part of the Endgame LTM. Korg can also be seen playing Fortnite in Avengers Endgame.
Richard from The Amazing World of Gumball mimics a dance from Fortnite in an official Cartoon Network video, though the video isn't part of either series.
Jake from Adventure Time mimics a dance from Fortnite in an official Cartoon Network video, though the video isn't part of either series.
Beast Boy from Teen Titans Go! mimics a dance from Fortnite in an official Cartoon Network video, though the video isn't part of either series.
Pearl from Steven Universe mimics a dance from Fortnite in an official Cartoon Network video, though the video isn't part of either series.
Ralph Breaks the Internet and Fortnite have references to each other.
Monopoly:Fortnite Edition is a format crossover between the two series. The Monopoly pieces are Back Blings wearable In-Game.
Chief Hopper, the Demogorgon and Eleven appear in Fortnite.
The Reaper skin from Fortnite was based on John Wick. In Chapter 1 Season 9, John Wick and Sofia were added, alongside the limited Wick's Bounty game mode.
A Psycho Bandit and Claptrap appear in Fortnite.

Several Batman themed skins and items appear in Fortnite; Tilted Towers was temporarily changed to Gotham City as part of a limited-time event. The movie Batman Begins was also screened in Fortnite during the "Movie Nite" event.
Catwoman appears in Fortnite.

Cuddle Team Leader, Jess, Kyle, Ramirez, Raven, Rustlord and a Supply Llama pet from Fortnite appears in Battle Breakers. Razor and Kurohomura also appear in Fortnite, along with a Cloudpuff Back Bling.

Captain America (Steve Rogers and Sam Wilson) appears in Fortnite.

Forza.description: Forza Horizon 2 presents The Fast and the Furious is a crossover between the two series.
The Chryslus Rocket 69 from Fallout is featured in Forza Motorsport 6.

The 2554 AMG Transport Dynamics M12S Warthog CST from Halo is featured in Forza Horizon 3 and Forza Horizon 4. Initially available to anyone who played either Halo: The Master Chief Collection or Halo 5: Guardians between September 6, 2016 and September 23, 2016, the M12S Warthog CST has been featured in several Forzathon events in Forza Horizon 3.
The Regalia from Final Fantasy XV appears as a DLC car in Forza Horizon 3 and Forza Horizon 4.
The Best of Bond Car Pack is added to Forza Horizon 4 featuring the James Bond versions of various cars.
The  Quadra Turbo-R V-Tech car from Cyberpunk 2077 appears as a DLC car in Forza Horizon 3 and Forza Horizon 4.
Hot Wheels tracks and cars appear in Forza Horizon 5.
Barbie's 1956 Chevrolet Corvette EV and Ken’s 2022 GMC HUMMER EV Pickup from Barbie (2023) appear as DLC cars in Forza Horizon 5.

Foster's Home for Imaginary Friends.description: The Eds makes a cameo in the Foster's Home for Imaginary Friends episode Eddie Monster and a package from Frankie is seen in the CN Invaded crossover event in Ed, Edd n Eddy.
Dexter from Dexter's Laboratory makes a cameo in the Foster's Home for Imaginary Friends episode Eddie Monster.

The Rudolph special is once referenced during a scene from the episode "A Lost Claus", and in another episode "Where There’s a Wilt, There’s a Way/Everyone Knows It’s Bendy", there is a scene where Wilt is referencing Hermey while cleaning Coco’s teeth and Eduardo is referencing the Boss Elf.

Foster's Home for Imaginary Friends.game: The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy
Foster's Home for Imaginary Friends.description: Goo and Mac from Foster's Home For Imaginary Friends appear in The Grim Adventures of Billy & Mandy episode The Adventure of the KND. Mandy appears in the Foster's Home For Imaginary Friends episode The Big Picture. Cheese appears in the episode Billy & Mandy Moon the Moon during the CN Invaded event. Wilt from Foster's Home For Imaginary Friends makes a cameo in the short Dream Date.

A package for Adam from My Gym Partner's a Monkey appears in Foster's Home for Imaginary Friends, during the CN Invaded crossover event, and Adam can be seen receiving it in My Gym Partner's a Monkey.
A package for Clam from Camp Lazlo appears in Foster's Home for Imaginary Friends, during the CN Invaded crossover event, and Clam can be seen receiving it in Camp Lazlo.

Freakazoid!.description: Freakazoid appears in the Animaniacs episodes "This Pun for Hire" and "The Big Wrap Party Tonight", and is seen on the cover of a magazine in "One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Clock". Wakko from Animaniacs appears in the Freakazoid! episode "The Freakazoid".

Pinky and the Brain appear in the Freakazoid! segment Freakazoid is History!". The Brain appears in the  Freakazoid! episode "The Freakazoid". characters appear in the Pinky and the Brain episode "Star Warners".

Freaky (Universal).description: Director of both films, Christopher Landon, responded to a fan on Twitter who asked if Freaky and Happy Death Day were set in the same world, stating "They def[initely] share the same DNA and there's a good chance Millie and Tree will bump into each other someday."
A poster for Pitch Perfect 2 hangs in Millie Kessler's room in Freaky.

Fred's World.description: Cheat consoles in Running Fred and Super Falling Fred feature characters and items from Psychoban series. Mental Dude is a playable character in Super Falling Fred and Skiing Fred. In the latter game, Zip and Zap, aliens from Psychoban, are also playable.

Free Fire.description: Items and skins based on Ragnarok were added to Free Fire for a limited time.
Items and skins based on One Punch Man were added to Free Fire for a limited time in.
Items and skins based on Attack on Titan were added to Free Fire for a limited time.
Costumes and items based on Assassin's Creed appear in Garena Free Fire as part of a collaboration event.
Items and skins based on Devil May Cry were added to Free Fire for a limited time.
Items and skins based on Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse were added to Free Fire for a limited time.

Free Guy.description: Dude from Free Guy appears in Fortnite. Additionally, the Rainbow Smash pickaxe appears in Free Guy.
One of the eight promotional posters for Free Guy released on August 9th is based on the cover of Mega Man. Additionally, the Mega Buster appears in the movie.
A lamp that looks like Blinky can be found in Free Guy.
Captain America's shield makes an appearance in Free Guy.
Hulk's fist makes an appearance in Free Guy.
The Gravity Gun from Half-Life makes an appearance in Free Guy.
A lightsaber makes an appearance in Free Guy alongside music from Star Wars.

Friday Night Funkin'.description: Skid and Pump from Spooky Month were added as opponents in Friday Night Funkin' with an update, while a Boyfriend plushie can be seen in the Spooky Month episode "Unwanted Guest". Someone dressed as the Boyfriend can also be found in Spooky Month episode "Tender Treats".
Pico was added as an opponent in Friday Night Funkin' with an update, while the Boyfriend made a cameo appearance in Pico's School: Love Conquers All.
Henry Stickmin appears in the background of the Week 5 mall in Friday Night Funkin'.
Meat Boy appears in the background of the Week 5 mall in Friday Night Funkin'.
Hatsune Miku appears in the background of the Week 5 mall in Friday Night Funkin'.
Sergeant John Captain from Tankmen was added as an opponent in Friday Night Funkin' with an update.
Hank J. Wimbleton from Madness Combat is going to be added as an upcoming Friday Night Funkin' character with an update.

Friday the 13th.description: Tonto is mentioned in Friday the 13th.
Posters of Godzilla appear in Friday the 13th Part III.
The Necronomicon and Skull Dagger from the Evil Dead series make an appearance in Jason Goes to Hell; Freddy vs. Jason vs. Ash is a direct crossover between the two series.
"Jason vs. Leatherface" is a direct comic crossover between the two series.
"Freddy vs. Jason" is a direct movie crossover between the two series.
According to "Word of God" the character Trent DeMarco from Transformers (2007) is the same character in Friday The 13th.
Dexter vs. Jason vs. Hack/Slash is a crossover between the three series.
Dexter vs. Jason vs. Hack/Slash is a crossover between the three series.
In an ad for Halloween Horror Night Jason from Friday the 13th appears with Jack the Clown.

Friends.description: Mr. Potato Head is mentioned in the Friends episode: "The One Where Monica Gets a Roommate".

A Speed Racer poster can be seen in the Friends episodes: "The One Where Monica Gets a Roommate" and "The One with All the Poker". Chandler wears a Speed Racer shirt in the episodes: "The One with the Boobies" and "The One That Could Have Been: Part 2". Speed Racer is mentioned in the episode: "The One Where Dr. Ramoray Dies".
Chandler mentions the Starship Enterprise in the Friends episode: "The One with the Sonogram at the End". Star Trek is also mentioned in the episode: "The One with the List".
Minnie Mouse is mentioned in the Friends episode: "The One with the Sonogram at the End".

Bugs Bunny is mentioned in the Friends episode: "The One with the Thumb", while Foghorn Leghorn is mentioned in the episode: "The One Where Joey Moves Out". David wears a Marvin the Martian shirt in the episode: "The One with the Monkey". A poster for Space Jam can be seen in the episode: "The One with the Jam".
Operation is mentioned in the Friends episode: "The One with George Stephanopoulos".

Snuffleupagus and Big Bird are mentioned in the Friends episode: "The One with George Stephanopoulos", while Bert and Ernie are mentioned in the episode: "The One Where Joey Moves Out". Elmo is also mentioned in the episodes: "The One with the Male Nanny" and "The One with the Cake". Phoebe and Ben watch Sesame Street in the episode: "The One Where Old Yeller Dies". Sesame Street is also mentioned in the episodes: "The One Where Rachel Quits" and "The One Where Phoebe Hates PBS". Rachel wears a Cookie Monster shirt in the episode: "The One Where Estelle Dies".

Future Generations.description: Bill, Ben, and Little Weed appear at the start of the video, which appears to be set in the garden from the series.
Muffin the Mule appears in the garden at the start of the video.
The Train, Brian, Ermintrude, Florence, Dougal, and Zebedee appear in the Magic Garden after the section in Chigley.
Noddy drives past Pingu in Toyland.
After exiting the garden, the boy enters Greendale, where he encounters Postman Pat and his cat Jess.
Gnasher runs down Festive Road with Dennis skating just behind him.
The boy exits the TARDIS into the Blue Peter studio, walking past a pair of Daleks.
The boy enters a wardrobe, walking through the version of Narnia from the BBC The Chronicles of Narnia series and encountering the White Witch.
The camera zooms out from the boy, out of Po's stomach, before further zooming out to the Live & Kicking studio.

F\u042fED.description: The Annoying Orange appears in Fred Goes Grocery Shopping feat. Annoying Orange while on that same day FЯED appears in Annoying Orange - Annoying Orange vs. FRED!!!. FЯED also appears in many episodes of Ask Orange.

G.I. Joe.description: Action Man was created as a licensed version of the original G.I. Joe; an Action Man figure also appears in the Valor vs. Venom line of G.I. Joe toys.

Cavemen is a spinoff of The Geico Cavemen Commercials.
Prince Naveen from The Princess and the Frog appears in a GEICO commercial.
Roadrunner and Wild E. Coyote appear in a GEICO commercial.
Rocky & Bullwinkle appear in a GEICO commercial.
The Geico Gecko appears in the Legitimate Research lab from Jetpack Joyride and interacts with Barry Steakfries in a GEICO commercial.
The Geico Gecko appears in the Temple Run world and interacts with Guy Dangerous in a GEICO commercial.
The Gecko imagines having the Infinity Gauntlet in the commercial "What happens when the Gecko wears the Infinity Gauntlet".
The Geico Gecko appears in the Rocket League world in a GEICO commercial.
The Geico Gecko appears in the Portal world in a GEICO commercial.
The Geico Gecko appears in the Cuphead world in a GEICO commercial.
Leo appears in a GEICO commercial. GEICO is also mentioned in Leo.

GRIEFVILLE.description: GRIEFVILLE was released as a Roblox experience and the player's Roblox Avatar can be used in it.
GRIEFVILLE x Chucky: Nightmares! was an event that was an official collaboration between Child's Play and GRIEFVILLE.

Gachapin.description: Gachapin ☆ Bomberman and Super Gachapin ☆ Bomberman are crossovers between the two series; Bomberman also appears in Gachapin & Mukku's Big Sports Day while Gachapin Challenge DS features Bomberman themed minigames and Gachapin wearing bomberman's uniform.

Gadget.description: The Inspector Gadget makes a cameo in the Catillac Cat's episode "Harem Cat", while the Catillac Cats make a cameo in an episode of season two of the Inspector Gadget TV series; there are other minor references between the two series.
The enemies in Inspector Gadget and the Circus of Fear are Horaces.
There's a reference to Space Invaders in the live action Inspector Gadget film.

Gal*Gun.description: Mighty Gunvolt is a crossover between Azure Striker Gunvolt, Mighty No. 9, and Gal*Gun.
Mighty Gunvolt is a crossover between Azure Striker Gunvolt, Mighty No. 9, and Gal*Gun.

Galactic Pinball.description: Various elements from the Metroid series are featured in the "Cosmic" table of Galactic Pinball.

Galaxian.description: The Galaxian flagship is an enemy in Super Xevious, while the X68000 version of Galaga '88 features a bonus level with enemies from Xevious.

The Special Flag from Rally-X is a special item in Gaplus while the X68000 version of Galaga '88 features a bonus level with cars and flags from Rally-X; the cars from Rally-X are featured in Galaga: Tekken 20th Anniversary Edition.

The X68000 version of Galaga '88 features a bonus level with the ghosts from Pac-Man, while the fighter from Galaxian is unlockable in Pac-Man Kart Rally and a theme with Galaxian characters appears in Pac-Man 99; Pac-Man also appears in Galaga: Tekken 20th Anniversary Edition and a Pac-Man-themed level appears in Galaga Wars; The flagship from Galaxian is a collectable item in various Pac-Man games; games from the Galaxian series are also included in Pac-Man Arcade Gold, Retro Arcade featuring Pac-Man, Pac-Man Party, Pac-Man Connect and Play. Pac-Man's Pixel Bash and Pac-Man's anniversary arcade cabinets; Pac-Man & Galaga Dimensions is a collection of both Pac-Man and Galaga games.
Elements from Dig Dug are featured in the X68000 version of Galaga '88 and in Galaga: Tekken 20th Anniversary Edition; the Galaxian flagship is an item in Dig Dug.

The X68000 version of Galaga '88 features a bonus level with enemies from Mappy, while Mappy himself makes an appearance in Galaga: Tekken 20th Anniversary Edition; while Galaga characters appear in Touch the Mappy with 80's Dot Stars.
StarBlade is a spiritual sequel to Galaxian 3 and features some enemies from it; StarBlade: Operation Blue Planet features the UGSF.
Katamari Amore features a Galaga-themed level; characters from Katamari appeared in the Galaga webcomic during a four part "Katamari X Galaga" story.
Space Galaga is a crossover between the two series.

Galaga: Tekken 20th Anniversary Edition features many characters from the Tekken series; additionally the PlayStation version of Tekken features a minigame version of Galaga and the Galaxian Flagship is featured as a point indicator in Tekken and Tekken 2.
Rick from Splatterhouse makes an appearance in Galaga: Tekken 20th Anniversary Edition.
Elements from Rolling Thunder are featured in Galaga: Tekken 20th Anniversary Edition.

Galaxy Fight.description: Yakopoo from Trip World is a mini-boss in Galaxy Fight.

GameCenter CX.description: Arino plays the NES game Takeshi no Chōsenjō in episode 1.
Arino plays the PS2 game Angelique Trois in episode 2.
Arino plays the Xbox game Steel Battalion in episode 3.
Arino plays the Dreamcast game Roommania＃203 in episode 4.

Arino plays the Japanese NES port of Star Force in episode 5. He later plays Super Star Force in episode 111 and the original Arcade version through Wii Virtual Console as part of Nintendo Channel promotional episodes. Former AD Shinchiro Toujima also played the Famicom version during the Saitama Super Arena event.
Arino plays the NES port of Sasa in episode 6.
Arino plays the PS1 game Namco Museum Volume 1 in episode 7. He also played Namco Museum Volume 4 during the GameCenter CX in Vietnam special.
Arino plays Galaga through the PS1 game Namco Museum Volume 1 in episode 7.
Arino plays the NES port of Door Door in episode 8.
Arino plays the NES port of Yie Ar Kung-Fu in episode 9. He also made it through a DVD-only revenge years later.
Arino plays the NES port of Gradius in episode 9. He did a full challenge in episode 136. He later plays Moai-kun in episode 370.
Arino plays the NES port of Track & Field (Hyper Olympic) in episode 9.

Arino plays the NES game Super Mario Bros. in episode 10. He also plays Super Mario Bros.: The Lost Levels in episodes 10 and SP of Season 1. He did a full challenge in a special live from 2013 and revenged against it in the Budokan live event. Other Mario games featured in the show includes Super Mario Bros. 3, Super Mario World, Super Mario 64, Dr. Mario, Super Mario Land, Super Mario Land 2: 6 Golden Coins, Super Mario RPG: Legend of the Seven Stars and Dance Dance Revolution: Mario Mix.

Arino plays the NES game Atlantis no Nazo in episode 1 of Season 2, which marks the current format of the TV show. He also tried a revenge through several obstacles in 2018 as part of a Blu-Ray compilation.
Arino plays the NES game Challenger in episode 2.

Arino plays the NES port of Ghosts 'n Goblins in episode 3 of GameCenter CX, the Genesis port of Ghouls 'n Ghosts in episode 34 and Super Ghouls 'n Ghosts in episode 52. He also tried a revenge through several obstacles in 2018 as part of a Blu-Ray compilation.
Arino plays the NES game Konami Wai Wai World in episode 4.
Arino plays the Disk System game Metroid in episode 5. He also did a full play through of Super Metroid in 2010 as part of the Wii Virtual Console promotional episodes.
Arino plays the NES port of Solomon's Key in episode 6.
Arino plays the SNES game Prince of Persia in episodes 7 and 8.
Arino plays the first five games in the classic Mega Man series and the first two Mega Man X games in GameCenter CX.
Arino plays the TurboGrafx-16 game Kato-chan Ken-chan (released in US as J.J. & Jeff with certain elements removed), in episode 11.
Arino plays the NES game of Ganso Saiyūki: Super Monkey Daibōken during the Arino's! Ring-Ring Tactics segment with the hints of viewers through a telephone.
Arino plays the NES game Totsugeki! Fūun Takeshi Jō in episode 12. He later plays Jogging Race in episode 158.
Arino plays the PS1 port of Tokimeki Memorial in episode 13. The PS1 version of Tokimeki Memorial 2 was also played by him as a DVD-exclusive challenge in 2019.
Arino plays the NES game Famicom Jump: Hero Retsuden in episode 14.
Arino plays the Disk System game Yume Kojo: Doki Doki Panic in episode 15.
Arino plays the NES game Milon's Secret Castle in episode 19.

Arino plays the SNES game The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past in episode 20. He later plays The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time in episodes 109 and 110, Zelda II: Link's Adventure in episodes 209, 210 and through a New Year Live Special, and The Legend of Zelda in episodes 317 and 318.
Arino plays the SNES port of Ultraman in episode 20. He also played Ultraseven later in episode 45.
Arino plays the SNES port of Final Fight in Episode 22 of GameCenter CX.
Arino plays the NES port of Adventure Island in episode 23. He also played New Adventure Island later in 2017 as part of a DVD-exclusive challenge.
Arino plays the SNES game ActRaiser in episode 24.
Arino plays the TurboGrafx-CD port of Quiz Tonosama no Yabō in episode 25. He also plays Quiz Tonosama no Yabō 2: Zenkoku-ban in episode 228 by using proper conversion kits.
Arino plays the NES game Transformers: Convoy no Nazo as part of a DVD-exclusive challenge.
Arino plays the NES game Doraemon in episode 26.

Arino plays the NES Ninja Gaiden in Episode 29 of GameCenter CX, and the NES Ninja Gaiden II in Episodes 96 and 97 and Ninja Gaiden III as part of the GameCenter CX in Pacific special episode. The "Robot Ninja Haggleman" fictional video games within Retro Game Challenge for Nintendo DS are inspired in the classic Ninja Gaiden series.
Arino plays the Disk System game Hikari Shinwa: Palutena no Kagami (known outside Japan as Kid Icarus) in episode 30.
Arino plays the SNES game Umihara Kawase in episode 31.
Arino plays the NES port of Contra in Episode 32 of GameCenter CX. He also plays Super C in episode 235 and Contra III: The Alien Wars in episode 360.
Arino plays the Cassette Vision game PakPak Monster during the Aces of Hardware that Won't Appear segment.
Arino plays the Cassette Vision game Monster Mansion during the Aces of Hardware that Won't Appear segment.
Arino plays the Cassette Vision game Kikori no Yosaku during the Aces of Hardware that Won't Appear segment.
Arino plays the NES game Ikki as part of a DVD-exclusive challenge.
Arino plays the Genesis port of Bonanza Bros. in episode 33.
Arino plays the Game Gear game Ganbare Gorby! (released in Europe as Factory Panic with certain elements changed) during the Aces of Hardware that Won't Appear segment.
Arino plays the 3DO game Jurassic Park Interactive during the Aces of Hardware that Won't Appear segment.
Arino plays the 3DO game Shock Wave during the Aces of Hardware that Won't Appear segment.
Arino plays the 3DO game Chiki Chiki Machine Mou Race: Kenken to Black Maou no Ijiwaru Daisakusen during the Aces of Hardware that Won't Appear segment.

GameCenter CX.game: Princess Tomato in the Salad Kingdom
GameCenter CX.description: Arino plays the NES version of Princess Tomato in the Salad Kingdom in episode 35.
Arino plays the SG-1000 game Girl's Garden during the Aces of Hardware that Won't Appear segment.
Arino plays the TurboGrafx-16 port of Yōkai Dōchūki in episode 36 of GameCenter CX.
Arino plays the SNES port of Street Fighter II: The World Warrior in episode 37 of GameCenter CX, and 2010 Street Fighter in episode 95.

Arino plays Castlevania III: Dracula's Curse in Episode 38. He also played the Disk System version of Akumajou Dracula (known as Castlevania outside Japan) later in 2014 as part of a DVD-exclusive challenge, Castlevania: Bloodlines in episode 270 and Akumajou Dracula X: Chi no Rondo (known as Castlevania: Rondo of Blood) in episodes 297 and 298.

Arino plays Mighty Bomb Jack in episode 39. He tried to avenge it in episode 40 and later in a live show. Both episodes and the live show were the basis for GameCenter CX THE MOVIE: 1986 Mighty Bomb Jack, a movie based on the show with a romantic side-story added as new content. The DVD and Blu-Ray releases of the movie also features Arino playing the original Bomb Jack on Wii Virtual Console as a DVD-exclusive challenge.
Arino plays Gargoyle's Quest II in Episode 40 of GameCenter CX and Demon's Crest in Episode 279.
Arino plays the NES port of TwinBee as part of a DVD-exclusive challenge.
Arino plays Adventure Quiz: Capcom World / Hatena? no Daibouken in Episode 42 of GameCenter CX.
Arino plays the SNES game Septentrion (released in US as SOS) in episode 43. He also played it during the Makuhari Messe event in order to get a better ending.
Arino plays the Disk System game Bio Miracle Bokutte Upa in episode 44.
Arino plays the Game & Watch game Fire during the Game & Watch, I Can't Leave You Alone segment.
Arino plays the Game & Watch game Flagman during the Game & Watch, I Can't Leave You Alone segment.
Arino plays the Game & Watch game Manhole during the Game & Watch, I Can't Leave You Alone segment.
Arino plays the Game & Watch game Helmet during the Game & Watch, I Can't Leave You Alone segment.
Arino plays the NES game Wagan Land in episode 47. He later plays Wagan Land 2 in episode 222 and Super Wagan Land in episode 323.
Arino plays the Game & Watch game Octopus during the Game & Watch, I Can't Leave You Alone segment.
Arino plays the Game & Watch game Parachute during the Game & Watch, I Can't Leave You Alone segment.
Arino plays the SNES port of Out of this World (released as Outer World in Japan) in episode 48.
Arino plays the Game & Watch game Oli Panic during the Game & Watch, I Can't Leave You Alone segment.

Arino plays Legend of the Mystical Ninja in episode 49. He later plays the NES game Ganbare Goemon 2 in 2016 as a DVD-exclusive challenge, and  Ganbare Goemon 2: Kiteretsu Shōgun Magginesu in episode 276.
Arino had a choice to play the NES game Ninja Hattori-kun for episode 51, but chose Musashi no Ken: Tadaima Shugyō Chū instead.
Arino plays the SNES game Clock Tower in episode 53. He later plays the PS1 game Clock Tower in episodes 230 and 231 and Clock Tower II: The Struggle Within in episode 342.
Arino plays the Game & Watch game Boxing during the Game & Watch, I Can't Leave You Alone segment.

Arino plays the NES game Kai no Bouken: Quest of Ki in episodes 54 and 55. He later did a revenge against the game within a Live Broadcast in 2007. The NES port of The Tower of Druaga was played by him as a DVD-exclusive challenge in 2008. During the GameCenter CX in Vietnam special, he also played The Return of Ishtar through Namco Museum Volume 4 for PS1.
Arino plays the Game & Watch game Spitball Sparky during the Game & Watch, I Can't Leave You Alone segment.

Arino plays the TurboGrafx-16 game Bikkuriman World in episode 57. The game is a port of the Wonder Boy in Monster Land arcade game but with Bikkuriman characters. The plot and the music were also changed.
Arino plays the NES game Kamen no Ninja Hanamaru (known as Yo! Noid in US) in episode 58.
Arino plays the Genesis game Super Fantasy Zone in episode 59.

Arino plays the NES game Bomberman as part of a DVD-exclusive challenge. In the same episode, he also played the TurboGrafx-16 version of Bomberman with the staff. Later, Super Bomberman was played by him in episode 269 and Bomberman '94 (released as Mega Bomberman on the Genesis) as part of the GameCenter CX mini special.
Arino plays the TurboGrafx-16 game PC Genjin (known as Bonk's Adventure in US) in episode 60. He later plays PC Genjin 2 (known as Bonk's Revenge in US) in episode 248
Arino plays Akumajō Special: Boku Dracula-kun in Episode 62 of GameCenter CX.
Arino plays the Genesis game Sonic the Hedgehog in episode 64. He later plays the Genesis version of Sonic the Hedgehog 2 in 2016 as part of a DVD-exclusive challenge.
Arino plays the NES game The Wing of Madoola in episode 68.
Arino plays the NES game Legacy of the Wizard in episode 69. He also played the NES game Faxanadu (based on the second title in the series, Xanadu) in episode 324.
Arino plays the NES game Dragon Power in episode 70. He later plays the SNES game  Dragon Ball Z Super Butōden (Dragon Ball Z in Europe) in episode 165.
Arino plays the SNES port of Lemmings in episode 73. He also played it for a 24-hour live broadcast in 2009.
Arino plays the SNES game Donkey Kong Country in episodes 75 and 76. He later played Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy's Kong Quest in episodes 162, 163 and 164.
Arino plays the Neo Geo game Fatal Fury Special in episode 77.

Arino plays the NES game Kirby's Adventure in episode 80. He also played Kirby Super Star in a New Year Live Special with his comedy partner Masaru Hamaguchi, Kirby's Dream Course in episode 123 and Kirby 64: The Crystal Shards in episode 262.
Arino plays the TurboGrafx-16 port of Volfied (also released as Ultimate Qix and Qix Neo) through Wii Virtual Console as part of a Nintendo Channel promotional episode.
Arino plays Genpei Toma Den in Episode 85 of GameCenter CX. He later get his revenge against the game in 2011 as part of a DVD-exclusive challenge.

Arino plays the promotional NES cartridge of Punch-Out!! (later re-released as Mike Tyson's Punch-Out!! and then, Punch-Out!! featuring Mr. Dream on digital re-releases) in episode 86. He also tried to get his revenge against Soda Popinski in the Budokan, Makuhari Messe and finally, Saitama Super Arena live events.
Arino plays the Genesis port of Golden Axe in episode 87.
Arino plays Dig Dug 2 in episode 88 of GameCenter CX.
Arino plays the NES port of Dragon Buster in episode 90 of GameCenter CX.
Arino plays the SNES game Fushigi no Dungeon 2: Fūrai no Shiren (later localized for Nintendo DS as Mystery Dungeon: Shiren the Wanderer) in episodes 92 and 93.
Arino plays the SNES game Pilotwings in episode 98. He also tried to get his revenge in a Special Live broacast and through the Iwate event.
Arino plays the NES port of Rainbow Islands in episode 99.
Arino plays the NES game Wrecking Crew in episode 100.

Arino plays the SNES game Fire Emblem: Mystery of the Emblem through Wii Virtual Console as part of a Nintendo Channel promotional episode. He also played the same game again but on Wii U Virtual Console as part of a Nintendo eShop promotional episode.
Arino plays the NES game Golgo 13: Top Secret Episode in episode 101. An arrangement of the game's main theme can be heard on the Family Computer Sniper segment in Season 17.
Arino plays the SNES port of Puyo Puyo, Super Puyo Puyo (later released in US as Kirby's Avalanche, featuring Kirby characters) in episode 102.
Arino plays the NES game Binary Land as part of a DVD-exclusive challenge.
Arino plays Mystery Tower in episode 116 of GameCenter CX.
Arino plays the NES game Gimmick! (known in Europe as Mr. Gimmick) in episode 117.
Arino plays the SNES game F-Zero in episodes 118 and 119. He later plays F-Zero X in episode 233.
Arino plays the Genesis game Comix Zone in episode 122.
Arino plays the 3DS game 3D Classics: Excitebike through Nintendo 3DS as part of a Nintendo eShop promotional episode.

Arino plays the 3DS game 3D Classics: Xevious through Nintendo 3DS as part of a Nintendo Channel promotional episode. The NES version was previously featured in the show as part of the Xevious Observation Diary in seasons 8 and 9.
Arino plays the NES game Battle Formula (known in US as Super Spy Hunter) in episode 126.
Arino plays the SNES game Hello! Pac-Man (known outside Japan as Pac-Man 2: The New Adventures) in episode 127. He also played the TurboGrafx-16 port of Pac-Land in episode 277.
Arino plays the NES game RoboCop as part of the GameCenter CX in USA special episode.
Arino plays the Genesis port of Strider in Episode 128 of GameCenter CX.
Arino plays the NES game Wild Gunman during the Project CX: Peripherals segment.
Arino plays the NES game Duck Hunt during the Project CX: Peripherals segment.
Arino plays the NES game Hogan's Alley during the Project CX: Peripherals segment.
Arino plays the NES game Saint Seiya: Ougon Densetsu (released in France as Les Chevaliers du Zodiaque: La Legende d'Or) in episode 130.
Arino plays the NES game Battletoads in episodes 132 and 133.
Arino plays the NES game Gyromite during the Project CX: Peripherals segment.
Arino plays the SMS game Alex Kidd in Miracle World in episode 135.

Arino tries the features of Family BASIC cartridge, including some BASIC programming, during the Project CX: Peripherals segment. Later, AD Takahashi programmed a shoot-em-up game called AKB, which is named after AKB48.
Arino plays the N64 game Star Fox 64 through Wii Virtual Console as part of a Nintendo Channel promotional episode.
Arino plays the SNES game Super Scope 6 during the Project CX: Peripherals segment.

Arino plays the NES game Captain Tsubasa (released in US as Tecmo Cup Soccer Game, with the elements of the Captain Tsubasa franchise removed) in episodes 141 and 142. He tried to do a revenge within the last soccer match with a weaker team, but in all chances, including the Saitama Super Arena event, he failed. He also played Captain Tsubasa II: Super Striker later in episodes 263 and 264.

Arino plays the Disk System game Famicom Tantei Club: Kieta Kōkeisha (later remade in 2021 for Nintendo Switch as Famicom Detective Club: The Missing Heir) in episode 145. Due to data reading problems in the disk itself, a Wii with the Virtual Console version of the game was used for most of the episode.
Arino plays the Sega Saturn port of Dynamite Deka as part of the GameCenter CX in USA DVD.
Arino plays the NES port of Karnov in episode 146.
Arino plays the SNES game Super Mario Kart as part of the GameCenter CX in Asia special episode. He also played Mario Kart 64 in episode 362.
The segment Barcode Gambler uses a Barcode Battler to provide fictional battle against two elements. The actual cards, however, are covered with a black tape.

Arino plays the NES game Balloon Fight through Wii Virtual Console as part of a Nintendo Channel promotional episode. He also played the same game again but on Wii U Virtual Console as part of a Nintendo eShop promotional episode. The Wii version of this episode also features a mini interview with Satoru Iwata.
Arino plays the PS1 game PaRappa the Rapper in episode 150. He also played Um Jammer Lammy in episode 240.
Arino plays the NES port of Spelunker as part of a DVD-exclusive challenge.
Arino plays the SNES game Super Mario World 2: Yoshi's Island in episodes 152 and 153.
Arino plays the NES port of Metro-Cross in episodes 154 and 155.

Arino plays the SNES game Mickey no Magical Adventure (released outside Japan as The Magical Quest Starring Mickey Mouse) in episode 157. He also played the Genesis game I Love Mickey & Donald: Fushigi na Magic Box (known outside Japan as World of Illusion Starring Mickey Mouse and Donald Duck) in episode 287 through Sega Genesis Mini.
Arino plays the NES game Chō Wakusei Senki Metafight (known outside Japan as Blaster Master) in episode 161.
Arino plays the NES port of Sky Kid in episode 167 of GameCenter CX.
Arino plays the SNES game Mario & Wario as part of the GameCenter CX in Paris special episode. He also played the Game Boy game Super Mario Land 2: 6 Golden Coins in episode 216.
Arino plays the Genesis game Yū Yū Hakusho Makyō Tōitsusen (released in Brazil as Yu Yu Hakusho: Sunset Fighters) in episode 168.
Arino plays the Wii U game NES Remix as part of a Nintendo eShop promotional episode. He also played NES Remix 2 on the same distribution format as well.
Arino plays the SG-1000 port of Flicky during the When I Looked Back, He was There segment.
Arino plays the NES game Devil World during the Famicom Box segment.
Arino plays the NES game Baseball during the Famicom Box segment.
Arino plays the NES game Tennis during the Famicom Box segment.
Arino plays the Famicom Box version of Volleyball (originally released for Disk System in Japan) during the Famicom Box segment.
Arino plays the NES game Golf during the Famicom Box segment.
Arino plays the SNES game Super Godzilla in episode 183.
Arino plays the Genesis game Shadow Dancer: The Secret of Shinobi in episode 187.
Arino plays the MSX game Majou Densetsu during the GameCenter MSX segment.
Arino plays the SNES port of Magic Sword in episode 189 of GameCenter CX.
Arino plays the TurboGrafx-16 port of Chō Zetsurin Jin: Berabōman (released in US as Bravoman) in episode 192.
Arino plays the TurboGrafx-16 port of R-Type, in episode 193. Both Part I and Part II of the game were featured, but only Part I was truly cleared. He later played Super R-Type in episode 246.
Arino plays the NES game Densetsu no Kishi Elrond (known outside Japan as Wizards & Warriors) in episode 194.
Arino plays the NES port of Commando in episode 195 of GameCenter CX.
The segment DJ Monster uses the PS1 game Monster Rancher for random battles against monsters through music singles.
Arino plays the Disk System game Nazo no Murasame Jo (released later on 3DS Virtual Console as The Mysterious Murasame Castle) in episode 196.
Arino plays the PlayStation port of Quiz Nanairo Dreams in episode 199 of GameCenter CX.
Arino plays the NES port of Double Dragon in episode 201.
Arino plays the Game Boy game Mole Mania in episode 205.
Arino plays the NES port of Trojan in episode 206 of GameCenter CX.
Arino plays the NES game Clu Clu Land during the Arino Kacho’s Bonus Assessment segment.

Arino plays the PS1 game Biohazard: Director's Cut (known outside Japan as Resident Evil: Director's Cut) as part of a DVD-exclusive challenge. He later played the PS1 versions of Resident Evil 2 and Biohazard 3: Last Escape (Resident Evil 3: Nemesis) as DVD-exclusive challenges in 2018 and 2023.

Arino plays the TurboGrafx-16 port of Taito Chase H.Q. in episode 211. One of the employees, TK Honda, also appears as a voice guest in multiple episodes as Nancy, which had her debut after this episode.
Arino plays the NES game Pinball during the Arino Kacho’s Bonus Assessment segment.
Arino plays the NES game Yume Penguin Monogatari in episode 214.
Arino plays the PS1 game Ape Escape in episodes 217 and 218.
Arino plays the NES version of Rygar in episode 219.
Arino plays the Genesis port of Altered Beast in episode 225.
Arino plays the TurboGrafx-16 port of Kiki KaiKai in Episode 226 of GameCenter CX.
Arino plays the TurboGrafx-16 port of Märchen Maze in episode 236 of GameCenter CX.

Arino plays the NES port of Renegade in episode 238. He later plays the TurboGrafx-16 port of Super Dodge Ball as part of a DVD-exclusive challenge, Shin Nekketsu Kōha: Kunio-tachi no Banka in episode 278 and Nekketsu! Street Basket: Ganbare Dunk Heroes in episode 371.

Arino plays the Genesis game Splatterhouse 2 in episodes 241 and 242. He previously played the Arcade version of Splatterhouse on Wii Virtual Console as part of the promotional Nintendo Channel episodes.
Arino plays the NES game The Adventures of Bayou Billy in episode 244.
Arino plays the SNES version of Earthworm Jim in episode 246.
Arino plays the NES game Dragon Warrior (the first entry in the Dragon Quest series) in episodes 250 and 251. Previously, the series' creator, Yuji Horii, was interviewed in episode 106.
Arino plays the TurboDuo port of Dynasty Wars in episode 253.
Arino plays the PS1 port of Power Shovel during the Learning Game Course segment.
Arino plays the Sega Saturn port of Virtua Fighter 2 in episode 254.

Arino tries out multiple features of Game Boy Camera during the Good-Bye Game Boy segment. In addition, the Game Boy Printer is also featured to make collages and give the results as present to viewers.
Arino plays the TurboGrafx-16 port of Wonder Momo in episode 259 of GameCenter CX.
Arino plays the NES port of The Legend of Kage in episode 265.
Arino plays the SNES port of The King of Dragons in episode 267.
Arino plays the TurboGrafx-CD game Ranma ½ in episode 268.
Arino plays the NES port of Rolling Thunder in episode 271.
Arino plays the NES port of Image Fight in episode 280.
Arino plays Klonoa: Door to Phantomile in episode 281 of GameCenter CX.
Arino plays Ice Climber during the GameCenter CX in Russia special episode.
Arino plays the NES port of Athena in episode 283.
Arino plays the GBA port of EarthBound through MOTHER 1+2 on a Game Boy Player in episodes 284, 285 and 286. In addition, the series' creator, Shigesato Itoi, was interviewed by Arino in episode 285.
Arino plays the TurboGrafx-16 port of Valkyrie no Densetsu in episode 289 of GameCenter CX.
Arino plays the Dreamcast game Space Channel 5 in episode 290.
Arino plays the NES game Joy Mech Fight in episode 296.
Arino plays the SNES game Panel de Pon in the GameCenter CX mini special episode through a SNES Classic Edition.
Arino plays the Neo Geo game The King of Fighters '98: The Slugfest in the GameCenter CX mini special episode through a Neo Geo Mini.
Arino plays the Sega Saturn port of The House of the Dead in episode 299.
Arino plays the NES port of Chack'n Pop in episode 302.
Arino plays the NES game Mappy Kids in episode 304.

Arino plays the N64 game Pokémon Snap in episode 305. He previously played the Red and Green versions of the first generation Pokémon games through Nintendo 3DS Virtual Console as part of promotional Nintendo eShop challenges.
Arino plays the GBA game Gyakuten Saiban (later ported and localized for Nintendo DS as Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney) as part of a DVD-exclusive challenge.
Arino plays the TurboGrafx-16 port of The NewZealand Story in episode 309.
Arino reacts to the opening of the Dreamcast game Segagaga during the Opening Only Theather segment.
Arino plays the SNES game Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon (released in Europe as just Sailor Moon) in episode 311.
Arino plays the Nintendo Switch port of Cave Story+ as part of the GameCenter KBX special episode.
Arino plays the NES port of Dragon's Lair in episode 319. He also tried to revenge it during the Saitama Super Arena event.
Arino plays the PS2 game Monster Attack in episode 325.
Arino plays the NES game Getsu Fūma Den in episode 327.
Arino plays the Genesis port of Rastan Saga II (either known as Nastar or Nastar Warrior in Arcade) in episode 328.
Arino plays the GameCube game Super Monkey Ball in episode 329.
Arino plays the SMS and Sega Saturn ports of Space Harrier in episode 332.
Arino plays the NES game Batman  in episode 335.
Arino plays the PS2 game Ico in episode 336.
Arino plays the NES port of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles in episode 345.
Arino plays the GameCube game Dance Dance Revolution: Mario Mix in episode 350.
Arino plays the PS1 game Metal Gear Solid as part of a DVD-exclusive challenge.
Arino plays the NES version of Gremlins 2: The New Batch  in episode 351.
Arino plays the Neo Geo game Samurai Shodown in episode 354.
Arino plays the PS2 game Onimusha 3: Demon Siege during the KACHO×FAMILY segment.
Arino plays the GB game Final Fantasy Adventure in episodes 357 and 358.
Arino plays the GB game Seiken Densetsu: Final Fantasy Gaiden (released outside Japan as Final Fantasy Adventure) in episodes 357 and 358.

Arino plays several NES games with Nijisanji's Hyakumantenbara Salome. In addition, her channel features Arino playing Resident Evil 7 plus several N64 games with herself as a back-to-back collaboration.
Arino plays the PS2 game Fatal Frame in episode 363.

A Mii of Arino was featured in the Japanese version of the Mii Fighter trailer reveal from Super Smash Bros. for Nintendo 3DS / Wii U. Arino plays the N64 game Super Smash Bros. as part of a YouTube crossover with Masahiro Sakurai on Creating Games.
Arino plays the Dreamcast port of Samba DE Amigo Ver. 2000  in episode 367.
Arino plays the Genesis game Streets of Rage 2 in episode 368.
Arino plays both WarioWare, Inc.: Mega Microgames! and WarioWare, Inc.: Mega Party Games! in episode 369.
Arino plays the Sega CD port of The Ninja Warriors in episode 373.
Arino plays the SMS game Hokuto no Ken (originally released outside Japan as Black Belt with certain elements modified) in episode 374.
Arino plays the Disk System game Kinnikuman: Kinnikusei Ōi Sōdatsusen as part of a DVD-exclusive challenge.

Game & Watch Collection.description: Oil Panic is included in Game & Watch Collection.
The Game & Watch Donkey Kong is included in Game & Watch Collection.
Greenhouse is included in Game & Watch Collection.
Parachute is included in Game & Watch Collection 2.
Octopus is included in Game & Watch Collection 2.

Game & Watch Gallery.description: Ball is playable in Game Boy Gallery and Game & Watch Gallery 2; it's also one of the "Gallery" games in Game & Watch Gallery.
Vermin is playable in Game Boy Gallery and Game & Watch Gallery 2; it's also one of the "Gallery" games in Game & Watch Gallery.
Flagman is playable in Game Boy Gallery, one of the "gallery" games in Game & Watch Gallery and an unlockable playable game Game & Watch Gallery 3.
Manhole is playable in Game Boy Gallery,  Game & Watch Gallery and Game & Watch Gallery Advance; it's also one of the "Gallery" games in Game & Watch Gallery.
Mario and other characters from the series are the main characters in Game & Watch Gallery and its sequels; Mario Game & Watch games are also playable in the various episodes.
Fire is playable in Game & Watch Gallery, Game & Watch Gallery 3 and Game & Watch Gallery Advance; it's also one of the "Gallery" games in Game & Watch Gallery.
Octopus is playable in Game & Watch Gallery and unlockable in Game & Watch Gallery Advance; it's also one of the "Gallery" games in Game & Watch Gallery.
Oil Panic is playable in Game & Watch Gallery.
Judge is included in Game & Watch Gallery as one of the "Gallery" games and in Game & Watch Gallery 3 as an unlockable playable game.
Helmet is included in Game & Watch Gallery as one of the "Gallery" games and in Game & Watch Gallery 2 as a playable game.
Lion is included in Game & Watch Gallery as one of the "Gallery" games and in Game & Watch Gallery 3 as an unlockable playable game.
Parachute is included in Game & Watch Gallery as one of the "Gallery" games and in Game & Watch Gallery 2 and Game & Watch Gallery Advance as a playable game.
Chef is included in Game & Watch Gallery as one of the "Gallery" games and in Game & Watch Gallery 2 and Game & Watch Gallery Advance as a playable game.
Turtle Bridge is included in Game & Watch Gallery as one of the "Gallery Corner" games and in Game & Watch Gallery 3 as a playable game.
Fire Attack is included in Game & Watch Gallery as one of the "Gallery" games and in Game & Watch Gallery Advance as an unlockable playable game.
Boxing is included in Game & Watch Gallery as one of the "Gallery" games and in Game & Watch Gallery Advance as a playable game.
Greenhouse is included in Game & Watch Gallery 2 as one of the "Museum" games and in Game & Watch Gallery 3 as a playable game.
Tropical Fish is included in Game & Watch Gallery 2 as one of the "Museum" games and in Game & Watch Gallery Advance as an unlockable playable game.
Rain Shower is included in Game & Watch Gallery 2 as one of the "Museum" games and in Game & Watch Gallery Advance as a playable game.
Spitball Sparky is included in Game & Watch Gallery 2 as one of the "Museum" games and in Game & Watch Gallery 3 as an unlockable playable game.

Donkey Kong Jr. makes an appearance in the ending credits for Game & Watch Gallery 2 and in various "Modern" games through the series, while he and Donkey Kong appear in the title screen for Game & Watch Gallery Advance; Donkey Kong Game & Watch games are playable in Game & Watch Gallery and its sequels;

The "Modern" versions of Vermin in Game & Watch Gallery 2, of Egg and Greenhouse in Game & Watch Gallery 3 and of Mario's Cement Factory in Game & Watch Gallery Advance feature elements from Yoshi games.
The "Modern" versions of Ball in Game & Watch Gallery 2, of Donkey Kong Jr. in Game & Watch Gallery 3 and of Fire Attack in Game & Watch Gallery Advance feature elements from the Wario Land series.
Egg is playable in Game & Watch Gallery 3.
The Game & Watch game Balloon Fight is included in Game & Watch Gallery 3 as one of the "Museum" games.
Mr. Game & Watch makes an appearance in Game & Watch Gallery Advance; Mr. Game & Watch's trophy in Super Smash Bros. Brawl references Game & Watch Gallery.
The Game & Watch game Zelda is unlockable in Game & Watch Gallery Advance.

Game Boy (Valiant).description: The Game Boy comic series by Valiant is based on Super Mario Land.

Game Boy Camera.description: A port of Ball is included in Game Boy Camera.
Arranged musics from Balloon Kid are featured in Game Boy Camera.
Donkey Kong and Donkey Kong Jr. appears in Game Boy Camera.
A picture of R.O.B. appears in Game Boy Camera.
A picture of the trumpet guy from Fire Attack appears in Game Boy Camera.
A picture of Judge appears in Game Boy Camera.
A picture of the bear from Lion appears in Game Boy Camera.

Mario appears in the title screen, including stamps, pictures and frames from Mario characters being featured.The Mario Artist games on Nintendo 64DD can edit pictures taken in Pocket Camera through Transfer Pak.
A picture from Mario Kart 64 appears in Game Boy Camera.
An arranged version of the Twinkle Elementary School music from EarthBound Beginnings is featured in Game Boy Camera.
Stamps featuring Generation I Pokémon appears in Game Boy Camera.
Sheriff appears in Game Boy Camera.
A picture of Wario from Wario Land II appears in Game Boy Camera.
A picture of Yoshi and Baby Mario referencing Super Mario World 2: Yoshi's Island appears in Game Boy Camera.
Elements from the Zelda franchise appears in the Gold Edition of Game Boy Camera.
A special edition of Pocket Camera featuring Hello Kitty was about to be released in Japan, but it was cancelled. This version was only discovered through leaks from Nintendo's archives in 2020.

Game Shakers.description: Helen from Drake & Josh appears in the Game Shakers episode "Tiny Pickles".
Rex from Victorious appears in the Game Shakers episodes "Tiny Pickles", "Lost Jacket", "Falling Pigeons" and "Llama Llama Spit Spit".

The Game Shakers track down Nathan Kress to see if his character, Freddie, liked Carly or Sam from ICarly in the Game Shakers episode Game Shippers. Nevel from iCarly makes a cameo in the episode "Llama Llama Spit Spit" in a photo on the wall of people who are banned from eating at Fooders.
Animal from The Muppets makes a cameo in the episode "Llama Llama Spit Spit" in a photo on the wall of people who are banned from eating at Fooders.

Game Tengoku.description: One of Momoko's outfit in her Momoko Bomber from Game Tengoku has her dressed as Lum from Urusei Yatsura.

Suchie-Pai makes a cameo appearance on the Game Tengoku OVA, while Suchie-Pai Arcade machines are added on Arrange Mode's Stage 1 in the Sega Saturn port, and Selia's ending image has her dressed as the main character.
A redesigned "Clarice" from City Connection is one of the playable characters in GUNbare! Game Tengoku 2, while the original "Claris" is a  DLC character in Game Tengoku CruisinMix.

Game no Kanzume.description: Flicky is a playable game in Game no Kanzume Vol. 1 and Game no Kanzume Otokuyou.
The visual novel games based around Phantasy Star II are playable games in both Game no Kanzume Vol. 1 and Game no Kanzume Vol. 2.
Sonic and Tails appears in the instruction manuals of Game no Kanzume Vol. 1 and Game no Kanzume Vol. 2.

Gamera.description: Godzilla and Gamera fought during the stage show Godzilla vs. Gamera.
A Pairan alien appears in Manga Boys Special Edition: Gamera.

Gamers!.description: Keita can be seen owning a poster for BlazBlue: Central Fiction in Episode 1 of Gamers!
Keita can be seen owning a poster for Under Night In-Birth in Episode 1 of Gamers!
Nina can be seen playing Guilty Gear Xrd Rev 2 in Episode 1 of Gamers!
Keita and Tasuku play a match of Persona 4: Arena Ultimax in Episode 2 of Gamers!
Chiaki plays StreetPass Plaza in Episode 3 of Gamers!
CLANNAD is mentioned in Episode 8 of Gamers!
A copy of Final Fantasy XV can be seen in Episode 8 of Gamers!

Ganbare Goemon.description: Goemon is a playable character in the series, while purchasing a cartridge item at a store in Ganbare Goemon 2 turns the money woman into Konami Lady, and Konami Lady appears at the game center in The Legend of the Mystical Ninja.

Purchasing a cartridge item at a store in Ganbare Goemon 2 turns certain enemies into Getsu Fuuma. The stage "Virtual Hell" in Ganbare Goemon 2: Kiteretsu Shōgun Magginesu features enemies from Getsu Fuuma Den.

Purchasing a cartridge item at a store in Ganbare Goemon 2 turns certain enemies into Pentarou from Antarctic Adventure. Goemon and Ebisumaru are seen playing Antarctic Adventure in the Ganbare Goemon: Jigenjou no Akumu OVA.

Goemon visits the world of Gradius in the Ganbare Goemon: Jigenjou no Akumu OVA. The first level of Arcade Gradius can be played at the Amusement Park in Legend of the Mystical Ninja. Ganbare Goemon 2 features a miniature Big Core Mk.II and an holographic, samurai-themed Moai as bosses, and there are references to Gradius in the credits of Ganbare Goemon: Uchuu Kaizoku Akogingu.

Goemon visits the world of Castlevania in the Ganbare Goemon: Jigenjou no Akumu OVA, Simon Belmont is a playable character in Ganbare Goemon Gaiden 2: Tenka no Zaihō, a vampire hunter look-alike makes a cameo appearance in Ganbare Goemon 2: Kiteretsu Shōgun Magginesu, and Simon's grandfather appears in the Ganbare Goemon: Jigoku-hen manga. Goemon appears as an item in Castlevania: Harmony of Despair.

Goemon visits the world of TwinBee in the Ganbare Goemon: Jigenjou no Akumu OVA, a TwinBee plane is found and used in Ganbare Goemon Gaiden 2: Tenka no Zaihō, and Pastel makes a cameo appearance in Ganbare Goemon 2: Kiteretsu Shōgun Magginesu and Ganbare Goemon 3: Shishijūrokubē no Karakuri Manji Gatame; Goemon and Ebisumaru make a cameo appearance in the TwinBee Paradise OVA.
There's an allusion to Daisuke Jigen from Lupin the Third in the Ganbare Goemon: Jigenjou no Akumu OVA.

A person dressed like Goemon can be seen in "The Outer Heaven Show Pub" in the Sega CD and later ports of Snatcher, and the main characters discusses the Ganbare Goemon series. Gillian Seed makes a cameo in Ganbare Goemon 2: Kiteretsu Shōgun Magginesu.
Sparkster makes a cameo appearance in Ganbare Goemon 2: Kiteretsu Shōgun Magginesu.
The second level of Arcade Xexex appears as a playable game at the Amusement Park in Ganbare Goemon 2: Kiteretsu Shōgun Magginesu.
Shiori Fujisaki from Tokimeki Memorial makes a cameo appearance in Ganbare Goemon 3: Shishijūrokubē no Karakuri Manji Gatame.
Beartank from Rakugakids appears as a board piece in Goemon Mononoke Sugoroku.
A modified version of Quarth with Goemon Impact replacing the ship can be unlocked in Ganbare Goemon: Tōkai Dōchū Oedo Tengu ri Kaeshi no Maki.
Space Manbow can be unlocked in Ganbare Goemon: Tōkai Dōchū Oedo Tengu ri Kaeshi no Maki.

Gantz.description: The people abducted by aliens sing “We Are!” in Chapter 339 of Gantz.

Garbage Pail Kids.description: Madballs vs. Garbage Pail Kids is a collaboration between the two series that includes plenty of different merchandise.

Garfield.description: In a Jon comic strip from October 7, 1976, Garfield watches the Mickey Mouse Club on TV. There's other references to Mickey Mouse throughout the comics.
In the June 2, 1977 Jon comic strip, Garfield thinks about Rocky.

The Garfield comic strip published on June 23, 1978 features a reference to Peanuts. There's other references to Peanuts throughout the comics. Garfield is mentioned in a Peanuts comic strip on April 29, 1988.
Barbie is mentioned in a Garfield comic strip on June 12, 1980.
King Kong is mentioned in a Garfield comic strip on March 4, 1983.
The Lone Ranger and Tonto and mentioned in a Garfield comic strip on August 27, 1985.
The Green Hornet and Kato are mentioned in a Garfield comic strip on August 27, 1985.
Batman and Robin are mentioned in a Garfield comic strip on August 27, 1985. Batman's hand appears on the cover of Garfield Vol. 2.

as both are created by Jim Davis, U.S. Acres characters appear in segments of Garfield and Friends. On the July 4th, 2010 Garfield strip, Jon draws Orson on a piece of paper. Characters from U.S. Acres appear in the logo panel in a Garfield comic strip on August 7, 2016.
Mr. Spock is mentioned in the Garfield and Friends episode Nighty Nightmare.
Peter Pan is mentioned in the Garfield and Friends episode Banana Nose.
The scale mentions Orson Welles and Rosebud in Garfield's Thanksgiving.
Jon dresses up as Popeye in Garfield's Thanksgiving.
Marmaduke appears in the Garfield and Friends episode "Mistakes Will Happen". Garfield appears in the Marmaduke comic published on November 14, 2017.

In the Garfield and Friends episode "The Automated, Animated Adventure", Garfield's model transforms into Felix the Cat. In The Twisted Tales of Felix the Cat episode "The Fuzzy Bunny Show", a kid mistook Felix for Garfield.
Roy mentioned Ren & Stimpy in the episode The Incredibly Stupid Swamp Monster.
Roy mentioned The Little Mermaid in the episode "The Incredibly Stupid Swamp Monster".
Sylvester is mentioned in the episode "The Feline Philosopher" from Garfield and Friends.
In the logo panel for the Garfield comic strip of November 16 2003, Garfield is dressed as SpongeBob.
Garfield watches The Simpsons in Garfield: The Movie.
Garfield and Jon appeared in the Blondie 75th anniversary comic; Dagwood and Blondie appear in Garfield Gets Real. Elmo Tuttle makes an appearance in the Garfield comic strip from October 30 2005.
Calvin makes an appearance in the Garfield comic strip from October 30 2005.
Grimm appears in Garfield Gets Real.
Odie wears Jason's mask in the February 2 2011 Garfield comic strip.
Garfield appears chasing Red after being launched off the Slingshot in the logo panel for the comic strip on May 13, 2012.
Thor's hand appears on the cover of Garfield Vol. 2.
Superman's hand appears on the cover of Garfield Vol. 2. The November 13th, 2016 Garfield comic strip feature references to Superman.
Green Lantern's hand appears on the cover of Garfield Vol. 2.
The Thing's hand appears on the cover of Garfield Vol. 2.
Wonder Woman's hand appears on the cover of Garfield Vol. 2.
Spider-Man's hand appears on the cover of Garfield Vol. 2.
Wolverine's hand appears on the cover of Garfield Vol. 2.
Iron Man's hand appears on the cover of Garfield Vol. 2.
Hulk's hand appears on the cover of Garfield Vol. 2.
Garfield dresses as Nyan Cat in the comic strip on April 14, 2013.
Garfield mentions Rudolph in the December 19th, 2015 Garfield comic strip.
Garfield and Grumpy Cat have a crossover in the Grumpy Cat/Garfield Collection.
Hello Kitty x Garfield is a crossover between the two series.
An official Youtooz figure was released that featured Hatsune Miku wearing Garfield attire.

Gargoyles.description: The Lion King can be seen on television in the episode: "Awakening - Part 4".
Characters from Gargoyles appear in Disney Heroes: Battle Mode

Garten of Banban.description: Choo-Choo Charles makes a cameo appearance in Garten of Banban 4.

Gatchaman.description: ThunderCats/Battle of the Planets is a crossover between the two series.

Gears of War.description: Gears 5 features a Terminator: Dark Fate character pack.
Gears 5 features a Halo: Reach character pack.
Marcus Fenix and Kait Diaz appear in Fortnite.

General Hospital.description: Characters from One Life to Live and General Hospital frequently crossover into the other show.

Anna Devane from General Hospital has made several appearances on All My Children and is the twin sister of Alex Marick from All My Children; Alex Marick has made several appearances on General Hospital; Mac Scorpio and Robin Scorpio-Drake from General Hospital have appeared on All My Children.
Dr. Jacoby from Twin Peaks appears in three episodes of General Hospital.
Colonel Sanders appears in an episode of General Hospital.

Generator Rex.description: Characters from Ben 10 appear in Generator Rex in the episode, Ben 10/Generator Rex: Heroes United.

Genpei Toma Den.description: The Galaxian flagship is an item in Genpei Toma Den.
The Special Flag from Rally-X is an item in Genpei Toma Den.

Genshin Impact.description: Genshin Impact x KFC is a crossover where KFC themed skins appear in Genshin Impact. Promotional artwork where an Unusual Hilichurl and Colonel Sanders interact was released.
Aloy from Horizon: Zero Dawn appears in the PS4 and PS5 versions of Genshin Impact as part of a special event.

Gen\u00b9\u00b3.description: Gen¹³/The Maxx is a crossover between both series. Additionally, The Maxx appears in Gen¹³ #13.
In Gen¹³ #13, many characters make an appearance including Spawn.
In Gen¹³ #13, many characters make an appearance including Wolverine.
In Gen¹³ #13, many characters make an appearance including Archie.
In Gen¹³ #13, many characters make an appearance including Shi.
In Gen¹³ #13, many characters make an appearance including Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.
In Gen¹³ #13, many characters make an appearance including Fone Bone.
In Gen¹³ #13, many characters make an appearance including Savage Dragon.
In Gen¹³ #13, many characters make an appearance including Madman.
In Gen¹³ #13, many characters make an appearance including Hellboy.

George Lucas' Super Live Adventure.description: The Willow universe is one of the worlds visited.
The Indiana Jones universe is one of the worlds visited.
The American Graffiti universe is one of the worlds visited.
The Star Wars universe is one of the worlds visited.

Gerald's Game.description: The Juniper Hill Asylum from IT appears in Gerald's Game.
Castle Rock from The Stand appears in Gerald's Game.
Derry, Maine from The Bird and the Album appears in Gerald's Game.
Alan Pangborn from The Dark Half appears in Gerald's Game.

Getter Robo.description: The short films Great Mazinger vs. Getter Robo, Great Mazinger vs. Getter Robo G: Kuchu Daigekitotsu, Grendizer, Getter Robo G, Great Mazinger: Kessen! Daikaijuu and the manga Mazinkaiser vs Shin Getter Robo are crossovers between the two series.
Grendizer, Getter Robo G, Great Mazinger: Kessen! Daikaijuu is a crossover between the two series.
The manga Devilman vs Getter Robo is a crossover between the two series.

Getting Over It with Bennett Foddy.description: The Sexy Hiker makes a cameo in Getting Over It with Bennett Foddy.

Gex.description: The "Indiana Gecko" enemy in Gex is dressed like Indiana Jones, Gex gets a similar costume in the first bonus level of Gex: Enter the Gecko and Gex 3: Deep Cover Gecko references a scene from Raiders of the Lost Ark.
Gex sometimes says "Gee, Scoob! Let's get back to the mystery van" in Gex.

Gex sometimes says "Obi Wan has taught you well", "What do you mean Darth Vader is my father?" and "Hey, it is Darth Vader's younger brother, Myron" in Gex; he dons a Stormtrooper costume and says "Aren't you a little short for a storm trooper?" in Gex: Enter the Gecko and imitates C3P-O and Luke Skywalker in Gex 3: Deep Cover Gecko.
Gex says "Hasta La Vista, baby" in Gex and "Terminator? Phone call for a Mr. Terminator" in Gex: Enter the Gecko.
Gex sometimes says "Jane! Stop this crazy thing!" in Gex, referencing Jane Jetson.
One of Gex's random quotes mentions Full House in Gex.
Gex says "Welcome to Jurassic Park" in Gex 2.
Nikki from Pandemonium appears in the ending cutscene of Gex 2.

The level "Out of Toon" in Gex: Enter the Gecko features a Bugs Bunny-themed costume and the enemy "Hunter" who resembles Elmer Fudd, as well as a "Wabbit Season Open" sign and other small references; the follow-up stage "Fine Tooning" features a Daffy Duck-themed costume.
The level "Gilligex Island" in Gex: Enter the Gecko is named after Gilligan's Island, and Gecko dresses like Gilligan during the level.
The "Lightsaber Alien" enemy in Gex: Enter the Gecko wears the red Starfleet shirt from Star Trek, while Gex's random quotes includes "Beam Me Up, Scotty!".
Gex says "Keep your stinking paws off me you damn, dirty ape!" in Gex: Enter the Gecko. while a scene from the movie is reference in the secret level "Lava Dabba Doo".
Gex says "HERE'S GEXY!" in Gex: Enter the Gecko.
Gex says "Stole the everlasting gobstopper?! Good day sir!" in Gex: Enter the Gecko.
Gex references Wilma Flintstone in Gex: Enter the Gecko, and the secret level "Lava Dabba Doo" is based on Fred's iconic phrase "Yabba Dabba Doo!".

Ghost (Dark Horse Comics).description: Predator fought Ghost during the Hunting the Heroes: The Predators Attack! event.
Ghost & The Shadow is a crossover between the two series.
There was a two issue crossover miniseries between Ghost and Hellboy.
Batgirl has a comic crossover with Ghost.

Ghost Recon.description: The USS Clarence E. Walsh from Ghost Recon 2 appears in the PlayStation 2 version of Splinter Cell: Chaos Theory; Third Echelon from Splinter Cell is mentioned in Ghost Recon: Advanced Warfighter 2; Sam Fisher's stealth suit from Spinter Cell appears in Ghost Recon Online; Sam Fisher from Splinter Cell appears in Ghost Recon: Wildlands and Ghost Recon: Breakpoint.
A Ghost Recon Phantom DLC features the player wearing the Hood and Armor from Assassin's Creed.  The player can even hold weapons from Abstergo.
Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Wildlands features a Predator event.
Operators from Rainbow Six Siege appear in Special Operation 2 from Ghost Recon: Wildlands and in the Amber Sky event from Ghost Recon: Breakpoint.

Ghost Rider.description: Cyblade/Ghost Rider is a crossover between the two series.
Witchblade, The Hulk, Doctor Strange, Ghost Rider, and The Darkness crossover called "Unholy Union".
Witchblade, The Hulk, Doctor Strange, Ghost Rider, and The Darkness crossover called "Unholy Union".
Moon Knight appeared in Ghost Rider Vol. 10 #5

Ghost Stories.description: A character plays Dark Cloud in the 6th episode of Ghost Stories.
A Gundam toy can be seen in the 8th episode of Ghost Stories.
Star Trek is mentioned in the English dub of the 4th episode of Ghost Stories.
Halo is mentioned in the English dub of the 5th episode of Ghost Stories.
Storm from the X-Men is mentioned in the English dub of the 6th episode of Ghost Stories.
Grand Theft Auto is mentioned in the English dub of the 7th episode of Ghost Stories.
Two and a Half Men is mentioned in the English dub of the 7th episode of Ghost Stories.
Texas Chainsaw Massacre is mentioned in the English dub of the 11th episode of Ghost Stories.
Barbie is mentioned in the English dub of the 16th episode of Ghost Stories.
Pokémon is mentioned in the English dub of the 18th episode of Ghost Stories.
The Ring is mentioned in the English dub of the 18th episode of Ghost Stories.
Scooby Snacks are mentioned in the English dub of the 19th episode of Ghost Stories.

Ghost Trick.description: Characters dressed as Phoenix Wright, WInston Payne and Dick Gumshoe appear in Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective.

Ghost Whisperer.description: Spongebob is mentioned in the Ghost Whisperer episode "Crossing".
Blair Witch is mentioned in the Ghost Whisperer episode "Horror Show".

Ghost in the Shell.description: Nineteen Eighty Four is mentioned in the SAC 2045 episode "Revolution Of The Fourteen Year Olds".

Ghostbusters.description: The alien race, the Gwanzulums, from Doctor Who appear in "The Real Ghostbusters #9".
Citizen Kane is mentioned in Ghostbusters 2.
Meikyuu Hunter G was readapted into The Real Ghostbusters keeping many of the same enemies.
The Ghostbusters attempted to catch Beetlejuice in the Universal Studios Florida show StreetBusters. The show would later be revamped into Extreme Ghostbusters: The Great Fright Way.
Ghostbusters appear in the Infestation Crossover event.
Mars Attacks has a crossover with Ghostbusters.
X-Files have a crossover with Ghostbusters.
Ghostbusters and TMNT have a crossover together in the IDW comics.
Parodies of the Ghostbusters appear in the Tokyo ESP episode "Penguin and Girl"; these characters later make a cameo in the comic Ghostbusters Get Real issue 2.
The Ghost Busters make a cameo in the comic Ghostbusters Get Real issue 2.
Captain Lou Albano, Wendi Richter, and Hulk Hogan as the Ghost Wrestlers make a cameo in the comic Ghostbusters Get Real issue 2.
Transformers/Ghostbusters is a crossover between the two series. Additionally, the Transformers Collaborative toy line has featured several Transformers based on Ghostbusters.
Men In Black/Ghostbusters: Ecto-terrestrial Invasion is a crossover between the two series.
The Stay Puft Marshmallow Man appears in Crossover #4.
Podcast has a Rainbow Dash flash drive in Ghostbusters: Afterlife.

Ghosthunter.description: Lazarus Jones refers to his partner Anna Steele as "one of Charlie's Angels."
Lazarus Jones makes a reference to G.I. Joe during a cutscene in the final area of the game.
Lazarus Jones refers to his partner Anna Steele as "Jane Bond."
Lazarus Jones initially refers to the events of the game as "a bunch of Twilight Zone crap."

Ghostrunner.description: A drawing of Dopefish from Commander Keen can be found in Ghostrunner.
Genji's katana can be found in a trash can in Ghostrunner.
A bike that seems to look like Akira's bike can be found in Ghostrunner.

Ghosts 'n Goblins.description: The Yashichi enemy from Vulgus appears as an item in Ghosts 'n Goblins.
Red Arremer is a spin-off of Ghosts 'n Goblins.

Ghosts (TV).description: Pete mentions Star Trek in CBS’s Ghosts episode “Dinner Party”.
Pete mentions Newhart in CBS’s Ghosts episode “Dinner Party”.
A kid dresses up as a Ghostbuster in CBS’s Ghosts episode “Halloween”.
Legally Blonde was mentioned in CBS’s Ghosts episode “Jay’s Sister”.
Jay mentions Friends in the CBS Ghosts episode "Jay's Friends".

Ghostwire.description: The vault suit from Fallout 4 can be found in Ghostwire: Tokyo.
You can find a set of Blu-rays of fictional movies in Ghostwire: Tokyo called "Serbian Psycho", "White Fog" and "Zom Bomb". These movies also have posters that you can find in The Evil Within.

Giana Sisters.description: The Cosmonaut Comrade from SpeedRunners appears in the multiplayer mode of Giana Sisters Twisted Dreams.

Gidget.description: Gidget and her family shipwreck on a deserted island in The New Gidget "Gilligidge Island", and actors from Gilligan's Island appear as themselves with many references to the show.

GigaBash.description: Godzilla, Gigan, Kiryu and Destoroyah appear in GigaBash as guest characters.
Ultraman, Ultraman Tiga, Alien Baltan and Camearra appear in GigaBash as guest characters.

Gingerdead Man.description: The Gingerdead Man appears in Evil Bong and some of its sequels, with Gingerdead Man vs. Evil Bong and the comic The Gingerdead Man Meets Evil Bong being crossovers between the two series.

Gintama.description: Ryuk appears as a cameo near the end of an episode of Gintama.
The Sket Dance series had a series of crossover episodes with the Gintama.

Girls' Frontline.description: Characters from Honkai Gakuen appear in Girls' Frontline as part of a collaboration event.

Characters from DJMax appear in Girls' Frontline as part of the "Glory Days" collaboration event. Additionally, songs and skins based on Girls' Frontline appear in DJMax Respect as part of the Respect X Girls' Frontline DLC Pack.
Noel Vermillion appears in Girls' Frontline as part of the "Operation Rabbit Hunt" collaboration event.
Elphelt Valentine appears in Girls' Frontline as part of the "Operation Rabbit Hunt" collaboration event.
Characters from VA-11 Hall-A appear in Girls' Frontline as part of a collaboration event.
Characters based on Tom Clancy's The Division appeared in Girls' Frontline as part of a collaboration event.
Characters from Zombie Land Saga appear in Girls' Frontline as part of a collaboration event.

Girls RPG: Cinderella Life.description: Characters from Sailor Moon make a guest appearance in Girls RPG: Cinderella Life.
Characters from Ashita no Joe make a guest appearance in Girls RPG: Cinderella Life.
Characters from Baki the Grappler make a guest appearance in Girls RPG: Cinderella Life.
Characters from Lupin the Third make a guest appearance in Girls RPG: Cinderella Life.
Characters from Inazuma Eleven make a guest appearance in Girls RPG: Cinderella Life.

Glee.description: The song "Defying Gravity" from Wicked is featured in the Glee episodes: “Wheels” and "100".
Pretty Woman is mentioned in the Glee episode "Home".
The Glee episode "Laryngitis" features a reference to Super Mario Bros. 3.
Avatar is mentioned in the Glee episode "Duets".
Inception is mentioned in the Glee episode "Rocky Horror Glee Show".
Black Swan is mentioned in the Glee episodes: "The New Rachel" and "Lights Out".
Glee has a comic crossover with Archie.

Godzilla.description: Godzilla fought King Kong in a movie crossover together.

Godzilla and Mothra have appeared in many films and media together.

Goofy.description: The Goofy series is a spin-off of the Mickey Mouse series; Mickey also makes an appearance in the Donald and Goofy short The Fox Hunt and in A Goofy Movie; Goofy's nephew Gilbert then makes an appearace in a Mickey Mouse sunday page from May 30, 1954 and in some other stories, while Goofy's son Max from Goof Troop is featured in Mickey's Once Upon a Christmas and the House of Mouse series; The Mickey, Donald and Goofy cartoons in Mickey Mouse Works can be considered crossovers between the two series; the Mickey Mouse episode "Good Sports" is based on the Goofy sports shorts.

The Donald and Goofy shorts as well as The Mickey, Donald and Goofy cartoons in Mickey Mouse Works and the movie Mickey, Donald, Goofy: The Three Musketeers can be considered crossovers between the two series;Humphrey the Bear from the Goofy short Hold That Pose makes an appearance in the Donald Duck short Rugged Bear and then becomes a regular character in the series.
In A Goofy Movie, Ariel is seen twice: once as a prop in Max's school auditorium and also a lamp in Goofy and Max's hotel room with her iconic colors.
In A Goofy Movie, the soundtrack album for Aladdin can be briefly seen.

Grand Theft Auto.description: Images of Ash, Pikachu, and Squirtle appear on a store sign in Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas.

A yacht from Max Payne is reused in Grand Theft Auto V. additionally, an advertisement in Max Payne features the Pillbox Hill Skyline from Grand Theft Auto V.
Carl from Aqua Teen Hunger Force appears as an angry caller in Grand Theft Auto V.

In Grand Theft Auto V there is a possibility of a family relationship with John Marston from Red Dead Redemption; the double-action Revolver and Stone Hatchet from Red Dead is also featured in the game as promotion for Red Dead Redemption 2.

Gravity Falls.description: 2319 from Monsters Inc. was referenced in the episode Headhunters by Officer Blubs as 2316.
The Gravity Falls episodes "The Inconveniencing" and "Fight Fighters" feature videogames based on Dance Dance Revolution.
The Gravity Falls episode "Fight Fighters" features a fictional game based on Pac-Man. Pac-Mabel, a Pac-Man version of Mabel, appears in Gravity Falls: Lost Legends.
The Gravity Falls episode "Fight Fighters" features a fictional videogame based on Frogger.

The Gravity Falls episode "Little Dipper" features skeletal remains that resemble the unicorn-turtle hybrid creature from Phineas and Ferb as a table for the chess board. In a tweet, Phineas and Ferb creator Dan Povenmire would suggest this to merely be a coincidence, but was admittedly uncertain.
A character is dressed up as the Goblin King in Mabel's Guide To Fashion.

In the Gravity Falls episode "Society of the Blind Eye", Stan loses a coffee mug, notepad, and pen which flies into portal. Those are the same items that came out of a portal in the Rick and Morty episode "Close Rick-counters of the Rick Kind". Bill Cipher appears on a monitor in the Rick and Morty episode "Big Trouble in Little Sanchez". In the Rick and Morty episode "The Rickshank Rickdemption", two Mortys can be seen dressed like Dipper and Mabel from Gravity Falls. The creator of Gravity Falls (Alex Hirsch) has also confirmed that the two shows take place in the same universe.

A "wanted" poster for Eda the Owl Lady, along with her staff, can be seen in Gravity Falls: Lost Legends; additionally in the secret commentary for the episode "Land Before Swine" in the Gravity Falls: The Complete Series set, Stan's description of his ex wife matches Eda.
Slender Man appears in Gravity Falls: Lost Legends.
