Groove Coaster.description: Groove Coaster is a spin-off of Space Invaders.
Various theme remixes from Darius are featured in Groove Coaster, while several models of Silver Hawk, Ti2 and Iron Fossil appear as avatars as well.
Groove Coaster features two BGM remixes of themes from Kiki KaiKai, while Sayo-chan/Pocky appears as an avatar in Groove Coaster 2: Heavenly Festival  and other games.
Nico from Spica Adventure and Spica from Nijiiro Ensoku appear as avatars in Groove Coaster 2: Heavenly Festival.

Bub and Bob from Bubble Bobble appear as avatars in Groove Coaster 2: Heavenly Festival as part of a limited promotion, and later return in other games, while the series features a remixed medley of themes from Bubble Bobble games.

Linka and Yume from Groove Coaster 3 appear among the characters providing assist attacks in Arkanoid vs. Space Invaders and Nadia Vivie appears as a Navigator in Groove Coaster, while Groove Coaster features two BGM remixes based on Arkanoid music.
The main theme of Galaga and Galaxian are part of the "Namcot Medley" BGM featured in Groove Coaster 4: Starlight Road.
The main theme of Mappy is part of the "Namcot Medley" BGM featured in Groove Coaster 4: Starlight Road.
The main theme of Pac-Man is part of the "Namcot Medley" BGM featured in Groove Coaster 4: Starlight Road.
The main theme of Xevious is part of the "Namcot Medley" BGM featured in Groove Coaster 4: Starlight Road.

Gun.Smoke.description: The Yashichi enemy from Vulgus appears as an item in Gun.Smoke.
The Dragonfly enemy from SonSon appears as an item in Gun.Smoke.

Gun Survivor.description: A Street Fighter poster can be found in Biohazard Gun Survivor.
A Ghosts 'n Goblins poster can be found in Biohazard Gun Survivor.
A Darkstalkers poster can be found in Biohazard Gun Survivor.

Gunbird.description: Marion is a secret character in Taisen Hot Gimmick and Taisen Hot Gimmick Kairakuten, the character Melty cosplays as Marion in Taisen Hot Gimmick 3: Digital Surfing and Yuan Nang is a secret character in Taisen Hot Gimmick 4 Ever, while the Yanken dog from the series replaces the Elephant God in the Dreamcast port of Gunbird 2.
Aine from the Sengoku Ace series is a playable character in Gunbird 2, while Marion is a playable character in the Sega Saturn port of Sengoku Blade.
Morrigan from Darkstalkers is a selectable character in the Dreamcast port of Gunbird 2.

Gunbuster.description: A poster for Lupin III: The Castle of Cagliostro can be seen in episodes 5-6 of Gunbuster.
A poster for My Neighbor Totoro can be seen in episodes 5-6 of Gunbuster.
A poster for Nausicaä can be seen in episodes 5-6 of Gunbuster.

Gundam.description: Gundam vs. Hello Kitty is a crossover series between Gundam and Hello Kitty.

H.A.W.X.description: Third Echelon from Splinter Cell is mentioned in H.A.W.X.

H.R. Pufnstuf.description: The Wicked Witch of The West from  The Wizard of Oz (MGM) and Wilhelmina W. Witchiepoo from H.R. Pufnstuf are revealed to be sisters though The Paul Lynde Halloween Special.

Hack/Slash.description: The Final Revenge of Evil Ernie is a crossover between the two series.
Hack/Slash vs. Chucky is a crossover between the two series.
An Invincible action figure can be seen in Hack/Slash Vol. 1 #18.
Re-Animator vs. Hack/Slash is a crossover between the two series.
Dexter vs. Jason vs. Hack/Slash is a crossover between the three series.
Dexter vs. Jason vs. Hack/Slash is a crossover between the three series.
Hatchet/Hack/Slash is a crossover between the two series.
Hack/Slash & Mercy Sparx: A Slice of Hell is a crossover between the two series.
Hack Slash vs. The Army of Darkness is a crossover between the two series.
Nailbiter/Hack/Slash is a crossover between the two series.
The Crow Hack/Slash is a crossover between the two series.

Hai no Majutsushi.description: Simon Belmont from Castlevania is one of the opponents in Hai no Majutsushi.
Popolon and Aphrodite from Knightmare are opponents in Hai no Majutsushi.
A Snatcher is one of the opponents in Hai no Majutsushi.
Goemon is one of the opponents in Hai no Majutsushi.
A Moai and Dr. Venom from Gradius are opponents in Hai no Majutsushi.
Penta from Antarctic Adventure is one of the opponents in Hai no Majutsushi.

Haiku, the Robot.description: Haiku, the Robot features a quote from Solaire from the Dark Souls series on a gravestone as well as his name.
In Haiku, The Robot, a gravestone has a message asking if Hollow Knight: Silksong is out yet. Additionally, the Knight from Hollow Knight can be found in a hidden room in the game.

Haikyu!!.description: Nisekyū!! is a crossover between both series.

Hajime no Ippo.description: In chapter 298 of the Hajime no Ippo manga, two characters can be seen playing Virtua Fighter.

Hakkutsu! Diggers.description: Sprites from the Babylonian Castle Saga appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
Sprites from the City Connection appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
The Dig Dug protagonist and the Dig Dug world appear in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers and various sprites from Dig Dug appear as treasures.
Sprites from Dragon Buster appear as treasures can be found in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
Sprites from Fighter's History appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
Sprites from Galaxian and Galaga appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
Sprites from Genpei Toma Den appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
Sprites from Glory of Heracles appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
Sprites from Idol Janshi Suchie-Pai appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
Sprites from Joe & Mac appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
Sprites from Karnov appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
Sprites from Katamari Damacy appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
Sprites from Mappy appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
Sprites from Mojipittan appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
Susumu Hori is one of the playable characters in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers, there are also sprite from the series appearing as treasures.
The Pac-Man world appears as a location in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers and various sprites from Pac-Man appear as treasures.
Red Baron from Sky Kid is one of the playable characters in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers, sprites also appear as treasures.
Sprites from Battle City appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
Sprites from Tower of Babel appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
Sprites from Valkyrie appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
Sprites from Wagan Land appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
Sprites from Wonder Momo appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.
Solvalou from Xevious and areas from the game appear in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers, various sprites from Xevious appear as treasures.
Sprites from Yōkai Dōchūki appear as treasures in Treasure Hakkutsu! Diggers.

Half-Life.description: For the release of Underworld Sony pictures released an official add-on level for Half-Life titled Underworld: Bloodline, which featured enemies and weapons from the Underworld series.

A copy of 1984 can be found amongst garbage in Half-Life 2 (contained in the texture "Garbage001a 01 1984".) 1984 is the inspiration behind multiple elements of Half-Life 2 and is referenced throughout the game.
The Portal series is set in the same universe as the Half-Life series.

Halfbrick Fridays.description: Halfbrick Rocket Racing Trial Mode! demo and PSP version of Halfbrick Rocket Racing have digital billboards advertising Raskulls. A rocket from Halfbrick Blast Off appears on the background of the menu in Magic Brick Wars.

Age of Zombies was originally going to be a part of Halfbrick Fridays series, and PSP version of Halfbrick Rocket Racing has digital billboards advertising it. A Blast Off Jetpack from Jetpack Joyride is based on the rocket from Halfbrick Blast Off.

Halloween (Trancas International Films).description: In an ad for Halloween Horror Nights 28 Michael Meyers from Halloween appears along with Carol Anne from Poltergeist
In an ad for Halloween Horror Nights 28 Michael Meyers from Halloween appears along with a Demogorgon from Stranger Things
There is official crossover art featuring Michael Myers from Halloween and Betty and Veronica from Archie.
There is official crossover art featuring Michael Myers from Halloween and Sabrina the Teenage Witch.
A crossover film between Halloween and Hellraiser was once pitched, but ultimately rejected.

Halloween Horror Nights.description: In an ad for Halloween Horror Nights 17, Leatherface from The Texas Chainsaw Massacre appears with Jack the Clown.
In an ad for Halloween Horror Night 25, Freddy Krueger from Nightmare on Elm Street appears with Jack the Clown.
In an ad for Halloween Horror Night 25, Jason from Friday the 13th appears with Jack the Clown.
In an ad for Halloween Horror Night 25, zombies from The Walking Dead appear with Jack the Clown.

Hamster and Gretel.description: a Dr. Zone movie poster from Milo Murphy's Law can be seen in the Hamster and Gretel episode An Arthouse Divided.

Sally, a minor character from Phineas and Ferb, makes a non-speaking cameo in the Hamster and Gretel episode The Opposite of Smart. The Farmer and his wife appear in the episodes Grounded! and A Mammoth Problem. The Farmer, Dr. Doofenshmirtz and Balloony makes a cameo in the episode Strawberry Fest Forever. An image of Candace and Stacy appears on Hamster's phone the episode Finding Professor Ex. Dr. Doofenshmirtz makes another cameo in the episode Shush Inator. Love Handel from Phineas and Ferb makes a cameo in the Hamster and Gretel episode Flake It Till You Make It. Dr. Doofenshmirtz talks on the phone with Hamster and Gretel as part of a Random Ring call.

Hamtaro.description: Figures were released that featured versions of Hamtaro dressed in Godzilla costumes to promote the release of Godzilla, Mothra and King Ghidorah: Giant Monsters All-Out Attack, and Hamtaro: Adventures in Ham-Ham Land.

Hangin' with Mr. Cooper.description: Michelle, Jesse, Denise and Aaron from Full House appear in the Hangin' with Mr. Cooper episode Hangin' with Michelle.

Hannah Montana.description: The Suite Life of Zack & Cody characters and Hannah Montana characters cross over in the crossover special That's So Suite Life of Hannah Montana; The Suite Life on Deck characters and Hannah Montana characters cross over in the crossover special Wizards on Deck with Hannah Montana.
That's So Raven characters and Hannah Montana characters cross over in the crossover special That's So Suite Life of Hannah Montana.
Wizards of Waverly Place characters and Hannah Montana characters cross over in the crossover special Wizards on Deck with Hannah Montana.

Happy!.description: The Ark of the Covenant from Indiana Jones is mentioned in the Happy! episode "What Smiles Are For".
Mickey Mouse and Pluto are mentioned in the Happy! episode "What Smiles Are For".
Little Orphan Annie is mentioned in the Happy! episode "The Scrapyard of Childish Things".
In the Happy! episode "Destroyer of Worlds", Happy describes "that movie where the iguana phoned home", a reference to E.T.
Bambi is mentioned in the Happy! episode "Tallahassee".
James Bond is mentioned in the Happy! episode "Some Girls Need a Lot of Repenting".
Star Wars is mentioned in the Happy! episode "Blitzkrieg!!!".
The Golden Girls is mentioned in the Happy! episode "Blitzkrieg!!!".
Mr. Rogers is mentioned in the Happy! episode "Arlo and Marie".

Happy Days.description: Laverne & Shirley is a spinoff of Happy Days.
Mork & Mindy is a spinoff of Happy Days.
Potsie from Happy Days makes a cameo in the Sabrina the Teenage Witch episode "Sabrina in Wonderland".

Happy Death Day.description: Director of both films, Christopher Landon, responded to a fan on Twitter who asked if Freaky and Happy Death Day were set in the same world, stating "They def[initely] share the same DNA and there's a good chance Millie and Tree will bump into each other someday.".

Happy Tree Friends.description: Mime dresses as Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer in the episode "Out of Sight, Out of Mime".
In the episode "Remains to be Seen", Sniffles is dressed as Vulcan.
The episode "Blind Date" features a reference to Transformers.
Sniffles watches Back to the Future in the episode "Blast From the Past".
Toothy watches Godzilla in the episode "Wingin' It".
Ka-Pow! is a spin-off of Happy Tree Friends.
In the episode "Wrath of Con", Nutty is dressed as Batman.
In the episode "Wrath of Con", Giggles is dressed as Princess Leia and playing with a lightsaber, while Petunia is dressed as an ewok.
In the Happy Tree Friends episode "Wrath of Con", a character is dressed as Rorschach from Watchmen.
Lord Tourettes from Dick Figures is based on Flippy from Happy Tree Friends. New Season Teaser by Mondo Media is a crossover between Happy Tree Friends and Dick Figures.

Harley Quinn.description: Harley Quinn series is a spinoff to Batman.
Harley Quinn, Poison Ivy, and Archie appear in the comic crossover, Harley & Ivy Meet Betty & Veronica.
Harley Quinn meets Gossamer in Harley Quinn/Gossamer Special.
Harley Quinn mentions Legally Blonde in the Harley Quinn episode "Til Death Do Us Part".
Joker mentions the time he rewatched a lot of Scrubs in the Harley Quinn episode “A Seat at the Table”.
Up was mentioned in the ninth episode of the TV show Harley Quinn.

Harley Quinn.game: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
Harley Quinn.description: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind is mentioned in the Harley Quinn episode: "Being Harley Quinn".

Harry Potter.description: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them is a spin-off of the Harry Potter series.
Lego Creator: Harry Potter and its sequel are crossovers between the two series.

Haruhi Suzumiya.description: Music from Haruhi Suzumiya was added to maimai in the maimai Splash PLUS version.

Harvest Hero Origins.description: Globule from Decline's Drops is a playable character in Harvest Hero Origins.
Shroomella from Renaine is a playable character in Harvest Hero Origins.

Harvey Beaks.description: Chowder appears in the Harvey Beaks episode “Fee & Foo’s First Birthday”.

Harvey Birdman, Attorney At Law.description: Harvey Birdman, Attorney at Law is a spin-off of Birdman and the Galaxy Trio.
Characters from Jonny Quest appear in several Harvey Birdman episodes, most notably "Bannon Custody Battle" and "Return of Birdgirl".
Apache Chief, Black Vulcan and Zan from Super Friends appear in the Harvey Birdman episode "Very Personal Injury"; Black Vulcan later becomes a recurring character on Harvey Birdman.
Shaggy, Scooby, and several other Scooby-Doo characters appear in the Harvey Birdman episode "Shaggy Busted".

Yogi and Boo Boo from Yogi Bear appear in the Harvey Birdman episode "Death By Chocolate", with Boo Boo later becoming a recurring character in the series; Yakky Doodle appears in the Harvey Birdman episodes "Gone Efficien...t" and "Identity Theft".
Fred and Barney from The Flintstones appear in the Harvey Birdman episode "The Dabba Don".
Dynomutt and Blue Falcon (called Azul Falcone in Harvey Birdman) appear in the Harvey Birdman episodes "Deadomutt, Part 1" and "Deadomutt, Part 2".

Magilla Gorilla appears in several episodes of Harvey Birdman; Mr. Peebles from The Magilla Gorilla Show appears in "Free Magilla"; Ricochet Rabbit from The Magilla Gorilla Show appears in the Harvey Birdman episode "X Takes The Crest".
Ding-a-ling Wolf from the Hokey Wolf segment on The Huckleberry Hound Show appears in the Harvey Birdman episode "SPF"; a picture of Huckleberry Hound appears in the episode "Droopy Botox".
Hi-riser from Wheelie and the Chopper Bunch appear in the Harvey Birdman episode "SPF".
Big Duke, Bigger Duke and Mother Load from CB Bears appear in the Harvey Birdman episode "SPF".
Kwicky Koala and Dirty Dawg appears in the Harvey Birdman episode "SPF".
Chief Schnooker from The Mumbly Cartoon Show appears in the Harvey Birdman episode "SPF".
Magic Rabbit from Laff-A-Lympics appears in the Harvey Birdman episode "SPF", the Laff-A-Lympics are later mentioned in "Grape Juiced".
Fluid Man from Frankenstein Jr. and the Impossibles appears in the Harvey Birdman episode "SPF".
Inch High P.I. appears in the Harvey Birdman episode "Trio's Company".
Several Speed Buggy characters appear in the Harvey Birdman episode "High Speed Buggy Chase".
The Funky Phantom appears in the Harvey Birdman episode "High Speed Buggy Chase".
The Jetsons appear in the Harvey Birdman episode "Back to the Present".
The DeLorean appears in the Harvey Birdman episode "Back to the Present".
Secret Squirrel appears in the Harvey Birdman episode "Blackwatch Plaid"; Morocco Mole from Secret Squirrel later appears in "Bird Girl of Guantanamole".
Grape Ape appears in the Harvey Birdman episode "Grape Juiced".
Augie Doggie and Doggie Daddy appear in the Harvey Birdman episode "Peanut Puberty"; Quick Draw McGraw and Baba Looey appear in the Harvey Birdman episode "Guitar Control".
Droopy Dog appears in the Harvey Birdman episode "Droopy Botox".
Wally Gator appears in the Harvey Birdman episode "Booty Noir".
Peter Potamus appears in several episodes of Harvey Birdman.
Characters from Valley of the Dinosaurs appear in the Harvey Birdman episode "Beyond the Valley of the Dinosaurs".
Captain Caveman and Cavey Junior appear in the Harvey Birdman episode "Evolutionary War".
Top Cat appears in the Harvey Birdman episode "Mindless".
Dum Dum appears in the Harvey Birdman episode "Mindless".
Shazzan appears in the Harvey Birdman episode "Shazzan".
Atom Ant appears in the Harvey Birdman episode "Incredible Hippo".
Loopy De Loop appears in the Harvey Birdman episode  "Juror in Court".
Several Street Fighter characters appear in the Harvey Birdman: Attorney at Law video game.

Harvey Girls Forever!.description: Little Audrey is one of the main characters of Harvey Girls Forever!.
Richie Rich appears in Harvey Girls Forever!.
Casper appears in the Harvey Girls Forever! episode "Scare Bud".

Hasbro Family Game Night.description: Mr. Potato Head appears as the host for all the Hasbro Family Game Night video games.
Battleship is featured in Hasbro Family Game Night.
Clue is featured in the PC version of Hasbro Family Game Night 2 and Hasbro Family Game Night 3.
Monopoly is featured in the PC version of Hasbro Family Game Night 2.
Operation is featured in Hasbro Family Game Night 2.
Mouse Trap is featured in Hasbro Family Game Night 3.

Hatchet (Anchor Bay Entertainment).description: Hatchet/Hack/Slash is a crossover between the two series.

Hatchetfield.description: Mamma Mia! is mentioned in The Guy Who Didn't Like Musicals.
Moana is mentioned in The Guy Who Didn't Like Musicals.
Fortnite is mentioned in Black Friday.
The Twilight Zone is mentioned in Black Friday.
Tamagotchis are mentioned in Black Friday.
Star Wars is mentioned in Nerdy Prudes Must Die.
Attack on Titan is mentioned in Nerdy Prudes Must Die.
Rei and Asuka from Evangelion are mentioned in Nerdy Prudes Must Die.
The Wizard of Oz is mentioned in a playbill in Workin' Boys.

Hatsune Miku.description: Hatsune Miku is a spinoff of the Vocaloid series.

A cartridge for Sonic the Hedgehog makes an appearance in Hatsune Miku: Project DIVA, while Hatsune Miku: Project DIVA Extend and Arcade features a Sonic costume for Miku; a cover of the theme song of Sonic Adventure 2, "Live and Learn", is also included in the album Hatsune Miku -Project DIVA- extend Special Collaboration Album VOCALOID extend REMIXIES.
Hatsune Miku: Project DIVA 2nd features a Sarah Bryant costume for Megurine Luka.
A costume based on Fei-Yen from Virtual On can be obtained in Hatsune Miku: Project DIVA Extend.
Songs from Chunithm appeared in Hatsune Miku: Colorful Stage! and vice versa as part of a collaboration event.
Songs from O.N.G.E.K.I. appeared in Hatsune Miku: Colorful Stage! and vice versa as part of a collaboration event.
Songs from maimai appeared in Hatsune Miku: Colorful Stage! and vice versa as part of a collaboration event.
An avatar and a song from Black Rock Shooter appeared in Hatsune Miku: Colorful Stage! as part of a collaboration event.

Hatsune Miku.game: My Life as a Teenage Robot
Hatsune Miku.description: An official Youtooz figure was released that featured Jenny with the appearance of Hatsune Miku called "Jenny Miku".
Project VOLTAGE is a collaboration between Hatsune Miku and Pokémon, comprised of multiple illustrations, songs and music videos.
Fitness Boxing feat. Hatsune Miku: Isshoni Exercise is a crossover between both series.
An official Youtooz figure was released that featured Hatsune Miku wearing Garfield attire.
Songs from Touhou Project appeared in Hatsune Miku: Colorful Stage! as part of a collaboration event.

Haunted PS1 Demo Disc.description: Tasty Ramen is included as part of the Haunted PS1 Demo Disc 2020 compilation.

Haunting Ground.description: Haunting Ground is a spin-off of the Clock Tower series.

Hawaii Five-O.description: Characters from NCIS: Los Angeles appear in the Hawaii Five-0 episodes "Ka Hakaka Maikaʻi" and "Pa Make Loa", while characters from Hawaii Five-0 appear in the NCIS: Los Angeles episode "Touch of Death".

Hawkeye.description: Sex and the City was referenced in the Hawkeye episode “Ronin”.

Hay Day.description: Characters from Hay Day appear in Squad Busters.

Hazbin Hotel.description: Helluva Boss is a spinoff to Hazbin Hotel.

Heathcliff.description: TV shows from both series aired together as the Heathcliff and Marmaduke container show; the two characters also meet during the opening sequence.

The Inspector Gadget makes a cameo in the Catillac Cat's episode "Harem Cat", while the Catillac Cats make a cameo in an episode of season two of the Inspector Gadget TV series; there are other minor references between the two series.
An image of Garfield appears in a Heathcliff comic strip.
The gang from Top Cat appears in a Heatchliff comic.
An image of Mighty Mouse appears in a Heathcliff comic strip.

Heave Ho.description: The Friend of Pedro from My Friend Pedro appears in Heave Ho.
The Marine from Enter the Gungeon appears in Heave Ho.
Gris from Gris appears in Heave Ho.
The Messenger from The Messenger appears in Heave Ho.
Zero from Katana Zero appears in Heave Ho.
Kiki from Gato Roboto appears in Heave Ho.
Prospect 1 from Absolver appears in Heave Ho.
The Biker from Hotline Miami appears in Heave Ho.
Piku from Pikuniku appears in Heave Ho.
The Beheaded from Dead Cells appears in Heave Ho after an update.
SAM from Observation appears in Heave Ho after an update.

Heavenly Sword.description: Kratos's Blades and armor appear in Heavenly Sword.

Heavy Barrel.description: Heavy Burger is a crossover between the two series.
Heavy Burger features the world of Karate Champ.
Heavy Burger features the world of Bad Dudes vs. DragonNinja.

Heavy Rain.description: Some endings of Heavy Rain takes place in Lucas Kane's apartment from Fahrenheit.

Hellboy.description: There was a two issue crossover miniseries between Ghost and Hellboy.
There was a crossover comic between Painkiller Jane and Hellboy.
There was a two issue crossover miniseries between Batman, Hellboy, and Starman.
Hellboy has a commercial with Chuck from Chuck.
There was a single page crossover story between Hellboy and Chilling Adventures of Sabrina entitled Sabrina Meets Hellboy.

Hello Kitty.description: The Famicom game Hello Kitty World is based on Balloon Kid, and also features many of the same elements.
Cinnamoroll characters have appeared in various pieces of Hello Kitty media.
Sanrio invited Blue's Clues for Blue to perform with Hello Kitty in Sanrio's Puroland. Sanrio also marketed both Blue and Hello Kitty together.
MonHan Diary: Poka Poka Felyne Village features costumes based on Hello Kitty while Monster Hunter-themed Hello Kitty plush dolls were also released.
Characters from Arcana Heart appear in Hello Kitty & Apron of Magic: Rhythm Cooking.
Doraemon meets Hello Kitty is a crossover between the two series.

Tamagotchi m!x: Sanrio Characters m!x Ver. and Tamagotchi Meets Sanrio Characters Meets Ver. include Hello Kitty, while Hello Kitty Tamagotchi is a crossover between the two series. A "Sanrio Characters Special Set Tama SmaCard" featuring clothes based on Hello Kitty was also released for Tamagotchi Smart'

The Hello Kitty ♥ Pac-Man line is a crossover between the two series and includes a Pac-Man ghost Hello Kitty; as part of the promotion the smartphone version of Pac-Man featured Hello Kitty-themed levels and items for a limited period.
Hello Kitty x Garfield is a crossover between the two series.
Atsushi Nakajima appeared alongside Hello Kitty on promotional material and merchandise for the Bungo Stray Dogs x Sanrio collaboration.
Tetris x Hello Kitty is a crossover between the two series.
Gundam vs. Hello Kitty is a crossover series between Gundam and Hello Kitty.
Characters from Jujutsu Kaisen appeared alongside characters from Hello Kitty on merchandise as part of a special collaboration.
A line of merchandise was released that features Fruits Basket and Hello Kitty characters interacting with one another one various types of merchandise.
Opera from Welcome to Demon School! Iruma-kun appears with Hello Kitty in a Pop Up Store in Loft ad.
The worlds of Hello Kitty and Friends and Yu-Gi-Oh crossed over as part of a collaboration for McDonald's Happy Meal toys.

Hello Neighbor.description: Hello Bendy was a limited time event between the two games. In Bendy And The Ink Machine Bendy's and Sammy Lawrence's roles were played by the neighbor; in Hello Neighbor the neighbor wore a Bendy mask and various easter eggs related to Bendy can be found.

Hellraiser.description: Pinhead fought Nightbreed in Hellraiser vs Nightbreed: Jihad.
Pinhead fought Marshal Law in Marshal Law Vs Pinhead-Law in Hell.
A crossover film between Halloween and Hellraiser was once pitched, but ultimately rejected.

Helltaker.description: Heroes of Might and Magic II is part of Malina's collection in the Helltaker comic strip "Prologue"; Heroes of Might and Magic III appears in various other comic strips.
UFO: Enemy Unknown is part of Malina's collection in the Helltaker comic strip "Prologue".
Fire Emblem is mentioned by Malina in the Helltaker comic strip "Prologue".

Modeus can be seen reading a novel titled "Spider Season" in the ending of Helltaker; the comic strip "Romantic Comedies" shows a movie of the novel with the characters from Mosquito Season on it, implying it is a sequel.
A kid dressed as Jason Voorhees appears in the Helltaker comic strip "Corruption of the Mortal Realm".
A kid dressed as Sadako from The Ring appears in the Helltaker comic strip "Corruption of the Mortal Realm".
The Helltaker appears dressed as the T-800 from The Terminator in the Helltaker comic strip "Corruption of the Mortal Realm".

Helluva Boss.description: Helluva Boss is a spinoff to Hazbin Hotel.
One of the game stand signs reads "MUPPET" in the Helluva Boss episode "Loo Loo Land".
A plush of Jack from Zoophobia can be seen in the Helluva Boss episode "C.H.E.R.U.B."
Shrek is mentioned in the Helluva Boss episode "Exes and Oohs".

Helmet.description: UNDIRECT: Modern Helmet within Game & Watch Gallery 2 features elements from the Mario series.

Henry Danger.description: Herb from Sam & Cat appears in "Secret Beef".  Also Goomer from Sam and Cat is an assistant to Frankini from Henry Danger.
Phoebe and Max Thunderman appear in the episode "Danger & Thunder".
Uncle Jesse from Full House was mentioned in the Henry Danger episode "Henry Danger: The Musical". The episode also has a deleted scene in which Michelle and Stephanie are also mentioned.
Good Burger is mentioned by Captain Man in the Henry Danger episode “Stuck in Two Holes”.
The Game Shakers appear in the Henry Danger episode "Danger Games". Henry and Schwoz later appears in the Game Shakers episode "Babe Loves Danger".
The musical Cats is mentioned in “Henry Danger: The Musical”.
Dumbo was referenced in the Henry Danger episode “The Fate of Danger”.
Danger Force is a spinoff to Henry Danger.

Henry Stickmin.description: A painting of Luigi from Mario can be found in Stealing the Diamond, Judge Planta's name from Super Mario Sunshine can be seen in Henry's cellphone in the remastered version of Escaping the Prison; while a Super Mushroom and Spiny Shell appear in Stealing the Diamond, a Koopa Shell in Infiltrating the Airship, the Bounce Bros attack from Mario and Luigi: Superstar Saga, Mario's Super Jump and the Leaf/Tanooki item appear as options in Fleeing the Complex, and the characters Marty O. and Louie G. are based on Mario and Luigi and perform the "Do the Mario" dance.

A painting of Harkinian can be found in Stealing the Diamond, a spoof of the chest opening cutscenes from Ocarina of Time appears in Infiltrating the Airship, a spoof of the melody gameplay in Wind Waker and the series' Longshot appear in Fleeing the Complex; and the ocarina from Ocarina of Time, the Moon from Majora's Mask and the stamina and inventory of Breath of the Wild appear in Completing the Mission.
A painting resembling Leonidas from 300 can be found in Stealing the Diamond, while minor references appear in Completing the Mission.
The Portal Gun (later renamed "Wormhole Gun" to avoid copyright issues) is used in Stealing the Diamond.

A creeper appears in Stealing the Diamond as well as a spoof of how walls are mined in-game. The remastered version of Breaking the Bank features a reference to Minecraft. A second spoof is featured in Completing the Mission.

When Henry gets close to a crowbar in Stealing The Diamond headcrabs fall on him, there's a Gravity Gun (later redesigned into the "Gravity Manipulator" to avoid copyright issues) option in Infiltrating the Airship and several more references in Completing the Mission.
The theme music of CSI Miami can be heard on an off-screen tv in Stealing the Diamond.
Henry plays a game similar to Civilization V in Infiltrating the Airship.
Hank Hill is mentioned in one of the fail messages from Infiltrating the Airship.
The character Heath Stone in Fleeing the Complex is named after Hearthstone, and she speaks about the game.

The diamond and teleporter from Henry Stickmin can be found in Among Us, there's a poster for The Henry Stickmin Collection in the MIRA HQ map, Henry and Ellie Rose appear as selectable pets and several cosmetics are taken from Henry Stickmin characters; the Henry Stickmin Collection includes sound effects from Among Us and crewmember plushies as collectables, a reference to its expelled screen and minor nods; a later update to Among Us adds a map based on the Airship from Infiltrating the Airship.
The Nintendo 64 cartridge Conker's Bad Fur Day can be seen in one of the endings from Completing the Mission.
In the "Special BROvert Ops" route from Completing the Mission, Charles broadcasts an episode of Seinfeld as a distraction.
The "Dance Moves" emote from Fortnite appears in Completing the Mission. The Distraction Dance from Fleeing the Complex appears in Fortnite as an emote.

Herbie.description: Alonzo Hawk from The Absent-Minded Professor appears in Herbie Rides Again.

Hercules: The Legendary Journeys.description: Xena is a spin-off of Hercules: The Legendary Journeys.

Hercules (Disney).description: Scar's dead skin can be found in Disney's Hercules.
Hercules and Aladdin meet in the crossover Hercules and the Arabian Knights.

Here's Lucy.description: Ralph Kramden from The Honeymooners appears in the Here's Lucy episode "Lucy Visits Jack Benny".
12 Angry Men is mentioned in the Here's Lucy episode "Lucy and Joan Rivers Do Jury Duty".

Here Comes Niko!.description: Hat Kid appears at a public pool in Here Comes Niko!. Additionally, stickers based on Here Comes Niko! can be found in A Hat in Time after an update.
Niko from Here Comes Niko! makes a cameo appearance in Demon Turf. Additionally, a drawing of Beebz from Demon Turf can be found in Here Comes Niko!

Herman's Head.description: Sally and Buddy from The Dick Van Dyke Show appear in the Herman's Head episode "When Hairy Met Hermy".

Homestuck.description: The Homestuck character John Egbert is depicted as being a fan of the Ghostbusters franchise, having a Ghostbusters II poster in his bedroom and Slimer appearing on his desktop wallpaper. John also owns a Ghostbuster II MMORPG which is played by him and Jade later in the comic.
John Egbert has a poster for Mac and Me in his bedroom in Homestuck.
John Egbert has a poster for Mac and Me in his bedroom in Homestuck.

The song "Megalovania" from Undertale first officially originated from a Homestuck album called "Homestuck Vol. 6: Heir Transparent". The Flash page [S] Collide features a short segment referencing the battle system of Undertale. Hiveswap: Act 1 contains a reference to Undertale.

Homicide: Life on the Street.description: In the Homicide: Life on the Street episode "A Doll's Eyes", the organs of a murder victim are shipped to various hospitals across the country. The heart is placed in a cooler with the destination label "Chicago Hope Hospital", and during a montage is received in Chicago by a heart surgeon played by Mandy Patinkin, who also plays surgeon Jeffrey Geiger in Chicago Hope (the character is unnamed in the Homicide episode, but identified in the closing credits).
Alfre Woodard reprises her role as Dr. Roxanne Turner, who appeared in 13 episodes of St. Elsewhere from 1985 to 1988.

Honey, I Shrunk the Kids.description: The Super Mario Bros. Super Show! episode "Princess, I Shrunk the Mario Brothers" is a parody of Honey, I Shrunk the Kids; in an episode of Honey, I Shrunk the Kids: The TV Show Wayne is seen playing Mario Kart 64.

Hot Wheels.description: Many Superman-themed Hot Wheels cars, as well as a set of Batman V Superman Hot Wheels set have been released.
Three The Flash-themed Hot Wheels cars have been released.
Many Wonder Woman-themed Hot Wheels cars, as well as two sets of Wonder Woman Hot Wheels cars were released.
Many Batman-themed Hot Wheels cars, as well as a set of Batman V Superman Hot Wheels, a Batman & Rogue Gallery 5-Pack, and a Batcave track set have been released.
A Green Lantern-themed Hot Wheels car was released.
Many Iron Man-themed Hot Wheels cars have been released.
Many Captain America-themed Hot Wheels cars, as well as a set of Captain America Civil War Hot Wheels have been released.
Many Thor-themed Hot Wheels cars, as well as a set of Thor: Ragnarok Hot Wheels have been released.
Three sets of Spider-Man Hot Wheels cars, as well as many other Spider-Man-themed cars were released.
Many Hulk-themed Hot Wheels cars have been released.
Two sets of Guardians of the Galaxy Hot Wheels cars, as well as the track set Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2: Milano Breakout have been released.
Two sets of Avengers Hot Wheels cars, as well as an Avengers Assemble 5-pack were released.
Several Star Wars-themed Hot Wheels cars and track sets have been released.
Three sets of Super Mario Hot Wheels cars were released; a Super Mario-themed car was also included in the Hot Wheels series HW Screen Time.
A set of Injustice 2 Hot Wheels cars was released.
A set of Despicable Me 3 Hot Wheels cars was released.
A set of Teen Titans Go!-themed Hot Wheels cars were released.
Hot Wheels appear in UNO! Mobile as a part of the "UNO! Mobile x Hot Wheels" event. Hot Wheels features UNO-themed cars. Hot Wheels UNO is a crossover between the two series.
Vehicles and cosmetics based on Jurassic World appeared in Hot Wheels Unleashed as part of a collaboration event.

Later, an episode of All My Children features a character played by Chase's actress Wendie Malick, though the role is credited to Victoria Chase, implying that this is the role her character gets in the Hot in Cleveland episode.

The story in DC Comics Presents #53 is a crossover between the two series.
Elvira's House of Mystery is a crossover between the two series.

Chapter 32 of How Heavy Are The Dumbbells You Lift features a parody of Terminator.

Leisure Suit Larry appears as an opponent in Hoyle's Offical Book of Games: Volume 1, Volume 3, and Hoyle's Classic Card Games. Passionate Patti and Mr. Big from Leisure Suit Larry appear as opponents in Volume 3.

Shang-Chi appears in The Incredible Hulk #434 and The Totally Awesome Hulk #15-18. Abomination from The Incredible Hulk appears in Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings.

The Micronauts appeared in several Hulk comics.

Witchblade, The Hulk, Dr. Strange, Ghost Rider, and The Darkness crossover called "Unholy Union".

Inanimate Insanity.description: In the Battle for Dream Island episode "Rescission", the entire cast of Inanimate Insanity is a recommended character by the series' creator AnimationEpic. Battle for Dream Island characters have made cameos in multiple episodes of Inanimate Insanity. "BFDI and II Finally Cross Over (L.A. MEETUP ON 6/24)" and "BFDI and Inanimate Insanity Meet Up!" are crossovers between both series.

Indiana Jones.description: Indiana Jones makes a cameo in the game E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial for Atari 2600. E.T. appears as one of the tiles in Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull.

Indiana Jones and Star Wars crossover with each other various times. First one being Indiana Jones making a cameo in the game Star Wars: Yoda Stories. Also, C-3PO's head appears in Lego Indiana Jones while Han Solo frozen in carbonite is in the sequel.  Indiana Jones and a trailer for LEGO Indiana Jones: The Original Adventures are unlockable in LEGO Star Wars: The Complete Saga and LEGO Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Out includes references to Indiana Jones. Also, Star Wars characters are unlockable in Lego Indiana Jones while Han Solo appears frozen in carbonite is in the sequel. An exclusive set was also released that featured both Indiana Jones and Han Solo called "Han Solo/Indiana Jones Transformation Chamber"

Indiana Jones briefly enters the Monkey Island universe in the game Indiana Jones and the Infernal Machine; additionally Guybrush briefly turns into Indy in the demo version of The Secret of Monkey Island and there's a book written by "I. Jones" in Monkey Island 2.

A poster of a parody of Magnum P.I. can be seen in the Invincible episode "It's Not That Simple".

Invizimals.description: Daxter appears as an Easter Egg in Invizimals: The Lost Tribes and as a card in the Invizimals Evolution sticker trading card game. In both appearances, Daxter is explained to actually be an Invizimal.

Iron Man.description: There have been many crossover stories between both series.
Moon Knight appeared in Iron Man Vol. 1 #161.

Black Panther appears in various Iron Man comics and in several episodes of Iron Man: Armored Adventures, while Iron Man appears in Black Panther Vol. 3 #41-45 and Black Panther Vol. 4 #18 and #21-26. Additionally, Zeke Stane from Iron Man appears in several issues of Black Panther Vol. 1 and 6.
Iron Man and X-O Manowar in Heavy Metal is a crossover between the two series.

Ittle Dew.description: Characters from Ittle Dew appear in Card City Nights and Card City Nights 2. Additionally, an outfit based on Little Dude from Card City Nights appears in Ittle Dew 2.
Ittle Dew and Tippsie from Ittle Dew make cameo appearances in Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt, while That Guy from Princess Remedy appears as a hidden boss in Ittle Dew 2.

J.J. & Jeff.description: J.J. & Jeff is a semi-clone of Hudson's Adventure Island. This is further evidenced in the Japanese version, which had key art drawn by Susumu Matsushita, who also did art for most games in the series until Super Adventure Island II.

JAG.description: NCIS is a spin off of JAG.

Jabberjaw.description: Aquaman meets Jabberjaw in the comic Aquaman/Jabberjaw Special #1.

Jack (Atlus).description: The Jack series is a spin off of Megami Tensei.

Jaco the Galactic Patrolman.description: Jaco the Galactic Patrolman is a prequel to the Dragon Ball series.  Jaco also makes later appearances in Ressurection 'F' and Dragon Ball Super.

Jak and Daxter.description: The Carnivorus Plant from "Crash Bandicoot 2: Cortex Strikes Back" is in Samos' hut using have the exact same model from Naughty Dog

You could find an image of Jak and Daxter inside Clank's apartment in Ratchet and Clank: Going Commando.  Also, Jak is playable in Ratchet and Clank: Deadlocked and Ratchet is playable in Jak X by having a save file onRatchet: Deadlocked.
Daxter is a downloadable character in the game Pain

Jay and Silent Bob.description: The Jay and Silent Bob series is a spin-off of the Clerks series.

Jay and Silent Bob's comic Walt Flanagan's Dog is a prequel to Mallrats; the comic Chasing Dogma includes references to Mallrats; Brodie Bruce and Trisha Jones from Mallrats appear in Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back.
Jay and Silent Bob's comic Chasing Dogma is a sequel to Chasing Amy; characters from Chasing Amy also appear in Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back.
Jay and Silent Bob appear in Dogma, while their comic Chasing Dogma is a prequel to the film; the Mooby's fast food from Dogma appears in Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back, and God also makes a cameo.
There are references to Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure in Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back.
There are references to Daredevil in Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back.
Home Alone is mentioned in Jay And Silent Bob Strike Back.
Plants vs. Zombies vs. Jay and Silent Bob is a crossover between the two series.
A Quiet Place is mentioned in Jay and Silent Bob Reboot.
A Guy Fawkes mask can be seen in Jay and Silent Bob Reboot.

Jazz Jackrabbit.description: Jill of the Jungle makes a cameo in Jazz Jackrabbit.
Jazz Jackrabbit 2 features a reference to Donkey Kong.
Jazz Jackrabbit 2 features a reference to the Dopefish.

Jazzpunk.description: Jazzpunk features a minigame where you beat up a Honda which also includes sound effects ripped straight from Street Fighter.
When using a certain telephone in Jazzpunk, you can hear part of "Theme A" from Tetris.

Top Cat and his gang appear in Jellystone!

Jonny Quest and Hadji appear in several episodes of Jellystone!; several other characters from the series appear in a photo in the episode "Mummy Knows Best".
Shazzan and Kazoobie appear in several episodes of Jellystone!

Rom appears on a variant cover for Jem and the Holograms #17. A soldier in IDW’s Rom #5 can be seen watching a video of Jem performing.

Jessie (Disney).description: Luke thought he was Superman in the episode Gotcha Day.
Austin & Ally characters and Jessie characters cross over with each other.

Jikky\u014d Power Pro Wrestling.description: Richter Belmont from Castlevania is a selectable character in Jikkyō Power Pro Wrestling '96: Max Voltage.
Bill and Lance from Contra are selectable characters in Jikkyō Power Pro Wrestling '96: Max Voltage.
Aitsu and Koitsu from Parodius appear as wrestlers in Jikkyō Power Pro Wrestling '96: Max Voltage under the names Mr. Gel and Dr. Mist.

Oolong is a selectable character in Jikkyō Power Pro Wrestling '96: Max Voltage  under the name "E R Kung-Fu".

Jill of the Jungle.description: Onesimus: A Quest for Freedom is based on Jill Saves the Prince also featuring many of the same elements.

Jimmy Neutron.description: Jimmy Neutron and Goddard have interacted with episodes of SpongeBob with cross promotions. SpongeBob's pineapple house makes a cameo in the Jimmy Neutron episode "Jet Fusion". Spongebob was referenced by Timmy Turner in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".

Jimmy Neutron.game: My Life as a Teenage Robot
Jimmy Neutron.description: Brobot from Jimmy Neutron appears in the episode "Doom With a View". Mrs. Wakeman from My Life as a Teenage Robot makes a cameo in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".
Cosmo mentions Jimmy, Carl and Cindy in the episode Sleepover and Over. Jimmy Neutron and The Fairly OddParents have a crossover called Jimmy Timmy Power Hour. They also have comic crossovers.
In Jimmy Timmy Power Hour, when Jimmy says he was not Timmy, Sanjay claims to be Yogi Bear.
Snap from ChalkZone makes a cameo in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".
Donnie and Darwin make cameos in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".
Krumm from Aaahh!!! Real Monsters makes a cameo in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".
Mr. Blik from Catscratch makes a cameo in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".
Truman from The X's makes a cameo in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".
Dill Pickles from Rugrats makes a cameo in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".
Daggett from The Angry Beavers makes a cameo in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".
Appa from Avatar: The Last Airbender makes a cameo in the Jimmy Timmy Power Hour comic "Dimension Intervention".
Planet Sheen is a spinoff to Jimmy Neutron.

Jingle All the Way.description: Somebody in a Sonic the Hedgehog costume appears in Jingle All the Way.

Somebody in a Paddington costume appears in Jingle All the Way.

JoJo's Bizarre Adventure.description: Joseph reads a Superman comic in Chapter 2 of Battle Tedency.
Doraemon is seen on the TV in Chapter 23 of Stardust Crusaders.
Vito Corleone is seen on the TV in Chapter 23 of Stardust Crusaders.
Jean Pierre Polnareff mentions the cartoon cheese of Tom and Jerry in Chapter 41 of Stardust Crusaders.
Enya mentions a James Bond movie being film at the Pakistan town as a joke in Chapter 42 of Stardust Crusaders.
Jotaro mentions watching Columbo as a kid in Chapter 46 of Stardust Crusaders.
The game “F-Mega” is shown in Chapter 117 of Stardust Crusaders, which is a parody of the game F-Zero.
Okuyasu references Ashita no Joe in Chapter 39 of Diamond is Unbreakable.

Josuke mentions Mickey Mouse in Chapter 60 of Diamond is Unbreakable.  Also, the tail of a character stated to be Mickey Mouse is spotted in Chapter 104 of Stone Ocean, as he was summoned by the Stand "Bohemian Rhapsody".

Rohan mentions he had a replica set of furniture used in Pretty Woman in Chapter 119 of Diamond is Unbreakable, while Chapter 137 of Vento Aureo mentions one of Mista’s favorite films is Pretty Woman.
Koichi mentions 2001: A Space Odyssey in the first chapter of Vento Aurero.
The TV inside Coco Jumbo shows Captain Tsubasa in Chapter 48 of Vento Aurero.
Thus Spoke Kishibe Rohan is a spinoff of JoJo's Bizarre Adventure.
The old janitor in Chapter 11 of Vento Aurero bares resemblance to Mario.  Also, Narancia mentions Super Mario in GioGio's Bizarre Adventure II: Golden Heart, Golden Ring.
It is mentioned that Coniglio has read The Adventures of Tintin in GioGio's Bizarre Adventure II: Golden Heart, Golden Ring.
Jolyne spoils the ending of The Sixth Sense in Chapter 99 of Stone Ocean.
The Terminator is mentioned by one of the dwarves in Chapter 105 of Stone Ocean.
Chewbacca from Star Wars is mentioned by one of the dwarves in Chapter 105 of Stone Ocean.
A street billboard for E.T. is briefly seen in one panel from Chapter 105 of Stone Ocean.
Astro Boy is seen in Chapter 106 of Stone Ocean, as he was summoned by the Stand "Bohemian Rhapsody".
Mazinger Z is seen in Chapter 106 of Stone Ocean, as he was summoned by the Stand "Bohemian Rhapsody".

A news report mentions eye witness reporting of Kenshiro defeating Raoh in Chapter 107 of Stone Ocean, as they were summoned by the Stand "Bohemian Rhapsody", while Chapter 134 of Vento Aureo mentions Narancia's favorite anime to be Fist of the North Star.
The hand of a character stated to be Spider-Man is spotted in Chapter 107 of Stone Ocean, as he was summoned by the Stand "Bohemian Rhapsody".
Snoopy is mentioned in Chapter 110 of Stone Ocean.

Weekly Shonen Jump 2003 Issue #20 "The Matrix Reloaded Support Project" is a cross-promotional advertisement for The Matrix: Reloaded and Stone Ocean. The artwork depicts a fight between Jolyne Cujoh (JoJo's Bizarre Adventure) and Neo (The Matrix.)
Tsukumojuku Kato from Tsukumojuku is a key character in Jorge Joestar.
There is a faceless Ultraman doll on chapter 24 of JoJolion.
The TV screen in chapter 24 of Jojolion shows a moment from Resistance: Fall of Man.
A car has a plush doll with Luffy’s original clothing and a head with Chopper’s pre time-skip hat in chapter 25 of JoJolion.
Polnareff references The Exorcist in Episode 19 of Stardust Crusaders.
A cartridge titled “Pac-Laudy 2” is shown in Episode 41 of Stardust Crusaders, which is a parody of Pac-Man.
Yoshikage Kira (alternate version) mentions Titanic in Chapter 50 of JoJolion.
Josuke was playing a parody of Gradius in Episode 11 of Diamond is Unbreakable.
Josuke mentions Twilight Zone in the dub version of Episode 6 of Diamond is Unbreakable.
Fujiko mentions Deadpool in the JoJo oneshot Fujiko's Bizarre Worldly Wisdom -Whitesnake's Miscalculation-.
Ryoko mentions Blade Runner in Chapter 3 of Crazy Diamond's Demonic Heartbreak.
Batman makes an off-screen appearance in Episode 26 of the Stone Ocean anime, as he was summoned by the Stand "Bohemian Rhapsody".
Tweety is mentioned in Episode 26 of the Stone Ocean anime as part of the "Bohemian Rhapsody" story arc, while Ermes mentions Bugs Bunny's birthday in Episode 6.

Joe & Mac.description: Karnov is an enemy in Joe & Mac Returns.
Mizoguchi from Fighter's History is an enemy in Joe & Mac Returns.

Joe Danger.description: On the PC Version of Joe Danger you get TF2 Characters.
On the PC Version of Joe Danger you get Minecraft Characters. Also, the Xbox version of Minecraft also features a downloadable skin based on Joe Danger in Skin Pack 3.
Joe Danger's costume is downloadable in LittleBigPlanet 2 and later Sackboy appears in the Vita version of Joe Danger.

A poster for Mallrats appears in the episode: "Joey and the Big Break: Part 2".
A poster for Dogma appears in the episode: "Joey and the Big Break: Part 2".

Judge Dredd.description: Batman and Judge Dredd had a comic book crossover.
Goro from Mortal Kombat was going to appear in the Judge Dredd arcade game as a pet, but the game was scrapped.
Doctor Who and Judge Dredd were suppose to have a crossover together, but it was scrapped due to the lack of success of 1995's Judge Dredd.
The Predator and Judge Dredd had a comic book crossover.
Alien and Judge Dredd had a comic book crossover.
Mars Attacks has a crossover with Judge Dredd.
